42606754|Afforestation programmes in Lesotho are hampered by a number of problems related to policy and management. Government commitment in the form of resources is necessary for a dramatically increased planting programme called for by the Lesotho Energy Masterplan. Community involvement in Forestry is imperative as government will not afford the costs of planting that is necessary to avert an energy crisis by the year 2010. Similarly the public needs to be involved in the harvesting and marketing of wood as government is failing to cut and sell wood to the public at rates necessary to satisfy demand. Forestry in Lesotho has great potential which has to be explored and exploited. Forestry development in Lesotho is hampered by lack of manpower and there is need for an improved training programme. Lesotho's membership of SADCC is not likely to enhance forestry development in the foreseeable future. Co-operation and co-ordination of activities of institutions involved with forestry is highly desirable. Development of a spectoral plan under the auspices of the Tropical Forestry Action Plan should help to clarify the direction that forestry development should take for effective afforestation. Des programmes de boisement en Lesotho sont entravs par quelques problmes touchant la politique et l'amnagement. L'engagement financier du gouvernement est ncessaire pour pouvoir entamer un programme considrablement augment de plantation demand par la Stratgie d'Ensemble nergtique de Lesotho. La participation de la communaut dans la foresterie est essentielle parce que le gouvernement ne financera pas les frais de la plantation ncessaire pour prvenir une crise nergtique par l'an 2010. De la mme faon, il faut que le peuple participe  l'exploitation et la commercialisation du bois parce que le gouvernement manque de couper et vendre du bois au peuple  des taux ncessaires pour remplir la demande. La foresterie en Lesotho a des perspectives excellentes qui doivent tre tudies et exploites. Le dveloppement forestier en Lesotho est entrav par une manque de main d'oeuvre, et un programme amlior de formation est aussi ncessaire. Il est peu probable que l'adhsion de Lesotho  SADCC (le Comit de l'Afrique mridionale pour la Coordination du Dveloppement) mettra le dveloppement forestier en valeur dans un proche avenir. La coopration et la coordination des activits des institutions engages dans la foresterie sont trs dsirables. Le dveloppement d'un plan de secteur sous les auspices du Plan d'Action pour la Foresterie Tropicale doit aider  stablir la direction que le dveloppement forestier doit prendre pour raliser le boisement efficace. Los programas de reforestacin en Lesoto son obstudos por una serie de problemas relacionados con poltica y manejo. Se necesita un compromiso gubernamental en la forma de recursos, para incrementar dramticamente los programas de plantacin requeridos por el Plan Maestro de Energa de Lesoto. La participacin de las comunidades en programas forestales es imperativa debido a que el gobierno no podr proveer los costos de plantacin que son necesarios para evitar una crisis energtica hasta el ao 2010. Igualmente el pblico necesita involucrarse en la cosecha y venta de la madera, debido a que el gobierno est fallando en cortar y vender madera al pblico a precios necesarios para satisfacer la demanda. La silvicultura en Lesoto tiene gran potencial, el cual debe ser explorado y explotado. El desarrollo forestal en Lesoto es obstaculizado por la falta de mano de obra y existe la necesidad de un programa de capacitacin mejorado. No es de esperar que la membresa de Lesoto en la SADCC intensifique el desarrollo forestal en el futuro previsible. La cooperacin y coordinacin de actividades de las instituciones dedicadas al campo forestal es altamente deseable. El desarrollo de un plan sectorial bajo el auspicio del Plan de Accin Forestal Tropical ayudara a clarificar la direccin que el desarrollo forestal debe tomar para una reforestacin efectiva.
42607341|Greenhouse and field trials with Eucalyptus tereticornis growing on neutral to alkaline mine tailings have demonstrated responses to N, P and boron. Regular applications were found necessary for sustained growth. The use of trees as pioneer vegetation on tailings is considered feasible under Bougainville conditions.
42603452|Increasing pressure on land for agricultural, forestry and urban usages has prompted progressive communities to integrate these demands to get the maximum value from a given area. An essential precursor of such integrated development, however, is an ability to appraise land for different types of utilization. This paper critically reviews the various methods used for the complex task of assessing forest-site capacity. Methods may be direct or indirect. Direct mensurational techniques record a growth characteristic of interest and by their objectivity are of fundamental and long-standing importance. Indirect procedures employ one or other of the related criteria climate, ground vegetation, soil properties, foliar characteristics and ecological site mapping. For their reliablity they depend on the validity of the relationship between growth and the criterion selected. Their use may permit growth to be more easily measured and more reliably sustained. Consideration of the methods as applied in various countries to nursery, newly forested and natural-forest areas suggests greater emphasis be placed on the selection and refinement of criteria more intimately related to physiological growth processes, and more attention be focused on basic studies in soil-forest relationships.
43737691|The mortality rates in 22 trials containing eight different CAMCORE and Oxford Forestry Institute sets of Pinus tecunumanii provenances were analysed in detail after the winter of 1987. All the trials were established in the summer rainfall forest areas of South Africa in 1986 and 1987 and were assessed from six to 12 months after planting. Mortality was attributed to cold spells in the areas prone to moderate frost. The winter of 1987 was generally, but not abnormally, cold while the winter of 1986 was generally mild. Macro-climate of the sites, micro-climatic conditions within site determined by the position of the provenances on the slope and obstacles to cold air drainage in relation with the height of the local night inversion and provenance differences were all related to the average mortality rates experienced in a given set of provenances. It was not possible to obtain reliable relationships between provenance mortality and place of origin. Thus provenance differences could not be explained and there was no indication of frost sensitivity differences between so-called "low" and "high" elevation provenances. Little or no mortality can be expected in subtropical climatic conditions (Poynton (1977)'s silvicultural zone B2, as in Zululand), in warmer-temperate climatic conditions (zone B4 as at Wilgeboom State Forest), and even on some sites in cooler-temperate climatic conditions (zone B5). Most sites in silvicultural zone B5 however seem to present high risk of mortality through frost during the first two years after planting, except perhaps on upper slopes where there are no obstacles to the drainage of cold air. Pinus tecunumanii is markedly more sensitive to frost at establishment than Pinus patula. Les taux de mortalit dans 22 essais avec huit ensembles diffrents de CAMCORE et de Oxford Forestry Institute de provenances de Pinus tecunumanii ont t analyss de point en point aprs l'hiver de 1987. Tous les essais ont t tablis dans les rgions de forts aux pluies estivales de l'Afrique du Sud en 1986 et 1987 et ont t valus de six  12 mois aprs plantation. La mortalit a t attribue  des coups de froid dans les rgions sujettes au gel modr. Pendant l'hiver de 1987 il faisait gnralement, mais pas anormalement, froid tandis que pendant l'hiver de 1986 il faisait gnralement doux. Le macroclimat des sites, les conditions microclimatiques dans les sites constates par la position des provenances sur le versant et par les obstacles  l'ecoulement de l'air froid par rapport  la hauteur de l'inversion de nuit locale, et les diffrences entre provenances avaient tous rapport aux taux moyens de mortalit rencontrs dans un ensemble donn de provenances. La pente et l'exposition de l'essai n'avaient pas d'influence sur la mortalit. Il n'tait pas possible d'tablir des rapports srs entre la mortalit d'une provenance et son lieu d'origine. Done on ne pourrait pas claircir les diffrences entre provenances et il n'y avait pas d'indication de diffrences de sensibilit au gel entre des soi-disantes provenances d'altitude 'basse' et 'leve'. On peut compter sur peu ou pas de mortalit dans les conditions climatiques subtropicaux (la zone sylviculturale B2 de Poynton (1977), comme dans le Zoulouland), dans les conditions climatiques tempres chaudes (zone B4, comme  Wilgeboom State Forest), et mme sur quelques sites dans des conditions climatiques tempres froides (zone B5). Pourtant, la plupart des sites dans la zone sylviculturale B5 semblent prsenter un risque lve de mortalit  cause de gel pendant les deux premires annes aprs plantation, sauf peut-tre sur les versants suprieurs o il n'y a pas d'obstacles  l'coulement de Pair froid. Pinus tecunumanii est manifestement plus sensible au gel  l'implantation que Pinus patula. Se analiz en detalle la tasa de mortalidad despus del invierno de 1987 de 22 ensayos que incluyeron ocho grupos diferentes de procedencias de Pinus tecunumanii de CAMCORE y del Oxford Forestry Institute. Todos los ensayos se establecieron entre 1986 y 1987 en las areas forestales de lluvia de verano de Africa del Sur y se evaluaron desde seis hasta 12 meses despus de plantados. La mortalidad se atribuy a olas frias en areas propensas a heladas moderadas. El invierno de 1987 fue generalmente frio, aunque no anormal, mientras que el invierno de 1986 por lo general templado. Se relacion la tasa promedio de mortalidad de un determinado grupo de procedencias con el macroclima de los sitios, las condiciones microclimticas dentro del sitio determinadas por la positin de las procedencias en la ladera y obtculos para el drenaje del aire frio en relatin con la altura de la inversin nocturna local y las diferencias entre procedencias. La pendiente y el aspecto del sitio no afectaron la mortalidad. No fue posible obtener relaciones confiables entre la mortalidad y el lugar de origen de la procedencia. Por lo tanto, no se pudo explicar las diferencias observadas entre procedencias y no hubo indicatin de diferencias en la sensibilidad a heladas entre las procedencias de "bajas" y "altas" elevaciones. Se puede esperar poca o ninguna mortalidad en condiciones climticas subtropicales (zona silvicultural B2 segn Poyton (1977) como por ejemplo en Zululand), en condiciones climticas templado-calientes (zona B4 como en Wilgeboom State Forest), y an en algunos sitios con condiciones climticas templado-frias (zona B5). Sin embargo, la mayora de los sitios en la zona silvicultural B5 parecen presentar alto riesgo de mortalidad debido a heladas durante los primeros dos anos despus de la plantatin, con la exceptin quizs de las laderas ms altas donde no hay obstculos para el drenaje del aire fro. P. tecunumanii es marcadamente ms sensible que Pinus patula a heladas durante la etapa de establecimiento.
42602980|It is becoming increasingly evident to Governments, particularly of the lesser developed countries, that they should acquire, at an early date, a thorough knowledge of their local timbers. This information is needed not only because, as a result of improved living standards, the local demand for timber is expanding, but also to provide data that will enable forest departments to assess more efficiently the value of the productive forests for which they are responsible and from which, owing to the claims on land for food and catch crops, a higher and improved yield is essential. This article is intended as a guide to the possible scope, cost and organisation of a research laboratory that will produce the necessary essential information on timber.
42603487|The amount and quality of sawn timber recovered from important exotic softwood plantation species of different ages was studied by the Utilisation Section of the Kenya Forest Department in 1963. The results obtained are compared with those observed from similar studies with four indigenous tree species taken from natural forest. Additional factors affecting quality are also considered, and all features are related to current sale prices. Recovery from gross overbark log volumes rose from about 30 to 50-60 per cent in 12 years old thinnings, and 35 years old clear fellings of exotic softwoods respectively. The logs were sound and generally circular in section. In contrast, logs from four indigenous species which were overmature and larger in size were generally unsound and irregular in shape, yielding only 26-35 per cent sawn timber from gross overbark log volumes. The proportion of structural quality timber rose from about 20 per cent to 43 per cent at 12 years and 35 years old respectively in the exotic softwoods, while approximately 75 per cent structural quality timber was obtained from the overmature indigenous species. Other factors affecting stand values included basic strength values, ease of extraction and conversion, natural durability and possibility of impregnation, rating as a fine timber, and difficulty of regeneration. Accounting for all factors, it was considered that 12 year old exotic softwood thinnings were only about 15 per cent as valuable as 35 year old clear fellings, and about ten per cent as valuable as the best overmature indigenous species. Although the method of assessing sawn timber by stress (or strength) grades was considered suitable for large sized timber, it was not thought to be ideal for small sized timber, which could often be converted into more profitable products than sawn structural timber.
42603454|A little known tropical pine species, P. khasya, forms the main species in a plantation programme in Northern Rhodesia. Trial plantings of various provenances of this pine have been made in the territory since 1937. A comparative study was made of growth rates at six different stations throughout Northern Rhodesia, and of stem form, branching characteristics and crown shape at two different stations, and timber properties at one station. It was apparent that P. khasya 'Assam' and 'Burma' were much inferior in growth rates to P. khasya 'Benguef' (Philippines), 'Dalat' (S. Viet Nam) and 'Madagascar' (originally somewhere in Indo-China). 'Benguet', 'Assam' and 'Burma' were inferior in stem form to 'Dalat' and 'Madagascar', 'Madagascar' being by far the best. 'Assam' and 'Burma' had the worst branching characteristics, while 'Benguef was slightly better than 'Dalat' and 'Madagascar' for these. 'Assam' had the biggest and most wide-conical crowns. Timber properties of 'Benguef' and 'Assam' were superior to P. patula, and 'Benguef' was, for its density, as good as "Oregon" (Pseudotsuga taxifolia). 'Assam' did not grade as a structural timber because of its branching characteristics (knots). Some tentative conclusions are drawn concerning relationships between provenances and their geographical distribution, based on the characteristics examined.
42608474|This document summarizes the results of the genetic variation in the quantification at the seed and the nursery level of 16 provenances of Acacia mangium carried-out at CATIE, Turrialba, Costa Rica. They indicate that considerable differences exist between the different seed sources studied in dimensions of seeds and growth of the plants in the nursery. From the point of view of indirect selection it is important to know if the growth behaviour of these provenances continues after they are planted in the field. This will be determined when the results of the field trials from these plants are analysed. Ce document rsume les rsultats de la variabilit gntique dans la quantification au niveaux de la graine et de la ppinire de 16 provenances de Acacia mangium ralise  CATIE, Turrialba, Costa Rica. Ils montrent que des diffrences considrables existent entre les origines de graines diffrentes tudies dans les dimensions des graines et l'accroissement des plantes en ppinire. Du point de vue de la slection indirecte il est important de savoir si le comportement de ces provenances est maintenu aprs plantation sur le terrain. Ceci sera dtermin quand les rsultats des essais sur le terrain avec ces plantes sont analyss. El presente documento resume los resultados de la variation genetica para la cuantificacion a nivel de semilla y vivero de 16 proveniencias de Acacia mangium llevado a cabo en el CATIE, Turrialba, Costa Rica. Estos indican que existen considerables diferencias entre las diferentes fuentes de semillas estudiadas, estas son, el tamao de la semilla y el crecimiento de las plantulas en el vivero. Desde el punto de vista de seleccion indirecta es importante saber si el mismo comportamiento de crecimiento de estas proveniencias continua una vez que son plantadas en el campo. Esto sera determinado cuando los resultados de los ensayos de campo de estas plantas sean analisados.
42607636|The general performance of solar heated timber drying kilns is discussed and their advantages and disadvantages compared with air drying and conventional kiln drying, in particular their ability to dry timber down to moisture contents suitable for immediate use for furniture and joinery manufacture and the high quality of drying with difficult woods. Different kiln designs are discussed and volume capacity and absorber area/timber volume ratios are given for a number of kilns described in the literature. The design and operation of a small low cost kiln built at Oxford which can be made up from a kit is described in more detail. Simple costings are included for the kiln.
42606233|Data on exposure and its effect on tree growth in the Falkland Islands are presented and analysed. It is concluded that sparsity of trees in the Islands is due to a combination of undeveloped soils and lack of advice and encouragement. An updated list of species currently growing on the Islands is presented along with a description and analysis of the important plantation at Hill Cove. Details of observations and trials laid down since 1976 are given and results, where available, are discussed. It is concluded that trees can be grown successfully and that shelter belts have a significant role in the development of agriculture in the Falkland Islands. L'auteur prsente et analyse des donnes sur l'incidence du vent et sur ses effets sur la croissance des arbres dans les Iles Malouines; il en conclut que la carence d'arbres est la consquence de l'tat peu dvelopp des sols, associ  un manque de conseils et d'encouragement. Une liste des essences actuellement tablies sur les les est fournie, ainsi eu'une description analytique de l'importante plantation  Hill Cove. L'auteur ajoute des renseignements dtaills sur des observations et des expriences effectues depuis 1976, et il en discute les rsultats disponibles. Il tire la conclusion que des arbres peuvent tres bien tre cultivs et que les brise-vent ont un rle utile  jouer dans le dveloppement de l'agriculture.
42604515|The paper briefly reviews the changing pattern of land uses in the uplands of Britain over the last two hundred years, and discusses the problems facing the land user in deciding on the system of management to be employed. The author separates the problems into three categories: A Problems in the choice of the system of management and the allocation of land to different uses. B Problems in the collection of data needed to make the choices in A. C Problems in improving the techniques of crop production. He concludes that greater emphasis on research into the problems in Categories A and Beven at the expense of those in Cis desirable. Cet article passe en revue, brivement, les diffrents types de mise en valeur des terres utiliss successivement sur les hautes terres de Grande-Bretagne durant les deux derniers sicles et il tudie les problmes auxquels doit faire face l'occupant qui doit dcider de la mthode d'amnagement qui convient. L'auteur groups les problmes en trois catgories: (a) Problmes du choix de la mthode d'amnagement et de l'affectation des terres  diverses mises en valeur. (b) Problmes concernant la rcolte des donnes ncessaires pour effectuer les choix de A. (c) Problmes rencontrs dans l'amlioration des techniques de production. Il conclut en insistant sur la ncessit d'entreprendre des recherches sur les problmes des catgories A et B, mme au dpends de C.
42609021|A diameter class growth model was used in a computer-based comparative investigation of three alternative silvicultural prescriptions designed for mature, untreated, natural tropical forests. The prescription employing a 3-cut conversion phase with lighter removals prior to application of a classic, individual tree selection system was found to give higher timber yields, lower logging damage, but resulted in greater losses to mortality compared to 2- and 1-cut conversion phase prescriptions. Un modle de croissance, par classe de diamtre, a t utilis dans une recherche comparative utilisant l'outil informatique. La comparaison portait sur trois diffrents traitements sylvicoles applicables  une fort tropicale naturelle, mature et intouche. Le traitement prescrivant une phase de conversion en 3 coupes successives, avec de lgers prlvements avant l'application d'un classique systme de slection par pied, s'est montr plus productif en terme de rcolte de bois d'oeuvre, a occasionn moins de dgts dus aux oprations d'exploitation mais a montr des pertes dues  la mortalit plus leves que les traitements de conversion effectus en une ou deux coupes. Un modelo computarizado de crecimiento de dimetro y volumen fue utilizado en una investigacin comparativa de tres prescripciones alternativas de silvicultura diseadas para bosques maduros, sin tratar y naturales tropicales. Se encontr que la prescripcin que emplea una fase convertida de tres cortes con ligeras extracciones previas a la aplicacin un sistema clsico de seleccin de rboles individuales da las ms altas producciones de madera, los menores daos en los troncos, pero las prdidas ms grandes por mortalidad comparada con las prescripciones de fase convertidas de 2 y 1 cortes.
42603723|A comparative study of seasonal soil moisture changes under grassland, thicket and woodland is described from four sites near Salisbury, Southern Rhodesia. Both gravimetric and electrical resistance measurements were used. Evidence for the period May 1964 until December 1965 showed that the soils were dried to wilting point soon after the end of the rainy season, that there was a slightly greater withdrawal of moisture under a Hyparrhenia cover than under woodland and that moisture losses below wilting point continued throughout the dry season until the onset of the next rains.
42606729|In the warm plains of northern India, the future supplies of raw material for the match industry will need to rely upon planted trees. As the land tenure system limits the area in one ownership, the desired volume of timber will be the planting efforts of a large number of individual farmers. Introduced poplar, Populus deltoides, has shown financially desirable growth rates with a mean annual increment after 8 years of 20 m ha with the prospect of an economic rotation of 12-15 years. Farmers are offered initial assistance and a guaranteed market at maturity. A programme to establish 10M trees between 1984 and 1991 has achieved the planting of 4.8M trees by 1988, involving 5,000 farmers and an area of 9,600 ha. One year rooted sets, 3-5m tall, are planted at 4m spacing in rows along field boundaries or in blocks. Various agricultural crops can be grown between the young trees. Establishment in the dormant season, January and February, needs to be followed by periodic irrigation until the monsoon when adequate drainage becomes equally important. The growing trees need protection against insects, fungi, stock and fire. Trials on 500 poplar clones show promise over the initial stock of G3 obtained from Australia. Dans les plaines chaudes de l'Inde septentrionale il sera ncessaire dans l'avenir d'obtenir les matires premires de l'industrie d'allumettes d'arbres de plantation. Comme le systme de tenure de terre limite la superficie dans la proprit d'un individu, le volume de bois souhait exigera qu'un grand nombre de propritaires s'engagent dans la plantation d'arbres. Le peuplier exotique, Populus deltoides, a montr des taux de croissance conomiquement avantageux avec un accroissement annuel moyen aprs 8 ans de 20 m ha, avec la perspective d'une rotation rentable de 12-15 ans. Les propritaires sont donns de l'aide au dbut et promis un march garanti  maturit. Un programme pour tablir 10 M arbres entre 1984 et 1991 a accompli la plantation de 4.8 M arbres jusqu'en 1988, entranant 5000 propritaires et une superficie de 9600 ha. Des boutures enracines ges d'un an d'une hauteur de 3-5 m sont plantes  un, espacement de 4 m dans des lignes le long des bords des champs ou en blocs. Des cultures agricoles varies peuvent tre cultives entre les arbres jeunes. L'tablissement pendant la saison de dormance, janvier et fvrier, a besoin d'tre suivi par une irrigation priodique jusqu' la mousson, quand un systme efficace d'ouclement devient tout aussi important. Les arbres croissants doivent tre protgs contre les insectes, les champignons, le btail et les incendies. Des essais sur 500 clones peupliers montrent qu'il y a des clones qui donnent des rsultats plus encourageants que le clone G3 obtenu d'Australie qui a t utilis au dbut. En las clidas planicies del norte de India, el suministro futuro de material no procesado para la industria fosforera depender necesariamente de las plantaciones de estos rboles. Como el sistema de tenencia de la tierra limita el rea a un solo dueo, el volumen deseado de madera requerir, para la plantacin, los esfuerzos individuales de un gran nmero de finqueros. El lamo Populus deltoides, como especie introducida, ha mostrado financieramente tasas de crecimiento deseadas con un incremento anual despus de los 8 aos e 20 m ha con una probable rotacin econmica de 12 a 15 aos. A los finqueros se les ofrece asistencia tchnica al inicio de la plantacin y mercado garantizado a la hora de la rotacin final. Un programa que propuso el establecimiento de 10 millones de rboles entre 1984 y 1991 ha logrado la plantacin de 4.8 millones hasta 1988, para lo cual se necesit de 5000 finqueros y un rea de 9600 ha. Arboles enraizados de 1 ao de edad y de entre 3 y 5 m. de altura, son plantados a espaciamientos de 4 m. entre filas a lo largo de los limites entre fincas o en bloques. La plantacin de varias cosechas agriculturales es posible entre las filas de arboles. El establecimiento de plantaciones en la estacin seca, Enero y Febrero, conlleva a una peridica irrigacin hasta la llegada de los monsones que es cuando una adecuada red de drenajes es tambin primordial. Durante el desarrollo de los rboles, estos necesitarn de proteccin contra insectos, hongos, animales y fuego. Ensayos sobre 500 clones de lamo han mostrado ventajas sobre el lote inicial de G3 trado de Australia.
42604793|The main purpose of this paper is to summarise the present status and future prospects of the pine forest stocks (gene pools) for each provenance, variety and species of the low level tropical pines of Central America, including the Caribbean and Bahamas. Brief mention is made of the reputation of each provenance grown so tar in exotic plantations and of the amount of seed exported. This shows how much more needs to be done to extend provenance trials throughout tropical countries. The species covered are: Pinus caribaea Mor. var caribaea Barr. & Golf. var hondurensis Barr. & Golf. var bahamensis Barr. & Golf. Pinus cubensis Griseb Pinus occidentalis Sw. Pinus oocarpa var ochoterenai Martinez Pinus strobus var chiapensis Martinez Pinus tenuifolia Benth. Pinus tropicalis Mor. It is concluded that firm action is needed by the countries concerned to preserve and demarcate on the ground representative stocks of each major provenance and the best phenotypes within each provenance. In addition the collection and dissemination to other tropical countries of representative samples of the seed of the best provenances should receive high priority in international forestry aid programmes so that adequate gene pools overseas may ensure survival of the best from each provenance.
42609014|The history of Australian forestry is traced showing the emergence of conflict between the forest industry and conservation movement. While State governments responded in various ways, the politicization of this conflict led to Federal Government intervention through constitutional and other powers relating to the control of exports, imports and foreign investments, and the nomination of forests to Heritage registers. Recently, a more conciliatory and cooperative approach to forestry has been developed, and has resulted in a National Forest Policy agreed by Federal and State Governments. However, implementation of the policy remains to be fully worked out. L'histoire de la foresterie australienne montre l'mergence de conflits entre le lobby forestier et le mouvement de conservation. La politisation de ce conflit a pouss le gouvernement fdral  intervenir sous diverses formes: dsignation d'espaces protgs et contrle des exportations, importations et investissements trangers. Rcemment une approche forestire plus conciliante et cooprative a t dveloppe. Le rsultat en est la mise sur pied d'une politique forestire nationale reconnue par les gouvernements fdraux et le gouvernement central. Toutefois le problme des modalits d'application de cette politique doit encore tre rsolu. La historia de la ciencia forestal en Australia es contada mostrando el surgimiento de conflicto entre la industria forestal y el movimiento conservacionista. La politizacin del conflicto conduciu hacia una intervencin por el gobierno Federal, planeando areas de conservacin y controlando exportaciones, importaciones y inversin del capital extranjeros. Recientemente, uno punto de vista ms conciliador y cooperativo se ha desenvolvido, resultando en una Poltica Forestal National consensual entre el gobierno Federal y de los Estados. Aunque la implementacin de la poltica ainda precise ser ejecutada.
42607277|The assessment uses output from coupled atmosphere-ocean general circulation models to define future climate changes; static global vegetation models which include land cover to quantify forest biomass responses to changing climate and land use; and projected regional population changes to define future wood consumption. The simulations, which are to the year 2050, indicate greatest climate-driven vegetation impacts in boreal regions, reducing biomass there by 16-30%. Land-use driven vegetation losses would be greatest in the tropics, reducing biomass there by 30%. Although wood consumption may increase by three times during the same period, consumption does not exceed average annual wood increments in temperate and boreal forests. However, projected consumption is twice the estimated annual increment in tropical forests by the year 2050. Uncertainties derived from processes not modelled suggest eventual consumption greater than that projected in tropical and boreal forest regions, and availability less than that projected in temperate forests. L'valuation utilise les rsultats provenant des modles de circulation gnrale du couple atmosphre-ocan, pour dfinir les futurs changements climatiques, les modles de vgtation globale statique qui incluent la couverture du sol pour quantifier les rponses de la biomasse forestire au changement climatique et  l'usage du sol, et les changements prvus de la population rgionale pour dfinir la consommation future du bois. Les simulations, qui vont jusqu' l'an 2050, indiquent que les plus forts impacts de vgtation pousse par le climat sont dans les rgions borales, rduisant la biomasse de 16-30% dans ces rgions. Les pertes de la vgtation drivant de l'usage de la terre seraient les plus grandes dans les tropiques, rduisant la biomasse de 30%. Bien que la consommation du bois puisse s'accrotre par 3 fois durant la mme priode, la consommation n'excde pas la moyenne de l'accroissement annuel de bois dans les forts tempres et borales. Cependant, la consommation prvue est le double de l'accroissement annuel estim dans les forts tropicales d'ici l'an 2050. Des incertitudes venant de processus non models suggrent une consommation finale plus importante que celle prvue dans les forts tropicales et borales et une production moindre que celle prvue dans les forts borales. La evaluacin utiliza resultados de modelos generales de circulacin atmsfera-ocano para definir cambios de clima futuros; modelos globales de vegetacin estticos que incluyen cobertura de tierra para cuantificar las respuestas de la biomasa forestal a las condiciones cambiantes climticas y de uso del suelo; y cambios proyectados de la poblacin regional para definir consumo futuro de madera. Las simulaciones, las cuales son para el ao 2050, indican mayores impactos inducidos por el clima, en la vegetacin de regiones boreales, reduciendo all la biomasa por un 16-30%. Prdidas en la vegetacin inducidas por el uso de la tierra seran mayores en los trpicos, donde la reduccin de biomasa sera de un 30%. Aunque el consumo de madera puede aumentar por tres veces durante el mismo perodo, el consumo no excede el promedio anual de incrementos de madera en bosques de la zona templada y boreal. Sin embargo, el consumo proyectado es dos veces el incremento estimado anual en bosques tropicales para el ao 2050. Las incertidumbres derivadas de procesos no modelados sugieren un eventual consumo mayor que el proyectado en bosques tropicales y boreales, y una oferta menor que la proyectada para bosques boreales.
42608425|Environmental constraints for Honduras Caribbean Pine (Pine caribaea Mor. var. hondurensis Barr. and Golf) seed production in the Northern Territory of Australia have prompted a cooperative arrangement with the Department of Forestry in Queensland whereby future supplies of genetically improved seed will be produced from a special clonal seed orchard in that State. The initial orchard establishment phase includes clones from plus phenotypes selected in both the Northern Territory and Queensland. These are predominantly of Mountain Pine Ridge, Belize origin, but a number of trees derived from coastal lowland provenances are also deliberately represented. The potential benefit from using this broadly based seed producing population will depend on adequate and synchronus flowering across the provenances represented. Des contraintes environnementaux pour la production de graines du pin des Carabes Hondurien (Pinus caribaea Mor. var. hondurensis Barr. et Golf) dans le territoire du Nord de l'Australie ont incit un arrangement coopratif avec la Direction des Forts en Queensland par lequel la provision future de graines amliores gntiquement sera produites par un verger  graines clonal spcial dans cet tat. La phase initiale d'tablissement du verger comprend des clones de phnotypes plus choisis et en territoire du Nord et en Queensland. Ceux-ci sont d'une manire prdominante de la provenance Mountain Pine Ridge, Belize, mais un certain nombre d'arbres drivs de provenances de la plaine littorale sont reprsents exprs. L'avantage potentiel de l'utilisation de cette population producteuse de graines  base large dpendra de la fleuraison suffisante et synchrone en travers des provenances reprsentes. Limitaciones climticas para la produccin de semilla de Pino caribe hondureno (Pinus caribaea Mor. var. hondurensis Barr. y Golf.) en el Territorio del Norte de Australia, han conducido a un acuerdo cooperativo con el Departamento Forestal en Queensland, mediante el cul el abastecimiento futuro de semilla genticamente mejorada se obtendr de un huerto semillero por clones especial, establecido en este ltimo estado. El beneficio potencial del uso de esta poblacin productora de semillas de base gentica tan amplia, depender de una adecuada y simultnea floracin en las procedencias representadas.
42603045|At to-days prices and costs, it would be necessary for a small band sawmill to convert 500,000 cubic feet of small logs annually from 12-13 year old cypress thinnings if the operation is to be profitable. The effect of early pruning on timber quality is discussed, and improvements to timber production techniques are recommended.
42609019|Forest floor mass was determined under 24 first rotation stands of Pinus patula ranging in age from 8 to 34 years, planted between 1100 and 1520 m above sea level and in the latitude range 26 20' to 26 40' S. The accumulation of forest floor was found to be influenced strongly by site elevation. At the lower range of elevations at which P. patula is planted the forest floor mass approached an equilibrium after age 10 years of some 40 t/ha. At higher elevations forest floor mass accumulated steadily up to at least an age of 34 years. At rotation age (17 years) a high elevation stand averages twice the forest floor mass of a low elevation stand. Possible causes of this elevation effect are discussed and its impact on nutrient cycling is considered. On a dtermin la masse de la couverture morte sous 24 peuplements de premire exploitation de Pinus patula, gs de 8 ans  34 ans, plants entre 1100met 1520m au-dessus du niveau de la mer et  des latitudes entre 2620' et 2640' Sud. On a trouv que l'accumulation de couverture morte tait fortement influence par l'altitude de l'emplacement. Aux plus basses altitudes auxquelles on plante P. patula la masse de couverture morte approchait aprs l'ge de 10 ans d'un quilibre de 40 t/ha environ. Aux altitudes plus leves la masse de couverture morte s'accumulait rgulirement au moins jusqu' l'ge de 34 ans. A l'ge d'exploitabilit (17 ans) un peuplement  altitude leve a en moyenne deux fois plus de masse de couverture morte qu'un peuplement  altitude basse. On considre des causes possibles de cet effet de l'altitude et son impact sur la circulation nutritive. La masa en el suelo forestal fue determinada bajo 24 rodales de Pinus patula en primeras rotaciones variantes en edades de 8 a 34 aos, plantados entre 1.100 y 1.520 metros sobre el nivel del mar y una latitud variante de 2620' a 2640' Sur. La cumulacin del suelo forestal fue fuertemente influenciada por la altitud local. En las elevaciones bajas donde Pinus patula es plantada la masa del suelo forestal tendi a un equilibrio despus de 10 aos de edad de aproximadamente 40 t/ha. En las elevaciones ms altas la masa del suelo forestal acumul rpidamente hasta por lo menos una edad de 34 aos. A la edad de rotacin (17 aos) un rodal a la altitud mas elevada tiene el doble de la masa del suelo forestal de lo que tiene un rodal en una elevacin baja. Las posibles causas del efecto de la altitud de elevacin y sus impactos en el ciclage de alimentos son discutidas.
42604795|A general account is given of forest diseases in Trinidad and Tobago, with special emphasis on diseases of teak, Caribbean pine and mahogany. In Jamaica, disease problems in pine plantations were more closely examined than were those of other tree species; with particular attention given to the incidence and potential of root infection by Fomes annosus. The observations described in this account were made during the year commencing August, 1966, when the author was employed by the Ministry of Overseas Development (on loan to the Government of Trinidad and Tobago) under the arrangements of Technical Assistance to the Caribbean.
42604898|When incorporated in Queensland's State Forest system, many of the extensive spotted gum forests had been selectively logged, and contained a high component of overmature and defective trees. Silvicultural management aimed to conserve growing stock through application of a cutting-girth-limit, and stimulation of potentially utilisable stems by release and spacing treatments. However, much of the growing stock retained below the cutting limit has responded poorly to release and in turn sensitively restricted satisfactory regrowth. This paper examines the impact of a new schedule requiring logging through all merchantable size classes, based on spacing and tree quality criteria. Although the total log volume available from a forest may not be greatly affected by the new schedule, the quality and size of the average log will be reduced. The retention of the more productive component of the forest, and the logging of substandard stems below the original cutting limit should improve forest productivity through all size classes, while conserving growing stock.

Se hacen recomendaciones para la introduccion de rboles y arbustos adecuados, in principio para mejoramiento del suelo y provision de abrigo.
42606327|Gross calorific values of biomass components of Eucalyptus camaldulensis Dehn, are tabulated. Graphs are presented of net calorific values of wood as related to moisture content and environmental conditions, i.e., at equilibrium moisture content, thereby providing practical estimates of the heat released during combustion. 42616713|The potential socio-economic value of species belonging to the tropical and subtropical timber-producing genus Toona. M. Roem. (Meliaceae) became evident during a biosystematic revision of the genus begun at the Oxford Forestry Institute in 1988. The many possible multipurpose uses of Toona species are described, and a summary of the species currently recognized within the genus is given. Silvicultural use of these species is currently restricted by the taxonomic complexities inherent in the genus, particularly at the infraspecific level, and by the susceptibility of some Toona species to the shoot-borer moth. Future work will resolve these biological problems restricting the promotion of these trees for rural and commercial development so that their socio-economic value can be realized by local farmers and communities in Southeast Asia. La valeur socio-conomique potentielle des espces appartenant au genre Toona M. Roem. (Meliaceae), un genre reprsent par des espces ligneuses tropicales et subtropicales, est devenue manifeste au cours d'une tude systmatique du genre dbute en 1988  l'Oxford Forestry Institute. Les multiples usages potentiels des espces du genre Toona sont dcrits et un rsum des espces actuellement reconnues comme faisant partie du genre est donn. L'usage de certaines espces de Toona en sylviculture est pour le moment restreint  cause des complexits taxonomiques inhrentes au genre, particulirement au niveau infraspcifique, et  cause de la susceptibilit de certaines espces de Toona vis--vis du papillon foreur du bourgeon. De futurs travaux devraient rsoudre ces problmes biologiques qui entravent la diffusion de ces arbres pour un dveloppement commercial et rural. Le dveloppement de ces essences permettrait la ralisation de leur valeur socioconomique par des fermiers et des communauts locales en Asie du Sud-Est. El valor socio-econmico potencial de especies tropicales y subtropicales de produccin de madera que pertenecen al gnero Toona M. Roem. (Meliaceae) fue evidente durante una revisin bio-sistemtica del gnero que comenz en el Instituto Forestal de Oxford en 1988. Se describen todos los posibles multi-propsitos usos de las especies de Toona y se da un resumen de las especies actualmente reconocidas dentro de este gnero. El uso en silvicultura de estas especies est actualmente restringido por las complejidades taxonmicas inherentes al gnero, particularmente al nivel infra-especfico y por la susceptibilidad de algunas especies de Toona a la polilla barrenadora del retoo. Un futuro trabajo resolver estos problemas biolgicos restringiendo la promocin de estos rboles para desarrollo rural y comercial de manera tal que su valor socio-econmico pueda ser aprovechado por silvicultores locales y comunidades en el sureste asitico.
42603789|Experience in agriculture and to a lesser extent in forestry shows that soil fertility is closely associated with the level of soil organic matter and in particular with the nitrogen which is held in the organic complex. Cultivation leads to a breakdown of the organic matter with a brief release of nitrogen but a decrease in fertility. European research suggests that pines are efficient in the uptake and use of soil N. At the same time, there is evidence that in many forests the supply of N is insufficient for maximum growth and that it decreases during the life of a plantation. The work reported here relates to an experiment in a Pinus radiata plantation in New South Wales, where responses to N and P fertilisers have been recorded for 5 years. The main effects and their interaction are very highly significant. Growth, in terms of height, stem diameter, and dryweight, the uptake of N and P, and total N and available P in the surface soil have been measured. The results show that for the area studied: (i) While N alone caused a slight depression in growth, P alone produced an increase of about 50 per cent. The addition of N and P, however, produced about three times the height growth and five times the basal area of the controls. (ii) Treatment with P alone caused an increased uptake of N from the soil, to almost twice the quantity taken up by the controls. This increased uptake was only one-quarter of the uptake of the NP plots. These results support growth data showing that after P fertilisation further growth is limited by a marked deficiency of N. (iii) Trees receiving both N and P took up more than six times as much N as the controls. This represents a recovery of about 25 per cent of the applied N. (iv) Trees receiving N and P took up 18 per cent of the applied P, compared with 3 per cent by trees receiving the same quantity of P without N. (v) In the surface (03") soil of the N and P plots, there was an increase in total N of 23 per cent in 2 years. This represents a gain of 133 1b. per acre.
42604640|Several types of photocopier at present used in offices produce surprisingly good copies direct from herbarium specimens. Their use in the field is discussed. Plusiers types de photocopieuse actuellement utiliss par les bureaux produisent des reproductions d'une qualit tonnante  partir de spcimenes d'herbier. L'article traite de leur utilit sur le terrain. Varios tipos de mquinas fotocopiadoras que se emplean actualmente en oficinas dan copias de especmenes de herbario mucho megores de lo que se pudiera creer, al ser sacadas las copias directaments sobre los especmenes. Se estudia el empleo, por los que trabajan en el terreno, de estas mquinas.
42610003|Two modelling areas with enormous potential for forestry applications are reviewed: forest management planning models and forest growth projection models. The 'allowable cut' problem is used both to show how these model types are used in combination and to highlight how management concepts have changed as more is learned about the complexities inherent in forest management situations. Deux zones modles possdant un norme potentiel pour l'application en foresterie sont examines: les modles d'organisation de la grance forestire et les modles de projection de la croissance forestire. Le problme de 'coupe permissible' est utilis pour  la fois montrer comment ces types de modles sont utiliss en conjonction, et pour souligner les changements survenus dans les conceptes de grance alors que les complexits inhrentes aux situations de grance forestire deviennent mieux connues. Se revisan dos modelos de reas con enorme potencial para aplicaciones de ingeniera forestal: modelos de planeacin de administracin forestal y modelos de proyeccin de crecimiento forestal. El problema de 'corte permisible' se usa tanto para mostrar como estos tipos de modelo se utilizan en combinacin y como para destacar como los conceptos de administracin han cambiado ha medida que se aprende ms acerca de las complejidades inherentes en las situaciones de administracin forestal.
42604303|Forest insect pest problems encountered in the South Pacific in American Samoa, British Solomon Islands Protectorate, Fiji, French Polynesia, New Caledonia, Papua New Guinea, Western Samoa and in the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands are considered in this paper. The three most serious problems are (i) the large scale infestation of Hoop Pine plantations at Bulolo and Wau in Papua New Guinea by a branchlet mining scolytid, Hylurdrectonus araucanae Schedl; (ii) the infestation of Mahogany plantations in Fiji and possibly in French Polynesia by ambrosia beetles; and (iii) a high incidence of ambrosial beetle attack in newly felled logs and timbers and subsequent downgrading for export and local sale where prompt extraction, utilization and shipping are not possible. There appear to be no major forest insect problems in most of the islands; American Samoa, British Solomon Islands Protectorate, Cook Islands, Gilbert and Ellice Islands, New Caledonia, Tonga, Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands and in the Wallis and Futuna Islands.

The history of the development of an internationally recognised decimal classification for forestry is outlined. Details are given of the growth of literature and its coverage in Forestry Abstracts since the war, of changes in its linguistic pattern, the sources of literature used, and the rle of selection, abstracting and indexing in making information available. The postal card-service and microfilming services available from Oxford are mentioned and the importance of literature reviews is stressed. Comments on the future are made.

There were twice as many right-handed pseudo-transverse divisions (parallel to the Spiral grain) as left-handed, suggesting a relation between the spiral grain and the direction of the pseudo-transverse divisions of the cambium. 2. During the development of spiral grain the rays rotate about their centres, the centres retaining their positions in relation to the axis of the stem. 3. This rotation of the rays is often accompanied by the withdrawal of a tracheid from one side of a ray and its reappearance on the other.
42605218|An international provenance research programme on Central American Pines was started in 1969 and international provenance trials are now in progress. Study of the natural forests of both species has confirmed their potential value for plantation in many tropical countries, especially on seasonally dry and infertile sites. Variation observed both within and between the natural populations offers possibilities for improved adaptation to site and production requirements. Some natural populations are in danger of depletion or extinction and further international action is needed to conserve and develop their genetic resources.
42606413|This review of SPR commences with the development of the technique since its inception in 1942, continues with the introduction of the method into forestry practice and concludes with an account of several case studies which have been reported. Esta resea de muestreo con reemplazamiento parcial (SPR) empieza con el desarrollo de la tcnica desde los comienzos en 1942, sigue con la introduccin del mtodo en la dasonoma practical y termina con un relato de varios estudios especficos citados en la literatura.
42607759|Wood is a renewable resource and one of our oldest structural materials. However at the present time the world's supply is diminishing and there are increasing pressures to more effectively utilise what material is still available. It has long been recognised that whatever timber is processed most of it has a finite service life; cellulose, the basic polymer which makes up the wood structure, is biodegradable. In Australia, the geography and climate combine to produce a wide range of hazardous environments, so that a significant proportion of wood in service is subject to fungal decay, termite and borer attack, chemical degradation, and severe weathering. The need for an effective preservation industry is thus apparent. The paper discusses the different types of wood preservatives being employed, including oil-borne treatments such as various creosotes, water-borne salts such as copper-chrome-arsenic, and organic-solvent-based formulations. Some of the processes for introducing these preservatives into timber are mentioned and the 'passive treatment' processes  diffusion techniques  are presented. Commodities being treated, including posts, poles, piles, railway sleepers, building timbers, and composite panel products (plywood, particleboard, etc.) are used as examples of current preservation technology. Some of the problems facing the industry are discussed. For example, vacuumpressure impregnated transmission and telegraph poles, which are being produced from non-durable hardwoods because the supply of naturally durable trees has been severely diminished over the years, may fail to give economic service life, particularly in Queensland and Tasmania, due to soft rot decay in the treated sapwood. Fungitoxic chemicals contained in bandages have been developed as groundline maintenance treatments to remedy the situation in Australia's standing pole populations, while research both here and overseas is trying to produce more effective initial treatments for new poles. Finally, future research and developments in wood preservation, especially the search for third-generation preservatives, are discussed in the context of the Australian industry, and in relation to developments in building practices. Le bois est une ressource renouvelable et l'un des plus anciens composants structuraux utiliss par l'homme; cependant, de nos jours, on voit se restreindre les rserves mondiales et il devient urgent de faire une meilleure utilisation de ce qui se prsente sur le march. On sait depuis longtemps que, quelle que soit la nature du bois en question, sa durabilit n'est pas ternelle; la cellulose, polymre de base de la structure du bois, est biodgradable. En Australie le climat et la gographie se combinent de faon trs varie, produisant un nombre considrable d'environnements hasardeux au sein desquels le bois est expos aux attaques de multiples champignons, des termites et des insectes xylophages,  la dgradation chimique et  une usure svre due au seul climat. L'industrie de produits de prservation du bois est dans ce pays d'une grande ncessit. Cet ouvrage dcrit les diffrents agents de prservation du bois utiliss, parmi lesquels on compte les traitements  base d'huiles comme les crosotes, les sels hydriques comme le mlange cuivre-chrome-arsenic, et les formules a base de solvant organique. Les techniques utilises pour introduire ces substances dans le bois sont revues en dtail ainsi qu'un court expos des techniques dites "passives", utilisant le phnomne de diffusion. Les pices de bois couramment traites, poteaux, piquets, taix, traverses de chemin de fer, bois de construction de mme que les diffrents groupes comprenant les contreplaqus, les panneaux de particules etc. servent d'exemples illustrant la description de la technologie de prservation courante. Quelques uns des problmes que l'industrie de prservation peut rencontrer nous sont exposs ici, parmi lesquels le cas des poteaux tlgraphiques et tlphoniques: imprgns sous pression et sous vide, ces lments proviennent de bois de feuillus peu durables en raison de l'appauvrissement rcent du pays en bois de meilleure qualit, et ne se rvlent pas conomiques du tout, surtout dans le Queensland et la Tasmanie, car leur aubier trait est sujet  une pourriture humide. On emploie actuellement des sortes de bandages situs au niveau du sol pour prserver les poteaux Australiens, en attendant que les diffrentes recherches en cours puissent produire des trairements applicables sur la nouvelle gnration de poteaux. Pour terminer l'auteur examine la recherche future et les diffrents dveloppements en cours dans le domaine de la prservation du bois; en particulier il insiste sur les produits de troisime gnration, dans le contexte de l'Industrie Australienne et en relation avec les pratiques structurales. La madeca es un producto renovable y uno de los materiales mas viejos usados en la construccin. Sin embargo, actualmente la produccin mundial est disminuyendo y las presiones aumentan para un uso mas efectivo del material existente. Por mucho timpo se ha reconocido que aun la mayora de la madera procesada tiene una vida de servicio limitada; celulosa, que es el polmero bsico en la madera, es biodegradable. En Australia la geografa y el clima se combinan para producir un amplio rango de anvientes peligrosos, por lo tanto una proporcin significativa de la madera en uo est sujeta al ataque de hongos, termites, barrenadores, degradacin qumica y un desgaste severo. La necesidad de una efectiva preservacin industrial es evidente. En el presente trabajo se discuten los diferentes tipos de preservativos para maderas que estn siendo usados, incluyendo tratamientos com productos solubles en aceite, tales como varias cocostas, sales solubles en aqua como cobre-cromoarsnico, y formulaciones de solventes bsicos orgnicos. Algunos de los procesos de la sobre la penetracin de estos preservativos en la madera son mencionados, asi como los procesos de ' tratamiento pasivo' y tcnicas de difusin. Han sido tratados varios productos, incluyendo postes, postes para transmisin de energa elctrica, pilotes, traviesas para ferrocarril, madera para construccin, y paneles compuestos (madera contrachapada y tabelros de partculas, etc.), los cuales son usados como ejemplos de tecnologa de preservacin corriente. Son discutidos algunos de los problemas que afronta la industria. Por ejemplo, imprecnasin bajo presin al vacio de postes telegrficos y de transmisin, los cuales estn siendo producidos con latifoliadas no durables, debido a que el suplimiento de rboles naturalmente durables, a disminuido sevesamente con los anos. Ademas al tratamiento de maderas suaves podra fallar en dar una vida til econmica, principalmente en Queensland y Tasmania, debido a la podricin de la albura previamenta tratada. Fungicidas txicos contenidos en vendas que se colocan al nivel del suelo, han sido desarrolladas como tratamientos de mantenimiento, para remidiar la situacin en la poblacin de postes colocados en Australia, mientras la investigacin aqu y en el extranjero est tratando de desarrollar tratamientos iniciates ms efectivos para postes nuevos. Finalmente, futura investigocin y desarrollos en preservacin de madera, especialmente la bsqueda de preservativos para tercera generacin, son discutidos en el contecto de la industria Australiana, y en relacin al desarrollo de las prcticas de construccin.
42608630|Of all forest crops now being developed and utilised in the tropics, Pinus species are probably amongst the most popular, especially where long-fibred raw material is required. This is particularly so in S.E. Asia where establishment programmes of native and exotic pines are proliferating. Until this expansion began, few insect pest problems were observed in the region, but in recent years one group of pests, collectively known as shoot or tip moths, have become very serious indeed in countries such as the Philippines, and at least common elsewhere, as in Thailand and Vietnam. This paper describes the biology, ecology and impact of members of two genera of shoot moth (Dioryctria and Rhyacionia = Petrova) as related to pine crops in parts of S.E. Asia, and discusses how site factors such as altitude, soil and climate, plus various species and provenances of host tree influence the success and hence effect of these pests. Trees are attacked primarily in two ways; shoot boring results in malformation and severe retardation, whilst bark boring, at least in young trees, results in death. Incidence of damage is highest at low altitudes (less than 800 m a.s.l.), on poor, degraded soils, and where the warm climate allows optimum growth and reproduction of the moths. New plantations are especially at risk when established in the vicinity of older ones which are able to provide a source of infestation. Present and future risk areas are discussed, and the need for research into the management of shoot moths emphasised.
42607495|Three pruning and four thinning trials have been conducted in a Pinus patula stand at Lendu, Uganda. In the thinning trial there are four stocking densities, while pruning has been to three proportions of tree height carried out at three periods; the thinning and pruning are replicated twice and eight times respectively. The results show that thinning regimes which leave a small number of trees per ha have the largest diameter increment. Standing basal area however, is dependent on the number of trees left after thinning. The larger the number the more basal area and vice versa. Pruning beyond 25 per cent of total height adversely affects height and diameter increment and pruning up to 25 per cent has a deleterius effect only when the stand density is very high. It is suggested that pruning beyond 25 per cent of tree height should be avoided in conifer plantations where the object is to grow general structural timber for which conifers in Uganda have been established. It is concluded that stand density should be taken into account when evaluating the effects of pruning, which can be done only when pruning and thinning studies are carried out simultaneously. Regarding pruning periodicity it has been shown that a two year period gives the best results. It is suggested that knot-free timber should be grown in natural forests and that conifer plantations be established to provide general structural timber in which small live knots can be tolerated. Operations which are likely to increase the period during which trees reach exploitable sizes should be avoided. A Lendu (Ouganda), des essais ont t effectu dans une population de Pinus patula, comprenant trois rgimes d'lagage et quatre d'claircissement. Tandis que ces derniers correspondent  quatre densits diffrentes du peuplement, l'lagage a touch trois pourcentages diffrents de la hauteur totale et a t effectu en trois oprations. Elagages et claircies sont rpts respectivement huit fois et deux fois. Les rsultats prouvent que les systmes d'claircies ne laissant qu'un petit nombre d'arbres font obtenir le plus grand accroissement en diamtre. La surface terrire sur pied dpendant cependant du nombre d'arbres subsistant aprs l'opration; plus ce nombre est lev, plus grande est cette surface terrire et vice-versa. Si on lague au-del de 25 per cent de la hauteur totale, on obtient des effets ngatifs sur l'accroissement en hauteur et en diamtre, tandis que la mme opration pratique jusqu' 25 per cent n'a d'effets nfastes que si la densit de la population est trs leve; on suggre donc d'viter d'aller au-del des 25 per cent dans les oprations di'lagage quand il s'agit de plantations de conifres destines  un usage structural du bois, ce qui est l'objet des plantations Ougandaises. En conclusion, il faut donc tenir compte de la densit du peuplement quand on veut y mesurer les rsultats de l'lagage, chose qui ne peut tre faite que quand les deux types d'opration, lagage et claircie, ont t tudies simultanment. La rotation de l'lagage donne les meilleurs rsultats lorsqu'elle s'tend sur deux ans. Il semble que le bois sans nuds doive tre produit par la fort naturelle et que l'on tablisse des plantations de conifres pour les usages structuraux, o l'existence de nuds de petite taille est tolerable. Il faudrait viter le genre d'opration tendant  prolonger la priode au cours de laquelle les abres atteignent leur taille d'exploitation. Siete anlisis, tres de poda y cuatro de aclareo, se han llevado a cabo en un rodal de Pinus patula en Lendu, Uganda. En el ensayo de aclareo se utilizan cuatro densidades de plantacin, mientras que la poda se ha realizado hasta tres proporciones de la altura del rbol, hechos en tres perdos. Los ensayos de aclereo y poda se han replicado dos y ocho veces respectivamente. Los resultados demuestran que los regmenes de aclareo que dejan pocos rboles por hextarea dan el mayor incremento de dimetro. El rea basimtrica es funcin del nmero de rboles en pi despus del aclareo, con correlacin positiva. La poda por encima del 25 per cent de altura total influye en el incremento de altura y dimetro, y la poda hasta el 25 per cent tiene efecto deleterio solamente cuando la densidad del rodal as elevada. Se sugiere que debe evitarse el podar por encima del 25 per cent de altura en aquellas plantaciones de coniferas donde el objeto es producir lea para estructuras  y es para este fin que se establecieron las coniferas en Uganda. Se llega a la conclusin que la densidad del rodal debe tenerse en cuenta cuando se evalan los efectos de la poda y aclareo lo que puede solamente cuando los estudios de poda y aclareo se hacen conjuntamente. Se ha demostrado que los mejores resultados son obtenidos si se realiza la poda cada dos aos. Se sugiere que madera sin nudos debe producirse en selva natural y que deben establecerse plantaciones de coniferas para producir madera para estructura general en que pueden tolerarse nudos adhrentes pequeos. Deben evitarse las operaciones que tienden a aumentar el perodo en que los rboles lleguen a tamaos utilizables.
42605219|The two most extensive forest formations found in Sierra Leone are moist evergreen forest and moist semi-deciduous forest. The former is characterised by an abundance of Tarrietia utilis and Lophira alata. Three kinds of moist semideciduous forest are found, where either Antiaris africana or Nesogordonia papaverifera or Triplochiton scleroxylon are common. A comparison of the geographical distribution of families shows the Caesalpiniaceae, Mimosaceac and Sterculiaceae to be most common in moist evergreen forest and the Mimosaceae, Moraceae and Combretaceae in moist semi-deciduous forest.
42607279|The goal of this paper is to present the current state of understanding of the potential for managing forests to mitigate CO emissions. There are basically three categories of promising forestry practices that promote sound management of forests and at the same time conserve and sequester carbon (C): (1) management for conservation of existing C pools through slowing deforestation, changing harvesting regimes and protecting forests from disturbances; (2) management for expanding C storage by increasing the area and/or C. density of native forests, plantations and agroforestry and/or in wood products; and (3) management for substitution by increasing the transfer of forest biomass C into products, such as biofuels and long-lived wood products, that can be used instead of fossil-fuel based products. Under baseline conditions of today's climate and no change in the estimated available lands, the cumulative amount of that could potentially be conserved and sequestered over the period 1995-2050 by slowing deforestation by 138 M ha (million ha) and promoting natural forest regeneration on 217 M ha in the tropics combined with the global establishment of 345 M ha of plantations and agroforestry on presently non-forested land would be about 60 to 87 Pg (Pg = 10g), equivalent to 11-15% of the projected cumulative fossil fuel C emissions over the same period. If the wood produced from the plantation programme was substituted for fossil fuels, about another 30 Pg of C would be sequestered. The cumulative cost, excluding land costs and transaction costs, to conserve and sequester the above amounts of C, ranges from US$247 billion to $302 billion at a unit cost of about $2-8/Mg C. Under a changed climate, atmospheric composition and land use, the carbon conservation and sequestration potential would be less than that estimated under baseline conditions because land would be less available in the tropics, and sequestration by new forests in temperate and boreal regions might be offset by transient decline and loss of carbon from existing forests in response to climate change. L'objectif de cet article est de prsenter l'tat de comprhension actuelle du potentiel de l'amenagement des forts en vue d'attnuer les missions de CO. Il y a 3 catgories de pratiques forestires gnrales prometteuses qui promeuvent l'amenagement intelligent des forts tout en conservant et squestrant le carbone (C): (1) amenagement pour conserver les bassins de C existants en ralentissant le dboisement, changer les rgimes de rcolte et protger les forts contre les troubles, (2) amenagement pour accrotre le stockage du C en aggrandissant la surface et/ou la densit de C des forts d'origine, les plantations et l'agrosylviculture et/ou dans les produits du bois, et, (3) l'amenagement pour la substitution en aggrandissant le transfert de la biomasse de C des forts en produits, comme les biofuels et les produits boiss durables qui peuvent tre utiliss au lieu des produits bass sur les fuels fossiles. Sous les conditions de base du climat actuel et sans changement dans les terres disponibles values, la quantit cumule de qui pourrait potentiellement tre conserve ou squestre dans la priode 1995-2050, en rallentissant le dboisement de 138 M ha (million d'ha) et en encourageant la regnration forestire naturelle sur 217 M ha dans les tropiques, en combinaison avec l'tablissement global de 345 M ha de plantations et de l'agrosylviculture sur des terres actuellement non boises, serait environ 60  87 Pg (Pg = 10 g), l'quivalent de 11 - 15 % des missions de C cumulatives de fuel fossile prvues sur la mme priode. Si le bois produit dans le programme de plantation tait substitu par les fuels fossiles, on pourrait encore squestrer 30 Pg de C. Le cot cumulatif, en excluant le cot du terrain et des transactions, pour conserver et squestrer les quantits de C ci-dessus, va de 247 milliards  302 milliards d'US$ au cot unitaire de 2-8$/Mg C. Dans un climat modifi, la composition atmosphrique et l'usage de la terre, le potentiel de conservation et de sequestration du carbone serait moins important que celui estim selon les conditions de base, car la terre serait moins disponible dans les tropiques, et la sequestration par des forts nouvelles dans les rgions tempres et borales pourrait tre mise en balance avec le dclin transitoire et la perte de carbone par les forts existantes, en raction au changement climatique. El objetivo de este artculo es presentar el estado actual del conocimiento del potencial del manejo forestal para mitigar las emisiones de CO. Existen bsicamente tres categoras de prcticas promisorias de ingeniera forestal que promueven la administracin slida de bosques y al mismo tiempo conservan y fijan carbono (C): (1) administracin para la conservacin de los reservnos de C existentes regmenes de cosecha y protegiendo bosques contra perturbacin; (2) administracin para expandir el almacenamiento de C a travs del incremento del rea y/o densidad de C de bosques nativos, plantaciones y sistemas agroforestales y/o en productos madereros; y (3) administracin para sustitucin a travs de un incremento de la transferencia de biomasa de C forestal en productos, como biocombustibles y productos de madera longevos, que pueden ser utilizados en lugar de productos basados en combustibles fsiles. Bajo las condiciones de base del clima actual y sin cambio en las tierras disponibles estimadas, la cantidad acumulativa de C que pudiera ser potencialmente conservada y fijada sobre el periodo de 1995-2050 a travs de la reduccin de la deforestacin en 138 M ha (millones de hectreas) y promoviendo la regeneracin natural de bosques en 217 M ha en los trpicos, combinado con el establecimiento a nivel global de 345 M ha de plantaciones y sistemas agroforestales en tierras actualmente sin bosques sera alrededor de 60 a 80 Pg (Pg = 10g), lo cual es equivalente a 11 - 15% de las emisiones de C de combustible fsiles acumulativas sobre el mismo perodo. Si la madera producida de un programa de plantacin fuera sustituida por combustibles fsiles, se fijara cerca de otro 30 Pg de C. El costo acumulativo, excluyendo los costos de tierra y costos de transaccin, para conservar y fijar las cantidades de mencionadas anteriormente, varan de US$247 billones a $302 billones a un costo unitario de cerca de $2-8/Mg C. Bajo cambios de clima, composicin atmosfrica y uso del suelo, la conservacin de carbono y la fijacin potencial seran menos que las estimadas bajo las condiciones iniciales de base porque habra menos tierra disponible en los trpicos, y la fijacin por nuevos bosques en las regiones templadas y boreales podra ser contrarrestada por la disminucin y prdida transitoria de carbono de bosques existentes en respuesta al cambio de clima.
42607757|As with any other forest plantation the maximum yield from trees used for smallholder and community forests can be obtained from the best adapted species and provenance; since these are commonly exotic, international collaboration is desirable in exploring, testing, evaluating and conserving the genetic resources of selected populations. However, there are four major differences between agroforestry and industrial plantations: (1) testing must take into account a range of agricultural crops and managerial treatments that may be available in combination with the tree crop; (2) the trees themselves are likely to be required simultaneously for a wide range of products and end uses so that careful character weighting will be needed; (3) the national agency obtaining information and plant material is not the grower so that an extension service is required to transfer the technology to the local community and smallholder; and (4) for many agroforestry tree species a considerable degree of local adaptation and land race development may already have occurred, adding to the problems of sampling, conserving and testing at the population level. Although it may appear premature at the present stage of species selection and development of management systems, genetic improvement within species should be considered now as a logical extension. The early economic and reproductive maturity of species required for agroforestry suggest that selection can be initiated shortly after routine adoption of a given population, provided that multiple end uses can be evaluated. The interactions of tree genotype with agricultural crop and environment are more difficult to identify precisely than those of provenance genotype, but they are as important. Again, the benefits of international collaboration and central coordination are considerable, especially if resources of local, trained manpower are limited and if fundamental research is necessary for untested species, including study of breeding system, seed storage, cytogenetics, phenology, vegetative propagation and physiological response to extreme environmental factors. De mme que pour toute autre plantation forestire, le rendement maximal d'arbres de petites proprits ou de forts communautaires peut tre obtenu des essences et des provenances les mieux adaptes; tant donn que celles-ci sont le plus souvent exotiques, une collaboration internationale est souhaitable en ce qui concerne l'exploration, les essais, l'valuation et la conservation des ressources gntiques des populations slectionnes. Il y a toutefois quatre diffrences majeures entre l'agroforesterie et les plantations industrielles: (1) Pour les essais, il faut prendre en considration une gamme de cultures agricoles et de traitements de gestion qui peuvent tre compatibles avec la culture d'arbres; (2) Comme il est possible que les arbres eux-mmes soient appels a tre utiliss pour une gamme tendue de produits et d'usages finaux, une pondration soigneuse des traits s'avre ncessaire; (3) L'agence nationale qui reoit les informations et le matriel vgtal n'est pas le cultivateur et par consquent un lien est ncessaire pour transfrer la technologie aux communauts locales et aux petits propritaires; (4) Pour de nombreuses espces d'arbres cultives en agroforesterie, un degr considrable d'adaptation locale a pu dj tre atteint et de nouvelles races ont pu dj tre dveloppes, ce qui ajoute aux problmes d'chantillonnage, de conservation et d'essais au niveau de la population. Bien que cela puisse sembler prmatur au niveau actuel de la slection d'espces et du dveloppement des systmes de gestion, l'amlioration gntique des systmes de gestion devrait tre considre maintenant comme la prochaine tape logique. La prcoce maturit conomique et reproductive des espces requises pour l'agroforesterie suggre que la slection peut commencer rapidement aprs l'adoption de routine d'une population donne,  condition que les usages finaux multiples aient pu tre valus. Les interactions entre gnotypes d'arbre et cultures agricoles et environnements sont plus difficiles  identifier precisemment que celles concernant les gnotypes de provenance, mais elles sont tout aussi importantes. Ici encore, les avantages de la collaboration internationale et d'une coordination centrale sont considrables, surtout si les ressources locales en main d'oeuvre qualifie sont limite et si la recherche fondamentale est ncessaire pour des espces non testes, telle que l'tude des systmes d'amlioration gntique, du stockage des graines, de la cytogntique, de la phnologie, de la multiplication vgtative et de la rponse physiologique aux facteurs environnements extrmes. Como con cualquier otra plantacin forestal, el mximo rendimiento de rboles usados por pequeos propietarios y bosques communitarios, puede ser obtenida de la especie y procedencia mejor adaptada; y como stas son comunmente exticas, la colaboracin internacional es deseable en exploracin, prueba, evaluacin y conservacin de recursos genticos de poblaciones selectas. Sin embargo, hay cuatro grandes diferencias entre agroforestacin y plantaciones industriales: (1) la prueba debe tener en cuenta un rango de cultivos agrcolas y su manejo que sean viables combinados con la explotacin forestal; (2) los rboles van a ser requeridos simultneamente para un amplio rango de productos y fines de uso por lo que ser necesario un balance cuidadoso de los caracteres; (3) la agencia nacional que obtiene la informacin y el material de plantas no es el productor, por lo que se requerir un servicio de extensin para la transferencia de tecnologa a la comunidad local y al pequeo propietario; y (4) para muchas especies de rboles usados en agroforestacin, puede haber ocurrido un grado considerable de adaptacin local y el desarrollo de razas locales, agregndose a los problemas de muestreo, conservacin y prueba a nivel de la poblacin. Aunque puede paracer prematuro al presente estado de seleccin de especies y desarrollo de sistemas de manejo, el mejoramiento gentico dentro de especies debera ser considerado como una extensin lgica. La temprana maduracin reproductiva y econmica de especies requeridas para agroforestacin sugiere que la seleccin puede ser iniciada inmediatemente despus de adoptada una rutina en una poblacin dada, si es que los mltiples fines de uso pueden ser evaluados. Las interacciones del genotipo del rbol con el cultivo agrcola y el medio son mas difciles de identificar con precisin que las del genotipo de procedencias, pero tambin son importantes.
