Nuevamente, los beneficios de la colaboracin internacional y una coordinacin central son considerables, especialmente si los recursos de mano de obra local entrenada son limitados y si es necesaria investigacin fundamental para especies no probadas, incluyendo estudios de sistemas de cra, almacenamiento de semillas, citogentica, fenologa, propagacin vegetativa y respuesta fisiolgica a factores ambientales externos.
42603017|The background to silviculture in Ghana is discussed with a review of the position to date and an indication of the lines which are likely to be followed in future. In the high forest the question of whether production is to be for quality, vary largely with the export market in mind, or for quantity, mainly to cater for local needs, is seen as dominant. In view of the uncertainty which prevails in the field of estimates of production it is suggested that the silvicultural solutions to both propositions deserve investigation, and indeed it seems possible that the two aspects may be complementary in the circumstances of Ghana. Until a good deal more is known, district work will have to proceed roughly along its present lines with selection working as the general method in the semi-deciduous forests. In the savannah it appears that the past policy of concentrating forestry on the worst soils has proved unsound, as they are incapable of producing the requisite produce. It will have to be faced that if forest produce is required, then soils suitable for the growth of trees will have to be provided and that this may mean a conflict of interest with the agriculturalists.
42610031|This paper discusses the effects of an accidental late dry season fire in a 34year old fire protected plot and prescribed annual early and late dry season burning on litter and coppiced miombo woodland. Compared with early burning, the accidental fire significantly reduced tree species diversity, basal area and surface litter. Annual late burning over a 36 year period has suppressed woodland development but nine species considered to be fire-tolerant have persisted. The study supports an early burning policy to reduce the risk of late fires and promote miombo woodland regeneration. Cet article traite les effets sur la litire et le bois de taillis miombo d'un feu imprvu vers la fin de la saison sche dans une parcelle de 34 ans protge contre le feu, et du brlage contrl annuel tt et tard pendant la saison sche. En comparaison du brlage tt, le feu accidentel a considrablement rduit la diversit des espces d'arbres, la surface terrire, et la litire. Le brlage annuel tard dans la saison pendant une priode de 36 annes a supprim le dveloppement du bois, mais neuf espces considres comme tolrantes du feu ont persist. L'tude conseille une politique de brlage tt pour rduire le risque des feux vers la fin de la saison et pour avancer la rgnration du bois miombo. Este artculo discute los efectos de un incendio accidental en la ltima etapa de la sequa en una parcela protegida del fuego por espacio de 34 aos y las temporadas anuales, temprana y tarda, de incendios prescritos de hojarasca y rebrotes en un bosque de miombo. Comparado con el fuego temprano, el incendio accidental redujo significativamente la diversidad de especies arbreas, el rea basal y la capa superficial de hojarasca. El incendio tardo anual sobre un perodo de 36 aos ha suprimido el desarrollo del bosque pero han persistido nueve especies consideradas resistentes al fuego. El estudio apoya una poltica de fuegos tempranos para reducir el riesgo de fuegos tardos y promover la regeneracin de bosques de miombo.
42603676|An attempt is made on certain broad assumptions to forecast what the effect of the British devaluation in November 1967 is likely to be in a full year. Estimation is made difficult by lack of data and the extent to which certain countries have passed on the effect of devaluation in their quotations of new season's prices and on the trend of freight rates which, for a number of reasons, are likely to move independently of devaluation, but at the same time are an important element in c.i.f. prices.
42606521|International gatherings of foresters in recent years have concentrated somewhat on forestry's potential to improve the quality of life of humankind, particularly the populations of post-colonial and other lesser-developed countries. Philosophical concepts which have been advanced with increasing vigour are: forests provide a base from which to launch attacks on economic underdevelopment; providing they are well planned, investments in forests can be justified because of their manifold socio-economic and other benefits, in almost any circumstance. Clearly these propositions have their own validity and it is tempting to allow them to outweigh other more practical considerations which, on the surface at least, may seem less altruistic. However, it seems to be that if an investment in forestry is made for no other reason than that land is available, it is likely that the return on funds would be less than optimal, and inefficient in the use of the investment resource. The evidence is that the more successful forestry project is characterised by the clear definition of the investor's objectives and the objectivity of its pre-planning. Where this occurs, the achievement of a successful crop is not seen in every case as an end in itself; very often the ultimate objective is its profitable utilisation by a forest owner, integrated to the maximum extent and aimed primarily at ensuring such a return on funds as would encourage further investment. Les runions internationales rcentes de sylviculteurs se sont concentres quelque peu sur le potentiel de la sylviculture d'amliorer la qualit de la vie de l'Homme, surtout les populations d'anciennes colonies et d'autres pays sous-developps. Les concepts philosophiques qui ont t propos avec de plus en plus de force sont: que les forts fournissent une base de laquelle on pourrait commencer  lutter contre le sous-dveloppement; pourvu qu'ils soient bien conu, les investissements en forts peuvent tre justifis  cause de leurs multiples bnfices socio-conomiques, etc., en presque tout tat de cause. videmment ces propositions ont leur propre force, et il est tentant de les laisser l'emporter sur d'autres considrations plus pratiques qui sont en apparence moins altruiste. Pourtant, il parait que si un investissement en sylviculture est fait simplement parce que cette terre est disponible, il est probable que le rendement des fonds serait moins qu'optimal et inefficace dans l'utilisation de la ressource d'investissement. Il est vident que les projets forestiers les plus russis sont caractriss par la dfinition prcise des buts du capitaliste et l'objectivit de sa conception d'avance. O cela arrive, l'atteinte d'une culture russie n'est pas toujours considre comme un but en soi; trs souvent l'objectif ultime est son utilisation lucrative par un propritaire forestier, intgre au maximum et vise premirement  assurer un rendement des fonds de faon  encourager plus d'investissement. Las reuniones de forestales en los ltimos aos se han concentrado hasta cierto punto en el potencial de la selvicultura de mejorar la vida humana, particularmente la de los habitantes de pueblos post-coloniales y de otros paises menos desarrollados. Las ideas filosficas que se han presentado cada vez con ms fuerza son:- Los bosques proveen la base de donde atacar el subdesarrollo econmico, econmico. Con tal de que estn bien planeadas, las inversiones en bosques se pueden justificar por muchos aspectos socioeconmicos y otros beneficios, casi en cualquier circunstancia. Est claro que estas proposiciones son vlidas y es tentador el permitir que preponderen sobre otras consideraciones ms prcticas que, al menos a primera vista, pueden parecer menos altruistas. Sin embargo parece ser que si se invierte en selvicultura simplemente porque hay tierra disponible para ello, lo ms probable es que las ganancias vo sean ptimas ni eficientes en cuanto al uso de los recursos invertidos. La evidencia es que los proyectos forestales ms eficaces, se caracterizan por la clara definicin de las miras del inversor y por la objetividad de su pre planificacin. Cuando stos ocurre el conseguir una buena cosecha no se considera siempre como una meta por s misma. Con frecuencia la meta final es el uso provechoso de los beneficios obtenidos por el dueo del bosque, integrados al mximo y enfocados especialmente para asegurar una retribucin de fondos que incite a ms inversiones.
42605441|Results of a previous study were reassessed on fresh information from new aerial photography. The previous contention was confirmed that the damage due to lightning and wind-throw are ecologically and economically significant for the management of natural Shorea albida-forest in Sarawak.
42604794|Characteristics which are important in the improvement of the quality of pines are discussed. These are disease and insect resistance, form, yield, uniformity, density, tracheid morphology and chemical composition, grain angle, compression wood and resin content. The discussion considers the relationship of the characteristics to various industrial uses. It is noted that technological change might alter requirements, but form, yield and uniformity will probably always be important. Some of the difficulties in making improvements in the characteristics also are mentioned. Improvement objectives are given for Malawi, Rhodesia and Zambia, with consideration of present and potential industrial uses for pine. Improvement must be obtained not only through breeding but by continued species, provenance and hybrid trials, and silvicultural management. Improvements in utilization methods should also contribute to increased productivity and product quality. Objectives for multi-purpose plantations are essentially hierarchial in order. Firstly, stem form must be improved but caution is urged in setting a too rigid standard for branch characteristics. All other improvements should be made within the framework of good form. Yield should be increased, but much of this should come from improvement of form and reduction of spiral grain and compression wood. Growth rate of trees with good form should be increased if consistent with the production of outer wood with straight grain, little or no compression wood, and an acceptable density. Uniformity between trees and within trees should be increased wherever it is economically feasible. The most important traits for uniformity are form, density and ring width. However, no attempt should be made to reduce the rate of growth of the core, unless it is to improve form. Increased rotation age to produce a wider band of uniform wood must be weighed against financial yield. Selection towards a population with a basic density averaging around 0.45 g/cc in thinnings and between 0.50 to 0.55 g/cc in the final crop is recommended, if possible, within the higher order objectives. If outer wood density falls below 0.45 g/cc, then a reevaluation of objective priority will have to be given if strength tests show the wood to be unsuitable for the required end uses. No selection for particular tracheid characteristics is needed, but a check should be made to determine if the mean tracheid length of the population is being shifted to an undesirably short length. Selection should be made against spiral grain and compression wood in outer wood, but if these characteristics are restricted to the core, then low priority should be given to their reduction. If spiral grain proves to be a major problem in a species, then that species might have to be rejected completely. No effort should be made to change resin content. Objectives for pulp plantations, when rotation age is around fifteen years, are to select for reasonable form and to increase dry weight yield as much as possible. If rotation age is much shorter, then re-evaluation of objectives to include tracheid characteristics may be necessary. Pulp evaluation tests would be required before new objectives could be drawn. For neither multi-purpose nor pulp plantations is there a pressing need for disease or insect resistance. However, the threat of the introduction of a pest or the development of an indigenous one to harmful proportions points to the danger of a plantation programme based on a single species. More than one species must be grown if at all possible even though the others may be somewhat less desirable in quality to the preferred species. The development of Pinus radiata resistant to Dothistroma would be welcomed in Central Africa, but development of resistant strains is not feasible within the area. It is cautioned that selection should not be made for tolerance to mineral deficiency until the costs of fertilizer can be evaluated against the quality of the wood.
42608089|The evergreen rainforests of Karnataka State occur on the west and east slopes of the Western Ghat mountain range. The climate is highly seasonal with an intense rainfall occurring largely from June to September. These forests cover an area of about 5000 km and whilst most have been logged, a substantial proportion is virtually untouched. A brief description of forest structure and tloristics is given. The present logging is relatively light and there is an active programme of enrichment planting. The forests are still little known but they deserve much further study because of their great economic and scientific importance. Les forts denses humides sempervirentes de l'tat de Karnataka se trouvent sur les pentes d'ouest et de Test de la chane de montagnes des Ghtes occidentales. Le climat est trs saisonnier avec une precipitation trs leve qui a lieu de juin  septembre. Ces forts s'tendent sur une superficie d' peu prs 5000 km et, bien que le plupart aient t exploit, une partie importante est presque intacte. Une courte description est donne de la structure des forts et de la rpartition des plants. L'exploitation en cours est relativement lgre et il y a un programme effectif d'enrichissement. Les forts sont encore peu connues, mais elles mritent d'tre tudies davantage  cause de leur grande importance conomique et scientifique. Los bosques siempreverdes del Estado de Karnataka se encuentran en las laderas orientadas hacia el este y el oeste de la cadena montaosa del Ghat Occidental. El clima es monznico con lluvias intensas desde junio hasta setiembre. Estos bosques cubren un area de alrededor de 5000 km y apesar que la mayor parte ha sido explotado, una parte importante se mantiene todavia virtualmente sin alguna intervencin. Se presenta una descripcin breve de la estructura del bosque y de su composicin florstica. La explotacin actual es relativamente leve. Se esta implementando un programa activo de enriquecimiento del bosque. Estos bosques son muy poco conocidos y debido a su gran importancia desde el punto de vista cientfico y econmico se recomiendan estudios ms detallados.
42603686|The hypothesis that relative distribution of rain forest and dry sclerophyll forest in south-east Queensland is determined by soil fertility was tested by means of field trials and pot cultures, using the rain forest species Araucaria cunninghamii (hoop pine) as an indicator plant. The plant communities and their associated soils are described, and the techniques of glasshouse and field experimentation discussed. The major factor limiting the growth of hoop pine in the soils of the dry sclerophyll forest community is nitrogen. When the nitrogen deficiency is corrected, the growth rate of hoop pine in these soils is comparable to that of plantations established on former rain forest sites, at least for a period of eight years. It is concluded that rain forest is prevented from occurring on these soils because rain forest species are not adapted to colonizing soils of low nitrogen status. This conclusion is discussed in relation to Beadle's hypothesis that plant distribution in eastern Australia is governed by soil phosphorus levels.
42608165|In the current world situation of diminishing, irreplaceable, fossil fuels, trees planted for fuelwood, charcoal or derived chemical fuels offer a partial solution to a crisis that, depending on the country, already exists or is very near. The paper describes the types of plantation that may be suitable in varying situations from large Government or commercial industrial blocks to small rural community woodlots and individual farmers' hedgerows or home fuel plantings. An ideal sequence of research to develop an acceptable management package includes site assessment, species and provenance trials, silvicultural trials and either pilot plantations or extension and training services but in many areas the problem is so intense that immediate action is necessary, based on the best information available. In addition to survival, resistance to adverse factors, and fast growth, species characteristics to be evaluated include several wood properties that affect heating value, sparking, odour, ease of handling, cutting and burning; also, for many rural situations selected species would provide other services or products, e.g. shade, shelter, food, fodder, soil stabilization or enrichment plus, in some cases, poles and light timber. Seeds should be available and local supplies (of genetically improved material where possible) should be established but good coppicing ability will reduce the problems of establishment of a second crop. Dans la situation mondiale actuelle qui voit s'amenuiser inexorablement les rserves en combustibles fossiles irremplaables, des plantations destines  la fourniture de bois de chauffage,  la production de charbon et de produits chimiques drivs offrent une solution partielle  cette crise dj prsente ou situe dans un futur trs proche, selon le pays o l'on se place. Cet article analyse les diffrents types de plantation pouvant convenir  diverses situations, depuis les grandes units forestires gouvernementales ou industrielles jusqu' aux plantations les plus restreintes des communauts rurales et aux haies des fermiers eux-mmes, ou encore aux plantations purement destines  l'usage domestique. La squence idale des oprations  entreprendre pour la mise en place d'un programme global comprend une tude du site, des essais d'espce et de provenance, des essais sylvicoles, et soit des plantations pilotes, soit des services de vulgarisation et de formation, mais dans de nombreux cas le problme est dj si crucial qu'une action urgente est vitale, base su le peu d'information disponible. En plus de la survie, de la rsistance aux facteurs ngatifs et de la croissance rapide, les caractristiques spcifiques  tudier comprennent plusieurs proprits du bois pouvant affecter la valeur calorique, les risques d'tincelle, l'odeur, la facilit de manipulation, de coupe et de combustion; de mme, dans de nombreuses situations rurales, des espces slectionnes pourvoieraient  d'autres ncessits ou besoins tels que par exemple, l'ombrage, l'abris, la nourriture et le fourrage, la stabilisation du sol ou son enrichissement et aussi parfois, la fabrication de perches et de poteaux. Il faut s'organiser pour que la graine soit facilement disponible et pour mettre sur pied des sources locales (de matriel gntiquement amlior si possible) mais une facult de rejet de souche devrait rduire le problme pos par la deuxime rvolution. En la situacin mundial actual, donde los recursos de combustibles fsiles irremplazables escasean, los rboles que se plantan para lea o para combustibles qumicos derivados, ofrecen una solucin parcial a la crisis que o bien ya existe o est muy cerca, segn los paises. El artculo describe los tipos de plantacin que puedan ser aptas en diferentes condiciones, desde las grandes zonas industriales del Estado o del negocio privado, hasta las pequeas plantaciones a escala de la comunidad local, e incluye tambin los setos de granjeros individuales, o plantaciones domsticas de lea. Una secuencia ideal de investigaciones para desarrollar un sistema aceptable de ordenacin, incluye: evaluacin de la estacin; ensayos de especies y procedencias; ensayos selviculturales; adems de plantaciones pilotos o bien servicios de extensin ye formacin. No obstante, en muchas regiones, el problema ya es tan serio que es necesario tomar medidas inmediatamente, a base de los mejores datos disponibles. Adems de la supervivencia, la resistencia a agentes nocivos y crecimiento rapido, las caractersticas a ensayar incluyen varias propiedades de madera que influyen en el valor calorfico, el chispear de la lea, la facilidad de manejo, corte y combustin. Es ms, en muchas situaciones rurales las especies elegidas abastecern servicios o productos tales como sombra, abrigo, alimento, forraje, estabilizacin o enriquecimiento del suelo. En muchos casos tambin darn palos y madera ligera. Semillas deben ser disponibles y suministros locales deben establecerse (cuando sea posible, deben ser de material genticamente amejorado). Sin embargo, una buena capacidad de producir brotes reducir los problemas del establecimiento de turnos posteriores.
42608005|Individual tree volume equations were developed for tropical rainforest species in the dry land area of Manaus, Amazonas State, Brazil, based on felled tree measurements. Several alternative relationships were analysed; the four best models are presented. Family-specific individual tree volume models are also presented for three separate families. All models use diameter of breast height (dhb) and commercial height to estimate gross volume including bark. One of the best volume equations was the Schumacher-Hall model. Les auteurs ont dvelopp des quations pour le volume des arbres individuels des espces trouves sur les terrains mergs de Manaus, Bresil. Plusieurs modles ont t analyszs: les quatre meilleurs sont prsents. Des modles spcifiques  la famille sont introduits pour trois familles. Tous les modles se servent du diamtre  hauteur d'homme et  la hauteur commercializable, pour estimer le volume brut avec corce. Un des meilleurs est l'quation Schumacher-Hall. Se desarrollaron ecuaciones de volumen para robles individuales de la selva hmida tropical de terra firma cerce de Manaus (capital Estado de Amazonas) sobre la base de mediciones de rboles cortados. Varias relaciones alternativas fueron analizadas y los cuatro modelos mejores son presentados. Se presentan tambin modelos volumetricos individuales para las tres familias botnicas mas abundantes. Todos los modelos utilizan dimetro a 1.3 m (DAP) y la altura comercial para estimar volumen bruto en metros cbicos con corteza. Uno de los ecuaciones me mejores fue la de Schmacher-Hall. Foram desenvolvidas equaces de volume comercial para cada rvore, individualmente, de floresta tropical mida de terra firme na regio de Manaus (Capital do Estado do Amazonas), com base em medices de rvores derrubadas. Vrias relaces alternativas foram analisadas e os 4 melhores modelos so apresentados. Os modelos volumtricos individuais so tambm apresentados para as 3 famlias botnicas mais abundantes, separatdamente. Todos os modelos usam DAP e altura comercial para estimar volume bruto em metros cbicos com casca. Uma das melhores equaes de volume foi a de Schumacher-Hall.
42606994|Twenty-four different species of conifer trees within the Cupressaceae family were studied for their growth rates and trends of tolerance against the cypress aphid Cinara cupressi (Buckton). The study undertaken at Muguga arboretum, Central Kenya over a continuous two year period indicates a wide range of tolerance among the species. Thuya spp. and Cupressocyparis leylandii (Jackson and Dallimore) were most tolerant while Widdringtonia and Callistris were the least. Among the cypresses, Cupressus torulosa (Don), C. funebris (Endl.) and C. arizonica (Greene) were very resistant whereas C. benthamii (Endl.), C. lusitanica (Miller) and C. lindleyi (Klotsch) were susceptible. In view of the growth vigour and resistance towards the aphids, Cupressocyparis leylandii appears the best alternative species to C. lusitanica which is infested and currently widely grown as a plantation species. Results of the hybrid species also indicate that resistance breeding through hybridization may offer a viable longterm solution to the aphid menace. On a tudi les niveaux de croissance et les types de tolrance de trentequatre espces diffrentes de conifres choisies parmi la famille des Cupressaces en prsence d'aphidiens du cyprs Cinara cupressi (Buckton). L'tude a t conduite  l'arboretum de Mugaga, dans le centre du Kenya, durant une priode de deux annes. Elle indique qu'on rencontre une large gamme de niveaux de tolrance parmi les diffrentes espces. Thuya spp. et Cupressocyparis leylandii (Jackson et Dallimore) se sont avres tre les espces le plus tolrantes, tandis que Widdringtonia et Callitris se sont avres tre les moins tolrantes. Parmi les cyprs, Cupressus torulosa (Don), C. funebris (Endl.) et C. arizonica (Greene taient trs rsistants l o C. benthamii (Endll.), C. lusitanica (Miller) et C. lindleyi (Klotsch) taient sensibles. En tenant compte de la vigueur de sa croissance et de sa rsistance vis--vis des aphidiens, Cupressocyparis leylandii semble tre la meilleure espce pour remplacer C. lusitanica qui est infeste et  ce jour, largement rpandue comme essence de plantation. Les rsultats obtenus sur base des espces hybrides montrent galement que la rsistance acquise par l'hybridation est en mesure d'offrir une solution viable  long terme  la menace des aphidiens. Se estudiaron las tasas de crecimiento y tendencias de tolerancia contra el fido de ciprs Cinara cupressi (Buckton) en veinticuatro especies diferentes de rboles coniferos dentro de la familia Cupressaceae. El estudio emprendido en el arboretum de Muguga, Kenya Central por un perodo de dos aos continuos indica un rango amplio de tolerancia entre las especies. Thuya spp. y Cupressocyparis leylandii (Jackson y Dallimore) fueron las ms tolerantes mientras Widdringtonia y Callistris fueron las menos. Entre los cipreses, Cupressus torulosa (Don), C. funebris (Endl.) C. arizonici (Greene) fueron muy resistentes mientras que C. benthamii (Endl.), C. Iusitanica (Miller) y C. lindleyi (Klotsch) fueron susceptibles. En vista del vigor de crecimiento y la resistencia hacia los fidos, Cupressocyparis leylandii aparece como la mejor especie alternativa C. lusitanica la cual est infestada y que actualmente se cultiva como una especie de plantacin. Los resultados de las especies hbridas tambin indican que la seleccin por resistencia travs de la hibridacin puede ofrecer a una solucin viable a largo plazo a la amenaza de fido.
42603255|A method for the collection of data required to determine production costs in sawmills in Fiji is described. The data obtained during a trial of this method suggests the procedure to be followed in a more detailed investigation. There is a quadratic relationship between the midgirth of the logs sawn and their recovery ratio, and its importance is discussed.
42606964|Changes in global-mean temperature over the past century are described and the likely role of man-made greenhouse-gas forcing is discussed. The 'noise' of natural variability, together with uncertainties in modelling the enhanced greenhouse effect, make it difficult to associate cause and effect with high confidence. However, the evidence strongly suggests that man-made effects have already played a significant role in modifying the climate. Future changes are likely to be dominated by the effects of Man. Projections of future global-mean temperature and sea level changes are given. The major contributor to these changes is CO. Current knowledge of the global carbon cycle is therefore reviewed. The reasons for uncertainties in the projections of future CO concentration changes are discussed and the uncertainties are quantified. An important factor in determining both past and future changes is the relative importance of emissions from industrial activity (such as fossil fuel combustion) and land-use changes (such as deforestation). An optimistic scenario in which future gross deforestation is halted by the year 2020 is defined, and the resulting reductions in CO concentration increase, global warming and sea level rise relative to those for the central IPCC deforestation scenario are calculated. Des modifications de la temprature globale moyenne au cours du sicle pass sont dcrites et le rle probable des gaz issus de l'activit humaine dans l'induction de l'effet de serre est discut. La notion de variabilit naturelle, tout autant que les incertitudes lies au processus de modlisation de l'effet de serre dans son ensemble, rendent difficile l'tablissement d'une relation de cause  effet de haute fiabilit. Toutefois il est clairement tabli que des effets rsultant d'actions humaines ont dj jou un rle significatif dans le processus de modification climatique. Il est probable que les changements  venir seront domins par des effets d'actions humaines. Des prvisions sont avances quant aux changements futurs de temprature globale moyenne et de niveau des mers. Le principal facteur qui influence ces changements est le CO. L'tat actuel des connaissances du cycle global du carbone est aussi pass en revue. Les raisons des incertitudes relatives aux prvisions de changement des futures concentrations en CO sont discutes et le degr d'incertitude est quantifi. Un facteur important dans la dtermination des changements  la fois passs mais aussi futurs est l'importance relative des missions issues de l'activit industrielle (comme la combustion de combustibles fossiles) et des changements intervenus dans les modes d'utilisation des terres (telle la deforestation). Un scnario optimiste dans lequel la majeure partie de la deforestation serait stoppe pour l'anne 2020, est dfini. Les rductions de l'augmentation de teneur en CO qui en rsultent, le rchauffement global et l'augmentation du niveau des mers sont calculs relativement aux valeurs du scnario de deforestation de l'IPCC. Se describen los cambios en la temperatura global promedio en el pasado siglo y se discute la probable contribucin de las actividades humanas al efecto de invernadero. El 'alboroto' de la variabilidad natural, junto con las incertidumbres al modelar el aumento del efecto de invernadero, hace difcil asociar con confianza las causas y efectos. Sin embargo, la evidencia sugiere fuertemente que los efectos causados por el hombre ya han jugado un papel significativo en la modificacin del clima. Los futuros cambios sern probablemente dominados por los efectos de hombre. Se dan proyecciones de los cambios de la temperatura global promedio y nivel de mar en el futuro. El mayor contribuyente a estos cambios es CO. Por lo tanto, se revisa el conocimiento actual del ciclo global del carbono. Se discuten las razones para las incertidumbres en las proyecciones de cambios futuros de la concentracin de CO y se cuantifican las incertidumbres. Un factor importante para determinar tanto cambios pasados como futuros es la relativa importancia de las emisiones de la actividad industrial (como quema de combustible fsil) y cambios en el uso de la tierra (como deforestacin). Se define un escenario optimista en el cual el grueso de la deforestacin futura ser detenido en el ao 2020, y se calculan las consiguientes reducciones en el aumento de la concentracin de CO, el calentamiento global y el aumento del nivel del mar con relacin a aquellos en el escenario central de deforestacin de IPCC.
42608143|The article describes the cost-benefit of four fuelwood projects and one protection forestry project. As rural fuelwood in the developing countries is not normally traded, while in the urban areas its price rarely contains an adequate stumpage fee, the benefits of the fuelwood projects were estimated in terms of the price or the value of the alternative fuels which people would most probably have to burn if they ran out of fuelwood and charcoal. Cet article dcrit l'analyse cot-profit de quatre projets de bois de chauffage et un projet de protection forestire. Comme dans les pays en voie de dveloppement on ne fait pas d'habitude le commerce du bois de chauffage dans les rgions rurales, tandis que dans les rgions urbaines son prix contient rarement une valeur suffisante des bois sur pied, les avantages des projets de bois de chauffage ont t estims en fonction du prix ou de la valeur des combustibles alternatifs que les gens devraient probablement brler s'ils puisaient le bois de chauffage et le charbon de bois. Se describe el anlisis beneficio-costo de cuatro proyectos de lea y un proyecto de proteccin forestal. Debido a que en las reas rurales de los pases en desarrollo, la lea no es normalmente comercializada y a que en las reas urbanas el precio raramente representa su verdadero valor, los beneficios de los proyectos forestales fueron estimados en trminos del precio o del valor de los combustibles alternativos que seran ms probablemente utilizados por la poblacin en caso de carencia de lea y carbn.
42607847|Whereas Triplochiton scleroxylon rarely flowers in its native West Africa until at least 15 years old, 15 plants representing eight different clones flowered in successive years between February and August in tropicalised glasshouses near Edinburgh, within 26 to 82 months of germination. Cuttings originating from one mature tree also flowered. Freshly collected pollen remained viable for at least 16 wk when stored dry at -25 C, and germinated best in 20% sucrose + 0.005% boric acid. Pollen stored at room temperature lost viability within 1 wk. Cross-pollinations with fresh and stored pollen were successful, with 8% of the resulting fruits reaching maturity; 16% of the seeds from these fruits subsequently germinated, forming normal seedlings.
42608326|Interest in the silviculture of mixed-species stands has grown rapidly throughout the world in recent years, particularly in regions where mixtures serve as an alternative to the widespread use of monoculture plantations. A considerable need exists for establishing experiments that can guide the selection of species and silvicultural treatment of mixtures. The analysis of species interactions, of both the complementary and facilitative types, is one goal of such studies. Two basic experimental approaches exist for studying species interactions in mixtures: (1) plot-level studies of the additive and substitutive designs, and (2) individual-tree studies of the neighbourhood design. The principles of each approach are reviewed, as are their strengths and limitations for use in forestry experiments. A planting arrangement is proposed that allows both kinds of analysis to be conducted using one set of plots. Ces dernires annes ont vu l'intrt pour la sylviculture en espces mixtes crotre rapidement  travers le monde, particulirement dans les rgions o les mixtures servent d'alternative  l'usage trs tendu des plantations de monoculture. Il existe un besoin considrable d'tablir des expriences qui puissent guider la slection des espces et le traitement sylviculturel des mixtures. L'analyse de la nature et de l'intensit de l'interaction des espces de type complmentaire et de type facilitatif est l'un des buts de ces tudes. Deux approches de base existent pour tudier l'interaction des espces dans les mixtures: 1) tude sur le terrain des formes additives et de substitution, et 2) tudes individuelles d'arbres de l'arrangement voisin. Les principes de chaque approche sont rviss ainsi que les forces et les limitations de leur usage dans les expriences sylviculturelles. Un arrangement de plantation est propos, permettant de conduire ces deux genre d'analyse en utilisant un seul lot de terrain. El inters en la silvicultura en nodales de especies mezcladas ha crecido rpidamente en todo el mundo en recientes aos, particularmente en regiones donde las mezclas sirven como una alternativa al uso extendido de monocultivos. Existe una consider-able necesidad por establecer experimentos que puedan guiar la seleccin de especies y el tratamiento silvocultural de mezclas. El anlisis de la naturaleza y la intensidad de las interacciones entre especies, tanto del tipo complementario como del facilitativo, es un objetivo de tales estudios. Existen dos enfoques experi-mentales bsicos para estudiar las interacciones de especies en mezclas: (1) estudios a nivel de parcela de los diseos aditivos y sustitutivos, y (2) estudios de los diseos de rboles individuales. Se revisan los principios de cada enfoque, tambin como sus fortalezas y sus limitaciones para su uso en experimentos de ingeniera forestal. Se propone un arreglo en la plantacin, el cual permite que se conduzcan ambas clases de anlisis utilizando un conjunto de parcelas.
42606127|In recent years, progress has been made with domestication of Triplochiton scleroxylon, an important timber tree of the moist West African forests. Seed viability has been extended from a few weeks to many months by appropriate drying and cold storage. Seed supply is irregular, but the successful development of vegetative propagation methods has provided an alternative, regular supply of planting stock. Rooted cuttings have the further advantage that they can readily be tested to identify promising clones of good form. To this end, experiments on the physiology of branching have allowed the development of a screening technique which can predict later branching habit from tests on small plants. The occurrence of precocious flowering in glasshouse conditions has allowed progress towards control over reproduction, and cross-pollinations with deep frozen pollen have produced viable seeds from clones only 2-5 years old. The possibility of similarly domesticating many other tree species is discussed in relation to the need for improved selections for use in diverse managed ecosystems. Obtaining sustained yields of food and wood products on land formerly under moist tropical forest clearly depends on learning how to combine increased output from currently under-utilized species with soil improvement and ex situ conservation. Triplochiton scleroxylon est un arbre des forts d'Afrique occidentale dont le bois est trs important. On peut rendre les graines plus viables en les faisant scher ou en les mettant dans une pice froide pendant quelques semaines ou mme pendant quelques mois. Il est quand mme difficile de les obtenir rgulirement. Les boutures, qui ont pris racine, ont l'avantage sur les graines par ce qu'elles sont plus disponibles et on peut les dvelopper  partir d'un bon clone. Elles fleurissent trs jeunes quand on leur offre les conditions semblables  celles d'une serre o il est possible de contrler la reproduction avec du pollen congel et cela a dj produit des graines viables  partir des clones gs de deux  cinq ans. La domestication d'autres arbres deviendra possible par cette mthode et avec l'amlioration de la terre il y aura plus de bois et plus de la nourriture dans les forts tropicales. En anos recientes se han hecho progresos en el cultivo de Triplochiton scleroxylon, un importante arbol maderero de los bosques humedos del Africa occidental. La viabilidad de la semilla ha sido extendida de unas pocal semanas a varios meses madiante tecnicas apropriadas de secado y alma cenamiento en frio. El abastecimiento de semillas es irregular, pero el exitoso desarrollo de metodos de propagacion vegetativa ha proveido de una laternativa, el abastecimiento regular de material vegetativo para plantacion. Estacas con raices tienen aun la ventaja que pueden ser probadas para identificar clones prometedores de buena forma. Para este fin, se han llevado a cabo experimentos en la fisiologa de la formacion de ramas que han permitido el desarrollo de una tecnica de proyeccion que puede prede predecir el desarrollo futuro de ramas mediante pruebas en plantas pequeas. La ocurrencia de floracion precoz en condiciones de invernacula ha permitido progresar hacia el control sobre la reproduccion y polinizaciones cruzadas usando polen congelado, han producido semillas via bles de clones de apenas 2.5 anos. Es discutida la posibilidad de uncultivo similar de muchas otras especies arboreas en relacion a la necesidad de selecciones mejoradas para vso en diversos ecosistemas bajo cultivo. La obtencion de rendimientos sostenidos de alimentos y productos madereros en tierras anteriormente bajo bosque tropical hmedo, depende claramente en aprender como combinar el incremento en la produccion de especies corrientemente subutilizadas con el mejoramiento del suelo y la conservacin ex situ.
42603197|Edaphic moisture under the canopy of forest plantings and in the neighbouring open areas has been studied in Israel under subtropical, semi-desert and desert conditions. The main tree xerophytes, indigenous and acclimatised, used in afforestation in the country were investigated. The locations tested were (1) along rocky slopes where a shallow soil layer usually 30 cm deep was found; (2) in deep soil of the semi-desert and desert plains, where the underground water is at a great distance (48-80 metres). In all the three climatic regions tested, a significant moisture excess was noted within the forests in comparison to the neighbouring open areas during the rainless hot season. The above results show an identical trend wherever the woody xerophytes grow within their natural habitat or in artificial forest plantings successfully adapted to the edaphic and climatic conditions of the locality. In the forests of Pinus halepensis, for instance, the edaphic moisture excess ranges between 12.5030.80 per cent in the upper soil layer (0-30 cm), depending upon location, type of soil, and season. In plantings of Tamarix aphylla within the desert, in sand dunes, where 100-200 mm of rain fell, the mentioned excess reaches 40 per cent and more. Soil moisture distribution during the rainless season within the forests shows an entirely different pattern from that of the open area. These facts were based on a statistical analysis and contradict the view that forests exhaust edaphic moisture, at least as far as it concerns the xerophytes and ecological conditions represented in this study. It appears that even in the desert, moisture within the forest drops to a minimum below which it does not diminish even during the driest and hottest months, until rainfall starts.
42608691|In the natural resources sector in Vietnam, the allocation of production forest and agricultural land to the householder or individual is the underlying concept of 'Doi Moi' the philosophy guiding the transition from a command to a decentralised market economy. This paper charts the evolution of forest policy since reunification, and reports some remarkable successes arising from private land and tree ownership. Since 1995 there has been an annual net gain in forest cover with plantation area exceeding forest loss to fire or conversion. The principal outstanding problem is how to manage the two million ha of natural forest land which the government has decreed should be set aside for conservation purposes but for which private ownership is not considered a good solution. Dans le secteur des ressources naturelles au Vitnam, l'allocation des forts de production et des terres agricoles aux chefs de famille ou aux particuliers est le concept de base de "Doi Moi" - la politique de transition qui avance l'conomie de march libre. Cet article trace l'volution de la politique forestire depuis la runification, et fait part de quelques grands succs dans la proprit prive des terres. Depuis 1995 il y a eu un accroissement total annuel du couvert, les zones de plantation dpassant les pertes des au feu ou  la conversion. Un problme pas encore rsolu: Comment grer les 2 millions ha de terres forestires naturelles que le gouvernement a ordonn tre conserves? La proprit prive, d'ailleurs, n'est pas considre comme une bonne solution. En el sector de los recursos naturales en Vietnam, la asignacin de tierras para la produccin forestal y agrcola a la cabeza de familia o a individuos es el concepto subyacente de el Doi Moi o las polticas de transicin que promueven una economa de libre mercado. Este artculo muestra la evolucin de la poltica forestal desde la reunificacin e informa de algunos xitos notables que surgen de la propiedad privada de la tierra. Desde 1995, ha habido una ganancia neta anual en cobertura forestal con un rea de plantacin que excede las prdidas de bosque por incendio o conversin. El problema sobresaliente principal es como lograr los dos millones de hectreas de tierra de bosque natural que el gobierno ha decretado deberan separarse para propsitos de conservacin pero para lo cual la propiedad privada no es considerada una buena solucin.
42606433|Guazuma ulmifolia Lam. (gucimo), because of its wide distribution, easy handling, and high firewood quality, is a promising native species for firewood production in the wet and dry regions of Central America. It is possible to make an accurate estimate of the firewood weight of the crown of a guacimo tree that has been periodically harvested, using regression models based on basal diameter of the branches and dbh, crown diameter and age. Several firewood weight tables were developed which can be used to make estimates for periodically harvested individual trees growing in pastures. Grace  sa grande aire naturelle,  sa tractabilit et  sa qualit calorifique, G. ulmifolia est une espce idigne prometteuse pour la production du bois de chauffage dans les rgions sches aussi bien qu'humides de l'Amrique Centrale. Il est possible de faire une estimation assez exacte du contenu d'une cime rgulirement exploite en se basant sur le diamtre des branches, le diamtre  hauteur d'homme, de diamtre de la cime et l'ge du sujet. Des tables ont t labores pour indiquer le poids du bois de chauffage d'arbres isols. Guazuma ulmifolia (guacimo) a causa de su rango amplio, propagacin fcil y la alta calidad de su lea, es una especie nativa prometador para la produccin de lea en las zonas ridas y hmedas de America Central. Se puede estimar con precisin el rendimiento de lea de la copa de un arbl de guacimo que se ha cosechado periodicamente, utilizando modelos de regression basados en el rea basai de las ramas, dimetro a la altura del pecho, dimetro de la copa y edad. Algunas tablas para el peso de lea fueron desarrolladas para estimar el rendimiento de arboles individuales cosechados periodicamente en pasto.
42606307|Timber is Canada's major source of income, not only offering timber products but supporting tourism and habitat. The days of 'mining' the forest are rapidly drawing to a close. It is time to invest more capital into the resource. C'est du bois que le Canada provient la plupart de son revenu, non seulement par offrir les produits du bois mais aussi par encourager le tourisme et la nature. Le temps quand on exploite la fort disparat rapidement. Maintenant on doit engager des capitaux en cette ressource. La madera es la mayor fuente de divisas del Canad; no solamente ofrece productos de madera, sino que tambin mantiene el turismo y el habitat. Los dias de explotacin del bosque estn rapidamente llegando a su fin. Es tiempo de invertir ms capital en el recurso.
42606961|The paper discusses conservation and environmental management generally and also within the context of the practical experiences gained by the ITTO in the implementation of the Preamble and one of the Objectives of the International Tropical Timber Agreement 1983, under which the ITTO was established. The prevailing tropical forest management techniques are treated broadly, including the present trend to blend environmental considerations into forest management and the resultant widening of the discipline of forest management into environmental management. These issues are discussed in the light of the 'Non-legally binding statement of principles' agreed at the Earth Summit at Rio in 1992. The paper stresses the need for an institutional balance m the global approach to addressing and eradicating forest-related environmental problems and restoring the health of the earth's ecosystem. Cet article traite de la conservation et de l'amnagement de l'environnement en gnral et aussi dans le cadre des expriences pratiques acquises par l'ITTO au cours de la mise en pratique du Prambule et d'un des Objectifs de l''International Tropical Timber Agreement 1983', accord sous l'gide duquel l'ITTO a t tabli. Les techniques d'amnagement des forts tropicales qui prvalent sont traites d'une faon gnrale. Sont galement abords la tendance actuelle de fusionner les considrations environnementales avec l'amnagement forestier et l'largissement rsultant de la discipline de l'amnagement forestier vers une discipline de l'amnagement de l'environnement. Ces points sont discuts  la lumire de la dclaration 'Non-legally Binding Statement of Principles' dicte lors du sommet mondial de Rio en 1992. L'article insiste sur le besoin d'un quilibre institutionnel dans une approche globale pour prendre en compte et rsoudre les problmes d'environnement lis au domaine forestier et pour restaurer la sant de l'cosystme de la terre. El artculo discute la conservacin y el manejo ambiental en forma general y tambin dentro del contexto de las experiencias prcticas obtenidas por el ITTO en la Implementacin del Prembulo y de uno de los Objetivos del Acuerdo Maderero Tropical Internacional de 1983, bajo el cual se estableci el ITTO. Se tratan en forma amplia, las tcnicas de manejo forestal tropical prevalecientes, incluyendo la actual tendencia de mezclar consideraciones ambientales en el manejo forestal y el ampliamiento de la disciplina de administracin forestal en administracin ambiental. Estos temas se discuten a la luz de la 'Declaracin de Principios Jurdicamente No-Obligatorios' acordada en la Cumbre de la Tierra en Rio en 1992. El artculo enf atiza la necesidad de un balance institucional en el enfoque global para combatir y erradicar los problemas ambientales relacionados con el bosque y restaurar la salud de los ecosistemas de la Tierra.
42605105|Management of the Trinidad Mora forests is aimed at replacing Mora by other species. In the Matura area this is by clear felling and replanting with Pinus caribaea. It is argued that Mora, an aggressive invasive species, can be managed under a selection system at very low cost. This would satisfy the increasing demand for Mora timber and release funds for replanting of existing scrub areas elsewhere in the island.
42608168|The concept of forestry as an instrument of rural development is examined in relation to some specified needs of local communities, and in relation to externally aided agroforestry and community forestry projects. It is suggested that the term "minor forest product" has no longer any real meaning in modern forestry practice in developing countries, and that it should be abandoned and more exact definitions sought for the variety of goods and services provided, or which can be provided, by the natural or man-made forest estate. If this is done, and if such goods and services are properly monitored and costed, then it will be found that the contribution of the forestry sector to the national domestic product is much greater in many developing countries than that indicated to date. It is also suggested that agroforestry and community forestry projects have little or no lasting effect in the absence of a government commitment to forestry as an instrument for rural development and in the absence of an appropriately trained indigenous manpower. On the basis of these assumptions, and taking into account some important activities of "Forestry for Local Community Development" (see FAO 1978), current manpower requirements are estimated and projected to the year 2000 for seven East and North East African countries. The prevailing situation in each country in regard to training and education in forestry is discussed and examples of existing curricula are given. Though there appears to be a considerable short fall in current requirements for professional foresters and technicians in the Region as a whole it is suggested that the Region has the potential to meet projected manpower requirements at both technical and professional levels, but that external support will be required and curricula will need revision to give greater emphasis to forest resources management and to forestry as an instrument for rural development generally. The weaknesses of the basic data and methodology used in estimating manpower requirements are emphasized. C'est le concept de l'exploitation forestire en tant qu'instrument du dveloppement rural qui est pass ici sous examen, et sa relation avec les besoins spcifiques des collectivits locales. Le terme de "produit forestier secondaire" n'a plus sa place dans le vocabulaire forestier moderne des pays en voie de dveloppement, son abandon est donc recommand en faveur de termes  dfinition plus adapte  la varit des biens et des services qui sont produits ou pourraient l'tre par la fort  l'tat naturel ou artificiel. Si l'on achve ce projet, et si ces services sont correctement distribus et leur cot valu, on dcouvre que le produit national domestique d au secteur forestier est dans de nombreux pays en voie de dveloppement suprieur  ce que l'on prvoyait. Les techniques agro-forestires et les projets forestiers des collectivits ont peu ou pas du tout d'effets si le gouvernement ne voit pas en la sylviculture l'instrument du dveloppement rural, et s'il n'existe pas de main-d'oeuvre locale forme de faon approprie. C'est pourquoi, et en tenant compte de certains faits souligns dans le fascicule intitul "Le Rle des Forts dans le Dveloppement des Collectivits Locales" (cf. FAO 1978), les besoins courants en main-d'oeuvre de sept pays Africains du Nord-Est et de l'Est ont t valus et prvus jusqu' l'an 2000; on prend part  un examen de la situation de chacun d'entre eux dans les domaines de la formation et de l'ducation forestire et quelques exemples sont exposs; cela met en relief l'apparition d'une chute considrable des besoins en forestiers et techniciens professionels dans le pays tout entier; il est probable que ce dernier peut faire face  de tels besoins mais avec l'aide d'un soutien extrieur, et d'une rvision des projets mettant une plus grande emphase sur l'organisation des ressources forestires et sur la sylviculture en tant qu'instrument de dveloppement rural gnralement parlant. On met enfin en vidence la faiblesse des donnes de base et de la mthodologie utilises pour l'valuation de la main-d'oeuvre requise. Se analiza el concepto de forestacin como un instrumento de desarrollo rural en relacin a algunas necesidades especificas de comuinidades regionales y en relacin a la agroforestacin y projectos forestales communitarios apoyados desde el exterior. Puede indicarse que el termino "producto forestal secundario" dejar de tener un significado real en la prctica forestal moderna de los pases endesarrollo y que debera ser substituido por definiciones ms exactas acorde a la variedad de bienes y servicios que se obtienen o pueden obtenerse del bosque, ya sea naturalmente o por la intervencin del hombre. Hecho esto, y establecidos los costos y supervisin adecuados a la produccin de tales bienes y servicios, surgir que la contribucin del sector forestal en el prducto interno* del pas es mucho mayor en muchos pases en desarrollo que la que se estimara en un principio. Adems tanto agroforestacin como los proyectos forestales comuniitarios tendran muy pequeo efecto o ninguno si no existen objetivos de gobierno para que la forestacin sea un instrumento de desarrollo rural y si no existe mano de obra regional preparada adecuadamente para tales fines. Sobre las bases de estos supuestos y teniendo en cuenta algunas activadades importantes "Forestry for Local Community Development" (FAO 1978), se estiman y projectan requerimientos de mano de obra para el ao 2000 para siete pases del este y norests africano. Se discute la situacin de cada pai's en cuanto a extrenamiento y educacin en forestacin y se dan ejemplos de curriculum existentes. Aunque parace haber un considerable descenso en los requerimentos de profesionales y tcnicos forestales en la regin, sta, est potencialmente dotada para suplir los requerimientos de mano de obra projectados a ambos niveles, tcnico y profesional. Para esto, se deber contar con apoyo externo y se necesitar hacer una revisin de los curriculum para darle mayor nfasis al manejo de los recursos forestales y a la forestacin como un instrumento del desarrollo rural en general. Se enfatizan las debilidades de los datos bsicos y la metodologa usada en la estimacin de los requerimientos de mano de obra.
42605185|The traditional approach to the economics of forestry has tended to emphasize production and paid relatively little attention to the marketing of forest products. As an economy grows, competition, particularly from non-wood substitutes assumes increasing importance in wood markets thus focusing attention on the need for positive and aggressive marketing by forest industries. The present analysis postulates a decline in the role of price and a corresponding increase in the influence of non-price competition on the stability of timber markets and the efficiency of the forestry enterprise. A re-orientation of forest products marketing with particular emphasis on improving the psychological image of wood is therefore advocated. The implications with regard to technical and organizational methods in forest industries have some relevance in both developed and developing countries.
42607271|The concern about climate change resulting from increased atmospheric concentrations of greenhouse gases is supported strongly by results from physically-based climate models. In particular, these are essential for providing and exploring the likely climate responses to a range of scenarios of future emissions of greenhouse gases. Examples of the most recent climate simulations and projections are discussed in the context of the reports of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC). The influence of greenhouse gases in climate models is well established. A more recent new feature is the inclusion of the effects of aerosols resulting from emissions of sulphur dioxide. The need to allow for the cooling effects of sulphate aerosols in climate models will be illustrated. This issue features in the IPCC's Second Assessment Report, 1995. Some of its already-published comments on the results and progress of climate models are presented, along with a list of the highest-priority modelling topics that need to be addressed over the next five years or so. Les inquitudes suscites par le changement climatique rsultant des concentrations atmosphriques accrues de gaz de l'effet-serre sont appuyes fortement par les rsultats des modles climatiques concrets. Ces derniers sont particulirement essentiels pour fournir et explorer les rponses probables du climat  un ventail de scnarios de futures missions de gaz de l'effet-serre. Les exemples des simulations et perspectives climatiques les plus rcents sont discuts dans le contexte des rapports de l'IPCC. L'influence des gaz de l'effet-serre dans les modles climatiques est bien tablie. Une nouvelle donne, plus rcente, est l'inclusion des effets des arosols rsultant des missions de dioxide de sulphure. La ncessit de laisser leur place aux effets refroidissants des arosols sulphats dans les modles climatiques sera illustre. Cette question est prsente dans le second rapport d'valuation de l'IPCC, 1995. Certains de ses commentaires dj publis sur les rsultats et progrs des modles climatiques sont prsents avec une liste des sujets de modelage de plus haute priorit auxquels il faudra faire face au cours des cinq prochaines annes. Resultados de modelos climticos, con bases fsicas, apoyan fuertemente la preocupacin acerca del cambio de clima como resultado del incremento de las concentraciones atmosfricas de los gases de invernadero. Estos modelos en particular, son esenciales para proveer y explorar las respuestas probables del clima a un rango de escenarios de emisiones futuras de gases de invernadero. Se discuten ejemplos de las ms recientes simulaciones y proyecciones climticas en el contexto de los informes del Grupo Intergubernamental en Cambio Climtico (IPCC). Se establece claramente la influencia de los gases de invernadero en modelos climticos. La ms reciente caracterstica es la inclusin de los efectos de aerosoles resultantes de emisiones de bixido de azufre. Se ilustrar la necesidad de incluir los efectos de los aerosoles de sulfato en modelos climticos. Este asunto se discute en el Segundo Reporte de Evaluacin del IPCC, 1995. Se presentan algunos de sus comentarios-ya publicados- en los resultados y progreso de los modelos climticos, junto con una lista de los tpicos de modelacin de ms alta prioridad - que necesitan ser estudiados durante los prximos cinco aos aproximadamente.
42603649|For the purpose of estimating stem diameter, the equation of the form: D=a+bH+bW+bHW Where D = stem diameter at breast height, H = tree height and W = tree crown width was calculated for each of four softwood species (white pine, jack pine, white spruce and balsam fir) and five hardwood species (hard maple, yellow birch, beech, white birch and aspen). In each regression equation, there was a high degree of correlation between the dependent and the independent variables. The possibility of having a common regression equation for two or more species was investigated, but the results were negative. Equations estimating stem diameter from crown width and tree height, and tree volume from stem diameter and tree height, are presented.
42608090|Of the many kinds of containers which have been developed over the last twenty years, re-usable trays containing cavities from which plants can be removed at planting are thought to have the widest potential application in tree nurseries in developing countries. Root volume, determined by the cavity size, is small compared with the traditional polythene pots and sleeves but in general the quality of the plants produced is high. Multiple cavity tray nurseries are many times more efficient than traditional polythene pot and sleeve nurseries but require investment in the trays themselves, in simple structures to elevate the trays off the ground, in the development of an optimum local nursery regime and in the retraining of nursery staff. Parmi le grand nombre de sortes de rcipients qui ont t dvelopp dans les vingt ans qui viennent de s'couler, on croit que des plateaux qui peuvent tre utilis plusieurs fois et qui ont des trous desquels les plants peuvent tre enlev au moment de plantation ont potentiellement l'application la plus tendue dans les ppinires darbres des pays en voie de dveloppement. Le volume des racines, dtermine par la grosseur des trous, est rduit par rapport aux pots et manchons traditionnels en polyethylene, mais gnralement la qualit des plants produits est leve. Des ppinires de plateaux aux trous multiples sont beaucoup plus efficaces que les ppinires traditionnelles de pots et manchons en polyethylene, mais elles exigent le placement de fonds dans les plateaux eux-mmes, dans des structures simples pour maintenir les plateux, dans le dveloppement d'un rgime local optimal pour les ppinires et dans la r-ducation du personnel des ppinires. De la gran variedad de recipientes que han sido desarrollados en los ltimos 20 anos, las bandejas reusables, las cuales contienen cavidades por donde las plntulas pueden ser removidas al momento de la plantacin, son consideradas como las de mayor potencial en los viveros forestales de los pases en desarrollo. El volumen de raices el cual es determinado por la dimensin de la cavidad, es pequeno comparado con las tradicionales bolsas de polietileno y los tubos, sin embargo, promueven generalmente plntulas de calidad superior. La eficiencia de un vivero que emplea bandejas reusables es varias veces superior a aquellos que emplean bolsas de polietileno o tubos, sin embargo, los primeros requieren una inversin inicial en estructuras simples para elevar las bandejas sobre el nivel del suelo, en el desarrollo de un regimen optimo del vivero y en el reentrenamiento del personal.
42602977|Unifying concepts are described to encourage analysis of crown development for improved understanding of and control of tree and wood quality. The open level of stocking and some biological limits to growth are examined as a supplement to the concept of normal stand density. Sequences and patterns which determine growth of individual trees and stands are noted. Importance of regulation of crown width and length is stressed. The open to normal pattern of stand density which can reduce "normal" rotations by 25 per cent is advocated. Problems in development of models which can guide forest managers toward their desired objectives are considered.
42608024|Convolvulaceous climbers in the genera Merremia and Operculina are particularly troublesome weeds in young plantations in the Solomon Islands. The comparative merits of weed control by herbicides, cattle, fire and cover crops are discussed. The climbers require full sunlight to grow vigorously. Silvicultural practice can be varied to control light availability and hence control the climbers. The forester can ensure that the most appropriate tree species is chosen, that vigorous stock from the nursery is spaced, planted and tended to offer the optimum chance of success. Les plantes grimpantes convolvulacs dans le genre Merremia et Operculina sont des mauvaises herbes particulirement nuisibles dans les jeunes plantations des Isles de Salomon. L'avantage comparatif du dsherbage effectu par l'emploi d'herbicide, de btail ou de feu est dis discut. Les plantes grimpantes ont besoin de lumire solaire abondante pour pousser vigoureusement. La pratique silvicole peut tre varie pour contrler la quantit de lumire disponible et ainsi le contrle des plantes grimpantes. Le forestier peut assurer que l'essence d'arbre la plus approprie est choisie, que les plants vigoureux obtenus de la ppinire sont plants, espacs et maintenus de faon  donner les plus grandes chances de succs. Las trepadoras de los gneros Merremia y Operculina de la familia Convolvulaceae son malezas molestas en plantaciones jovenes en las Islas Solomon. Se describe los beneficios relativos del control por medio de herbicidas, ganado, fuego y cubierta vegetal. Las trepadoras exigen la plena luz del sol para crecer con vigor. Se puede utilizar la practica silvicola para controlar la disponibilidad de la luz y por esto contolar las trepadoras. El dasonomo puede asegurarse que se eligen las especies mas apropiados, y que se lleva a cabo la plantacin con espaciamiento y mtodos apropiados con las plantulas mas robustas del vivero, y aplicar los cuidados culturales para conseguir un establecimiento con exito.
42608660|Horizontal point sampling for basal area per hectare estimates using the so-called 'constant tally rule' procedure is tested on a digitized 60 hectare stand of tropical rainforest using nine samples, each of size n = 60, for the constant tallies 2 to 10 and integer basal area factors ranging from 1 to 16. Results indicate a distinct and unacceptably large positive bias. L'chantillonage horizontal par placettes circulaires  rayon variable pour des valuations de surface terrire par hectare utilisant le soi-disant procd de 'rglement de taille constante' est vrifi sur un peuplement digitis de 60 hectares de fort tropicale humide en utilisant neuf chantillons, chacun de grandeur n = 60, pour les tailles constantes 2  10 et des facteurs de surface terrire s'tendant de 1  16. Les rsultats montrent une dviation positive nette qui est inacceptablement grande. Se prueba sobre un rodai digitalizado de 60 hectareas de selva tropical lluviosa, el muestreo de punto horizontal de estimaciones de area basal por hectrea, usando la llamada "regla de cuentas constantes". Se usaron nueve muestras, cada una de tamao n = 60, para las cuentas constantes de 2 a 10 y factores de area basal enteros variando de 1 a 16. Los resultados indican un claro gran sesgo positivo que no se puede aceptar.
42604765|Consistency of properties is of paramount importance for all kinds of pulpwood. Straight logs free from projections resulting from poor debranching are vital for mechanical handling in pulpmills Pulpwood for mechanical pulp should be of low density and light colour. Pulpwood for dissolving pulp should preferably be from fast-grown hardwoods, with a low content of fats and various other non-cellulose materials. Pulpwood for paper pulps should be as uniform as possible to avoid specks and other blemishes in paper, but several different types of fibre are suitable for papermaking. The factors affecting the choice are fibre length, the weight per unit length of fibre, and whether the fibres are rod-like or ribbon-like. Wood species and wood density largely determine these parameters, but the type of pulping process and the yield of pulp from the wood are also important.
42607463|Plantations of exotic hardwoods and softwoods were started during 1968 in the Munessa Forest (7 N, 38 E) in Ethiopia. Measurements of height and diameter were made in 1976 and a comparison of growth of the various species was carried out. Eucalypts were the fastest growing trees, doing well both on well drained forest soils and on swampy grasslands with black soil. In the latter areas the growth of cypress and pines was retarded. The most promising eucalypt species were: E. regnans, E. saligna, E. grandis and E. maideni. Of the conifers the fastest growing were: Pinus radiata, P. patula and Cupressus lusitanica. A variety of species should be planted as none of them has experienced a full rotation and accordingly none is fully beyond the stage of experimentation. Both conifers and eucalypts are recommended for the planting programme as both groups are expected to be in high demand because of the continuous devastation of natural forest and the relatively late start of plantation forestry in this country. Des plantations de feuillus et rsineux exotiques ont t entreprises, en 1968, dans la fort de Munessa (7N, 38 E), en Ethiopie. Aprs le mesurage de la hauteur et du diamtre, en 1976, on a compar la croissance des diffrentes espces. Les Eucalyptus prsentent la plus grande rapidit de croissance et sont de bonne venue,  la fois sur les sols forestiers bien draines et sur les terres noires des prairies marcageuses. Sur ces derniers emplacements, la croissance des cyprs et des pins est ralentie. Les Eucalyptus regnans, E. saligna, E. grandis et E. maideni sont les espces les plus prometteuses. Le Pinus radiata, le P. patula et le Cupressus lusitanica sont les conifres qui prsentent la croissance la plus rapide. On devrait donc planter diffrentes espces puisqu'aucune d'entre elles n'a fait l'objet d'un essai complet de rotation, toutes tant encore au stade de l'exprimentation. On ne peut que recommander  la fois conifres et Eucalyptus pour ce programme de plantation, puisque ces deux groupes d'espces sont supposs pouvoir rpondre  la forte demande en bois, cause par la continuelle dvastation de la foret spontane et le dmarrage relativement tardif des plantations forestires dans ce pays. En el bosque de Munessa, (7N, 38E) en Etiopia, se establecieron plantaciones de frondosas y conferas exticas en 1968. En 1976 se compararon el crecimiento de las diferentes especies a base de la toma de medidas de altura y dimetro. Los eucaliptos fueron las especies de mejor crecimiento demostrando beunos rendimientos en suelos bien drenados de bosque y tambin en praderas pantanosas de suelos negros. En estas zonas el crecimiento del ciprs y del pino fue atrasado. Las especies ms prometadoras de eucalipt fueron: E. regnans, E. saligna, E. grandis y E. maidenii. Entre las coniferas, las especies de mejor crecimiento fueron: P. radiata, P. patula y Cupressus lusitanica. Deberan plantarse varias especies puesto que hasta ahora ninguna ha experimentado el turno total y, por tanto, ninguna ha sobrepasado la etapa de experimentacin. Eucalitpos y coniferas se recomiendan para el programa de plantacin puesto que se espera que ambos grupos encontrarn una elevada demanda como resultado de la destruccin continua del bosque natural y el empiezo relativamente tardo de plantacin forestal en este pas.
42607575|The system used to process 10,000 kilos of Gmelina arborea Roxb. seed per year is detailed. The soundness of the procedures is shown by the 90 per cent germination obtained. The phases in the operation are: collection of the fruit when green to yellowgreen in colour, depulping, drying of the seed to an 8-10 per cent moisture content and then storage at 5C. No more than a few days should elapse between the various phases if a high germination percentage is to be obtained consistently.
42606520|The president of a major British Columbian timber using corporation explains that industry does not have the funds for reforesting public owned lands. There is the expertise to establish and manage the forest, there is skilled labour at present unemployed but not receiving financial help from the government. A reallocation of government spending could ensure that the forest resource was sustained, that constructive employment could be enjoyed and government money spent on forest establishment would show both immediate and long term benefits. Providing that there was a commitment from those who own the forest resource, those who utilise the produce from the forest and those whose work affected each stage from the young tree to the finished product, the investment of public funds and private capital would generate worthwhile returns for all involved. Le prsident d'une corporation de Colombie britannique qui est une utilisatrice importante de bois d'oeuvre explique que l'industrie ne dispose pas des fonds ncessaires aux reboisement des terrains du domaine public. On dispose de l'expertise d'tablir et de grer la fort, et il y a de la main-d'oeuvre professionnelle maintenant au chmage. Une nouvelle rpartition des dpenses gouvernementales pourrait assurer le maintien de la ressource forestire, fournir du travail productif et assurer que des deniers gouvernementaux dpenss pour tablir la fort montreraient des bnfices et immdiats et  long terme. Pourvu qu'il y et un engagement de la part des propritaires de la ressource forestire, des utilisateurs des produits forestiers et de ceux dont le travail influence chaque tape du semis jusqu'au produit fini, l'investissement des fonds publiques et du capital priv serait trs lucratif pour tous les intresss. El presidente de una importante empresa maderera en British Columbia explica que la industria no tiene fondos para la reforestacin del terreno pblico. Existen los conocimientos para el establecimiento y el manejo del bosque, lo mismo que mano de obra calificada, actual mente desempleada y recibiendo ayuda financiera por parte del estado. Una mejor distribucin de los gastos del gobierno podri asegurar el sostenimiento del recurso forestal y la creaciou de nuevas fuentes positivas de empleo dedicado a la reforestacion, lo cual traeria beneficios tanto a corto como a largo plazo. Siempre y cuandu haya un compromiso por parte de los dueos del recurso forestal, de los que aprovechan los recursos forestalos y de los que estau involucrados en cada etapa desde el arbol joven hasta el producto final, la inversion de fondos pblicos y privados proporcionaria apreciables beneficios para todos los interesados.
42608322|Use-values have been advocated as a tool to compare the value of not just individual species, but also of plant families and forest types to local people, in order, for example, to identify species or habitats in need of special management or conservation. We estimated usevalues in three forest types (upper restinga, lower restinga, tahuampa) on the Amazon flood plain south of Iquitos (Peru), compared two methodologies, identified the most valuable species and contrasted these valuations with the actual use of forest resources in local villages. A new method for estimating use-values was contrasted with the method of Phillips and Gentry (1993a). Despite philosophical and procedural differences, estimates were highly correlated (R=0.86). We discuss limitations of both methods and suggest some possible enhancements. The need to discriminate between past, present and potential uses is emphasised. Les valeurs utilitaires ont t recommandes comme outil pour comparer les mrites pour les habitants locaux, non seulement d'espces individuelles mais aussi des familles de plantes et des types de forts afin d'identifier, par exemple, les espces ou habitats ayant besoin d'organisation spciale ou de conservation. Nous avons fait l'estimation des valeurs utilitaires sur trois types de forts (restinga haute, restinga basse, tahuampa) dans la plaine inonde de l'Amazone au sud d'Iquitos (Prou). Nous avons galement compar deux mthodologies, identifi les espces les plus intressantes et mis en contraste ces valuations avec l'utilisation courante des resources forestires dans les villages locaux. Une nouvelle mthode d'estimation des valeurs utilitaires a t mise en contraste avec la mthode de Phillips et Gentry (1993a). En dpit de diffrences de procdure et philosophiques, les estimations sont fortement corrlatives (R=0.86). Nous examinons les limitations de chaque mthode et suggrons quelques amliorations possibles. La ncessit de discriminer les usages passs, prsents et potentiels est souligne. Valores de uso han sido propuestos como una herramienta para comparar el valor no slo de especies individuales, sino tambin de familias de plantas y tipos de bosques para la comunidad local, con el fin, por ejemplo, de identificar especies o hbitats que necesiten un manejo especial o conservacin. Nosotros estimamos valores de uso en tres tipos de bosques (restinga superior, restinga inferior, tahuampa) en los llanos de inundacin Amaznicos al sur de Iquitos (Per), comparamos dos metodologas, identificamos las especies ms valiosas, y contrastamos estas evaluaciones con el uso actual de los recursos forestales en aldeas locales. Se compar un mtodo nuevo paraestimar los valores de uso con el mtodo de Phillips y Gentry (1993a). A pesar de las diferencias filosficas y de procedimiento, los estimados fueron altamente correlacionados (R=0.86). Discutimos las limitaciones de a'mbos mtodos y sugerimos algunas mejoras posibles. Se da nfasis a la necesidad de discriminar entre usos pasados, presentes y potenciales.
42608696|A number of devices are available for the detection and assessment of decay and other internal defects in trees. A brief description of the principles of these devices is provided, together with a discussion of their efficacy and the diagnostic value of the information that they provide. This information is based partly on a current research project for the evaluation of some of the devices. Il existe plusieurs dispositifs pour la dtection et l'valuation du dprissement et d'autres dfauts internaux des arbres. L'article prsente un brief expos de ces dispositifs, de leur efficacit, et de la valeur du diagnostic de leurs informations. Existe un nmero amplio de dispositivos para la deteccin y evaluacin de la pudricin y otros defectos internos en rboles. Se provee una breve descripcin de estos dispositivos, junto con una discusin de su eficacia y el valor de diagnstico de la informacin que estos proveen.
