42606281|Sixteen Pinus caribaea Morelet provenance trials from the Commonwealth Forestry Institute international series were selected to cover the range of climatic conditions suitable for afforestation with the species. Height, diameter and bark thickness were measured, and bark percentage and volume under bark calculated for 19 provenances which were unequally represented in the trials; the provenance-locality table had 205 entries out of a possible total of 304. Provenance mean values over sites were calculated, adjusted where necessary for sites where provenances were not grown. A non-orthogonal, weighted analysis was performed to estimate the significance and magnitude of provenance and locality effects and their interaction; the latter was statistically significant but the proportion of total variance explained was small, e.g. for volume under bark, localities accounted for 67%, localities plus provenances 79% and localities plus provenances plus interaction 80%. However, important reversals in ranking between inland and coastal provenances of P. caribaea var. hondurensis Barrett and Golfari do occur at the environmental extremes. Productivity of P. caribaea var. hondurensis was superior to P. caribaea var. caribaea and P. caribaea var. bahamensis Barrett and Golfari at all localities. There were significant differences between the P. caribaea var. hondurensis provenances. Among the most productive were Laguna el Pinar, Alamicamba and Karawala from the coastal lowlands, Santa Clara, Los Briones, Poptun, Culmi, Potosi and Mountain Pine Ridge from inland areas, and Guanaja, the only insular source. Many provenances were shown to be better producers than Mountain Pine Ridge, the source of most exotic afforestation programmes to date, but Byfield, a Queensland select provenance developed from Mountain Pine Ridge, was the highest producer of all provenances. Although operational forestry would benefit from the use of such select land races, the more productive provenances should be used to establish new, potentially more productive, breeding populations. Seize provenances de Pinus caribaea, parmi celles qui constituent la srie internationale du Commonwealth Forestry Institute, ont t choisies pour reprsenter la gamme de conditions climatiques auxquelles cette espce se prte. La hauteur, le diamtre et l'paisseur de l'corce pour 19 provenances ingalment reprsentes; le tableau des provenances et des localities prsentait 205 combinaisons sur 304 possibles. La valeur moyenne a t calcule pour chaque provenance sur chaque place d'essai, enrgle s'il le faut en places d'essai o l'on n'en a pas cultives. Il a t procd  une analyse compense non-orthogonale, afin d'estimer l'importance et la grandeur des effets de provenance et de localit et leurs intrations; celles-l taient statistiquiement significatives mais la proportion de variance totale n'tait pas grande, par exemple pour le volume sous corce, la localit contribuait 67%, les localits avec les provenances 79% et les localits avec les provenances et l'interaction 80%. Cependant, des revirements importants de priorits entre les provenances de l'intrieur et celles de la cte de P. caribaea var. hondurensis Barrett and Golfari se produisent aux extrmits de l'environnement. La productivit de P. caribaea var. hondurensis tait suprieure  P. caribaea var. caribaea et P. caribaea var. bahamensis Barrett et Golfari dans toutes les localits. Des diffrences importantes ont apparu entre les provenances de P. caribaea var. hondurensis. Entre celles les plus productives se trouvait Laguna el Pinar, Alamicamba et Karawala des pays bas de la cte, Santa Clara, Los Briones, Poptun, Culmi, Potosi et Mountain Pine Ridge des rgions intrieures et Guanaja, la source insulaire unique. Bien des provenances ont t dmontres d'tre producteurs meilleurs que Mountain Pine Ridge, source des programmes d'afforestation les plus exotiques jusqu'ici, mais la provenance les plus productives d'entre toutes les provenances tait celle de Byfield, qui a t dveloppe a Queensland  partir de Mountain Pine Ridge. Bien que de telles races slectionnes soient intressantes pour le reboisement actuel, il conviendrait d'utiliser les provenances les plus prometteuses pour tablir des populations potentiellement capables de fournir de nouvelles sources encore plus avantageuses. Dieciseis ensayos de procedencia de Pinus caribaea Morelet fueron seleccionadas, los cuales forman parte del serie internacional del Commonwealth Forestry Institute, para cubrir el rango de condiciones ambientales aptas para la reforestacin con aquella especie. Se midieron la altura, dimetro, y grosor de la corteza, y se calcularon el porcentaje de la corteza, y el volumen debajo de la corteza para 19 procedencias, las cuales no fueron representadas igualmente; el cuadro de procedencia/localidad tenia 205 registros de un total posible de 304. Se calcularon los valores promedios de las procedencias sobre los sitios, adjustados donde fuera necesario para los sitios donde no se sembr una procedencia. Se realiz un anlisis "non-orthogonal" y adjustado para estimar el significado y magnitud de los efectos de procedencia y localidad, y tambin su interaccin; la ltima fue significativa, pero la proporcin de la variacin total explicada fue minima, es decir, para el volumen debajo de la corteza, los sitios explicaron 67%, los sitios ms procedencias 79%, y los sitios ms procedencias ms interaccin 80%. Sin embargo, en los extremos del ambiente, se encuentra importantes inversiones en el orden entre las procedencias insulares y costaeras de P. caribaea var. hondurensis Barrett y Golfari. La productividad de P. caribaea var. hondurensis fue superior a P. caribaea var. caribaea y P. caribaea var bahamensis Barrett y Golfari en todos los sitios. Hubo diferencias significativas entre las procedencias de P. caribaea var. hondurensis. Entre las ms productivas estn Laguna el Pinar, Alamicamba y Karawala en las tierras bajas costaeras; Santa Clara, Los Briones, Poptun, Culmi, Potosi y Mountain Pine Ridge en las areas inertiores; y Guanaja, la nica fuente insular. Muchas procedencias se demonstraron ser mejores productores que el "Mountain Pine Ridge", el cual es la fuente de la mayor parte de los programas de aforestacin hasta la fecha, pero Byfield, una procedencia selecta de Queensland, desarrollada de Mountain Pine Ridge, fue el mejor productor des todas las procedencias. Aunque el forestal industrial se beneficiar del uso de tales razas selectas, las procedencias ms productivas deben ser usadas para establecer poblaciones nuevas con fines de crianza, las cuales son potencialmente ms productivas.
42606435|The background and design of a factorial thinning experiment in Eucalyptus grandis are described and the preliminary results up to 15 years of age are discussed. Four main factors are tested, i.e. thinning intensity, commencement of thinning, thinning frequency and final stocking, each at three levels. At 15 years of age only two-thirds of the plots had received their final thinning. The experimental site and stand are extremely uniform which is indicated by low standard errors and coefficients of variation. There were highly significant responses in dbh and height to all main factors which were elucidated further by various significant interactions. The most important result is that mean annual volume increment underbark is not affected by any of the main factors, except in extreme cases which are not normal forestry practice. The influence of rainfall on the results is stressed and may be greater than that of any of the treatments. It is shown that the response of breast height diameter to release by thinning is limited and that generally accepted final stockings are too low for optimum sawlog production of E. grandis at clearfelling.
42606386|Better methods of vegetative propagation for promising clones of Pinus caribaea Morelet are required. Repeated sprays of 100 mg/litre BAP on the stems of 2.5 year-old trees significantly increased the number of interfascicular shoots produced. When these were taken as cuttings, the larger they were the more and longer were the roots they produced. Dipping cuttings in a solution of 0.8% IBA significantly increased root numbers, especially with large cuttings. On recherche de meilleurs mthodes pour la propagation vgtative de clones intressants de P. caribaea. En effectuant des aspersions rptes sur les tiges de semis ags de 2, 5 ans avec du BAP  100 mg/litre on a provoqu la production de pousses interfasciculaires en nombre accru. Utilises come boutures celles-ci produisaient des racines dont la quantit et la taille taient fonction de la longuer bouture. Le nombre de racines etait augment par le passage des boutures, surtout des grandes, dans un bain de 0.8% IBA. Faltan mejores mtodos para la propagacin vegetativa de clones de Pinus caribaea Morelet. Despus de rociar el tallo de rboles de 2.5 aos varios veces con 100 mg/1 de BAP, el nmero de brotes producidos increment significativamente. Cuanto ms grande fueron los recortes de estos brotes, tanto el nmero y el tamao de las races fueron producidos. Despus de inmersin de los recortes en una solucin de 0.8% IBA el nmero de races se increment significativamente, sobre todo con recortes grandes.
42606692|A major constraint on the multiplication of many woody perennials for use in rural development forestry is poor seed supply and handling. Seed requiring scarification is often treated inadequately as a result of a scarcity in terms of skill and capital. The hot-wire method of scarifying seed described in this paper is applicable to such conditions as it is a cheap, effective method with a broad applicability to a number of seed types. The hot-wire scarifier is used by applying a wire tip heated by electrical resistance to the testa of 'hardseeded' seed. This method damages the testa sufficiently to allow the imbibition of water. The paper describes the results obtained from treating ten 'hardseeded' species.
42607089|The paper considers on a global perspective of conservation and resources utilization, policies based on regulation of use according to an accessible potential, reinvestment for continued productivity and preservation of irreplaceable values. The evolution of relevant federal policies in Switzerland is reviewed with emphasis on cross-sectoral conservation and forest policy programmes. The relationship between such programmes, the social and political dimension of conservation, and new actors determining the various policy processes are described. It is concluded that the linkages between the different policy areas increasingly determine forest protection and management, and are a central element of forest policy development and analysis. L'article considre une perspective globale des politiques de conservation et d'utilisation des ressources bass sur les objectifs des ressources potentiellement accessibles et du rinvestissement en vue d'assurer une production continue et une prservation des valeurs irremplaables. L'volution des lignes de conduite fdrales Suisses en question est examine avec une attention spciale donne  la conservation intersecteur et les programmes forestiers. Les relations entre de tels programmes, la dimension politique et sociale de la conservation, et les nouveaux acteurs qui dterminent les diffrentes mises en pratique des programmes, sont pris en compte. La conclusion qui en ressort est que les liens entre les diffrents secteurs de planification dterminent de plus en plus la protection et l'entretien des forts, et qu'ils sont un lment central dans l'analyse et le dveloppement de la politique forestire. El artculo considera una perspectiva global de polticas de conservacin y utilizacin de recursos basados en los objetivos de potencial asequible, reinversin para productividad continua y conservacin de valores irreemplazables. Se revisa la evolucin de polticas federales relevantes en Suiza con nfasis en programas de conservacin cruzada y polticas forestales. Se discuten la relacin entre tales programas, la dimensin social y poltica de la conservacin, y nuevos factores que determinan varios procesos polticos. Se concluye que los enlaces entre las diferentes reas de poltica determinan en forma creciente la proteccin y administracin forestales, y son un elemento central del desarrollo y anlisis de polticas forestales.
42604748|Riparian evergreen forests, or mushitu, cover an area of approximately 95 square miles and are scattered throughout the watercourses of north-eastern Zambia (61,000 sq. miles). Mushitu play an important role in the preservation of perennial streams, and they also conlain some valuable timber species Because of the distribution of these forests, management and protection are difficult, but essential if the forests are to survive The yield of 300 cubic feet an acre compares favourably with other sources of indigenous timber; it is, however, low in comparison with the tropical high forest yields of 1,2003,000 cu. ft. an acre. The common dominants are light demanders and exploitation by clear-felled coupes is suggested. The grassy areas of the watercourses or dambos, offer an excellent opportunity for enrichment planting and Maesopsis eminii is probably one of the most promising species.
42607846|A brief review is given of the major consequences believed likely to follow the destruction of tropical rain forest. The importance of understanding processes of forest regeneration is recognised. There is a general consensus on the characteristics of regrowth species but not on hydrological and mineral cycles or how these or biomass recover after forest clearance. Salient aspects of the monumental Hubbard Brook study of the northern hardwood forest of northeastern North America are reviewed. It is suggested that no study in comparable detail can at present be anticipated in tropical rain forest. Instead the American studies provide valuable insights to hydrological and mineral cycles in forest ecosystems and give guidance on methodology and inter-relationships. L'auteur passe rapidement en revue les principales consquences attribues  la destruction de la fort tropicale humide et reconnait l'importance d'une meilleure comprhension des processus de la rgnration forestirre. Il existe un accord gnrale sur les caractristiques des espces qui recolonisent les terrains dboiss mais pas sur la perturbation des cycles hydrologique on chimique, ni sur l'ventuel rtablissement soit de ceux-ci soit de la biomasse. Aprs avoir cit les grandes lignes de l'tude Hubbard Brook sur les forts  feuilles caduques du Nord-Est amricain, l'auteur suggre que pour le moment on ne peut esprer aucun approfondissement comparable dans les recherches sur la fort tropicale humide. Les tudes nord-amricaines donnent cependant des apperus prcieux sur les cycles hydrologique et chimique dans les cosystmes forestiers et fournissent des indications utiles sur la mthodologie et sur les rapports entre les divers facteurs. Se de una revisin breve de las probables mayores consecuencias de la destruccin del bosque tropical hmedo. Es reconocida la importancia del entendimiento de los procesos de regeneracin del bosque. Hay un consenso general sobre las caractersticas de reproduccin de las especies pero no en ciclos hidrolgicos y minerales o cmo estos o la biomasa se recuperan despus de la tala. Se hace una resena de los salientes aspectos del monumental estudio Hubbard Brook del bosque de maderas duras del norte del noreste de Norteamrica. Se sugiere que ningn estudio en el presente puede anticiparse a tal detalle en el bosque tropical hmedo. Los estudios norteamericanos proveen ms bien, una valorable visin de los ciclos hidrolgicos y minerales en ecosistemas forestales y dan una guia en su metodoligia e interrelaciones.
42608167|Agroforestry is not a new enterprise since it has been practised under different conditions and in diverse locations for more than a century. The system originated with the Burmese hill-farming experience using teak as the forest crop. Since then, the system though called by different names, has spread throughout Asia, and to Africa and Latin America. The basic conditions that favour its adoption are those of unemployment and shortage of farmlands. However, over the last two decades during which critical political decisions have had to be made under severe socioeconomic climate, agroforestry has become increasingly popular, not merely as a regeneration technique but increasingly as a comprehensive rural development programme. The tremendous employment opportunities generated as well as the social infrastructures and multiplier effects thereof have enhanced the popularity of the scheme. The real increase in the quantity and variety of foodstuffs due to agroforestry in addition to its role in soil rehabilitation and in conjunction with other land use agents are now widely recognized. The potentialities of agroforestry compel a land use management which eschews the false dichotomy of agriculture and forestry which conserves the ecosystem, and which at one and the same time provides food and wood. Therefore there is an urgent need for a new cadre of forest managers not only trained in multiple production systems but also fully aware of the significant role of the pertinent socio-economic inputs. The future of agroforestry is intimately related to the development of appropriate expertise and implementation techniques. Les systmes agro-forestiers ne sont pas une nouveaut car depuis plus d'un sicle ils ont t mis en application dans des lieux varis et sous diverses conditions. Leur point de dpart se situe dans la technique Birmanaise du "taungya" pour la plantation de teck, puis, sous des appellations diffrentes, ces systmes se sont propags dans toute l'Asie, pour atteindre l'Afrique et finalement l'Amrique Latine. Les conditions de base favorisant leur dveloppement sont le sous-emploi et la carence en terres agricoles. Durant les deux dernires dcennies au cours desquelles d'importantes dcisions ont d tre prises sous la pression d'un climat socio-conomique tendu, les systmes agro-forestiers ont acquis une popularit croissante, non seulement au sens de technique de rgnration de la fort, mais englobant souvent un programme intgr de dveloppement rural. De plus, leur popularit a t accentue par la quantit d'emplois crs ainsi que par la cration d'infrastructures sociales et par leur effet de multiplicateur. On reconnat maintenant presque partout ce que l'on doit  ces techniques d'abord par la quantit et la varit des produits de consommation produits mais encore par leur rle dans la rgnration du sol et son utilisation en parallle avec d'autres systmes d'utilisation des sols. Le potentiel des techniques agro-forestires se tient dans une exploitation du sol effacent la dichotomie sparant l'agriculture de l'conomie forestire et conservant l'cosystme, tout en parvenant en mme temps  produire bois et nourriture; c'est pourquoi un besoin en cadres comptents commence  se faire sentir, qui seraient non seulement forms aux systmes de production multiple mais comprendraient pleinement le rle significatif des facteurs socio-conomiques. Le futur de ces systmes agro-forestiers est intimement li au dveloppement d'une expertise approprie ainsi qu'aux techniques de mise en oeuvre. Agroforestacin no es una actividad nueva desde que ha sido practicada bajo diferentes condiciones y en diversos lugares por mas de un siglo. El sistema se origin en Burma, con los cultivos de montaa, usando teca como produccin forestal. Desde entonces, aunque bajo diferentes nombres, el sistema se ha extendido a travs de Asia y a Africa y Latino Amrica. La condiciones bsicas que favorecieron su adopcin son el desempleo y la escasez de tierras cultivables. De todos modos, en las dos ultimas dcadas, durante las cuales han tenido que ser tomadas decisiones polticas criticas bajo una fuerte presin socio-econmica, agroforestacin ha incrementado su popularidad no meramente como una tcnica de regeneracin sino progresivamente como un programa de desarrollo rural integral. Las oportunidades de empleo generadas, asi' como la infraestructura social y sus efectos multiplicadores han realzado la polularidad del esquema. El incremento real en la cantidad y variedad de alimentos debido a la agroforestacin, en adicin a su rol en la rehabilitacin del suelo y en conjuncin con otros agentes de uso de la tierra son ahora ampliamente reconocidos. Las potencialidades de la agroforestacin compelen a un uso de la tierra que evita la falsa dicotoma de agricultura y forestacin, lo cual conserva el ecosistema y a la vez provee alimento y madera. Por consiguiente, hay una urgente necesidad de nuevos expertos forestales entrenados no solamente en sistemas de produccin multiple sino tambin que conozcan perfectamente el importante rol socioeconmico de los mismos. El futuro de la agroforestacin est intimamente relacionado con el desarrallo del conocimiento tecnolgico adecuado y a las tcnicas de implementacin.
42608108|The approach of the millennium has provoked a spate of reflection, prediction and enterprise. This commentary on my impression of key elements of the future of forestry and the forest products industries perpetuates the millennium theme as a convenient vehicle by which to illustrate the transitions with which we are variously engaged. I synthesise the work of many others to suggest a suite of contentions about native, plantation and farm forests, markets and market mechanisms, and institutional structures and processes. My conclusion - that it is better for the forestry and forest products industries to anticipate and embrace the future than to fight against it - is not novel, but it is counter to much of the rhetoric, and some of the actions, of the past few decades. L'approche du millnium a provoqu un coup de rflexion, de prdiction et d'entreprise. Ce commentaire sur mon impression des lments essentiels du futur de la foresterie et des industries des produits forestiers perptue le thme du millnium comme moyen convenient pour illustrer les transitions avec lesquelles nous nous mettons diversement en prise. Je synthtise le travail de beaucoup d'autres pour suggrer une suite de dbats sur les forts de plantation, les forts indignes et rurales, les marchs et les mcanismes du march, et les structures et procds institutionnels. Ma conclusion - que la foresterie et les industries des produits forestiers feraient mieux d'anticiper et d'embrasser le futur que de lutter contre - n'est pas nouvelle, mais elle contrarie beaucoup de la rhtorique, et une partie des actions des dcennies rcentes. El advenimiento del milenio ha provocado un torrente de reflexin, prediccin e iniciativa. Este comentario, en mi impresin de los elementos claves para el futuro de la ingeniera forestal y las industrias de productos forestales, perpeta el tema del milenio como un vehculo conveniente por medio del cual se ilustran las transacciones con las que estamos comprometidos. Yo sintetizo el trabajo de muchos otros para sugerir un conjunto de argumentos acerca de los bosques nativos y plantaciones, mercados y mecanismos de mercadeo y las estructuras y procesos institucionales. Mi conclusin - que es mejor para las industrias de productos forestales y la ingeniera forestal anticipar y acoger el futuro en vez que luchar en su contra - no es nueva, pero es contradictoria a gran parte de la retrica, y a parte de las acciones, de las dcadas pasadas.
42607088|Human activities greatly reduced New Zealand's natural forests. A national park system and other forms of reservation first emerged in the late nineteenth century. From the early 1970s active ecosystem conservation policies expanded in state-owned forests, then managed principally by the New Zealand Forest Service and the Department of Lands and Survey. Concurrent political activism combined with pressure for Government reform culminated in a revolution in environmental administration, through the transfer of most state-owned forests to a new Department of Conservation in 1987. Les activits humaines ont grandement rduit les forts naturelles de Nouvelle-Zlande. Un systme de parcs nationaux ainsi que d'autres formes de mise en rserve s'est dvelopp depuis la fin du dix-neuvime sicle. A partir du dbut des annes soixantedix, des programmes actifs de conservation de l'cosystme se sont tendus aux forts d'tat, qui taient alors entretenues principalement par le Service des Forts de Nouvelle-Zlande et par le dpartement des Terres et de l'expertise foncire. Le double feu de l'activisme politique, combin aux pressions visant a obtenir des rformes gouvernementales, a culmin en une rvolution de l'administration de l'environnement: le transfert de la plupart des forts d'tat dans un nouveau Dpartement de la Conservation en 1987. Las actividades humanas redujeron grandemente bosques naturales de Nueva Zelandia. A finales del siglo diecinueve emergi un sistema de parque nacional y otras formas de reservacin. A Principios de los setenta se expandieron las polticas de conservacin de ecosistema activo en los bosques en posesin del estado, en aquel entonces manejados principalmente por el Servicio Forestal de Nueva-Zelandia y el Departamento de Tierras y Catastro. En 1987, el activismo poltico concurrente combinado con presin para reforma del Gobierno culmin en una revolucin en la administracin ambiental, a travs de la transferencia de la mayora de los bosques en posesin del estado a un nuevo Departamento de Conservacin.
43737706|Acacia nilotica, an important all-purpose timber species in the northern districts of Karnataka, was widely infested by the borer Celosterna scabrator Var. spinator during 1983-85. Occurences were recorded in Gulbarga district. The etiology is discussed in the paper and measures of prevention and control of the beetle have been suggested. An important inference that could be drawn from the present study is that A. nilotica is better equipped to ward off the borer attack when it is raised on deep soils, preferably black cotton soil.
43737694|This paper reports some of the research studies in the Development of Diversified Forest Rehabilitation Project in Northeast Thailand. It considers the factors which influence the planting of Eucalyptus camaldulensis by farmers, the likelihood of their continuing to grow trees and some factors which might encourage further planting. It was based on interviews with both growers and non-growers of eucalypts. Cet article rend compte de quelques-uns des travaux de recherche qui font partie du Projet de Rhabilitation visant le Dveloppement de Fort Diversifie dans le Nord-est de la Thalande. Il examine les facteurs qui one de l'influence sur la plantation d'Eucalyptus camaldulensis par les propritaries et la probabilit qu'ils continuent  cultiver des arbres et quelques facteurs qui peut-tre favoriseront la plantation de plus d'arbres. Il fut bas sur des entrevues et avec des cultivateurs d'eucalyptus et avec des non-cultivateurs. Se reportan algunas de las investigaciones del proyecto Development of Diversified Forest Rehabilitation (mtodos alternativos de renovacin de bosques) en el noreste de Tailandia. Se consideran los factores que influyen en la plantacin de Eucalyptus camaldulensis por parte de agricultores, la probabilidad de la continuidad de esta actividad y lgunos de los factores que podran promover la plantacin de rboles.Este estudio se bas en entrevistas tanto a agricultores que plantaron eucaliptos as como a otros que no lo hicieron.
42606769|A method is described for interpreting the data from a series of species trials by regressing the growth of the individual species against a marker species. The marker species should be one whose behaviour during the establishment phase can be reliably predicted by most forest managers. Three characteristics are defined and used in the interpretation: "productivity" being the average performance of each species relative to the marker species; "responsiveness" being the slope of the regression of each species growth against that of the marker species across the range of sites and conditions and "predictability" being the closeness of the relationship. It is argued that expressing the data in this way makes transference of the results to managers easier and more comprehensible to them. On dcrit une mthode pour l'interprtation des donnes d'une srie d'essais spcifiques par la rgression de l'accroissement des essences individuelles sur une essence marqueuse. Pendant la priode d'implantation l'essence marqueuse doit avoir un comportement qui peut tre prdit avec confiance par la plupart des administrateurs forestiers. Trois caractres sont dfinis et utiliss dans l'interprtation: la "productivit" est le rendement moyen de chaque essence par rapport  l'essence marqueuse; le "degr de raction" est l'inclinaison de la rgression de l'accroissement de chaque essence par rapport  celle de l'essence marqueuse  travers l'ventail de sites et de conditions; et la "prvisibilit" est la proximit du rapport. On prtend que l'expression des connes d'une telle faon facilite le transfert des rsultats aux administrateurs et les rend plus comprhensibles. Se describe un mtodo para la interpretacin de datos de una serie de ensayos de especies. El mtodo utiliza el anlisis de regresin de cada una de las especies contra una especie control. La especie control debe ser una que la mayora de los administradores forestales puedan predecir en forma confiable su comportamiento en la fase de establecimiento. Se definen y utilizan tres caractersticas en la interpretacin: "productividad" la cual se define como el comportamiento promedio de cada especie con relacin a la especie control; "respuesta" definida por la pendiente de la regresin del crecimiento cada especie contra la especie control en todo el mbito de sitios y condiciones evaluados; y "prediccin" definida por el ajuste de la relacin. Se discute que el expresar la informacin de esta manera hace la transferencia de los resultados ms fcil y comprensible para los administradores forestales.
42605276|A computer system was developed to provide a data base for the intensive management of a large plantation enterprise. The system embraced area, inventory, cost and wood production data. The design provided rigorously edited records able to be interrogated to meet evolving needs for management information.
42608284|The European Timber Trends Study V reviewed the effects of different economic and policy scenarios on forest products' consumption, production and trade in the year 2020. In addition to the central (base) scenarios adopted in the study, additional scenarios were chosen to reflect uncertainties about product prices, construction activity, recycling of waste paper, energy prices and environmental policy. Review of the results for the different scenarios indicates that the influences of costs and prices in the sector are more important than has commonly been appreciated. Parts of the system are more stable than others, notably demand for European roundwood is much less volatile than demand for other regions' products. L'tude V des courants du bois europen a pass en revue les effets des diffrents scnarios politiques et conomiques sur la consommation des produits forestiers, leur production et le commerce en 2020. Ajouts au scnarios centraux (de base) adopts dans l'tude, des scnarios additionnels ont t choisis pour reflter les inscurits quant aux prix des produits, l'activit de la construction, le recyclage des dchets de papier, le prix d'nergie et la politique environnementale. Une rvision des rsultats pour les diffrents scnarios indique que les influences des cots et des prix dans le secteur sont plus importantes qu'on ne l'a en gnral prvu. Certaines parties du systme sont plus stables que d'autres, particulirement la demande de bois rond europen est bien moins incertaine que la demande de produits d'autres rgions.
42603892|Twenty-six species out of 190 that grow to timber size are economically valuable. There are one or two exploitable trees per acre. Reserves with an average stocking of at least nine economic trees below the exploitable size of 9 ft or 7 ft girth according to species are managed by the selection system with a 25-year felling cycle.The requisite stocking is never found in the rain forest, but is normally found in the semi-deciduous forest. Stock maps showing the position of each exploitable economic tree are prepared and used to select a sustainable yield which is calculated from the basal areas and presumed rates of growth of trees greater than 5 ft girth. Thinnings are carried out either shortly before or less usually after exploitation in order to favour the smaller individuals of valuable species. The prescribed yield often includes defective trees which the exploiter does not remove ; this is a serious obstacle to selection working as it is likely to result in insufficient regeneration. In addition, because of this and the practice of cutting to a girth limit, it may lead to genetical deterioration. Much of the additional information that is required for satisfactory selection working could most readily be obtained by a system of continuous forest inventory with permanent randomly selected sample plots.
42606969|Recent efforts to translate the concept of sustainable development into practice have led to the establishment of innovative new international programmes. These new programmes, including the Canadian Model Forest Initiative, regional cooperative programmes sponsored by the Canadian International Development Agency in Southeast Asia, Southern Africa and the Caribbean, and the Commonwealth Forestry Initiative, are described. An examination of these initiatives reveals that sustainable approaches to forest management are based on a wider consideration of biological and socio-economic issues in the forest and surrounding areas, and that, more and more, decision-making processes are taking into account a variety of different interests. Working models of sustainable management are still rare, but as these and other initiatives begin to provide insight into the concept of sustainable management, there will be a need to combine programmes, to form networks and to coordinate the exchange of scientific, technical and policy results. De rcents efforts de mise en pratique du concept de dveloppement qui peut tre soutenu  long terme ont conduit  l'tablissement de nouveaux programmes internationaux novateurs. Sont dcrits ces nouveaux programmes comprenant 'the Canadian Model Forest Initiative' (l'Initiative du Modle Forestier Canadien), des programmes rgionaux de coopration sponsoriss par l'Agence Canadienne de Dveloppement International en Asie du sud-est, en Afrique australe et dans les Carabes, et l'Initiative Forestire du Commonwealth. Un examen de ces initiatives rvle qu' une approche d'amnagement forestier soutenable  long terme est base sur une plus large prise en compte des facteurs biologiques et socioconomiques dans la fort et les espaces environnants et que, de plus en plus, les processus de prise de dcisions prennent en compte une varit d'intrts diffrents. Des modles de travail d'amnagement soutenables  long terme sont encore rares, mais comme ceux-ci et d'autres initiatives commencent  fournir une meilleure comprhension de ce concept, on va, d'ici peu, rencontrer un besoin de regrouper les diffrents programmes afin de construire des rseaux et de coordonner la circulation des rsultats scientifiques, techniques et politiques. Los recientes esfuerzos para traducir el concepto de desarrollo sostenible dentro de la prctica, han llevado al establecimiento de nuevos e innovadores programas internacionales. Se describen estos nuevos programas incluyendo la Iniciativa Forestal Modelo del Canad, los programas cooperativos regionales auspiciados por la Agencia Canadiense de Desarrollo Internacional en el sureste de Asia, Sur Africa y el Caribe, y la Iniciativa de Ingeniera Forestal de la Comunidad Britnica de Naciones. Un examen de estas iniciativas revelan que, los enfoques sostenibles para el manejo forestal se basan en una consideracin ms amplia de los temas biolgicos y socio-econmicos del bosque y de las reas circundantes, y que, ms y ms procesos de toma de decisiones estn teniendo en cuenta una variedad de diferentes intereses. Modelos de trabajos de manejo sostenible son todava raros, pero as como estas y otras iniciativas, comienzan a proveer conocimiento en el concepto de manejo sostenible, habr una necesidad de combinar programas, formar redes de trabajo y coordinar el intercambio de resultados cientficos, tcnicos y polticos.
42608595|A major problem with large areas of plantations is forest fire. In 1994, in one newly established industrial forest plantation in Sumatra, approximately 20,000 ha of 120,000 ha (17 %) of Acacia mangium were damaged by fire in only three months. All trees died and no natural regeneration could be found on the forest floor one year after the fire. One of the reasons why so much of the plantation were burned was the high level of fuel stored in the vegetation as a result of poor maintenance. The key to saving industrial forest plantation from fire invasion is a reduced fuel load. One possible solution for reducing fuel load in the plantation is proper tree maintenance with the correct tree spacing. The area must also contain fire breaks. Although these planning activities are established with rules and guidelines in the manuals, these are not always followed in practice. Un problme majeur des grandes plantations c'est le feu sauvage. En 1994, dans une nouvelle plantation de fort industrielle en Sumatra, environ 20.000 ha de 120.000 ha (17%) d'acacia mangium ont t endommags par le feu pendant trois mois. Tous les arbres sont morts et il n'y avait pas de rgnration naturelle dans la couverture morte un an aprs le feu. Une des raisons pourquoi une proportion tellement grande de la plantation a t brle, c'est le haut niveau de combustible amass dans la vgtation  cause d'un entretien insuffisant. Le moyen de protger les plantations de fort industrielle contre le feu est de rduire le combustible, ce qu'on peut effectuer avec l'entretien correct, et avec un bon espacement des arbres. Il doit y avoir aussi des pare-feux. Bien que ces dmarches soient tablies dans les manuels avec des rgles, celles-ci ne sont pas suivies effectivement. Un mayor problema con las grandes reas de plantaciones es el incendio forestal. En 1994, en una de las plantaciones forestales ms recientemente establecidas en Sumatra, aproximadamente 20.000 de las 120.000 hectreas (17%) de Acacia mangium fueron daadas por el fuego en un periodo de slo tres meses. Todos los rboles murieron y no se pudo encontrar regeneracin natural en el suelo del bosque hasta un ao despus del incendio. Una de las razones por las cuales las plantaciones fueron quemadas a tal grado, fue el alto nivel de combustible almacenado en la vegetacin como resultado de un mantenimiento pobre. La clave para salvar plantaciones de bosques industriales de la invasin del fuego es reducir la carga de combustible. Una solucin posible para reducir la carga de combustible en la plantacin es un buen mantenimiento de los rboles con un correcto espacio entre ellos. El rea tambin debe contener barreras rompefuegos. A pesar de que stas actividades han sido establecidas con reglamentos y lincamientos en los manuales, stas no se siguen en la prctica.
42603450|The flecks or holes commonly visible on the surface of this timber and often believed to be evidence of borers are shown to be due to radial strands of phloem. The strands appear to be traumatic in origin and frequently develop in the xylem of seedlings, possibly as the result of virus infection. The defect cannot become worse after the tree has been felled.
42608097|Research into the impacts of logging on the regeneration of lowland dipterocarp forests has been carried out in Central Kalimantan (Indonesian Borneo) as part of the UK Department for International Development funded Indonesian Tropical Forest Management Programme. The paper describes the impact of logging on the radiation environment, dipterocarp seedling growth and mycorrhizal dynamics and assesses the impact of logging on the forest as managed under the Indonesian Selective Cutting and Replanting system (TPTI). The study concludes that soil disturbance associated with the logging operation is the main factor limiting seedling establishment and regeneration. The creation of skid trails is associated with removal of the upper soil layers and the pool of shade-suppressed dipterocarp seedlings. The distance to seed sources limits establishment of new seedlings in large gaps following logging. In relation to improving sustainable management of dipterocarp forests, it is suggested that great care should be taken to apply reduced impact logging techniques to protect the soil and dipterocarp seedlings and mycorrhizal fungi. Logging systems can be modified to maximise the regrowth rate of dipterocarp species while inhibiting that of less valuable pioneer species by limiting the size of individual canopy gaps formed by logging so that their projected ground area does not exceed 650 m. This implies felling no more than two trees per gap. La recherche sur les impacts de l'exploitation sur la rgnration des forts diptrocarpaces  basse altitude a t fait  Kalimantan Centre (partie indonsienne de Borno), tant partie du Programme Indonsien de l'Amnagement des Forts Tropicales soutenu par le Department for International Development du Royaume-Uni. L'article dcrit l'impact de l'exploitation sur l'environnement radial, sur la croissance des semis diptrocarpaces, et sur la dynamique des mycorhizes, et estime l'impact de l'exploitation sur la fort gre par le Systme Indonsien de Coupe et Replantage Slectifs (TPTI). L'tude conclut que la perturbation du sol que comporte l'exploitation est le plus grand facteur qui limite l'tablissement et la rgnration des semis. La cration des sentiers de dbardage comporte l'enlvement des couches suprieures du sol et du fonds de semis diptrocarpacs supprims par l'ombre. La distance aux origines des graines limite l'tablissement de nouveaux semis dans les grandes troues cres par l'exploitation. Afin d'amliorer la gestion durable des forts diptrocarpaces, on suggre apporter soin  appliquer les techniques d'exploitation d'impact rduit pour protger le sol et les semis diptrocarpacs et les mycorhizes. Les systmes d'exploitation peuvent tre modifis pour maximiser le taux de recr des espces diptrocarpaces tout en empchant celle des essences transitoires moins prcieuses en limitant la grandeur des troues individuelles du couvert forestier causes par l'exploitation, afin que leur superficie terrestre projete n'excde pas 650 m2. Cela veut dire couper pas plus que deux arbres par troue. Se ha estado llevando a cabo una investigacin de los impactos de la produccin de madera en la regeneracin de bosque dipterocrpeo de las tierras bajas en Kalimantan Central (Borneo Indonsico) como parte del Departamento del Reino Unido para el Desarrollo Internacional que financi el Programa de Administracin Forestal Tropical de Indonesia. El artculo describe el impacto de la produccin de madera en el entorno de radiacin, crecimiento de las plntulas y dinmica de micorriza y evala el impacto de la produccin de madera en el bosque tal como es manejado bajo el sistema indonsico de Corte Selectivo y Replante (TPTI). El estudio concluye que el desajuste del suelo asociado con la operacin de produccin de madera es el factor limitante principal para el establecimiento y regeneracin de plntulas. La creacin de vas de arrastre se asocia con la remocin de las capas superiores del suelo y el colectivo de plntulas desprovistas de sombra. La distancia a las fuentes de semillas limita el establecimiento de nuevas plntulas en brechas grandes despus del corte y acarreo de los troncos. Con relacin al mejoramiento del manejo sostenible de bosques dipterocrpeos, se ha sugerido que se debe tener mucho cuidado de aplicar tcnicas que reduzcan el impacto de la extraccin de madera para proteger el suelo, las plntulas de dipterocrpeos y las micorrizas. Las tcnicas de produccin de madera pueden modificarse para maximizar la tasa de rebrote de especies dipterocarpas mientras que inhibe aquellas especies pioneras menos valiosas, a travs de limitar el tamao de brechas de dosel individuales formadas por la extraccin de troncos de tal manera que su rea proyectada de tierra no exceda 650 m2. Esto implica el corte de no ms que dos rboles por brecha.
42606942|This paper examines the potential role that naturally extracted non-timber forest products (NTFPs) can play in the sustainability of the Amazon rain forest. Through a number of case studies which examine the history of the exploitation of some of the main NTFPs of the Amazon, it shows that due to a number of inter-related factors, the outlook for the sustainability of NTFP-based natural forest management, if left solely to market forces, is poor. These factors include the ephemeral nature of the markets for many of these products, often due to the substitution of natural products by synthetics; substitution by plantation products; tenure insecurity and government policies that encourage alternative land uses; destructive harvesting techniques; and exploitative commercialization systems in which the extractors receive insufficient incentive to manage the resource sustainably. The future of this form of forest management will depend increasingly on fundamental tenure and institutional reforms, adequate remuneration of producers (possibly involving some form of subsidy), and a more integrated agroforestry approach to natural forest management. Cet article examine le rle que les produits forestiers autre que le bois (les NTFP), extraits naturellement, pourraient jouer dans l'amnagement  production soutenue de la fort ombrophile de l'Amazone. Au moyen de plusieurs tudes qui examinent l'histoire de l'exploitation de certains NTFP de l'Amazone, on montre que, en raison de plusieurs facteurs en corrlation, la perspective de l'amnagement  production soutenue des forts naturelles bas sur les NTFP est sombre, si l'on laisse faire les forces du march. Parmi ces facteurs sont le caractre phmre du march pour beaucoup de ces produits, d souvent au remplacement par des produits de plantation; le manque de bail assur, ainsi que des politiques gouvernementales qui encouragent d'autres usages des terres; des techniques d'exploitation qui causent des dgts; et l'exploitation dans les systmes de commercialisation, qui n'incitent pas suffisamment ceux qui extraient les produits de la fort  amnager la ressource d'une manire soutenable. L'avenir de cette forme d'amnagement forestier va de plus en plus tre tributaire des rformes fondamentales des baux et des institutions, d'une rmunration suffisante pour les producteurs (y compris, peut-tre, des subventions), et d'une faon plus intgre d'aborder l'amnagement des forts naturelles,  la manire de l' agroforesterie. Este artculo examina el potential que productos no madereros extrados naturalmente (PFNM) pueden desempear en la sustentabilidad de la floresta hmeda amazonica. Atravs de un nmero de casos estudiados los cuales examina la historia de la explotacin de algunos de los principales PFNM de la Amazonia, muestra que debido a un nmero de factores inter-relacionados, la visin general para la sustencin de PFNM basada en el manejo de floresta natural, si es dejada solamente a las fuezas del mercado, es pobre. Estos factores incluyen la natureza efmera de los mercados para muchos de esos productos, debido frecuentemente, a la substitucin de productos naturales por sintticos, substitucin por productos de plantacin; inseguridad en la propriedade de la tierra y en polticas de gobierno que apoyan los usos alternativos de la tierra; tcnicas de coseja destructivas; y sistemas de explotacin comercial en los cuales los extradores reciben incentivos insuficientes para majejar los recuros de forma sustentable. El futuro de esta forma de manejo florestal depender cada vez ms de reformas fundamentales de la propriedad de la tierra y de las instituciones, remuneracin apropriada de los productores (possiblemente envolviendo alguna forma de subsidio) y un acercamiento ms integrado entre agro-silvicultura y manejo de floresta natural.
42606682|Preparation for a World Food Programme project in Tibet enables a review of the forest resources and economy. The autonomous region is less influenced than 'China proper' by new reform policies and suffers from isolation, extreme poverty and an intractable environment. The project involves 'high tech', irrigated plantations which at first sight seem inappropriate: but Tibet is served by dedicated foresters, and China's record in implementing WFP projects is outstanding. La prparation pour un projet du Programme Mondial de la Nourriture en Tibet rend possible une revue des ressources et de l'conomie forestires. La rgion autonome est moins influence que 'la Chine mme' par la politique nouvelle de rforme et souffre de l'isolement, la misre et un environnement ingrat. Le projet comprend la haute technologie, des plantations irrigues qui  premire vue paraissent inaptes: mais le Tibet est servi par des forestiers ddis, et la conduite de la Chine dans l'xecution des projets du Programme Mondial de la Nourriture est excellente.
42606679|Each established silvicultural system for tropical forests reflects its time and place of origin. There is much to be learned from these systems, but it is dangerous to apply them without modification to forests about which little is known. Instead, it is preferable to begin by testing the forest's reactions to individual silvicultural operations and to simple improvement treatments. This approach will rapidly provide reliable information upon which to develop a suitable silvicultural system. Chaque rgime tabli pour les forts tropicaux reflte son temps et son lieu d'origine. On peut apprendre beaucoup de ces rgimes, mais il est hasardeux de les appliquer sans modification  des forts dont on connait trs peu. Au lieu de cela, il vaut mieux commencer par faire des essais des ractions de la fort  des interventions sylvicoles isoles et  des traitements simples d'amlioration. Cette mthode fournira rapidement des reseignements fiables sur lesquels on pourra dvelopper un rgime appropri. Cada uno de los sistemas silviculturales implementados en bosques tropicales refleja las particularidades del lugar y de la poca de establecimiento. Todava hay mucho que aprender sobre ellos, pero es peligroso aplicarlos sin ninguna modifacacin a bosques poco conocidos. Es preferible comenzar con ensayos de las reacciones del bosque a las diferentes operaciones silvcolas y a tratamientos simples de mejoramiento. Un enfoque de esta naturaleza proporcionara informaciones confiables, que serviran como fundamento para el desarrollo de un sistema silvicultural apropiado.
42605466|Selective tree breeding is most effective when practised on the most suitable population, i.e. the best adapted and most productive species and provenance. Exotic sources are frequently more desirable than indigenous material and there is a need for rigorous, comparative testing of many source populations with precise information on their origins. Many species that are potentially useful for plantations in many ("recipient") countries occur naturally over wide ranges, often encompassing several ("donor") countries. It would probably be impracticable and certainly inefficient for each recipient country to search each donor country for seed, pollen or vegetative propagules of each of the species of interest. Personal correspondence and meetings can facilitate a limited amount of seed exchange but clearly there are great advantages in centrally planned seed collecting expeditions that will provide material of certified sources for comparative testing on as many sites and in as many countries as required. Examples are given in this paper of existing co-operative programmes including those of the following units, supported morally or financially by F.A.O. through its Panel of Experts on Forest Gene Resources: Commonwealth Forestry Institute, Oxford, U.K. (international provenance trials, particularly of Central American pines, e.g. Pinus caribaea Morelet and P. oocarpa Schiede); Danish seed centre and pine and teak centres in Thailand (international provenance trials of Tectona grandis L., P. kesiya Royle ex Gordon, and P. merkusii Jungh. et de Vriese with P. merkusiana Cooling and Gaussen); Forest Research Institute, Canberra, Australia (Eucalyptus species seed on request and, jointly with C.F.I., Oxford, an international provenance trial of P. kesiya from the Philippines). Although there are problems in the planning, conduct and assessment of such international projects, they are outweighed by the advantages to the individual recipient countries. In some cases the greatest single advantage is the provision of material that would otherwise be unheard of or at least unobtainable through normal channels. These international programmes are very new and so far they have dealt mainly with the collection and distribution of seed from various provenances of a limited number of species, usually with recommendations for experimental design and early assessment. There is a great need to standardise the types of characteristics to be assessed (including wood properties), the frequency of assessment, the techniques of measurement (including precision), and the methods of analysis and presentation. This standardisation will facilitate comparisons between sites and countries; it will increase the precision of such comparisons and of predictions of performance on untested sites. Centralised projects should be active in the accumulation and dissemination of information. Attention is drawn to relevant activities of I.U.F.R.O. and F.A.O. Centrally planned and co-ordinated projects may play an important role also in intra-population improvement through selective breeding. Selection criteria and indices may be standardised, at least for each species in each major recipient region. Central breeding pools will be desirable, with production seed orchards and planned international progeny tests. For some widely used species this type of activity could attain the status of global projects that have proved successful with some agricultural crops.
42608856|Chataldag is the name of a mountain which stands between Bursa and Balikesir in Turkey. The altitude of the mountain peak is 1336 metres. The fir species, distributed on Chataldag, has been called Abies equi-trojani Ashers et Sinten by Gokmen (1970) and Arbez (1969). Contrary to Gokmen and Arbez, Ata (1975) has claimed that this fir is not Abies equi-trojani, but he did not give a name. Mixed and pure stands of Chataldag fir are seen between 800 m and 1300 m elevation. The area of mixed stands is larger than those of pure stands. The distribution area is about 1000 hectares on Chataldag. External morphological features of Chataldag fir are very similar to Abies bornmulleriana Mattfeld and Abies equi-trojani but the features of pollen and wood anatomy are different. These differences show that this fir taxon, distributed on Chataldag, is not Abies equi-trojani, but a new fir taxon in Turkey, and it is named Abies X olcayana Ata & Merev. It is a natural hybrid developed during geological time, and grows faster than Abies nordmanniana Spach, Abies bornmulleriana and Abies cilicica Carr. Chataldag est le nom d'une montagne qui se trouve entre Bursa et Balikesir en Turquie. L'lvation de la montagne est 1336 mtres. Gokmen (1970) et Arbez (1969) ont dnomm Abies equi-trojani Ashers et Sinten l'essence sapinire rpartie sur Chataldag. Contrairement  Gokmen et Arbez, Ata (1975) a prtendu que ce sapin n'est pas Abies equi-trojani, mais il ne l'a pas donn un nom. Des peuplements mixtes et homognes de sapin de Chataldag se trouvent entre 800 m et 1300 m d'altitude. La superficie de peuplements mixtes est plus grande que celle de peuplements homognes. L'aire de rpartition est d'environ 1000 m sur Chataldag. Les caractres morphologiques externes du sapin de Chataldag sont trs semblables d'Abies bornmulleriana Mattfeld et Abies equi-trojani mais les caractres du pollen et de l'anatomie du bois en diffrent. Ces diffrences montrent que ce taxon sapinier, rparti sur Chataldag, n'est pas Abies equi-trojani mais plutt un nouveau taxon sapinier en Turquie, et il est dnomm Abies X olcayana Ata & Merev. Il est un hybride naturel qui a volu pendant l're gologique, et son taux d'accroissement dpasse ceux d'Abies nordmanniana Spach, Abies bornmulleriana et Abies cilicica Carr. Chataldag es el nombre de una montaa que se localiza entre Bursa y Balikesir, en Turqua. La elevacin de este pico es de 1336 msnm. La especie de abeto que ocurre en esta montaa fue clasificada como Abies equi-trojani Ashers et Sinten por Gokmen (1970) y Arbez (1969). En contraposicin a lo sealado por Gokmen y Arbez, Ata (1975) reporta que este abeto no es Abies equi-trojani, sin embargo, no le di otra clasificacin. Rodales mixtos y puros del abeto de Chataldag ocurren entre los 800 y 1300 m. de elevacin. El rea de rodales mixtos es mayor que aquella de rodales puros. El rea de distribucin en Chataldag es de aproximadamente 1000 hectreas. Las caractersticas morfolgicas externas del abeto de Chataldag son muy similares a las de Abies bornmulleriana Mattfeld y Abies equi-trojani, sin embargo, las caractersticas anatmicas del polen y de la madera son diferentes. Estas diferencias muestran que este taxon de abeto que ocurre en Chataldag no es Abies equi-trojani, sino un nuevo taxon de abeto en Turqua, el cul se clasifica como Abies  okayana Ata y Merev. Este corresponde a un hbrido natural desarrollado durante el perodo geolgico, el cul crece ms rpido que Abies nordmanniana Spach, Abies bornmulleriana y Abies cilicica Carr. Cataldag Bursa ile Balikesir arasinda 1336 m yuksekligi olan dagdir. Bu dagda yayilmis olan goknara Gokmen (1970) ve Arbez (1969) Abies equi-trojani demisler ancak Ata (1975) bu goknarin Abies equi-trojani olmadigini belirtmis fakat bir isim vermemistir. Cataldag goknarinin saf ve karisik mescereleri 800-1300 m rakimlar arasindadir. Karisik mescerelerin alani saf mescerelerden fazladir. Bu goknarin yayilis alani yaklasik 1000 ha dir. Cataldag goknarinin dis morfolojik ozellikleri Abies bornmulleriana ve Abies equi-trojani' ye cok benzemektedir, fakat polen ve odun anatomisi ozellikleri cok farklidir. Bu farklar Cataldagda yayilmis olan goknarin Abies equi-trojani olmadigini, Turkiyede yeni bir taxon oldugunu gostermistir. Polen ozellikleri bu taxonun jeolojik zaman boyunca olusmus bir melez oldugunu gostermektedir. Melez gucu nedeniyle Abies nordmanniana, Abies bornmulleriana ve Abies cilicica'dan daha hizli buyumektedir. Bu goknara Abies x olcayana Ata ve Merevadi verilmistir.
42605183|An instrument was developed to measure the sinuosity of tree stems. This measured the maximum deviation of crook and angles of lean after crook formation. Trial experiments on seven-year-old Pinus kesiya Royle ex Gordon provenances showed within-operator differences to be negligible, and compared well with visual assessment. Three instruments having sectional rods 4, 5 and 7 ft (1.22, 1.52 and 2.13 m respectively) in length were used by four teams (comprised of an operator and a recorder) to test the efficiency of instruments and between-team differences. Analysis showed operator differences to be significant in the case of one instrument and were mainly due to the inexperienced operators. A larger instrument detected sinuosity in apparently straight trees and showed higher values in maximum deviation than the other two. Within-and between-recorder differences were significant in visual assessment of number of bends. Maximum deviation, angles, and number of bends were not related to each other and any of these traits could not be dispensed. It is recommended that a combination of both objective and subjective assessment methods should be employed for good results.
42606639|A technique is described for "in vitro" culture of explants of Eucalyptus grandis mature trees. It is based on epicormic shoots induced on branches 3 cm diameter and 70 cm long in a greenhouse. The paper also describes a method to disinfect explants and to initiate "in vitro" culture using epicormic nodal segments and apical shoot tips. On dcrit une technique pour la culture 'in vitro' d'explants d'arbres adultes d'Eucalyptus grandis. Elle est base sur des gourmands produits sur des rameaux de 3 cm de diamtre et de 70 cm de long dans une serre. L'article dcrit aussi une mthode pour dsinfecter les explants et pour initier la culture 'in vitro' a partir de segments nodaux de gourmands et de bouts de pousses aplcaux. Se describe una tcnica para el cultvo in vitro a gran escala de plntulas, apartir de material vegetativo de rboles adultos de Eucalyptus grandis. Esta tcnica se basa en la induccin en invernadero de brotes epicrmicos en ramas de 3 cm de dimetro y 70 cm de longitud. Se describe tambin un mtodo para la desinfeccin del material vegetativo y la iniciacin del cultivo in vitro usando segmentos nodales epicrmicos y puntas de brotes apicales.
42606599|Gmelina arborea cuttings have been successfully used for establishing large scale commercial plantation in Sabah, Malaysia. The ability to produce large quantities of planting materials from cuttings not only solves the seed procurement problem, but has also resulted in significant improvement in plantation uniformity and stem quality. The techniques described in this paper could probably be applied to other easy to root species being considered for afforestation programmes. On a utilis des boutures de Gmelina arborea avec succs pour l'tablissement de plantations commerciales  grande chelle en Sabah, Malaysia. La capacit de produire une grande quantit de matriel de reproduction  partir de boutures rsoud non seulement le problme de l'acquisition de graines, mais a aussi abouti  une amlioration significative dans l'uniformit des plantations et la qualit des tiges. La mthodologie dcrite dans cette communication pourrait probablement tre applique aux autres essences faciles  enraciner pour beaucoup de programmes de reboisement  grande chelle. En Sabah, Malasia, se ha venido utilizando con xito estacas de Gmelina arborea para el establecimiento de plantaciones a escala comercial. La facilidad que presenta esta especie para reproducir material de plantacin a travs de estacas, resuelve no solo el problema de abastecimiento de semillas, sino que tambin promueve una mejora significativa en la uniformidad y calidad de los fustes. La metodologa descrita en este artculo puede probablemente ser aplicada en programas de re forestacin a gran escala, con otras especies que presenten facilidad de enraizamiento.
42603895|Pterocarpus angolensis naturally grows widely scattered in miombo woodland, and the high cost of harvesting makes it desirable to concentrate the species in plantations. As part of the search for the best sites, the correlation of rainfall distribution with diameter-growth has been studied. It is shown that Pterocarpus angolensis grows (a) fastest where there are the greatest number of months with 30-100 m. m. of rain during the early part of the growing period, (b) slowest where there are the greatest number of months with <30 m.m., and (c) fastest where the growing season (flush to fall) is longest. It is concluded that the most promising areas will be those where there are two or three months in the early part of the growing season, having a rainfall of 30-100 m.m., and not more than four or five dry months preceding the growing period.
43737862|Of the many aspects of coupling between atmosphere and forest ecosystems, the ecological aspects of wind is, perhaps, least known. The concerns of the greenhouse effect have concentrated primarily on changes in global temperature and precipitation; its effects on forests and vice versa. Within the context of climatic change, however, little attention has been given to the ecological consequences of changes in surface wind patterns. The paper focuses on some of the impacts of wind on northern forests under past, present and future changing climate. De los muchos aspectos relacionados entre atmsfera y ecosistemas forestales, la parte ecolgica del viento es, quiz, el menos conocido. Las preocupaciones del efecto invernadero se han concentrado primordialmente en los cambios globales de temperatura y precipitatin; asi como sus efectos en bosques y vice versa. Sin embargo, en el contexto del cambio climatlogico, se ha dado poca atencin a las consecuencias ecolgicas de los cambios en patrones de vientos. El articulo centra su atencin en algunos de los impactos del viento en los bosques del norte (septentrionales), tanto en el pasado, presente como futuro de los cambios climatolgicos.
42606638|A review of the research on application of isozyme analysis to genetic breeding of forest trees in China since 1978 is compiled in this report. The following applications are discussed: Identification of clones and cultivated varieties; Identification of hybrids and early prediction of hybrid vigour; Sex differentiation of forest trees; Mating patterns in forest trees; Genetic analysis of progenies of controlled hybrid or self-bred; Tree phylogenetic relationships; Genetic variation in tree populations and Disease resistance. The author also gives the prospects and limitations of isozyme techniques as applied to breeding of forest trees. Une revue de la recherche sur l'application de l'analyse d'isozymes  l'amlioration gntique des arbres forestiers en Chine depuis 1978 est compile dans ce compte rendu. Les applications suivantes sont discutes: Identification de clones et de cultivars; Identification d'hybrides et prdiction prcoce de vigueur hybride; Diffrenciation sexuelle des arbres forestiers; Systmes d'accouplement des arbres forestiers; Analyse gntique de descendants d'hybrides contrls ou de pollinisation directe; Relations phylogntique des arbres; Variabilit gntique de populations d'arbres et Rsistance aux maladies. L'auteur donne aussi les perspectives et limitations des techniques isozymes dans l'amlioration gntique des arbres forestiers. Se compila una revisin sobre el estado de la investigacin en la aplicacin de anlisis de isoenzimas en el mejoramiento gentico forestal en China desde 1978. Se discuten las siguientes aplicaciones: Identificacin de clones y de variedades cultivadas; Identificacin de hbridos y prediccin temprana de vigor hbrido; Diferenciacin de sexos en rboles; Patrones de cruzamiento en especies forestales; Anlisis gentico de progenies de hbridos o autocruzamientos controlados; Relaciones filogenticas en rboles; Variacin gentica en poblaciones forestales y Resistencia a enfermedades. El autor tambin analiza el prospecto y limitaciones de las tcnicas de isoenzimas aplicadas al mejoramiento gentico forestal.
42603658|A preliminary pathological examination of Caribbean pine (Pinus caribaea Morelet) in low-lying coastal savannahs and in the upland pine area of British Honduras has revealed no evidence of root rot caused by Fomes annosus or Armillaria mellea, although several other noteworthy disease-producing organisms are recorded for the first time on this host. These include: dwarf mistletoe [Arceuthobium globosum]; a true mistletoe belonging to the genus Psittacanthus of the family Loranthaceae; cone rust caused by Cronartium conigenum; and 10 species of wood-destroying fungi causing decay in living trees and slash.The pathological significance of these observations and some aspects of control are discussed.
42608324|Three plantations, each with four indigenous tree species, were established in the humid lowlands of Costa Rica to compare growth, pest damage and economics in pure and mixed stands, with the objective of developing suitable plantation models for small farms. In measurements taken at 2-4 years of age, DBH was larger in mixed than in pure plots of the fastest growing species of each combination. Pest damage was less severe in mixed than in pure stands for three of the twelve species tested, and there was no damage or no difference between pure and mixed conditions for the other species. Establishment costs were lower for the slower growing species in mixture than alone. In comparison with pure stands of the fastest growing species, mixtures had relatively high yields, with the additional advantage of including other species of high economic value. Trois plantations comprenant chacune 4 espces d'arbres indignes ont t tablies dans les terres basses humides du Costa Rica pour comparer la croissance, les dgts de la peste et l'conomie des peuplements purs et mixtes, dans l'objectif de dvelopper des modles de plantation appropris pour les petites fermes. Dans les mesures prises  2-4 ans d'ge, le DBH tait plus grand dans les lots mixtes que dans les lots purs des espces aux croissances les plus rapides de chaque combinaison. Le dgt de la peste tait moins svre dans les peuplements mixtes que dans les purs pour trois des douz espces testes, et il n'y avait pas de dgts ou pas de diffrence entre les conditions pures ou mixtes pour les autres espces. Pour les espces  croissance plus lente les cots d'tablissement taient moins importants dans les mixtures que dans les plantations uniques. Compares aux peuplements purs des espces aux croissances les plus rapides, les mixtures avaient relativement plus de rcolte, tout en offrant l'avantage ajout d'inclure d'autres espces  haute valeur conomique. Se establecieron tres plantaciones, cada una con cuatro especies arbreas indgenas, en las tierras bajas hmedas de Costa Rica para comparar crecimiento, dao por plagas y economa de nodales puros y mezclados, con el objetivo de desarrollar modelos apropiados de plantaciones para granjas pequeas. En mediciones realizadas a los 2-4 aos de edad, DBH fue mayor en parcelas mezcladas que en parcelas puras para las especies de crecimiento ms rpido de cada combinacin. El dao de plagas fue menos severo en nodales mezclados que en nodales puros para tres de las doce especies probadas, y no hubo ningn dao o ninguna diferencia entre condiciones puras y mezcladas de las otras especies. Los costos de establecimiento para las especies de crecimiento ms lento fueron ms bajos en mezclas que cuando se establecieron como nicas especies. En comparacin con nodales puros de las especies de crecimiento ms rpido, las mezclas tuvieron relativamente producciones ms altas, con la ventaja adicional de incluir otra especie de alto valor econmico.
42608449|The assumption is often made by social forestry planners that farmers are only interested in short-rotation forestry. However the recent history with teak (Tectona grandis) in North Thailand shows that farmers are showing increased interest in planting teak on private lands as a cash crop, or the planting of a few trees in "niches" on smallholdings as a contingency or "bank account". Farmers can propagate their own seedlings, and often obtain higher growth rates than in forestry plantions due to better sites, and better maintenance. The main constraint to further private development of teak is farmer uncertainty over forestry regulations concerning the cutting and transportation of teak. Les planificateurs des forts collectives prsument souvent que les agriculteurs ne s'intressent qu' la sylviculture  courte rotation. Pourtant, les expriences rcentes avec teck (Tectona grandis) dans le nord de la Thalande montrent que les agriculteurs s'intressent de plus en plus  la plantation de teck sur des terres prives comme culture de rapport ou la plantation de quelques arbres dans des 'niches' sur des petites fermes comme 'caisse de prvoyance'. Les agriculteurs peuvent propager leurs propres semis, et ils obtiennent souvent des meilleurs taux de croissance que dans les plantations forestires  cause de meilleures stations et meilleur entretien. La contrainte principale  l'extension du dveloppement priv de teck est l'incertitude des agriculteurs en ce qui concerne les rglements forestiers sur l'abattage et le transport de teck. Los planificadores en el campo social de la silvicultura, generalmente asumen que los agricultores se interesan nicamente en la silvicultura de rotaciones cortas; sin embargo, la historia reciente con teca (Tectona grandis) en el norte de Tailandia, muestra como los agricultores se estn interesando cada vez ms en plantar teca en tierras privadas como una fuente de ingresos, o en plantar algunos pocos rboles en minifundios como contingencia o "cuenta bancaria". Los agricultores pueden propagar sus propias plantas y generalmente obtienen tasas de crecimiento ms altas que en plantaciones forestales, debido a mejores condiciones del sitio y mejor mantenimiento. La principal limitante para un mayor desarrollo privado de la teca, es la inseguridad del agricultor acerca de las leyes forestales que conciernen el corte y transporte de teca.
42603296|Published material on pruning for the improvement of timber quality is deficient in records of assessment of results by test on the grading table. This article is intended as a small contribution towards making good this deficiency. It describes four trials in New Zealand of the conversion of logs from pruned trees of Pinus radiata. The first three are referred to only briefly. The fourth describes the sawing and veneer peeling of 15 radiata pine trees, planted in 1928, pruned from 1935 to 1947 to a height of 45 feet, with largest pruned whorl diameters averaging 8.4 inches in the first 18 feet and something between 8.6 inches and 9.1 inches in the second 18 feet, and felled in 1963 at a mean d.b.h.o.b. of 24 inches and a mean height of 112 feet. To provide a basis for assessing improvement attributable to pruning, a further sample of trees, unpruned but otherwise similar, was also sawn. The comparison showed a higher yield from the average pruned tree of 198 board feet in Clear (28 per cent of total sawn outturn), 16 board feet in Clear-one-face (2 per cent), 44 board feet in Finishing and Dressing grades (6 per cent), and 22 board feet in Merchantable grade (3 per cent). The yield in Factory grade (equal in value to Dressing) was lower by 68 board feet (10 per cent), and the yield in the unwanted "Box" was lower by 212 board feet (31 per cent). The profitability of the pruning is touched on, and it is concluded that with radiata pine grown at similar rates to the sample tested (rates normal enough for the main producing areas of the North Island), and provided that bark damage to the lower trunk in thinnings is avoided and that the increase in value of the sawn product is passed on to the grower, the pruning of the first 18 feet log length is clearly profitable. The pruning of the second log is likely to be profitable in most cases, again provided that the value of the improvement is passed on to the grower.
42610029|The Canadian Forest Service established the Model Forest Program in 1991 as an experiment on the national scale to provide the opportunity for broad participation in the investigation of just how to incorporate the theory of sustainable development into practice. The term 'Model Forest' describes a partnership of interested individuals representing many different forest values, including timber production, who agree to work collaboratively in pursuit of their common goal of defining approaches to SFM. The partnership includes representatives from all organisations responsible for land-use decisions on the Model Forest area, however, the Model Forest partnership has no direct authority over the landbase nor are the partners bound to any Model Forest decision. Le Service canadien des forts a tabli le program de la fort modle canadien en 1991 comme un expriment d'envergure nationale pour fournir la possibilit d'investiguer la question: Comment transformer la thorie du dveloppement durable en pratique? Le terme '91 model Forest' dcrit une association de personnes intresses rprsentant beaucoup de valeurs forestires diffrentes, y compris la production de bois, qui se sont mises d'accord de collaborer pour dfinir les mthodes d'aborder la gestion de fort durable. L'association inclue les reprsentants de toutes les organisations responsables pour les dcisions concernant la rgion de la fort modle. Mais l'association de la fort modle n'a pas d'authorit sur le fonds de terre, et les partenaires ne sont pas soumis  aucune dcision de la fort modle. El Servicio Forestal Canadiense estableci el Programa Bosque Modelo en 1991 como un experimento a escala nacional para proveer la oportunidad para una participacin amplia en la investigacin de como incorporar la teora del desarrollo sostenible en la prctica. El trmino 'Bosque Modelo' describe una asociacin de personas interesadas que representan diversos valores del bosque, incluyendo la produccin de madera, quienes estn de acuerdo con trabajar en colaboracin en la persecucin de su objetivo comn de definir enfoques al SFM. La asociacin incluye representantes de todas las organizaciones responsables de decisiones sobre el uso de la tierra en el rea del Bosque Modelo, sin embargo, la asociacin de Bosque Modelo no tiene autoridad directa sobre la tierra ni sus socios estn ligados a cualquier decisin del Bosque Modelo.
42607604|The effect of early severe pruning of fast growing tropical pines in increasing wood density of the juvenile core is discussed. It is contended that a significant increase in central core wood density in the bottom log of the tree can be obtained with negligible loss of volume growth provided pruning is severe, and done very early (starting when trees are 3.5 metres high), and competition from unpruned trees is avoided. It is suggested that the topping of unpruned trees at about two metres height should be tried to eliminate competition from them but at the same time to suppress grass growth. Trials of pruning in this way on the best sites should yield information on the effectiveness of the treatment within five to seven years. L'article tudie les effets d'un lagage svre et prcoce sur la densit du bois juvnile dans les pines tropicaux  croissance rapide. Il semble qu'une augmentation significative de la densit du bois situ dans la partie centrale de la grume infrieure est possible sans porte importante dans l'accroissement en volume  condition qui l'lagage soit svre et en'il intervienne trs tt ( partir du moment o les arbres atteignent 3m 50 de hauteur), et en vitant la concurrence des sujets non lagus. L'auteur propose que ceux-ci soient dcapits  deux mtres du sol afin d'liminer la concurrence tout en continuant de supprimer la vgtation herboise. Des essais organiss de cette faon pourraient fournir des renseignements sur l'efficacit de ce traitement dans cine  sept ans sur les meilleurs terrains. El efecto de una poda precoz y severa de los Pinos tropicales de rpido crecimiento en aumentar la densidad de la madera del corazn juvenil est discutido. Se contiende que se puede obtener un incremento significante de la densidad de la madera del corazn central en la troza inferior del rbol junto con una prdida insignificante de volumen, dados que la poda es severa y est realizada muy temprano (empezndose quando los rboles tienen 3.5 metros de altura) y se evita la competencia de los rboles no podados.
