Une attaque directe contre la pauvret rurale par une rvolution tendue, verte ou rouge, est peu probable, et elle aurait des effets et bons et mauvais, comme autrefois. On pourrait plus faisablement essayer  amliorer la vie do peuple rural dfavoris par un changement d'un autre genre: par des rvolutions personnelles dan les perceptions, les valeurs et les choix des professionnels intresss  la technologie de recherche et la mise  excution de dveloppement rural. Un ataque directo a la pobreza campesina atravs de una extensa revolucin de cualquier color, mo es probable y tendra como en el pasado efectos diversos. Una mejoria en la vida de los campesinos podria ser ms factible con la busqueda de un diferente tipo de cambio: Atravs de revoluciones personales silenciosas al captar, valorar y elegir los profesionales que estn relacionados con la investigacin tecnolgica y la accin para el desarrollo del campo.
42606875|This paper summarizes two experiments which examine the effect of weed competition on early growth of Pinus caribaea var. hondurensis. One examined competition from naturally occurring weeds which regenerate after native eucalypt forest is converted to plantation. The other used planted grasses to simulate the competition from introduced pasture grasses which is experienced when pasture areas are used for afforestation. Results indicate that grass control beyond the baseline provided in current management practices increased early (six year) volume growth by as much as 30 per cent. Care is required with repeated glyphosate applications which may lead to stem deformities known as 'speed wobbles'. Cet article rsume deux expriences qui tudient l'effet de la concurrence des mauvaises herbes sur la croissance initiale de Pinus caribaea var. hondurensis. L'une a tudi la concurrence des mauvaises herbes indignes qui se rgnrent lorsque la fort indigne d'eucalyptus a t transforme en plantation. L'autre a utilis des gramines plantes pour simuler la concurrence des gramines de pturage introduites, concurrence qui se produit lorsque des pturages sont boiss. Les rsultats suggrent que la lutte contre les herbes au-del de la bordure prescrite par les pratiques d'amnagement actuelles a augment la croTssance en volume initiale (jusqu' six ans) par jusqu' 30 pour cent. Il faut se mfier des applications rptes de glyphosate, qui peuvent provoquer des dformations de la tige que l'on appelle 'oscillations de vitesse'. Este documento resume dos experimentos que examinan el efecto de la competencia con mala hierba sobre el desarrollo temprano de Pinus caribaea variadad hondurensis. El primer experimento examina la competencia natural de la mala hierba indgena que existe y que regenera cuando un bosque de eucalipto est convertido en una plantacin. El otro experimento us hierba cultivada para simular la compentencia con el pasto que est experimentado cuando los reas del pasto estn usados para la repoblacin forestal. Los resultados indiquen que el control del pasto ms all de la lnea de base lo cual es normal en las prcticas administrativas actuales aumenta el volumen del crecimiento temprano por un treinta porciento (30%). Las aplicaciones repitadas de glifosfato requieren cierto ciudado porque pueden causar deformacines del fuste que se llaman 'speed wobbles'.
42606312|The issue of tropical deforestation has received considerable publicity in recent forestry literature and in the international press, e. g. Myers, (1) U.S. 2000 Global Task Force. (2), National Geographic (3), etc., but little mention has been made of the extent to which reforestation might be able to compensate for such deforestation. This paper highlights past reforestation achievements and examines some of the main constraints. Twenty developing country reforestation 'success stories' are analysed and the reasons for their success briefly summarized. Ten of these relate to farm forestry in situations where fuelwood, fodder, building poles and other forest products are being grown for indigenous consumption; the other ten are examples of industrial plantation forestry. The intention of the analysis is not to engender a spirit of complacency about the negative ecological and human impact of deforestation, which remain a matter of considerable concern to many developing country governments, but rather to restore a sense of balance to the tropical deforestation dialogue; to focus on reforestation problems which still have to be overcome and to examine the level of resource commitment needed to help developing countries to move more rapidly towards a goal of self-sufficiency in forest product needs.
43737692|Most species of forest trees grown as wood-producing crops in plantations, in particular the eucalypts, are at an early stage of domestication: they are not much different from their wild ancestors still growing in natural forests. This is quite unlike the situation in the major food and fibre crop plants. Forest tree breeders have a unique opportunity to control and document the genetic history of domestication and to plan for the conservation of an adequately broad genetic base for future selection. Conservation would be relatively easy if large tracts of natural forest representing the full range of variation of each species could be conserved, in situ. Ex situ conservation in special plantations becomes necessary as natural forests are eliminated. For six of the major plantation eucalypts Eucalyptus camaldulensis, E. deglupta, E. globulus, E. grandis, E. regnans, E. tereticornis, and for Acacia mangium, and Pinus radiata, examples are provided of (a) known or likely origins of the first large plantations; (b) present knowledge of genetic variation between populations; (c) conservation status of remaining natural forests; (d) current action for conservation in situ and ex situ. The genetic base of the first plantations of all these species was too narrow, and has been greatly expanded with recent seed collections in the better provenances of the remaining natural forests. Conservation of their genetic resources will permit continued infusions of new material which will be needed in future. La plupart des essences d'arbres forestiers cultives en plantation pour la production de bois, en particulier des eucalyptus, sont  un premier stade de domestication: elles ne sont pas trs diffrentes de leurs anctres sauvages qui poussent toujours dans les forts naturelles. Ceci est tout  fait diffrent de la situation des plantes principales pour la production de la nourriture et de fibres. Les chercheurs travaillant dans l'amlioration gntique des arbres forestiers ont une occasion unique de diriger et documenter l'histoire gntique de la domestication et de dresser le plan de la consrvation d'une base gntique suffisamment large pour la slection dans l'avenir. La consrvation serait relativement facile si on pouvait conserver in situ de grandes tendues de fort naturelle reprsentant la gamme complte de la variation de chaque essence. La consrvation ex situ dans des plantations spciaux devient ncessaire  mesure que les forts naturelles sont limines. Pour six des eucalyptus majeurs de plantations, Eucalyptus camaldulensis, E. deglupta, E. globulus, E. grandis, E. regnans et E. tereticornis, et pour Acacia mangium et Pinus radiata, des exemples sont donns (a) des origines connues ou probables des premires grandes plantations; (b) des connaissances actuelles de la variation gntique entre populations; (c) de l'tat de consrvation des forts naturelles restantes; (d) des mesures courantes pour la consrvation in situ et ex situ. La base gntique des premires plantations de toutes ces essences tait trop troite, et a t beaucoup largie avec des rcoltes rcentes de graines dans les meilleures provenances des forts naturelles restantes. La consrvation de leurs ressources gntiques permettra des infusions soutenues de matire nouvelle dont on aura besoin dans l'avenir. La mayora de las especies forestales que se cultivan para la productin de madera, particularmente los eucaliptos, estn en un estado inicial de domesticatin: estas no son muy diferentes de sus ancestros silvestres que todavia crecen en los bosques naturales. Esta situatin es muy diferente a lo que ocurre con los principales cultivos agrcolas alimenticios y fibrosos. Los mejoristas forestales tienen una oportunidad nica para controlar y documentar la historia gentica de la domesticacin nica para controlar y documentar la historia gentica de la domesticacin y para planificar la conservacin de una suficientemente amplia base gentica para futuras selecciones. La conservacin sera relativamente fcil si se conserva in situ areas grandes de bosques naturales que representen el mbito de variacin completo de cada una de las especies. La conservacin ex situ, en especial las plantaciones, se hacen necesaris conforme los bosques naturales son eliminados. Se presentan ejemplos para seis de las principales especies de eucaliptos usados en plantaciones tales como Eucalyptus camaldulensis, E. deglupta, E. globulus, E. grandis, E. regnans y E. tereticornis, y para Acacia mangium y Pinus radiata sobre: (a) origen conocido o probable de las primeras plantaciones a gran escala; (b) conocimiento actual de la variacin gentica entre poblaciones; (c) estado de conservacin de los rodales naturales remanentes y (d) acciones actuales para la conservacin in situ y ex situ. La base gentica de todas las primeras plantaciones con estas especies era muy reducida, pero ha sido ampliada en gran medida con recolecciones de semilla recientes de las mejores procedencias de los rodales naturales remanentes. La conservacin de sus recursos genticos permitir una contnua inclusin de material nuevo el cual ser necesario en el futuro.
42603252|Softwoods have been planted in Western Uganda since 1947. In the early years spacing was close and inaccurate; thinning was light. This resulted in dense unstable stands. Later thinning prescriptions resulted in patchy crops. The latest methods of lining out, stock checking and selection for thinning are described in this paper. They produce a more even crop of known density, and, it is hoped, will result in more regular stands of faster growing, more stable trees.
42608087|Seventy longterm productivity plots were remeasured to continue research begun in 1968 and last undertaken in 1977 (Evans, 1978a). Previous work used matched pairs of plots and stem analysis to compare growth between rotations. The present survey assessed plots relocated on exactly the same sites, at the same age and with the same procedures as in the previous rotation. At six years of age most third rotation Piniis patula is growing significantly better than had the second rotation. The exception where the third rotation has declined is, as in the earlier studies, a part of block A with soils low in phosphate. Change to P. taeda for some third rotation plantings has not significantly improved productivity so far. Productivity of second rotation P. patula at 12 years, assessed on exactly the same sites as the previous crop, is not significantly different. Similarly second rotation P. elliottii appears at least as productive as the first. These results are encouraging since six of the last eight years have been drier than average. Generally better growth of the third rotation may be due to using improved seed since 1979. Apart from the small area P deficient soils, there is no evidence of decline in productivity with successive rotations. On a remesur soixante-dix parcelles de productivit  long terme pour continuer les recherches commencs en 1968 et entreprises pour la dernire fois en 1977 (Evans, 1978). En ce qui concerne les travaux prcdents, on s'est servi de paires assorties de parcelles et d'analyse des trones pour comparer l'accroissement entre les rvolutions. Quant  l'tude ectuelle, on a estim de parcelles situes de nouveau prcisment aux mmes marches  suivre que dans la rvolution prcdente. A l'ge de six ans la plupart de la troisime rvolution de Pinus patula est en train de pousser sensiblement mieux que l'avait fait la deuxime rvolution. L'exception o la troisime rvolution a diminu se trouve, comme dans les tudes plus rapproches, dans la partie de la parcelle A o les sols sont faibles en phosphate. Un changement  P. taeda pour certaines plantations de la troisime rvolution n'a pas sensiblement amlior l'accroissement jusqu'ici. La productivit de la deuxime rvolution P. patula, value  l'ge de douze ans dans prcisment les mmes emplacements que la rcolte prcdente n'est pas sensiblement diffrente. Pareillement, la deuxime rvolution de P. elliottii semble tre au moins aussi productive que la premire. Les rsultats sont encourageants puisqu'il a fait plus sec qu'en moyenne pendant six parmi les huit ans qui riennent de s'couler. On peut attribuer l'accroissement qui est en gnral mieux dans la troisime rvolution  l'emploi depuis 1979 d'une smence amliore. A part la petite superficie de sols dpouills de phosphate, il n'y aucune preuve d'un dclin de la productivit en ce qui concerne les rvolutions successives. Setenta parcelas de productividad fueron remedidas para seguir las investigaciones empezadas en 1968, y emprendidas la ltima vez en 1977 (Evans, 1978). Bon respecto a los trabajos anteriores, se sirvieron de pares iguales de parcelas y del estudio de los troncos para comparar el crecimiento entre los turnos. El presente estudio evalu parcelas rueltas a situar en exactamente las mismas estaciones, a la misma edad y con los mismos procedimientos que en el turno anterior. A la edad de seis aos la mayora del tercer turno de Pinus patula est creciendo mejor de modo significativo que lo habia hecho el segundo tercero. La excepcin en que el tercer turno ha disminuido es, como en los estudios ms tempranos, en la parte de la parcela A en que los suelos sonescasos de fsforo. Un cambio a P. taeda for ciertas plantaciones del tercer turno no ha mejoradoel crecimiento de modo significativo hasta ahora. La productividad del segundo turno P. patula, evaluada a la edad de doce aos en exactamente las mismas estaciones que el cultivo anterior no es distinta de moda significativa. Del mismo modo el segundo turno P. elliottii parece ser, por lo menos, tan productivo como el primero. Estos resultados son alentadores porque ha hecho ms seco durante seis entre los oito ltimos aos que en promedio. Es posible que el crecimiento de tercer turno  que es, por lo general, mejor  sea atribuido al uso desde 1979 de uno semilla mejorada. Aparte de la pequea superficie de los suelos deficientes de fsforo no hay prueba de una disminucin de la productividad en cuanto a los turnos seguidos.
42616711|A strategy for the integration of modelling and experimental work in agroforestry research is presented. The approach, in which modelling is perceived as a central feature determining and coordinating process-based experimental studies, aims to achieve a functional understanding of how agroforestry systems work. The underlying context concerns the effects of placing a variable number of trees into cultivated fields, and the mechanisms involved in the resultant interactions between tree and crop species. Four elements to the strategy are described; the modelling approach, the priority research areas, a knowledge base, and necessary organizational structures. Une stratgie pour l'intgration de la modlisation et des travaux d'exprimentation dans le domaine de la recherche en agroforesterie est prsent. Dans ce cadre, la modlisation est perue comme un lment-cl qui permet de dterminer et coordonner ce type d'tude exprimentale de processus. Par cette approche, on essaye d'acqurir une parfaite comprhension des systmes agroforestiers et de leur fonctionnement. Les effets causs par l'introduction d'un nombre variable d'arbres au sein des cultures et les mcanismes impliqus dans les interactions entre arbres et cultures constituent les questions de base. Quatre lments sont dcrits pour cette stratgie: l'approche de modlisation, les domaines de recherche prioritaires, les prrequis et les structures organisationnelles ncessaires. Se presenta una estrategia para la integracin de modelos y trabajo experimental en la investigacin agroforestal. El enfoque, en el cual el modelo es percibido como una caracterstica central determinante y que coordina los estudios experimentales basados en el proceso, pretende alcanzar un entendimiento funcional de cmo trabaja el sistema agroforestal. El contexto fundamental concierne con los efectos de colocar un nmero variable de rboles dentro de campos cultivados y con los mecanismos envueltos en las interacciones resultantes entre rbol y especies del cultivo. Se describen cuatro elementos de la estrategia; el enfoque del modelo, las reas prioritarias de investigacin, el conocimiento bsico y las estructuras organizacionales necesarias.
42608325|There is a growing interest in developing plantations of native rainforest species in many parts of the tropics, and mixed species management systems are being proposed as being more appropriate for these plantations. Results from two experiments are presented. The first aimed to compare the performance of Australian red cedar (Toona ciliata) planted in the open with cedar planted at varying lengths of time after the planting of a cover species (Southern silky oak, Grevillea robusta). The second aimed to test a variety of establishment techniques for native rainforest species on a tropical coastal lowlands site. Benefits and disadvantages of mixed species plantings are discussed in light of these results and operational experience. Il existe un intrt croissant pour dvelopper des plantations d'espces natives de la fort vierge dans nombreuses rgions des tropiques, et on propose les systmes d'organisation des espces mixtes comme tant plus appropris  ces plantations. Les rsultats des deux expriences sont prsents. La premire visait  comparer le rendement du cdre rouge Australien (Toona ciliata) plant  l'air libre avec des cdres plants en plusieurs tapes aprs la plantation d'une espce couvrante (Southern silky oak, Grevillea robusta). La seconde visait tester une varit de techniques tablies pour les espces natives de la fort vierge sur un site de terre-basse ctire tropicale. Les bnfices et les dsavantages des plantations en espces mixtes sont dbattus  la lumire de ces rsultats et de l'exprience oprationelle. Existe un inters creciente en el desarrollo de plantaciones de especies nativas de la selva lluviosa en muchas partes de los trpicos, y se estn proponiendo sistemas de manejo de especies mezcladas como los sistemas ms apropiados para estas plantaciones. Se presentan los resultados de dos experimentos. El objetivo del primer experimento era comparar el desempeo del cedro rojo Australiano (Toona ciliata) plantado en el abierto con el cedro plantado a lapsos de tiempo variables despus de la plantacin de una especie de cobertura (Roble Sureo, Grevillea robusta). El objetivo del segundo experimento era probar una variedad de tcnicas de establecimiento para especies nativas dla selva lluviosa en un sitio de tierras bajas costeras tropicales. Se discuten los beneficios y desventajas de plantaciones de especies mezcladas a la luz de estos resultados y de la experiencia operacional.
42606325|Populations of the world are now becoming concerned at the threat being made by the misuse of natural resources and pollution. Articulation of these fears is having political impact. Developed nations, such as Britain, have a responsibility to increase their self sufficiency in timber and wood products, relieving pressure on the forests of developing nations. Both the State and Private Forestry, separately and in concert, backed by co-ordinated research, can demonstrate that timber growers can sustain an ecological balance for the benefit of future generations. L'opinion mondiale s'inquite des dangers posps par l'exploitation abusive des ressources naturelles et par la pollution. L'articulation de ces craintes commence  peser sur la politique. Les pays dvelopps, comme la Grande Bretagne, ont un devoir d'accrotre leur auto-sufficance en bois et en produits drivs du bois, afin d'allenger les pressions sur les forts des pays en voie de dveioppment. Les secteurs forestiers publics et privs peuvent, chacun de son cte ainsi que collaborativement et avec l'appui d'une rechereche coordine, dmontrer que les producteurs de bois savent maintenir un quilibre colgique pour le bien des gnrations futures. Las Poblaciones del mundo estn preocupados por la amenaza del maltratamiento de los recursos naturales y de la polucin, la expresin de estos temores tiene un impacto poltico. Las naciones desarroladas, como la Gran Bretaa, tienen la responsabilidad de aumentar su autosuficiencia en madera y sus productos, as disminuyendo la presin sobre los bosques de las naciones en vas de desarrollo. Ambos el forestal privado y estatal, separados o en conjuntos, apoyados por la investigacin coordinada, pueden demostrar que los productores de madera pueden sostener un balance ecolgico a beneficio de las generaciones futuras.
42616715|Seedlings from a collection of 20 Central American dryland tree and shrub species were planted in the Comayagua valley on alluvial soil, within their native range. The species comprise Moringa oleifera, Leucaena salvadorensis, Mimosa tenuifolia, Gliricidia sepium, Guazuma ulmifolia, Parkinsonia aculeata, Albizia niopoides, Acacia deamii, Acacia farnesiana, Caesalpinia coriaria, Caesalpinia eriostachys, Albizia saman, Senna atomaria, Simarouba glauca, Prosopis juliflora, Crescentia alata, Cordia alliodora, Swietenia humilis, Enterolobium cyclocarpum and Hymenaea coubaril. Their performance and nutritional health in their native range is of interest to foresters growing them as exotics. Foliage samples were collected from the trees in a replicated, designed trial at the end of their second growing season. There were very large variations in foliar nutrient content between species (threefold for nitrogen, phosphorus and potassium; sevenfold for calcium and magnesium and sixfold for boron), which were not related simply to the relative size differences of the plants. There could be an opportunity to use specific species to raise specific soil nutrient levels by mulching or to use fodder to redress animal health problems caused by poor mineral nutrition. Four of the species tested might be poor sources of animal fodder -Simarouba glauca and Crescentia alata because of low N content and high fibre content and Caesalpinia coriaria and Caesalpinia eriostachys because of high lignin content. De jeunes plants provenant d'une collection de 20 espces arbustives et d'arbres originaires des rgions sches d'Amrique Centrale ont t plants dans la valle de la Comayagua sur des sols alluviaux, dans leur zone bioclimatique. Les espces reprsentes sont: Moringa oleifera, Leucaena salvadorensis, Mimosa tenuifolia, Gliricidia sepium, Guazuma ulmifolia, Parkinsonia aculeata, Albizia niopoides, Acacia deamii, Acacia farnesiana, Caesalpinia coriaria, Caesalpinia eriostachys, Albizia saman, Senna atomaria, Simarouba glauca, Prosopis juliflora, Crescentia alata, Cordia alliodora, Swietenia humilis, Enterolobium cyclocarpum et Hymenaea coubaril. Leur performance et leur tat nutritionnel dans leur rgion d'origine sont d'un intrt certain pour les forestiers utilisant ces essences en tant qu'espces exotiques. Des chantillons de feuillage ont t collects  la fin de leur deuxime saison de croissance selon un dispositif d'essai avec rplication. De trs importantes variations interspcifiques de concentration foliaire en lments nutritifs ont t observs (diffrence de concentration d'un rapport de trois pour l'azote, le phosphore et le potassium, d'un rapport de sept pour le calcium et le magnesium et d'un rapport de six pour le bore). Ces diffrences n'taient pas simplement corrles aux diffrences de taille entre plantes. On pourrait sur cette base trouver une opportunit, grce  la technique du paillage, d'utiliser une espce donne pour relever dans le sol le niveau d'un lment nutritif particulier, qui serait dficient. Ou bien, une espce donne pourrait tre utilise comme fourrage pour soigner du btail en mauvaise sant  cause d'une alimentation minrale carence. Quatre des espces testes pourraient constituer une source de fourrage pauvre, Simarouba glauca et Crescienta alata,  cause de leur faible concentration en azote et de leur haute teneur en fibre et, Caesalpinia coriara et Caesalpinia eriostachys,  cause de leur haute teneur en lignine. Plntulas de una coleccin de 20 rboles y especies arbustivas de la zona seca de Amrica Central fueron plantadas en el valle de Comayagua en suelos aluviales, dentro de su rango nativo. Las especies comprenden Moringa olefera, Leucaena salvadorensis, Mimosa tenuifolia, Gliricidia sepium, Guazuma ulmifolia, Parkisonia aculeata, Albizia niopoides, Acacia deamii, Acacia farnesiana, Caesalpinia coriaria, Caesalpinia eriostachys, Albizia saman, Senna atomaria, Simarouba glauca, Prosopis juliflora, Crescentia alata, Cordia alliflora, Swietenia humilis, Enterolobium ciclocarpum y Hymenaea coubaril. El comportamiento y salud nutricional de estas especies en su rango nativo es de inters para los silvicultores quienes las cultivan como exticas. Se tomaron muestras del follaje de estos rboles en duplicado de un ensayo diseado al final de su segunda estacin de crecimiento. Se encontraron variaciones muy grandes en el contenido de nutrientes foliares entre especies (variaciones de tres veces en los contenidos de nitrgeno, fsforo y potasio; siete veces en calcio y magnesio y seis veces en boro) las cuales no estaban relacionadas con las relativas diferencias de tamao de las plantas. Podra ser conveniente el uso de especies especficas para aumentar los niveles de nutrientes en suelos especficos a travs de su uso como abono verde o del uso del forraje para remediar problemas de salud animal causados por una pobre nutricin mineral. Cuatro de las especies estudiadas podran ser fuentes pobres de forraje para animales - Simarouba glauca y Crescentia alata a causa de su bajo contenido de nitrgeno y alto contenido de fibra y Caesalpinia coriaria y Caesalpinia eriostachys por su alto contenido de lignina.
42608533|The history and problems of concession management in Indonesia are outlined, showing the wider implications in other countries. The effect of short-term concessions is to encourage concessionaires to extract as much as quickly as possible, while the present system of regulatory controls is not enforceable. It is proposed that concessions should be let for a minimum 100 years; that all taxes should be replaced by an annual rental per hectare payable on the whole concession, regardless of whether it is being operated or not; and that every concessionaire should be required to deposit a performance bond to be forfeited in the event of non-performance of obligations. The operator would then have an incentive to use the land productively after harvesting, and in many situations, natural forest management would become the most attractive economic option. Cet article prsente l'histoire et les problmes de l'amnagement des concessions en Indonsie en montrant de plus larges implications possibles  d'autres pays. En fait, le principe des concessions de courte dure encourage le concessionnaire  exploiter autant de produits possible dans un minimum de temps, alors que le systme actuel de rgulations et de contrle ne peut tre appliqu efficacement. Il est propos que les concessions soient loues pour un minimum de cent ans, que toutes les taxes soient remplaces par une rente annuelle payable sur la totalit des concessions, qu'ily ait eu exploitation ou non, que chaque concessionnaire dpose une garantie non recouvrable en cas de non respect des engagements. Ces mesures inciteraient  une utilisation plus productive de la terre aprs la rcolte et dans beaucoup de cas, l'amnagement de la fort naturelle deviendrait alors l'option conomique la plus motivante. La historia y los problemas de la administracin de concesiones en Indonesia son explicados en trminos generales para demostrar las implicaciones ms amplias para otros pases. El efecto de concesiones de corto plazo es animar a los concesionarios a extraer lo ms posible lo ms rpido posible mientras el sistema actual de controles reguladores no est ejecutable. Est propuesto que las concesiones deben ser alquiladas por un mnimo de 100 aos y que todos los impuestos deben ser reemplazados por un alquiler pagadero para la concesin en su totalidad, sin tomar en cuenta si est operando o no; y que cada concesionario debe pagar un depsito como un bono de cumplimiento que se pierda en caso de incumplimiento de las obligaciones. As que el operador tendra un incentivo para usar la tierra en una manera ms productiva an despus de la cosecha y en muchos casos la administracin natural de bosques llegara a ser la opcin econmica ms atractiva.
42605250|Developing countries stand to derive immense benefits from the new science of remote sensing. By opening up new ways for the extension of knowledge about details and patterns of environmental phenomena, remote sensing techniques permit large scale resources management and research. Some of the scientific activities which may be investigated by remote sensing techniques include the mapping and inventory of biotic and abiotic components of natural and modified ecosystems, the assessment of spatial and temporal variation of selected living and non-living constituents of ecosystems, and the description of physical and biotic factors controlling biological productivity. Since the scope of the applications of remote sensing methods is very wide, being equally useful in studying forestry, agricultural, geological and hydrological problems, the time has come for an inter-disciplinary approach to the evaluation of these techniques so that the system best suited to the needs of developing nations may be procured and applied.
42603523|Some soil physical and chemical properties were measured under a secondary indigenous forest cover and a 16-year-old stand of Cupressus lusitanica. No significant differences in the physical parameters were noted; but distinct differences in some of the chemical determinations, viz. nitrogen, exchangeable bases, exchangeable hydrogen and pH, were found particularly at the top of the soil profile; however the sampling technique requires to be refined. Further detailed studies are planned.
42604414|Oven-dry weight of culms, rhizomes and roots of seedlings of Dendrocalamus longispathus has been determined at ages 3, 6, 9 and 12 months. Air-dry weight of full grown bamboo culms, of five species commonly found in forests of Bangladesh and used in paper making, has been collected up to age of 33 months. Data presented indicate that two distinct types of physiological activities are going on within the culm. One, determined by seasonal changes, is transitory, and the other, due to increasing age, is cumulative. Weight both of seedlings and full grown culms declines from wet to dry season and rhizomes of seedlings gain weight during the same period. This is reversed on the onset of monsoon and repeated year after year irrespective of age. In addition to this seasonal variation, weight of full grown culms continues to increase from year to year, which is clearly related to age. Increase in weight of culms in wet season is due to translocation of carbohydrates from crown to rhizome through it. Supply of food from the crown reduces during dry season due to leaf shedding, causing reduction of weight of culms. Decline of weight of rhizomes of seedlings comes at a time when new shoots emerge and it is obvious that all food material is used up in building new tissue. Increase of dry season weight of culms is a function of age and probably due to thickening of cell walls. This process is responsible for increasing consistence, gain in weight and strength of culms. It appears that part of carbohydrates during translocation get converted to cell wall material and deposited on existing cell walls.
42608006|In a tropical forest about which little is known, grouping standtables into botanical families shows in broad outline the forest structure and composition. It is a simple method for estimating initial commercial value and prospects, and suggesting ecological relationships. It provides a brief appraisal of the effects of harvesting and silvicultural treatment, thus helping guide procedures to be employed. An example from Malaysian Mixed Dipterocarp Forest is given, and the implications of silvicultural treatment discussed. Dans une fort tropicale peu connue, l'on apperoit les grandes lignes de la structure et de la composition en groupant les tables des peuplements par famille botanique. C'est une mthode simple qui permet d'estimer la valeur commerciale et les perspectives, tout en suggrant des effets de l'exploitation et du traitement sylvicole, et elle aide ainsi  tablir des normes. Un example est tudi, pris dans la fort malsienne  diptrocarpes, et la signification sylvicule est examine. En un bosque tropical poco conocido, la agrupacin de las tablas de existencia segn las familias botnicas permite la visualizacin en grandes rasgos de la estructura y la composicin del bosque. Es un mtodo simple para estimar inicialmente el valor comercializable de un bosque y sus perspectivas, y para indicar los vnculos ecolgicos. Adeas, proporciona una evaluacin rpida de los efectos del aprovechamiento forestal y de los tratamientos silvcolas; orientando as las tcnicas para la silvicultura y para el manejo. Se presenta un ejemplo tomado del bosque del trpico hmedo de Malasia, analizando las implicaciones del tratamiento silvcola.
42606434|A single, F hybrid family of Pinus caribaea var. hondurensis Barr. and Golf. and P. oocarpa Schiede was planted in 1979 at Cardwell, north Queensland as part of a small provenance trial. It is a single cross between an elite tree of the P. caribaea breeding population as seed parent, and a now-rejected P. oocarpa tree selected at very low intensity. Both parents are of Belize Mountain Pine Ridge provenance. This locally produced hybrid has shown exceptional early growth. To age 4-5 years, the hybrid has surpassed the high parent, P. caribaea, in height, diameter, basal area and total volume growth by 37%, 23%, 56% and 116% respectively. Survival of the hybrid has been excellent and it appears to have good stem quality and an ability to recover from wind deformation. A preliminary study of wood density has allayed fears that it may be unacceptably lower than that of the parental varieties. Further crosses in both directions, using several selected trees of a few provenances of both parental species have been made, and well-controlled field trials will be established soon to determine more clearly the potential value of this very promising hybrid. On a plant une famille F hybride de Pinus caribaea var hondurensis et de P. oocarpa dans le cadre d'un essai de provenance tabli en 1979 a Cardwell, Queensland du Nord. La graine provient d'un arbre lite de P. caribaea fconde par un P. oocarpa qui depuis a t rejet. Les deux proviennent de Mountain Pine Ridge, Belize. Cet hybride a atteint une vitesse de croissance initiale exceptionnelle. A l'ge de 45 ans, il avait deposs le parent P. caribaea en hauteur, en diamtre en surface terrire et en volume au mme age de 37%, de 23%, de 56% et de 116% respectivement. La survie est excellente, ainsi que la qualit de la tige, et la capacit de se remettre de la dformation par le vent. Une premiere tude sur la densit du bois a assur quelle n'est pas moindre que celle des parents. D'autres hybridations ont t effectues dans les deux sens, on se serrant de parents lites, et on espre dterminer plus clairement le potential de ce croisement prometteur. Una familia hbrida (F) de Pinus caribaea var. hondurensis Barr. y. Golf.  P. oocarpa Schiede fue plantado en 1979 en Card well, en el norte de Queensland, como parte de un pequeo ensayo de procedencias. Es un cruzamiento entre un rbol superior de la poblacin de mejoramiento de P. caribaea como madre y el padre fue un rbol, ya arrojado, del programa de mejoramiento de P. oocarpa seleccionado a una intensidad muy baja. Ambos padres son de la procedencia de Mountain Pine Ridge, Belice. Este hbrido local ha mostrado un desarrollo excepcinal en los primeros aos. A los 4-5 aos, ha superado el mejor padre, P. caribaea, en altura, dimetro, rea basl y volumen total con 37, 23, 56 y 116 porciento respectivamente. Sobrevivencia ha sido excellente y parece que la forma del fuste es buena y que tiene la abilidad de recuperarse de los efectos de los vientos fuertes. Habia miedo de que la densidad de la madera pueda ser mucho ms baja que la densidad de la madera de los padres, pero despus de un estudio preliminar, parece que no es as. Se han hecho algunos ms cruzamientos en ambas direcciones, utilisando arboles seleccionados adicinales de algunaso procedencias de ambas especies y ahora van a establecersa ensayos de campo bien contralados para determinar mejor el valor potencial de este hbrido muy prometador.
42607845|In August 1980 the United Nations Centre on Transnational Corporations (TNCs) ran a workshop at Pattaya, Thailand on "Negotiations with Transnational Corporations in the Tropical Hardwoods Sector". Among those invited to give presentations on the TNCs point of view was Mr. D.L. McNeil, Forestry Director of the Timber Division of UAC Limited. It is not possible to publish the paper in its entirety here but the UAC quote extracts. They apologise if this appears to give a somewhat discontinuous feel to the whole.
42608283|The benefits which forests provide can be increased by sound forest management but the difficulty in valuing externalities and the long-term nature of forestry means that the benefits of many investment decisions are uncertain. This adds to the complexity of managing forest enterprises. Global markets for forest products, for capital and for forestry assets will reduce artificial differences in prices and improve the value of price signals in decision-making. Regulation of forestry will ensure that forestry continues to provide non-market benefits and that the costs of providing these are known. The potential for technological developments in wood production are greatest at the start of the process, i.e. the genetic material, and at the end, i.e. the manufacturing process. How decision makers react to these developments will depend on how prices and values change. The development of an active global market for forestry assets and an informed and continuing debate on regulations and standards will help to reduce complexity and cost in the management of forest enterprises. Les bnfices produits par les forts peuvent tre accrus par leur bonne grance, mais la difficult d'valuer les facteurs extrieurs et la nature  long terme de la foresterie signifie que les bnfices de nombreuses dcisions d'investissement restent incertains. Cela accrot la complexit de la grance des entreprises forestires. Les marchs globaux de produits forestiers, de capital et de possessions forestires rduira les diffrences artificielles de prix, et amliorera la valeur des signaux de prix dans les prises de dcision. La rglementation de la foresterie assurera qu'elle continue  produire des bnfices hors-march et que les cots de la fourniture de ces bnfices soient connus. Le potentiel pour les dveloppements technologiques est le plus fort au dbut du processus, c.a.d. le matriel gntique, et  la fin, c.a.d. le processus de production. La faon dont les responsables ragissent  ces dveloppements dpendra de la manire dont les prix et les valeurs changeront. Le dveloppement d'un march global actif des possessions de foresterie et un dbat inform et persvrant sur les rgles et les standards aidera  rduire la complexit et le cot de la grance des entreprises forestires.
42603488|The performance of overwinter stored nursery stock was compared with that of fresh, unstored stock, using white spruce (Picea glauca (Moench) Voss) and red pine (Pinus resinosa Ait.), two age-classes (3-0 and 2-2), and two types of bale (standard and jelly-roll). Trees wrapped in bales were stored on racks in a small shed built mostly below surface level. The trees were put in storage in November and were at temperatures below freezing from December to March inclusive, with a minimum of 15 deg. C.recorded inside the bale. In the spring, 6,400 trees of each species were planted in northern Ontario according to experimental designs, 3,200 trees being randomly selected, fresh (or unstored), stock from the same seed and transplant beds. Observations were made during the first year and at the end of the third. The stored white spruce showed a reduction in vigour, measured in terms of survival, susceptibility to damage, and growth, as compared with fresh stock. The stored red pine trees had lower survival than the unstored trees. Growth of the stored trees of both species started earlier than growth of the unstored trees. The 3-0 stock of both species was much inferior in survival and growth than the 2-2 (transplants). The jelly-roll bale resulted in less damage to the spruce, and better subsequent average height in the pine than the standard bale. This was believed due to later flushing of trees packed in this manner. This would not always be an advantage. It was concluded that there is a considerable element of risk in this type of storage.
42604438|At present there are two types of agri-silvicultural system in Nigeria. The first is the "own your own crop" system and the second is the "farming for pay" system. Although there are some differences in the practice of these two systems, they both have the same aim, which is to improve the standard of living of the rural people as well as providing some labour for clearing of the forest for plantations. The system of agri-silviculture has contributed to increased food production in Nigeria as well as helping to solve the problem of rural unemployment or disguised unemployment.
42603455|This paper mentions the ambrosia beetles which are of chief economic importance in the peat swamps of Sarawak. The susceptibility of various species of tree to attack, economic losses and methods of control is described.
42608327|Participatory approaches to development have been widely promoted and implemented in recent years, and forestry, including specifically forest resource assessment, has not been excepted from this trend. Local people may have a variety of reasons for participating in forest resource assessment, ranging from a need to secure tenure and rights to forest resources, to attempts to seek compensation for forest resources which have been lost or which are under threat, to a wish to practise sustainable management of forest resources where, in addition to timber, they may often wish to manage a variety of Non-Timber Forest Products (NTFPs). Biodiversity conservation objectives may also be linked to participatory forest resource assessment by outside governmental or non-governmental agencies. Participatory approaches to forest resource assessment may entail the modification of existing survey or inventory techniques, or they may involve the development of innovative methods, sometimes taking advantage of the relatively recent availability of tools such as GPS (Global Positioning Systems) and computerised data management. This paper reports on experiences of local people's participation in forest resource assessment, focusing on selected case studies in Indonesia and Mexico. The final section considers two important general findings on cost and the nature of local people's participation. Les approches participationnelles du dveloppement ont t largement promues et implantes ces dernires annes, et la sylviculture prenant en compte spcifiquement l'valuation de la ressource forestire, n'a pas t trangre  ce courant. Les raisons qu'ont les habitants locaux de participer  l'valuation de la recherche forestire sont varies: besoin d'assurer leur location des terres et leur droits aux ressources forestires, tentative de rechercher une compensation pour les ressources forestires ayant t perdues ou tant menaces, dsir de mettre en pratique une bonne organisation des ressources de la fort et dans laquelle ils peuvent vouloir ajouter  la production du bois l'organisation d'une varit d'autres produits forestiers. Les objectifs de la conservation de la biodiversit peuvent aussi tre lis  unje valuation participationelle de la ressource forestire par des agences extrieures gouvernementales ou non-gouvernementales. L'approche participationelle  l'valuation de la ressource forestire peut inclure une modification des techniques existantes d'inventaire ou de topographie, ou elles peuvent inclure le dveloppement de mthodes innovatives en prenant parfois avantage de la disponibilit relativement rcente d'outils comme les systmes de positionnement global et les donnes d'organisa-tion informatises. Cet article offre un compte-rendu des expriences de participation dans l'valuation de la valeur des forts par les habitants locaux, et se concentre sur des tudes-cas slectionnes en Indonsie et au Mexique. La dernire partie offre deux conclusions gnrales importantes sur le cot et la nature de la participation des personnes locales. En aos recientes, se han estado promoviendo e implementando ampliamente enfoques participativos para el desarrollo y el caso de ingeniera forestal, incluyendo especficamente la evaluacin del recursos forestal, no ha sido la excepcin a esta tendencia. La comunidad local podr tener una variedad de razones por las cuales participar en la evaluacin del recurso forestal, variando desde una necesidad de asegurar la tenencia y los derechos a los recursos forestales, intentos de buscar compensacin por recursos forestales los cuales se han perdido o estn bajo amenaza, hasta el deseo de practicar un buen manejo del recurso forestal donde, adems de madera, ellos puedan a menudo desear administrar una variedad de recursos forestales no madereros (NTFPs). Los objetivos de conservacin de la biodiversidad pueden tambin estar vinculados a la evaluacin participativa del recurso forestal por agencias externas gubernamentales o nogubernamentales. Enfoques participativos para la evaluacin del recurso forestal, pueden vincular la modificacin de encuestas o tcnicas de inventario existentes o pueden involucrar el desarrollo de mtodos innovadores, a menudo, tomando ventaja de la relativamente reciente disponibili-dad de herramientas como GPS (Sistema de Posicionamiento Global) y el manejo de datos por computador. Este artculo reporta sobre las experiencias de la participacin de la comunidad local en la evaluacin del recurso forestal, centrndose en estudios seleccionados de casos prcticos en Indonesia y Mxico. La seccin final considera dos hallazgos generales importantes en costo y naturaleza de la participacin de la comunidad local.
42603043|The growth rates in natural woodland under a rgime of annual early-burning are examined and found to bear comparison with the growth of cultivated plantations of Cassia siamea on the same site. The practice of early-burning clear-felled coupes is shown to be detrimental both to the growing stock and to the site potential, but cultivation followed by exclusion of fire during the regeneration phase is seen to achieve large increases in both immediate and potential productivity of the site.
43737739|The tree planting experience of farmers in two villages, one from an agriculturally prosperous area in the west and the other from the subsistence oriented eastern part of Uttar Pradesh in north India are examined and compared. In the first, in the early 1980s, extensive areas were planted with Eucalyptus, often replacing annual crops. As the price of wood started to fall in 1986 their enthusiasm declined and many farmers reverted to annual cropping. In the other village, tree planting remained at a low level till 1987, when it gradually increased, albeit at an unpredictable level. An explanation is offered for the different response to tree cropping in the two villages, while the paper speculates on the likely reasons for the collapse of wood markets in the first village, which is explained in terms of over-production, lack of demand and market imperfections. On examine et compare les expriences des agriculteurs dans deux villages en ce qui concerne le plantage des arbres. L'un des villages se trouvait dans une rgion d'agriculture prospre dans l'Ouest et l'autre dans la partie est d'Uttar Pradesh dans le Nord de l'Inde, rgion o l'agriculture est oriente vers les cultures vivrires de base. Dans le premier, au dbut des annes 1980, de grandes surfaces ont t plantes avec Eucalyptus, qui a souvent remplac des cultures annuelles. Lorsque le prix du bois a commenc  baisser en 1986 leur enthousiasme s'est refroidi et beaucoup d'agriculteurs se sont remis  la culture annuelle. Dans le second village, le niveau de plantage des arbres est rest bas jusqu'en 1987,  partir de quand il est mont graduellement, quoique de manire imprvisible. On propose une explication de la rponse diffrente  la culture des arbres dans les deux villages, et l'on conjecture sur les raisons probables de l'effondrement des marchs du bois dans le premier village, effondrement que l'on explique comme une fonction de la surproduction, due manque de demande et des imperfections du march. En dos pueblos de India, se examin y compar la experiencia de los agricultores en la plantacin de rboles; uno de una zona agrcola prspera en el oeste y el otro en una regin orientada a la subsistencia en la parte oriental de Uttar Pradesh en el norte de India. En el primero, a principios de los 80's, se sembraron reas extensas con Eucalyptus, a menudo reemplazando los cultivos anuales. Debido a que el precio de la madera empez a bajar en 1986 su entusiasmo decay y muchos de los agricultores volvieron a los cultivos anuales. En el otro pueblo, la plantacin de rboles permaneci a un nivel bajo hasta 1987, cuando se increment gradualmente, aunque a un nivel imposible de predecir. Se presenta una explicacin para la respuesta diferente al cultivo de rboles en los dos pueblos, mientras que este reporte especula sobre las razones probables para el colapso de los mercados de madera en el primero de los pueblos, el cual es explicado en trminos de sobre-produccin, falta de demanda e imperfecciones de mercado.
42608088|Best coppice production is achieved in Israel by felling trees during March-May (spring season). In no felling season was stump mortality pronounced and only 5% of the stump failed to coppice within one year. The mean number of shoot clumps per stump after 12 months was 5.1. The mean height of the tallest coppice shoot per month after 12 months ranged between 2 m and 3 m regardless of the month of felling. Grafting to rejuvenate mature tissue is useful for producing cuttings to start a clonal line without damaging an elite tree. The initial grafting take of an adult scion on a young seedling was highly successful. As a result of incompatibility, grafts started to die a short time after grafting, with an ultimate survival rate of approximately 15% after one year. Stockplants planted 1.4  0.5 m apart produced 70 to 120 six-leaf cuttings per plant per year. Under 50% shade there was a reduction of 30% in production. Protecting the stockplants with polyethylene during winter increased their production. Open growing of stockplants and repeated pruning provided the largest number of cuttings at the least expense and effort. It is estimated that 10,000 stockplants per ha can produce more than 1,000,000 cuttings per year, yielding some 500,000 rooted plants. La meilleure production de taillis en Israel est accomplie en abattant les arbres en mars  mai (saison printanire). La mortalit de souches n'tait leve en aucune saison d'abattage et seulement 5% des souches n'avaient pas produit de rejet dans un an. Le nombre moyen de groupes de rejets par souche aprs 12 mois tait 5.1. La hauteur moyenne du rejet de souche le plus haut par mois aprs 12 mois tait comprise entre 2 m et 3 m indpendamment du mois d'abattage. Le greffage pour rajeunir du tissu g ast utile pour produire des boutures pour fonder une ligne clnale sans abmer un arbre d'lite. Le greffage initial d'un greffon adulte sur un semis jeune a eu beaucoup de succs.  cause d'incompatibilit, les greffes commenaient  mourir peu aprs le greffage, avec un taux de survie final d'environ 15% aprs un an. Des plantes-mres plantes  un espacement de 1.4  0.5 m produisaient 70  120 boutures  six feuilles par plant par an. Quand elles taient ombrages  50%, la production tait rduite de 30%. La protection des plantes-mres par du polythylne pendant l'hiver augmentait leur production. La culture en plein air des plantes-mres et l'lagage rpt produisaient le plus grand nombre de boutures aux moindres frais et avec le moindre travail. On estime que 10 000 plantes-mres par ha peuvent produire plus de 1 000 000 boutures par an, rapportant quelques 500 000 plants enracins. La mayor produccin de estacas fue obtenida en Israel mediante la corta de los rboles entre Marzo y Mayo (primavera). La mortalidad de tocones fue baja y al cabo de un ao apenas cinco por ciento de ellos no rebrotaron. Se encontr un promedio de 5.1 rebrotes/tocn al cabo de un ao y la altura promedio del rebrote ms alto vari de 2m a 3m a la misma edad; no hubo diferencias respecto al mes de corta. El injerto de material adulto sobre una plntula jven fue exitoso inicialmente, sin embargo, los injertos murieron poco tiempo despus, como consecuencia de incompatibilidad lo que result en una sobrevivencia de apenas 15% despus de un ao. Los injertos reproductores de estaces plantados a 1.4m  0.5m produjeron entre 70 y 120 estacas (con seis hojas) por planta anualmente. Bajo 50% de sombra la produccin se redujo en un 30%. La proteccin de los injertos con polietileno durante el inviervo aument la produccin. La plantacin a cielo abierto y las podas repetidas produjeron la mayor cantidad de estacas al menor precio y esfuerzo. Se estima que los injertos plantados a una densidad de 10.000/ha producirn ms de 1.000 000 de estacas/ao, que a la vez significarian cerca de 500.000 plntulas enraizadas.
42606431|There is a general assumption that the development of large areas of exotic coniferous plantations for local consumption or for export is, or should be, determined by that market. The New Zealand experience is instructive in that Bunn (1981) has demonstrated how the output can be predicted from forest history, because it is dictated by that history. Furthermore, Bunn emphasised that the wood quality sought, varies according to the end productthat "quality" cannot be used in an absolute sense. Some of Bunn's ideas are worth further development because this approach affects, or should affect, thinking about forestry development policy. There are lessons for other countries with plantations yet to be exploited. On a tendance  supposer que la plantation de rsineux xotiques sur de grandes surfaces estou devrait tre dtermin par le march. L'exprience no-zland-aise est instructive par le fait, dmontr par Bunn, que la production est prvisible, tant donn l'histoire de la fort. En plus, Bunn a dmontr que la qualit dpend de la nature du produit labor; i'l n'y a donc pas de qualit dans l'absolu. Ces ides mritent d'tre dveloppes, car elles portent sur les questions de la politique forestire. Il y a la des leons pour d'autres pays dont les plantations restent  exploiter. Hay una suposicin general que el desarrollo de extensiones grandes de bosques exticos de coniferas para el mercado local o de exportacin, es, o debera ser, determinado para ese mercado. La experiencia de Nueva Zealandia es instructivo para que Bunn (1981) ha mostrado como la produccin total puede ser predecido por la historia forestal, desde la historia lo decreta. Ademas, Bunn subray que la calidad de madera que se busca, varia sgun el producto finalque "calidad" no puede usarse en un sentido absoluto. Vale la pena desarrollar ms algunos de los ideas de Bunn para que esas consideraciones influeyen, o deberan influir, los pensamientos sobre la poltica de desarollo forestal. Los pases con plantaciones aun no explotadas pueden apprender algo.
42608671|In 1990, UNCTAD proposed the application of trading in emissions allowances as an alternative to carbon taxes. UNCTAD has carried out research on all aspects of emissions trading and has played a central role in establishing the Greenhouse Gas Emissions Trading Policy Forum. The Kyoto Protocol has opened up prospects of trading certified emission reductions (CERs) under the Clean Development Mechanism between developed and developing countries. En 1990, l'UNCTAD a propos l'application du commerce des tolrances des missions comme une alternative  la taxe sur le carbone. l'UNCTAD a fait des recherches sur tous les aspexcts du commerce des missions et a jou un rle central dans l'tablissement du Forum pour la Politique du Commerce des missions des Gaz qui Causent l'Effet de Serre. Le Protocole de Kyoto a cr la possibilit de faire le commerce des Rductions Certifies d'missions (RCE) dans le Systme du Dveloppement Propre entre les pays dvelopps et les pays en voie de dveloppement.
42608658|Efforts to reafforest the denuded Jos Plateau began in 1924, with the encouragement of natural woodland cover in Forest Reserves on unproductive hill land. Plantations of exotic species were unimportant in the region until the Second World War, when a series of community forests were initiated for fuelwood. These plantings continued in the 1960s and 70s with Eucalyptus, and were eventually extended to derelict land left by the tin-mining industry, as well as to new Forest Reserves. Today, Forest Reserves account for about 8% of the Plateau area, though few have more than a sparse woodland cover, compared with 0.5% under plantations. The significance of these plantations in relation to wood shortages on the Jos Plateau is briefly discussed. Les travaux de reboisement du Jos Plateau dnud ont commenc en 1924, avec l'encouragement du couvert forestier naturel dans les Rserves Forestires sur du terrain montagneux et peu productif. Des peuplements d'essences exotiques taient de peu d'importance dans la rgion jusqu' la Deuxime Guerre Mondiale, quand une srie de forts collectives tait tablie pour produire du bois de chauffage. Ces plantations ont continu dans les annes 60 et 70 avec Eucalyptus, et ont t finalement tendues au terrain abandonn par l'industrie minire d'tain, de meme qu' nouvelles Rserves Forestires. Aujourd'hui, les Rserves Forestires constituent 8% de la superficie du Plateau, bien que la plupart d'entre elles n'aient qu'un couvert forestier clairsem, en comparaison de 0.5% de peuplements. L'importance de ces peuplements par rapport aux crises de bois du Jos Plateau est brivement discute. En 1924 se iniciaron los esfuerzos por reforestar la planicie de Jos, mediante la promocin de bosques naturales en las Reservas Forestales o en los suelos improductivos de laderas. Las platacines de especies exticas no tuvieron importancia en la regin hasta la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Estas plantaciones continuaron en los aos sesentas y setentas con especies de Eucalyptus, y eventualmente se extendieron a las tierras abandonadas por la industria de la minera del estao, al igual que a las de neu vas Reservas Forestales. En la actualidad, las Reservas Forestales contienen el 8% de la superficie de la planicie. Unicamente el 0.5% de las Reservas tienen plantaciones forestales, los demas apenas si tinen cubierta forestal. Se discute brevemente el significado de estas plantaciones en relacin a la escasez de madera en la Planicie de Jos.
42609015|With changing markets and increasing restrictions on the management of public native forest managed for multiple use purposes, private forests are playing an increasing role in native forest timber production. The recent Tasmanian experience provides a pointer to the future policy environment needed to foster private forestry nationally. The paper argues that reforms are needed to public policy for private forests in the following areas: Codes of Forest Practice; private timber reserves; taxation; contestable markets; education and extension; and whole farm planning, if we expect an increased contribution from the private sector for both wood production and amenity values. Du fait de l'irrgularit des marchs et de la multiplication des restrictions touchant l'amnagement des forts publiques qui doivent servir  des fins multiples, les forts prives sont appeles  jouer un rle de plus en plus important dans la production nationale de bois. La rcente exprience de Tasmanie fournit de prcieuses indications quant au type d'environnement politique ncessaire pour favoriser la foresterie prive  l'chelon national. Cet article insiste sur le fait que des rformes dans le secteur de la politique des forts prives sont ncessaires dans les domaines du Code Forestier, de la dsignation des rserves forestires prives, de la taxation, des 'contestable markets', de l'ducation et de la sensibilisation et de la gestion intgre des forts et de l'agriculture. Ces rformes sont ncessaires si nous attendons une augmentation de la contribution du secteur priv en terme de production de bois et galement en terme de valeur rcrative des forts. Debido a los mercados cambiantes y al reciente incremento de las restricciones del manejo de bosques pblicos nativos para propsitos de mltiples usos, los bosques privados estn jugando un papel cada vez ms importante un la produccin de bosques maderables. La experiencia reciente de Tasmania provee un derrotero para la futura poltica medioambiental que se necesita para promover la produccin forestal privada a nivel nacional. El artculo argumenta que se necesitan las reformas de las polticas pblicas para los bosques privados en las siguientes areas: cdigos de prctica forestal; reservas privadas de maderas; impuestos; pugna de mercados; educacin y extensin y planeamiento de la granja en su totalidad, si nosotros esperamos un incremento de la contribucin del sector privado tanto para produccin de madera como para los valores amenos.
42604636|This paper reports the insects which were collected from exotic forest trees in Zambia during the period 1973-1975, and reviews previous records. The insects which cause most damage, namely the cerambycid beetles Phoracantha recurva and P. semi-punctata, are reported at greater length with descriptions of their life-history, host-range and associated predisposing factors. The occurrence of these pests is discussed in relation to their economic importance. Cet article a pour objet les insectes qui ont t collects en Zambie, sur des essences forestires exotiques, durant les annes 1973  1975 et il donne un aperu des prcdentes observations recueillies. Une place importante est rserve aux insectes qui causent le plus de dommages, c'est  dire aux Cerambycides: Phorocantha recurva et P'semipunctata. Des descriptions du droulement de leur vie, de leurs divers htes et des facteurs qui prdisposent aux attaques sont indiqus. La prsence de ces insectes foreurs est examine par rapport  leur importance conomique. Este estudio detalla los insectos recogidos en rboles forestales exticos de Zambia durante el perodo 1973-75 y resea observaciones previas. Se tratan ms detalladamente los insectos que causan el mayor dao, a saber, los escarabajos cerambcidos Phoracantha recurva y P. semi-punctata, con descripciones de vida, gamas de huspedes y factores asociados de predisposicin. Se examina el acaecimiento de estas plagas en relacin con la importancia econmica de cada una de ellas.
42605181|A sampling scheme based on a strip of contiguous quadrats, each  chain square, is described. Stocking of each quadrat is considered with respect to two value classes but without a count of numbers of individuals, one being sufficient to stock the quadrat. So that basal areas and stand tables can be determined as well, all trees over 2 ft. girth are individually recorded and the data for smaller trees found by relascope counts. Results of various samplings are presented and used as a basis for arriving at criteria which should be met before treatment is considered. Stocking, basal area of weeds, and of commercial trees, degree of dominance and climber infestation, are the variables used for these criteria. Then again treatment variations are proposed, to take account of variation in the size and stocking of the commercial trees.
42608693|Low-intensity selection and selective logging systems, especially those based on diameter limits, are often attractive to foresters and conservationists because they maintain a high degree of forest cover while theoretically providing a sustainable flow of harvestable wood. However, as currently practised, low-intensity selective or selection harvesting requires human intrusion into large areas of undisturbed forest, gradually resulting in the commercial elimination of the most highly-valued species, and often neither provides conditions appropriate for regeneration nor protects biological diversity. Instead of evaluating the success or failure of harvests by their selectivity or temporary maintenance of canopy cover, it would be more appropriate to evaluate the success of harvesting based on measurable standards of sustainability. In many cases, more intensive forest harvesting on a smaller land base may increase profitability of forest operations, provide better regeneration, maintain stumpage value, and protect biodiversity by reducing the rate of intrusion into primary forest. La slection peu intense et les systmes de la rcolte d'crmage, surtout de la coupe au diamtre minimal, sont souvent aims des forestiers et des partisans de la conservation parce que ces systmes maintiennent un bon niveau de couvert forestier, tout en garantissant - en thorie - une exploitation durable. Dans la pratique actuelle, d'ailleurs, la slection ou la rcolte d'crmage de faible intensit ncessitent l'intrusion humaine dans de grandes aires de fort vierge, aboutissant  l'limination commerciale des espces de la plus grande valeur. Souvent aissi ces mthodes ne fournissent pas les conditions convenables pour la rgnration, et ne protgent pas la diversit biologique. Au lieu d'valuer le succs de la rcolte selon sa slectivit ou son maintien temporaire du couvert forestier, il serait plus appropri de l'valuer selon des normes mesurables de la durabilit, comme le niveau de rgnration et de protection de la biodiversit, et le rendement soutenu. Dans plusieurs cas, une rcolte plus intense sur une terre plus limite pourrait augmenter le rendement de l'exploitation forestire, faciliter la rgnration, maintenir la valeur du bois sur pied, et protger la biodiversit en rduisant le niveau d'intrusion dans la fort vierge. La baja intensidad de seleccin y los sistemas de tala selectivos, especialmente aquellos basados en el dimetro como lmite, son muy a menudo atractivos para los ingenieros forestales y para los conservacionistas porque ellos mantienen un alto grado de cobertura forestal al mismo tiempo que ofrecen, tericamente, un flujo sostenible de madera aprovechable. Sin embargo, de la manera como actualmente se practica, la baja intensidad de seleccin o la tala selectiva requieren la intromisin humana en grandes zonas de bosque inalterado, resultando gradualmente en la eliminacin comercial de las especies ms altamente valoradas, y frecuentemente tampoco provee condiciones apropiadas para la regeneracin ni protege la diversidad biolgica. En lugar de evaluar el xito o el fracaso de las cosechas de madera por su selectividad o su mantenimiento temporal de la cubierta de dosel, sera ms apropiado evaluar el xito de la cosecha basado en normas medibles de la sostenibilidad, tales como el nivel de regeneracin, el grado de proteccin de la biodiversidad y la produccin sostenida de madera. En muchos casos, la cosecha ms intensiva del bosque con base en una rea ms pequea de tierra, puede aumentar la rentabilidad de las operaciones forestales, proveer mejor regeneracin, mantener el valor de desembolso, y proteger la biodiversidad reduciendo la tasa de intervencin en el bosque primario.
42605332|The EEC represents an attractive market opportunity for British Columbia's pulp and paper products. The trade is currently dominated by pulp exports which accounted for over 60 per cent of the total export value in 1973. This feature is clearly undesirable and is attributed to conservatism of the British Columbia paper industry and EEC's restrictive trade policies. It is suggested that British Columbia might significantly improve its standing in this market if the industry up-grades products and adopts a better marketing system. La Communaut Economique Europenne reprsente un march particulierement intrssant pour la vente des produits cellulosiques et papetiers de la Colombie britannique. Ce commerce est caractris par l'exportation prdominante de pte qui a dpass 60 per cent de la valeur totale des exportations en 1973. Ce qui, manifestement n'est pas souhaitable, mais qui peut tre attribu au onservatisme de l'industrie papetire de la Colombie britannique et aux mesures restrictivs de la politique commerciale de la Communaut. On propose que la Colombie britannique puisse amliorer sensiblement sa position sur ce march en proposant des produits de qualits suprieures et qu'elle puisse aussi adopter une meilleure mthode de vente.
42608107|Studies on the causes and extent of forest fires have revealed the associations between: burnt area and lifetime of fire, and area burnt at time of arrival of firefighters and number of firefighting staff. Current deficiencies in the scale of resources available for monitoring and control of fire are serious in view of the impact of forest loss on environmental functions of the forest as well as on wood supply. Les tudes sur les origines et l'tendue des feux sauvages ont rvl les relations entre: la superficie brle et la vie du feu; et la superficie brle  l'heure de l'arrive des pompiers et le nombre de personnes dans l'quipe des pompiers. L'insuffisance actuelle des ressources pour contrler et matriser le feu est srieuse tant donn l'impact des pertes forestires sur les fonctions environnementales de la fort non moins que sur les rserves de bois. Estudios de las causas y extensin de los incendios forestales han revelado las asociaciones entre: el rea quemada y duracin del incendio, y el rea quemada al momento de llegada de los bomberos y nmero de equipo tcnico para controlar el fuego. Las deficiencias actuales en la escala de recursos disponible para monitoreo y control de incendios son serias en vista del impacto de prdida de bosques sobre las funciones ambientales de los bosques as como en el suministro de madera.
42603048|A study was made of weekly girth increment of ten Pterocarpus angolensis trees in Western Tanganyika, by the Dawkins ''tree vernier" method. The season (1961-62) produced an abnormally high rainfall. Growth began before the rainy season was under way with a shrinkage, probably related to the leaf and flower flush. Even short dry spells lead to a reduction of the growth rate. Growth stopped before the rainy season was over. Overall increment varies widely between the trees. It was related closely to crown status.
42603226|Studies of the effect of defoliation by Dothistroma pini on the increment rates of young Pinus radiata have shown that diameter growth is reduced to a greater extent than height. Serious loss may be expected in the crop where more than 25 per cent of the foliage has been killed or is moribund. Almost complete cessation of growth occurs when this has reached 75 per cent.
42608797|To explain the absence of seedlings in Acacia mangium stands one year after burning, seed germination, seed lethal temperature, fuel loading and heat penetration were measured in 3, 4 and 5 year old stands in a plantation in South Sumatra, Indonesia. Seed viability was high, germination percentages of seed from 0-5 cm and 5-10 cm soil depths being 92.0% and 95.8% respectively. In laboratory conditions, at temperatures from 150C to 180C for 5 minutes, no seeds germinated. From 100C to 140C, 5 min., however, germination ranged from 60% to 86%. The temperature in a burn at 1 cm below the soil surface was no higher than 76C. Seed lethal temperature was around 150C, whereas a temperature of 76C cannot break seed dormancy. Pour expliquer l'absence de nouvelles pousses dans les habitats 'Acacia mangium un an aprs le feu, la germination des graines, la temprature lthale des graines, le chargement du fuel et la pntration de la chaleur ont t mesurs dans des habitats vieux de 3,4 et 5 ans dans une plantation au Sud de Sumatra, Indonsie. Le vitalit des graines tait forte, les pourcentages de germination des graines aux profondeurs de 0-5cm et de 5-10cm tant respectivement 92.0% et 95.8%. En conditions de laboratoire et  des tempratures de 150C  180C maintenues pendant 5 minutes, aucune graine n'a germ. En revance  des tempratures entre 100C et 140C maintenues pendant 5 mn, la germination allait de 60%  86%. La temprature pendant un feu  1 cm sous le sol de surface n'tait pas plus haute que 76C. La temprature lthale des graines tait autour de 150C, alors qu'une temprature de 76C ne peut pas briser l'tat dormant des graines. Se evaluaron la germinacin de la semilla, la temperatura letal para la semilla, la carga de combustible y la penetracin de calor para explicar la ausencia de plntulas de Acacia mangium un ao despus de la quema, en cultivos de 3, 4 y 5 aos de edad en una plantacin en Sumatra del Sur, Indonesia. La viabilidad de la semilla fue alta, encontrndose porcentajes de germinacin de semilla desde 0-5 cm y de 5-10 cm de profundidad del suelo de 92.0% y 95.8% respectivamente. En condiciones de laboratorio, a temperaturas desde 150C a 180C por 5 minutos, ninguna semilla germin. Desde 100C a 140C, 5 min., sin embargo, la germinacin vari desde 60% a 86%. La temperatura en una quema a 1 cm por debajo de la superficie de suelo no fue ms alta que 76C. La temperatura letal de la semilla fue alrededor 150C, mientras que una temperatura de 76C no puede romper el letargo de la semilla.
42606752|Widdringtonia nodiflora will root from cuttings. The use of IBA increases the rooting percentage. Cuttings from the lower third of the crown were more likely to root than those from the upper third. Widdringtonia nodiflora s'enracine  partir de boutures. L'utilisation d'AIB augmente le pourcentage d'encracinement. Les boutures enleves dans le tiers infrieur du houppier avaient plus de chances de s'enraciner que celles enleves dans le tiers suprieur. Widdringtonia nodiflora posee capacidad de enraizar a partir de estacas. El uso de cido indolbutlico increment el porcentaje de enraizamiento de las estacas. Las estacas del tercio inferior de la copa presentaron mayor capacidad de enraizamiento que las obtenidas del tercio superior de la misma.
42603518|The existence of forest plantations and natural woody vegetation in desert and subtropical regions, where the rainfall is slight and droughts are frequent, poses a fundamental question: what is the source of the water necessary for their establishment and development in the area where the subterranean water is beyond the reach of the roots? The sole source of water available for reducing the water deficit in the plant and the soil moisture tension is the atmosphere (dew, mist and water vapour). In order to investigate the influence of the moisture on the water economy of the most common xerophytes in this country, this problem was examined in three different ways: (1) By a comparison of the soil moisture, its distribution with depth and its fluctuations throughout the year, in forest plantations and in neighbouring bare areas of identical make-up; (2) By an investigation, in controlled conditions, of the mode of entry of atmospheric water into the plant via the leaves, and its passage to the stem and roots and thence to the soil; (3) By an investigation of the changes effected in the ionic constitution of the forest floor resulting from the absorption of atmospheric water containing the same ions which were located in the neighbourhood of the roots. We found that there was an increased moisture content during the dry months (June-October) of 30-50 per cent in the permeable soils beneath Tamarix aphylla and T. pseudopalassi, and of 12.5-30.8 per cent in the hills, according to region and soil-type (rendzina or terra rossa) beneath Aleppo pine. The entry of atmospheric water was examined only during the summer months where the woody xerophytes excel in their attraction for water vapour, dew and mist owing to the water tension of the soil leading to a shortage in the plant, thus creating conditions facilitating the penetration of water through the leaves. By the use of containers under similar atmospheric conditions (exposure to extreme climatic conditions by day, and natural dew and mist by night), we followed the entry of atmospheric water into the leaves, stem and roots, and even into a partnering plant in the same container. We utilised dye powders spread on the leaves (fuchsin, methyl green, etc.) or potassium permanganate, whose presence was checked by analysis to locate the presence of this water. An examination of natural dew and mist in the summer revealed the presence of anions and cations, many of nutritional value to the plant. The same ions were found both in the forest floor and in the bare areas, but in quantities 15-135 times as great in the former. This high ionic concentration has raised further problems requiring solution, viz. (1) is the entry of ions, with the dew, selective or not, (2) did the ions, found in the soil, enter via the leaves and pass through the plant to the soil, or is there a process of washing-through by the rains?
42602981|1. Braun's observation that vessels in hardwoods may anastomose freely was confirmed, the movement of vessels being almost entirely in a tangential plane. 2. Anatomical investigation of 142 hardwood species showed that buttressing is more common among species with features that hinder lateral spread of water in the stem than in those without. Out of 30 heavily buttressed species 29 had libriform fibres compared with 1 without and 24 had paratracheal parenchyma compared with 6 without. Conversely, of 33 species with fibre-tracheids only one had heavy buttresses.
42608692|The Canadian Forest Service launched the Model Forest Program in 1992 and one of the model forests was designated north of Prince Albert, Saskatchewan. Under this Program, integrated resource management and sustainable forest management were proposed as practical means to balance environmental, economic and social concerns. The Prince Albert Model Forest was managed by a committee composed of official representatives of First Nations organisations, provincial and federal government agencies as well as the forest industry. It also involved several public issue groups. The first five years demonstrated that the Model Forest Program offered innovative ways of providing First Nations and public stakeholder groups with real opportunities to participate in the integration of different aspects of forest management. The inclusion of First Nations and National Parks in the Model Forest Program also reflected a change in basic attitude by the forest industry towards environmental and social issues while the procurement of wood remained the main concern.
