The Canadian Forest Service demonstrated, with the implementation of the Model Forest Program, the possibility of a government agency assuming a facultative role rather than taking sides in the public debate of forest management issues. Le Service canadien des forts a dclench le Model Forest Program en 1992. Une des forts modles a t dsign au nord de Prince Albert, Saskatchewan. Selon ce programme, la gestion intgre des ressources et la gestion forestire durable ont t proposes comme un moyen d'quilibrer des questions environnementales, conomiques et sociales. La fort modle Prince Albert tait gre par un comit compos de dlgus officiels autochtones, d'agences du gouvernement provincial et fdral, et de l'industrie forestire. Elle a aussi engag plusieurs groupes d'intrts publiques. Les premiers cinq ans ont dmontr que le Model Forest Program a trouv des moyens innovateurs d'offrir aux premires nations et aux groupes d'intrts publiques la participation  l'intgration des divers aspects de la gestion forestire. L'inclusion de premires nations et de parcs nationaux dans la Model Forest Program tait aussi un signe de l'adoption par l'industrie forestire d'une nouvelle attitude envers les questions environnementales et sociales, mais sans oublier que l'exploitation du bois avait la plus grande importance. Avec la mise en oeuvre du Model Forest Program, le Service canadien des forts a dmontr qu'une agence du gouvernement est capable de faciliter la rsolution publique des questions de la gestion forestire, au lieu d'tre partiel. El Servicio Forestal Canadiense lanz el Programa de Bosque Modelo en 1992 y uno de los bosques modelos designados fue el de Prncipe Albert, en Saskatchewan. Bajo este Programa, se propusieron la administracin integrada de recursos y el manejo sostenible de bosques como medios prcticos para balancear los intereses ambientales, econmicos y sociales. El Bosque Modelo Prncipe Albert, fue administrado por un comit compuesto de representantes oficiales de organizaciones Primeras Naciones, agencias de gobierno provinciales y federales as como la industria forestal. Tambin involucr varios grupos de temas pblicos. Los primeros cinco aos demostraron que el Programa de Bosque Modelo ofreci modos innovadores para proveer a las organizaciones y grupos participantes con oportunidades reales para participar en la integracin de diferentes aspectos de la administracin forestal. La inclusin de Primeras Naciones y Parques Nacionales en el Programa de Bosque Modelo tambin reflej un cambio bsico en la actitud de la industria forestal hacia temas ambientales y sociales mientras la obtencin de madera permanece como el inters principal. El Servicio Forestal Canadiense demostr, con la instrumentacin del Programa de Bosque Modelo, la posibilidad de que una agencia del gobierno asuma un papel facilitador en lugar de tomar partido en el debate pblico de los temas de administracin forestal.
42606973|This presentation traces events during the past 30 years which have characterized the transition from 'the primacy of wood production' within the native forests towards balanced and sustainable development. Wood supply strategies after World War II were designed to meet demand for timber at a time of rapid economic growth, but these generated, at the same time, serious environmental conflicts. While environmental laws were to provide more objective land use and environmental review processes, they could not fully resolve the underlying conflicts. Conflicts became progressively more polarized, leading to the intervention in forestry of a Federal Government committed to the cause of environmental conservation. The divisiveness of this intervention highlighted the need for a more conciliatory and cooperative approach to resource decision-making, and this came to be based on the emerging concept of 'ecologically sustainable development'. A framework for such an approach evolved through a number of inquiries into forestry and, eventually, the formulation of the broadly acceptable 'National Forest Policy'. The presentation examines the resource planning processes needed to translate the policy into practice, and against this background, prospects for the forest industries. Ce document prsente un expos du conflit portant sur les ressources en Australie et la recherche de schmas socialement acceptables d'utilisation et de gestion des forts. Pendant presque trois dcades, le conflit forestier australien aura sem la discorde, et le dbat 'conservation contre dveloppement' aura t trs radical. Tandis qu'il pourrait ne pas y avoir de fin au dfi de l'environnement, on aperoit toutefois des raisons d'esprer que le but d'une industrie forestire stable et sre puisse tre atteint. Il le serait sur base des principes d'un dveloppement qui, cologiquement, peut tre maintenu  long terme et d'une structure de planification des ressources qui peut permettre  ce dveloppement de se raliser. El artculo presenta una relacin de conflicto de recursos en Australia, y la bsqueda de patrones socialmente aceptables de uso y manejo del bosque. Por cerca de tres dcadas, el conflicto de bosques en Australia ha estado dividido, y se ha enfocado predominantemente en el debate 'conservacin contra desarrollo'. Mientras que puede que no exista un fin para el reto ambiental, hay sin embargo, bases para el optimismo en el cual la meta de una industria forestal estable y segura puede lograrse con base en los principios de desarrollo ecolgicamente sostenibles, y en una estructura de planeacin de recursos que pueden dar expresin a ese desarrollo.
42606872|Seed collections from populations covering the natural range of Acacia mearnsii were used in a study of variation in seedling morphology. Collections (provenances) were classified according to climatic groups based on latitude, longitude and elevation. A seedlot from a South African seed orchard and single seedlots of three closely-related species, A. dealbata, A. irrorata and A. parramattensis were included for comparison. Pinnules, pinnae, leaf hairs and extrafloral nectaries (glands) were counted on seedlings grown in two glasshouse trials. Intensive measurements of pinnules, pinnae and leaves were also made. Provenances were grouped according to scores for linear combinations of traits. Tasmanian provenances fell into two groups; low elevation provenances George Town, Avoca and Boyer in one group, medium elevation provenance of St Leonard's in the other. Mainland provenances were divided into two main groups; one high elevation group centred on Mount Rix and Cooma in southern New South Wales, inland of the Great Dividing Range, the other a low elevation group, centred on Cann River/Orbost, closer to the coast. The single South African provenance (from a seed-orchard) included in the present study showed close affinities with the Tasmanian lowland group. On a utilis des collections de graines venues de populations comprenant l'ensemble de l'habitat actuel d'Acacia mearnsii pour raliser une tude des variations de morphologie des semis. On a class les collections (provenances) selon des groupes climatiques bass sur latitude, longitude et altitude. Un lot de graines d'un verger  graines sud-africain et des lots uniques de graines de trois essences troitement apparentes, A. dealbata, A. irrorata et A. parramattensis, ont t inclus pour faire des comparaisons. On a compt les pinnules, les folioles, les poils foliaires et les nectaires extrafloraux (glandes) sur des semis cultivs dans deux essais en serre. On a galement mesur intensivement les pinnules, les folioles et les feuilles. On a group les provenances selon les rsultats des combinaisons linaires de caractres. Les provenances tasmaniennes se sont divises en deux groupes: les provenances  basse altitude George Town, Avoca et Boyer dans l'un, la provenance  moyenne altitude St. Leonard's dans l'autre. Les provenances continentales se sont divises en deux groupes principaux: un groupe  haute altitude centr sur Mount Rix et Cooma dans le sud de la Nouvelle Galles du Sud,  l'intrieur de la Great Dividing Range, et un groupe  basse altitude, centr sur Cann River/Orbost, plus prs de la cte. La seule provenance sud-africaine (d'un verger  graines) qui a figur dans cette tude a mont des affinits troites avec le groupe tasmanien  basse altitude. Coleccines de semillas de poblaciones que cubre la zona entera de distribucin natural de Acacia mearnsii fueron usada en un estudio de la variacin en la morfologa de plntulas. Las procedencias de las colecciones fueron clasificadas segn los grupos climticos basado en latitud, longitud y elevacin. Una coleccin de semilla de un huerto de semilla surafricano y colecciones nicas de tres especies que son parientes cercanos A. dealbata, A. irrorata, A. parramattensis fueron incluidas para comparacin. Pinnules, pinnae, los pelos de la hoja y nectarios extraflorales (glndulas) fueron contados durante dos experimentos en invernculos. Tambin se tomaron medidas intensivas de pinnules, pinnae y hojas. Las procedencias fueron agrapadas segn las calificaciones de combinaciones lineales de caractersticas. Las procedencias de Tasmania se cayeron en dos grupos: las procedencias de elevacin baja de George Town, Avoca y Boyer en un grupo y las de elevacin mediana de St Leonard's en el otro. Las procedencias de la tierra firme tambin fueron dividas en dos grupos principales: un grupo de elevacin alta centrada en Mount Rix y Cooma en el sur de Nueva Gales del Sur haca el interior de la Gran Cordillera Divisoria, y el otro grupo de elevacin baja centrada en el ro Cann/Orbost ms cerca a la costa. La nica procedencia surafricana (de un huerto de semilla) que se incluy en este estudio mostr afinidades muy cercanas al grupo de la tierra baja de Tasmania.
42608101|Among the most significant changes in contemporary forest management and policy in Canada has been the broad acceptance of public participation in decision-making processes. This paper aims to describe the need and roles for public participation in forest decision-making, outline essential ingredients of successful public participation exercises, provide a national overview of recent developments in public participation, raise some key issues as forest managers design public participation processes, and reflect on future trends. It also briefly describes an example - the Wabakimi Park Boundary Committee - of the popular approach of advisory groups. While overall progress has been promising (albeit comparatively late in starting), more effort at the implementation level is needed. L'acceptation gnrale de la participation publique dans les prises de dcision a t un des changements les plus importants dans la gestion et la politique forestires contemporaines. Cet article vise  dcrire le besoin et les rles de la participation publique dans la prise de dcision forestire; indiquer les ingrdients essentiels des exercices de la participation publique; fournir un examen gnral national des dveloppements rcents de la participation publique; examiner quelques problmes-clefs affrontant les grants forestiers lors de la construction des procdures de la participation publique; et rflchir sur les tendances futures. En plus, il dcrit brivement un exemple - le Conseil des Frontires du Parc Wabakimi - de la mthode populaire des groupes consultatifs. Tandis que le progrs gnral a t encourageant (bien que relativement tardif), plus d'effort au niveau de l'excution est exig. Entre los cambios contemporneos ms significativos en la administracin forestal y poltica en Canad ha sido la aceptacin amplia de la participacin pblica en el proceso de toma de decisiones. Este artculo describe la necesidad y el papel de la participacin pblica en el proceso de toma de decisiones forestales, esboza los ingredientes esenciales de los ejercicios exitosos de participacin pblica, provee una visin nacional de desarrollos recientes en la participacin pblica, establece algunos puntos claves de cmo los administradores forestales disean los procesos de participacin pblica, y refleja tendencias futuras. Tambin describe brevemente un ejemplo - el Comit Fronterizo del Parque Wabakimi - del enfoque popular de los grupos asesores. Mientras que el progreso global ha sido prometedor (aunque comparativamente tardo al comenzar), se necesita un mayor esfuerzo a nivel de instrumentacin.
42608905|A round table discussion was convened to explore divergent views on the potential for natural forest management (NFM) for timber to contribute to wide-scale maintenance of forest cover and biological diversity in tropical forests. The general argument for NFM for timber is that, by conferring relatively more economic value on forests than alternative forest uses, NFM for timber is a necessary, though imperfect, means by which extensive areas of forest cover and a large measure of their biological diversity would be maintained outside nature reserves. The discussion centred on five topics: the biological-diversity-related benefits and drawbacks of instituting NFM for timber, the biological and economic constraints on successful NFM for timber, the alternatives to NFM for timber, and the relative merits of community versus industrial concessions as mechanisms by which to institute NFM for timber. Both proponents and critics of NFM for timber should recognise that, first, NFM for timber can be carried out in ways that mitigate the negative effects on biological diversity and, second, there is a common set of conditions necessary to maintain forest cover for any use, including NFM for timber or nature reserves. Un dbat de table ronde a t convoqu pour explorer les vues divergentes sur le potentiel de la grance des forts naturelles (GFN) quant au bois, en vue de contribuer au maintien  grande chelle du couvert forestier et de la diversit biologique des forts tropicales. L'argument gnral en faveur de la GFN pour le bois est que, en confrant relativement plus de valeur conomique aux forts qu'aux usages alternatifs des forts, la GFN est un moyen ncessaire, bien qu'imparfait, pour maintenir d'importantes superficies de couvert forestier et une grande partie de leur diversit biologique en dehors des rserves naturelles. Le dbat se centrait sur cinq sujets: les bnfices relis  la diversit biologique et les inconvnients de l'institution de la GFN pour le bois, les contraintes biologiques et conomiques de la GNF profitable pour le bois, les alternatives  la GFN pour le bois, et les mrites relatifs des concessions communautaires compares aux concessions industrielles en tant que mcanismes  utiliser pour instituer la GFN pour le bois. Les dfenseurs tout comme les critiques de la GFN pour le bois devraient reconnatre que, tout d'abord, la GFN pour le bois peut tre effectue de manire mitigeant les effets ngatifs sur la diversit biologique et, qu'ensuite, il existe une srie de conditions ncessaires pour maintenir le couvert forestier pour tout usage, lesquels comprennent la GFN pour le bois ou les rserves naturelles. Se cit a una mesa redonda para explorar los puntos de vista divergentes sobre el potencial del manejo del bosque natural (MBN) maderero para contribuir al mantenimiento a gran escala de la cubierta del bosque y a la diversidad biolgica en bosques tropicales. El argumento general para el MBN maderero es que, concediendo relativamente un mayor valor econmico al bosque en vez de a los usos alternativos del mismo, el MBN para madera es un medio, aunque imperfecto, necesario, mediante el cual extensas reas de cubierta forestal y una gran cantidad de su diversidad biolgica seran conservadas por fuera de las reservas naturales. La discusin se centr en cinco tpicos: los beneficios y desventajas relacionadas con la diversidad biolgica al iniciar el MBN para madera, las restricciones biolgicas y econmicas basadas en el xito del MBN para madera, las alternativas al MBN para madera, y los mritos relativos de la comunidad vs. las concesiones industriales como mecanismos por medio de los cuales instituir el MBN para madera. Tanto los proponentes como los crticos del MBN para madera deberan reconocer que, primero, el MBN para madera puede llevarse a cabo de una manera que mitigue los efectos negativos en la diversidad biolgica y, segundo, que hay un conjunto comn de condiciones necesarias para mantener la cubierta del bosque para cualquier uso, incluyendo al MBN para madera o reservas naturales.
42608447|Hibiscus elatus in Puerto Rico was surveyed on 34 plantation plots ranging in age from 6.5 to 27 years and, in species adaptability trials, on 97 plots ranging in age from 0.9 to 7.0 years. Three life zones and two soil orders were represented. The standing volumes for the sample plots ranged from 97 to 979 m/ha, yielding growth rates of 4.5 to 36.0 m/ha.yr. Mean annual diameter increment ranged from 0.64 to 2.52 cm/yr and mean annual height increment from 0.5 to 2.6 m/yr. Defects such as large epicormic branches and sweep were common but varied among plots. Crown-to-bole ratios averaged 20.3 for 80 sampled trees. The mean specific gravity for Hibiscus on five different sites was 0.50 g/cm and ranged from 0.40 to 0.53. The performance of Hibiscus was compared with sites elsewhere in the Caribbean Basin and in Hawaii. Hibiscus Elatus en Porto Rico tait relev sur 34 placettes dans des plantations dont les ges taient compris entre 6.5. et 27 ans et, dans des essais d'adaptation d'essences, sur 97 placettes dont les ges taient compris entre 0.9 et 7.0 ans. Trois biomes et deux ordres de sol taient reprsents. Les volumes de bois sur pied pour les placettes d'chantillonnage s'chelonnaient entre 97 et 979 m/ha, donnant des taux d'accroissement de 4.5 jusqu' 36.0 m/ha par an. L'accroissement moyen annuel en diamtre s'chelonnait entre 0.64 et 2.52 cm/an et l'accroissement moyen annuel en hauteur entre 0.5 et 2.6 m/an. Des dfauts comme des grandes branches gourmandes et la courbure taient nombreux mais variaient entre les placettes. Les rapports entre la cime et le ft donnaient une moyenne de 20.3 pour 80 arbres chantillons. La densit moyenne pour Hibiscus sur cinq sites diffrents tait 0.50 g/cm et s'chelonnait entre 0.40 et 0.53. L'accroissement de Hibiscus tait compar avec des sites ailleurs dans les Carabes et en Hawaii. Se realiz un inventario en 34 parcelas establecidas en plantaciones de Hibiscus elatus de 6.5 a 27 aos de edad y 97 parcelas de ensayos de adaptacin de especies, con edades entre 0.9 y 7.0 aos. Las parcelas representan tres zonas de vida y dos orden de suelos. El volumen en pie de las parcelas analizadas vari de 97 a 979 m/ha, con un rendimiento de 4.5 a 36.0 m/ha. ao. El incremento medio anual en dimetro vari de 0.64 a 2.52 cm/ao y el incremento medio anual en altura de 0.5 a 2.6 m/ao. Fue comn encontrar defectos tales como ramas epicrmicas grandes y fustes torcidos, sin embargo, se not gran variacin entre las parcelas. La relacin promedio entre la copa y el fuste fue 20.3 para una muestra de 80 rboles. La gravedad especfica promedio para Hibiscus en cinco sitios diferentes fue 0.50 g/cm, variando entre 0.40 y 0.53 g/cm. Se compara el comportamiento de Hibiscus con otros sitios en la Cuenca del Caribe y Hawaii.
42607093|The wide range of interests of members of the World Conservation Union is emphasised. Not all of IUCN's efforts are achieved through projects but by activities designed to influence societies to conserve nature and to use natural resources in an equitable and sustainable way. Field forestry projects promote such use and aim to ensure that management practices are compatible with the conservation of biological diversity. Pluralistic forms of planning to achieve these ends are favoured, so that the skills of local people are mobilised to bridge the gap between conservation and socio-economic well-being. L'accent est mis sur le large ventail d'intrt des membres de l'Union Mondiale de la Conservation. Les efforts de l'IUCN sont non seulement traduits par des projets mais aussi par les activits visant  encourager la socit  conserver la nature et  utiliser les resources naturelles de manire quitable et continue. Les projets pratiques de la sylviculture promeuvent un tel usage et visent  assurer la compatibilit de la mise en pratique des projets avec la conservation de la diversit biologique. En vue d'arriver a ces rsultats, les formes de planning pluralistiques sont favorises, afin que les comptences des personnes locales soient mobilises pour combler le prsent hiatus entre la conservation et le bien-tre conomique. Se hace nfasis en el amplio rango de intereses de los miembros de la Unin de Conservacin Mundial. No todos los esfuerzos del IUCN se alcanzan a travs de proyectos sino a travs de actividades diseadas para influenciar sociedades para conservar la naturaleza y usar los recursos naturales de una manera equitativa y sostenible. Proyectos forestales de campo promueven tal uso y pretenden asegurar que las prcticas de manejo son compatibles con la conservacin de la diversidad biolgica. Se favorecen las formas pluralsticas de planeacin para alcanzar estos objetivos, de tal manera que las habilidades de la gente local se movilicen para llenar el vaco existente entre la conservacin y el bienestar socio econmico.
42608590|Conflicts over natural resources are becoming more frequent due to increasing populations, the clash between different value systems, and the greater economic and environmental demands on finite resources. The dynamics of conflict are complex as a result of interacting factors related to the parties involved, the nature of the resource, and the stage of development of the conflict. Where people are denied access to resources or are continually marginalised from resource-planning processes, disputes may escalate to civil strife. While the underlying causes of conflict may be clear, there is an urgent need for practical methods to address and resolve conflict. Mechanisms are required to promote understanding and cooperation of an increasing number of stakeholders, especially if resources are to be sustained to support present and future generations. The International Model Forest Program is one example of a multi-stakeholder approach in conflict prevention and resolution at the landscape level of resource management. Les conflits concernant les ressources naturelles deviennent de plus en plus frquents  cause de la croissance des populations, des diffrences entre les systmes de valeurs, et et des exigences plus grandes de l'conomie et de l'environnement sur les ressources limites, la dynamique des conflits est complexe par suite des lments rciproques relatifs aux parties intresss, au genre de ressource et  l'tape du dveloppement du conflit. Si les gens sont refuss l'accs aux ressources, ou s'ils sont exclus des prises de dcision  l'gard de l'utilisation des ressources, les disputes peuvent se transformer en conflits civils. Il existe un besoin urgent de mthodes pratiques pour aborder et rsoudre les conflits. On a besoin des mcanismes pour soutenir l'entente et la coopration d'un nombre accroissant de groupes en jeu, surtout si on veut soutenir les ressources pour les gnrations prsentes et futures. l'International Model Forest Program est un exemple de cette faon - l'implication de plusieurs partenaires - d'aborder le problme de la prvention et de la rsolution des conflits au niveau paysager de l'amnagement des ressources. Los conflictos sobre los recursos naturales estn siendo cada vez ms frecuentes debido al crecimiento de la poblacin, el choque entre los diferentes sistemas de valores y las mayores demandas econmicas y medio ambientales de unos recursos finitos. Las dinmicas del conflictos son complejas como resultado de los factores interactuantes relacionados con las partes involucradas, la naturaleza del recurso y el estado de desarrollo del conflicto. Donde se le ha negado a las personas el acceso a los recursos o que son continuamente marginalizadas de los procesos de planeacin del mismo, las disputas pueden escalar hasta una contienda civil. Hay una necesidad urgente de encontrar mtodos prcticos para enfrentar y resolver el conflicto. Se requieren mecanismos para promover el entendimiento y la cooperacin de un nmero creciente de personas interesadas, especialmente si los recursos han de ser sostenidos para soportar las presentes y futuras generaciones. El Programa Internacional de Modelo Forestal es un ejemplo de un enfoque multi-partidista en la prevencin y solucin de conflictos a nivel de administracin de recursos.
42603494|Two hundred and forty-five, 75 and 91 sample trees of the three species B. plurijuga, G. coleosperma and P. angolensis respectively were measured, and volume in cu. ft. to defined diameter limits was derived. Linear regression analyses relating volume to sectional area at breast height were calculated and volume tables prepared for the exploitable diameter range (> 14 in.) of each species. The precision of the table for millable volume to 6 in. has been tested against typical enumeration data. It is concluded that the standard error of the predicted volume for a 100 per cent enumerated acreage is less than  2 per cent, and that this is negligible when compared with the sampling error using current sampling techniques.
42605249|Heavy infestation by the pine woolly aphid was first discovered in the estates of the East African Agriculture and Forestry Research Organization (EAAFRO) at Muguga in January, 1969, where it was established on pines. The taxonomic status of the woolly aphid is briefly reviewed and it is concluded that only one species, Pineus pini (L.) (Homoptera: Adelgidae), is present in Kenya. The history of the introduction of pines is discussed in relation to the occurrence of P. pini in East Africa, and it is concluded that the pine woolly aphid was introduced from Australia on pine scions, about six years ago. Subsequent spread has since occurred in all directions from Muguga. Two isolated outbreaks have been reported from seed orchard plots in West Kilimanjaro and in the southern highlands of Sao Hill of Tanzania. Pineus pini has been reported on 39 species. Pinus massoniana Lamb., P. elliottii Engelm., P. contorta Dougl. ex Loud., and P. radiata D. Don were the most favoured hosts; while P. patula Schl. and Cham, was less readily attacked. The majority of trees in a stand where the infestation is well established often develop heavy infestations, but a few trees remain untouched. P. ayacahuite Ehrenb. and P. strobus var. chiapensis Martinez, were resistant to attack.
42607199|New Zealand has gained greatly through the introduction of food and other crop plants, herbaceous species, shrubs and trees for use and ornament. Current attempts to restrict biodiversity by eradicating introduced genotypes are to be regretted. La Nouvelle-Zlande a beaucoup bnfici de l'introduction des plantes agricoles, des espces herbaces, des arbrisseaux et des arbres d'utilit et d'ornement. Les effortsactuels de limiter la biodiversit en dracinant les gnotypes introduits sont regrettables. Nueva Zelandia ha ganado mucho debido a la introduccin de alimento y otras plantas de cosecha, especies herbceas, arbustos y rboles para uso y ornamento. Los intentos actuales de restringir la biodiversidad a travs de la erradicacin de los genotipos introducidos causarn remordimientos futuros.
42606869|Sustained yield, as a working principle for forest managers, needs to be superseded by a wider concept of sustainability, applied over the forest sector as a whole. This may conveniently be called 'sustainable forestry'. The practical implications of adopting this concept were addressed by asking 'what is to be sustained' and 'how can sustainability be achieved'? These questions were investigated with the aid of a simple model, which was set up and run on a microcomputer, using the TIMPLAN modelling system designed for forest sector planning. The model was used to try out five management alternatives and reveal their consequences. It was demonstrated that sustained yield does not produce sustainable forestry. The achievement of sustainable forestry depends on working out, step by step, a satisfactory strategy for development of the forest sector, as part of the forest sector policy and planning process. In practice, because of the complexity of the temporal and spatial interactions which are a feature of the sector, this is impracticable without the use of a modelling system. En tant que principe de travail des grants forestiers, le rendement soutenu doit tre supplant par un concept plus large de supportabilit appliqu au secteur forestier considr comme un tout. On pourrait judicieusement appeler ceci 'Sylviculture supportable'. Les implications pratiques entranes par l'adoption de ce concept ont t tudies en se posant les questions 'Que doit on supporter' et 'Comment atteindre cette supportabilit'. Ces questions ont t investiges grce  un modle simple, install et fonctionnant sur un micro-ordinateur, en utilisant le systme de modlisation TIMPLAN destin  la planification du secteur forestier. Le modle a permis d'essayer cinq alternatives de gestion et de rvler leurs consquences. Il est dmontr qu'un rendement soutenu ne gnre pas une sylviculture supportable. L'accomplissement d'une sylviculture supportable dpend de l'laboration, pas  pas, d'une stratgie suffisante au dveloppment du secteur forestier. En pratique, ceci est impossible sans l'emploi d'un systme de modlisation, en raison de la complexit des interactions spatiales et temporelles caractrisants ce secteur. Es necesario reemplazar Produccin Sostenida como el principio director del trabajo de los administradores forestales por el concepto mas amplio de Sostenabilidad que puede ser empleado al sector forestal en su totalidad. Se aplic a las consecuencias prticas de adoptar este concepto a travs de las preguntas siguientes: Que es lo que se va a sostener? y Cmo lograr la Sostenabilidad? Estas preguntas fueron investigadas a travs de un modelo sencillo que requiere el uso de una microcomputadora y la sistema modelada TIMPLAN, diseada especficamente para la plannificacin del sector forestal. El modelo fue usado para someter a prueba cinco alternativas administrativas y revelar sus consecuencias. Fue demostrado efectivamente que la Produccin Sostenida no resulta en la Silvicultura Sostenible. La realizacin efectiva de Silvicultura Sostenible depiende de la elaboracin, paso a paso, de una estrategia adecuada para el desarrollo del sector forestal como parte del proceso de planificacin. Sin embargo, en la prctica, por causa de la complejidad de las interacciones temporales y espaciales que son caractersticas del sector, es impracticable sin el uso de una sistema modelado.
42603254|The nature and importance of genetic variation in forest trees is described, with particular reference to Sitka spruce, Picea sitchensis (Bong.) Carr. The literature referring to patterns and nomenclature of variation is reviewed and it is concluded that the concepts of clinal and ecotypic variation are not mutually exclusive. The natural distribution of Sitka spruce is illustrated and the literature on variation in individual characters is discussed. With the exception of wood qualities, anatomical and morphological traits have received little attention. Most research has been concentrated on variation in total growth and survival as determined from provenance tests. On the basis of its long and continuous range, and from a consideration of the literature, Sitka spruce might be expected to show gradual variation with respect to latitude. However, the number of characters studied and the intensity of sampling have been too low to allow a detailed analysis of the variation pattern.
42608282|Australian forestry is undergoing significant changes in policies and practices while at the same time undergoing major changes in structure and organisation. The current position with respect to some of these issues is summarised, especially the trend from public sector to commercial and corporate models. The principal forces leading to these changes are reviewed and some of the unresolved problems enumerated. Finally, future issues posed by other concurrent changes in conservation, wood production and competition policies are discussed. La forestene Australienne est en priode de changements significatifs de politique et de pratique tout en tant en cours de changements majeurs de structure et d'organisation. La position courante sur certaines de ces questions est rsume, particulirement le courant du secteur public ou modles commerciaux et communautaires. Les forces principales conduisant  ces changements sont rvises et certains des problmes non rsolus sont numrs. Finalement, les questions futures poses par d'autres changements simultans dans la conservation, la production du bois et les plans d'action comptitifs sont examines.
43737737|Expanding the scope of traditional diagnostic sampling to include "relict" trees on a separate record, measure the dbh of leading trees, and note the intensity of illumination of the crowns of all Leading Desirables and of unstocked quadrats, enhances the value of the technique as an effective tool for implementing silviculture and planning management in tropical forest. Elargir le champ de l'chantillonage diagnostique traditionnel, de sorte que l'on enregistre sparment les arbres 'relictes', mesure le dhh des arbres principaux, et note l'intensit d'illumination des houppiers de tous les arbres principaux souhaitables ainsi que des quadrats nus, augmente la valeur de cette technique en tant qu'outil efficace pour implmenter la sylviculture et planifier l'amnagement dans la fort dense tropicale. El aumentar el alcance de muestreo diagnstico tradicional - a travs de incluir en un registro parte los rboles grandes rechazados de cosechas anteriores, medir el dap de todos los rboles seleccionados como Deseables Sobresalientes, y adems anotar la intensidad de la iluminacin de las copas de todos los Deseables Sobresalientes y tambin de los cuadrados sin ningn Deseable Sobresaliente - mejorara el valor de la tcnica como un implemento eficaz para realizar la silvicultura y planificar el manejo en bosques tropicales.
42605222|The aim and purpose of forestry is under discussion and some of the more traditional tenets such as the principle of sustained yield are being criticised. This criticism has focussed upon the claims that: (1) The need for wood products will continue indefinitely. (2) Forestry is a good investment. (3) Forestry produces unique non-marketed benefits. These points are discussed and the conclusion reached that although the need for wood products is likely to increase for at least 50 years, more attention should be paid to growing quality timber as well as quantity cellulose in order to be able to adjust to future demand elasticity. It is agreed that the afforestation of bare ground may produce a favourable return on capital when compared with alternative uses of the land but the conversion of existing forest into plantations runs the risk of failing to maximise monetary returns. Much of the discussion on profitability arises from a growing awareness of the non-marketed benefits of forestry. Forestry should take this into account and should try to maintain non-marketed benefits. Provided this is done, any investment in forestry which produces a positive Net Discounted Revenue per unit of capital at the ruling rate of interest will not only be profitable but will satisfy the ultimate criterion of the provision of positive net social benefit. The source of strength for forestry has always been its concern with the environment. This should be given practical expression by the adoption of the net social benefit criterion derived from greater use of cost benefit analysis techniques in its decision-making.
42606640|The major effects of recent biotechnological developments will be in: (i) enhancing the planting and survival of trees on sites that are naturally environmentally difficult, degraded by poor husbandry or previously unused for forestry; (ii) increasing the yields of both traditional and new products; (iii) increasing the transfer and use of disease-free stock; (iv) improving the yield of wood-based products by efficient conversion processes including the use of micro-organisms; and (v) facilitating the identification and conservation of genetic resources. Specific technologies that are outlined in this paper include: (a) rejuvenation through clonal propagation including cuttings, micro-grafting and tissue culture, (b) haploid generation, (c) somatic embryogenesis, (d) protoplast fusion and gene transfer, (e) cryopreservation of germplasm, (f) microbial breakdown of wood components, (g) forest soil microbiological improvement and risk detection. The stage of development of all these techniques and their current economic application to forest trees varies between species but the potential is high. Les effets les plus importants des dveloppements rcents en biotechnologie seront (i) l'augmentation de la plantation et l'amlioration de la survie d'arbres sur des sites difficiles qui ont t dgrads par de la mauvaise gestion ou qui n'ont pas t utiliss avant pour la sylviculture, (ii) l'augmentation des rendements de produits et traditionnels et nouveaux, (iii) l'augmentation du transfert et de l'utilisation de matriel de reproduction sans maladies, (iv) l'amlioration du rendement de produits de bois par des traitements de conversion efficaces, y compris l'utilisation de micro-organismes, et (v) la facilitation de l'identification et la conservation de ressources gntiques. Les technologies spcifiques qui sont esquisses dans cet article comprennent: (a) la rajeunissement a partir de la multiplication clonale, y compris les boutures, le micro-greffage et la cutture cellulaire, (b) la gnration haplode, (c) l'embryogense somatique, (d) la fusion de protoplasme et le transfert de gees, (e) la cryoprservation du patrimoine hrditaire, (f) la dcomposition microbiale des composants de bois, (g) l'amlioration microbiologique de sols forestiers et la dtection de risques. Le stade de dveloppement de toutes ces techniques et leur application conomique courante aux arbres forestiers varient entre essences mais le potentiel est lev. Los principales efectos de los recientes avances biotecnolgicos sern: (i) un aumento en la plantacin y sobrevivencia de rboles en sitios que son por naturaleza ambientalmente difciles, degradados por causa de una agricultura inapropiada, o que no estaban previamente bajo uso forestal; (ii) un incremento en el rendimiento tanto de los productos tradicionales como de nuevos productos; (iii) un incremento en la transferencia y uso de material de propagacin libre de enfermedades; (iv) el mejoramiento en el rendimiento de productos de la madera mediante procesos de conversin eficientes, incluyendo el uso de microorganismos; y (v) facilitar la identificacin y conservacin de recursos genticos. Las tecnologas especficas que se mencionan en este documento incluyen: (a) rejuvenecimiento a travs de propagacin clonal incluyendo estacas, micropropagacin y cultivo de tejidos, (b) generacin haploide, (c) embriognesis somtica, (d) fusin de protoplastos y transferencia de genes, (e) criopreservacin de germoplasma, (f) descomposicin microbiana de los componentes de la madera, (g) mejoramiento microbiolgico y deteccin de riesgo en suelos forestales. El estado de desarrollo de todas estas tcnicas y su actual aplicacin econmica en especies forestales vara de especie para especie; a pesar de esto su potencial es alto.
42616710|A project for the rehabilitation and sustainable management of communally owned land was set up in a village in the North West Frontier Province, which had been surrounded by woodland until about 50 years ago. The project, supervised by IUCN, used an existing self-help organization in the village and was intended to ensure sustainability by making a significant improvement in the quality of life of the farmers. The first step was to increase agricultural yield, and thus convince villagers of the value of the project. Further steps aimed to reduce the pressure on grazing lands and forests by improving animal husbandry and introducing fuel-efficient stoves. Un projet de rhabilitation et d'amnagement  long terme du terroir commun a t mis sur pied dans un village de la North West Frontier Province au Pakistan. Cette rgion tait 50 ans auparavant entoure d'espaces boiss. Le projet dirig par l'IUCN agit par l'entremise d'une organisation autonome d'aide, propre au village, et a pour but d'assurer un dveloppement qui pourra tre maintenu dans le temps par une amlioration significative de la qualit de vie des fermiers. La premire tape tait d'augmenter le niveau des rcoltes agricoles et ainsi de convaincre les villageois du bien-fond du projet. Les tapes suivantes avaient pour but de rduire la pression sur les pturages et sur les forts par l'amlioration de l'levage et l'introduction de foyers amliors. Un proyecto para la rehabilitacin y manejo sostenible de tierras de propiedad comunal fue establecido en una villa en el North West Frontier Province, la cual haba estado circundada por tierras de bosques maderables hasta hace aproximadamente 50 aos. El proyecto, supervisado por IUCN, utiliz una organizacin de autoayuda y fue propuesto para asegurar la sostenibilidad a travs de hacer una mejora significante en la calidad de vida de los agricultores. El primer paso fue incrementar la produccin agrcola y de esta forma convencer a los habitantes de la villa del valor del proyecto. Los siguientes pasos fueron encaminados a reducir la presin sobre las tierras de pasturas y bosques mediante la mejora de la produccin animal e introduciendo estufas eficientes en el uso de combustible.
42608166|Coppice with standards is a well tried and efficient system for producing large and small dimension timber together, and it has important biological, economic, social and aesthetic advantages. There are great possibilities for developing the system in the tropics and for combining coniferous with broad-leaved species. Le taillis sous futaie est un systme sylvicole qui a fait ses preuves et qui permet de produire avec efficacit  la fois le petit bois et les grumes. Il prsente aussi d'importants avantages biologiques, conomiques, sociaux et esthtiques. Les possibilits sont considrables pour son dveloppement dans les pays tropicaux et pour l'introduction de combinaisons entre feuillus et rsineux. El tallar bajo fustal es un bien experimentado y eficiente sistema silvicultural que permite la produccin simultanea de madera de pequeas y grandes dimensions. Tiene adems importantes ventajas biolgicas, econmicas, sociales y estticas. Hay grandes posibilidades para el desarrollo del sistema en los trpicos por la posibilidad de establecer combinaciones de coniferas y latifoliadas.
42604543|A fifteen years old stand of Teak received three thinning treatments: unthinned, thinned to 320 trees/acre and thinned to 160 trees/acre. Before thinning the stand had about 900 trees, a basal area of 140 ft, a volume of 3000 ft and a gross current annual increment of 250 ft per acre (2200 trees, 32 m, 210 m and 17 m per ha). Only about a half of the number of trees were growing, and about a quarter of the trees were producing threequarters of the total increment. The 50 largest trees per acre exceeded 25 inches girth (20 cm diam.), and the 50 fastest growing trees exceeded 1.4 inches girth increment (1.1 cm diam.). The moderate thinning reduced the basal area to 85 ft and the volume to 2350 ft per acre (760 trees, 20 m and 165 m per ha). The heavy thinning reduced the basal area to 56 ft and the volume to 1600 ft per acre (400 trees, 13 m and 110 m per ha). When the stand was twenty years old, the current annual increment for the unthinned plots was 28 ft per acre, for the moderate thinning 40 ft per acre and for the heavy thinning 162 ft per acre (respectively 2.0 m, 2.8 m and 11.3 m per ha). For the heavy thinning the fastest growing 50 trees per acre had a higher basal area increment (mean of 0.063 ft) than before thinning (mean of 0.055 ft), whereas for the unthinned control the basal area increment (mean of 0.032 ft) had fallen to about 60 per cent of the pre-thinning level. For the heaviest thinning the 50 largest trees per acre exceeded 33 inches girth (27 cm diam.), and the annual increments of the 50 fastest growing trees per acre exceeded 1.0 inches girth (0.8 cm diam.). In the unthinned control the girth increment had fallen to 0.5 inches (0.4 cm diam.). It is clear that, if growth of the potential final crop trees is to be maintained at satisfactory levels, heavy thinning is required by 15 years old and the basal area must be brought down well below 80 ft per acre (20 m per ha). Pattern analysis showed that thinning reinforced rather than changed the pattern of discriminative growth within the stand, even for the heaviest thinning which virtually eliminated crown contacts. The fastest growing individuals, both before and after treatment, tended to remain the same and about 60 percent of the fastest growing trees two years before thinning were also amongst the fastest growing four years after thinning. In this respect the thinned treatments differed little from the control.
42608450|Since the early 1970's, Cordia alliodora has been widely planted on various islands throughout Vanuatu. However, the species has suffered from a root disease, Phellinus noxius, which has caused significant losses in some plantations. Field investigations were started in 1983 which involved a comprehensive survey of all plantations. A follow up survey was carried out in 1985 and a number of observation blocks and trials established. The investigations showed that site conditions were related to the incidence of root disease, and that some native tree species were carriers of P. noxius and potentially important field centres of infection. Precipitation is also thought to play a role in the incidence of root rot. Likewise, it is apparent that extremes of weather, such as experienced during a hurricane, are of considerable importance in serious root rot outbreaks. Investigations into the disease are continuing involving modification of methods of clearing the natural forest to reduce the residual inoculum in the soil, the use of "blocking plants", and the possible use of less susceptible provenances of C. allidora or tree species in plantations. Currently, careful site selection is the most costeffective management of the disease. Depuis le dbut des annes 70 Cordia alliodora a t plant sur une grande tendue sur des les diverses du Vanuatu. Pourtant, l'essence a t atteinte d'une maladie des racines, Phellinus noxius, qui a entran des pertes considrables dans quelques plantations. Des enqutes sur le terrain ont t commences en 1983, qui comprenaient une tude complte de toutes les plantations. Une tude complmtaire a t ralise en 1985 et quelques blocs d'observation et essais ont t tablis. Les enqutes ont montr qu'il y avait un rapport entre les facteurs du milieu et la frquence de la maladie des racines, et que quelques essences forestires indignes taient des plantes porteuses de P. noxius et des foyers potentiellement important d'infection sur le terrain. La preciptation peut aussi influencer la frquence du pourridi Pareillement, il est vident que les extrmes du temps, comme dans un ouragan, sont d'une importance considrable dans les recrudescences graves du pourridi. Des enqutes sur la maladie se poursuivent, entranant la modification des mthodes de dgagement de la fort naturele pour rduire l'inoculum restant dans le sol, l'utilisation de 'plantes bloquantes', et l'utilisation ventuelle de provenances moins susceptibles de C. alliodora ou des essences moins susceptibles dans les plantations. Actuellement, le choix soigneux de sites est la mthode de gestion la plus rentable de la maladie. Cordia alliodora se ha venido plantando extensivamente en varias islas de Vanuatu desde principios de la decada de los setenta. Sin embargo, la especie ha sufrido del ataque de una enfermedad de la raz, Phellinus noxious, la cual ha causado prdidas significativas en algunas plantaciones. En 1983 se iniciaron investigaciones de campo, las cuales incluyeron un inventario de reconocimiento detallado de todas las plantaciones. En 1985 se llev a cabo un segundo inventario de reconocimiento y se establecieron una serie de bloques y ensayos de observacin. Las investigaciones mostraron que las condiciones del sitio estn asociadas con la incidencia de la enfermedad y que algunas especies nativas son portadoras de P. noxious y potencialmente importantes fuentes de inculoo. Tambin se cree que la precipitacin juega algn papel en la incidencia de la pudricin de raz. Igualmente, parece se que condiciones climticas extremas, tales como el efecto de huracanes, son de considerable importancia en el inicio de la enfermedad. Las investigaciones sobre la enfermedad continan, las cuales incluyen una modificacin de mtodos de limpieza del bosque natural a manera de reducir el inoculo residual en el suelo, el uso de "plantas de bloqueo" y el posible uso en plantaciones de procedencias de C. alliodora u otras species menos susceptibles. Actualmente, la seleccin cuidadosa del sitio es la accin de manejo ms efectiva en trminos de costo.
42608661|Pilot plantings of Pinus chiapensis (Mart.) Andresen were established in the mid 1960s and early 1970s in Brazil, Colombia, New Zealand, South Africa and Zimbabwe with seed of Mexican origin. Plot means from these studies, measured between ages 3.5 and 12.5 years, were standardized to a common base of 10 years so that growth and productivity could be compared across sites. Results indicate that on a good site P. chiapensis will produce more than 20 m ha a of wood with specific gravity values of .342 to .351. The species should be grown in areas with fertile, well drained soils, and with annual rainfall greater than 1200 mm uniformly distributed throughout the year. When planted off-site, P. chiapensis does not exhibit the necessary plasticity to adapt to sub-optimal conditions, and productivity is greatly reduced. To preserve threatened populations and to enlarge the existing genetic base of the species, seeds from more than 200 selected trees in eight provenances in Guatemala and Mexico have been collected by the CAMCORE Cooperative since 1983. Conservation banks and provenance/progeny tests are being established by CAMCORE members in Mexico, Brazil, Colombia, Venezuela and South Africa. When collections are completed in 1986, participating organizations will have a genetic base of approximately 400 families. Des plantations d'essai de Pinus chiapensis (Mart.) Andresen ont t tablies pendant les annes 60 et 70 en Brsil, Colombie, Nouvelle-Zlande, Afrique du sud et Zimbabwe avec des graines de provenance mexicaine. Les moyennes de parcelle de ces tudes, mesures entre les ages de 3.5 et 12.5 ans, ont t unifies  une base commune de 10 ans pour que la croissance et la productivit puissent tre compares sur les stations diffrentes. Les rsultats montrent que P. chiapensis produira plus de 20 m ha a de bois avec des valeurs de densit de .342 a .351 sur une bonne station. L'essence doit tre cultive en des rgions avec des sols fertiles et bien drains, et avec une prcipitation annuelle de plus de 1200 mm distribue uniformment pendant toute l'anne. Quand on le plante hors station, P. chiapensis ne montre pas la plasticit ncessaire pour s'adapter aux conditions sous-optimaux et sa productivit est beaucoup rduite. Pour conserver des populations en danger et pour largir la base gntique actuelle de l'essence, des graines de plus de 200 arbres slectionns de huit provenances en Guatemala et Mexique ont t collectionnes par la Cooprative CAMCORE depuis 1983. Des banques de conservation et des tests de provenances/descendance sont en train d'tre tablis par des membres de CAMCORE en Mexique, Brsil, Colombie, Venezuela et Afrique du sud. Quand les collectionnements sont achevs en 1986, les organisations participantes auront une base gntique d' peu prs 400 familles. A mediados de los sesentas y a principios de los setentas se establecieron plantaciones piloto de Pinus chiapensis (Mart.) Andresen en Brasil, Colombia, Nueva Zelanda, Sur Africa y Zimbabwe, con semilla proveniente de Mxico. Las medias de las plantaciones de estos estudios, medidas entre las edades de 3.5 y 12.5 aos, se normalizaron a una base comn de 10 aos, de tal manera que su pudiera comparar el crecimiento y la productividad a travs de los sitios. Los resultados indican que en un buen sitio P. chiapensis produce ms de 20 m3/ha/ario de madera con una densidad relativa de 0.342 a 0.351. Esta especia se debe de cultivar en areas con suelos frtiles y con buen drenaje, con precipitaciones anuales mayores a los 1200 mm distruibuidas uniformemente durante todo el ao. Cuando se planta en un sitio no adecuado, P. chiapensis no exhibe la plasticicidad adecuada para adaptarse a condiciones por abajo de las ptimas y la productividad se reduce mucho. Para preservar poblaciones amenazadas y para agrandar la base gentica de la especie, a partir de 1983 se han colectado semillas de ms de 200 rboles seleccionados en 8 procedencias de Guatemala y Mxico, por miembros de la Cooperativa CAMCORE. Miembros de CAMCORE en Mxico, Brasil, Colombia, Venezuela y Sur Africa, estn estableciendo bancos de semillas y pruebas de procedencia/progenie. Cuando las colecciones se completen en 1986, las organizaciones participantes tendrn una base gentica de aproximadamente 400 familias.
42607282|The 3 international conventions agreed following the Rio conference include provision for monitoring global change. Such monitoring is essential if the intentions of the conventions for policy, management and research are to be achieved. Yet there is no comprehensive, integrated system for collection of land cover and land use data. Current aims and activity wihtin the Global Terrestrial Observing System (GTOS) are described, including the five tier hierarchy of data sampling. A major international collaborative activity by FAO, UNEP and the International Institute for Aerospace Survey and Earth Sciences (ITC) concerns a global land use classification. The IGBP (International Geosphere-Biosphere Programme) with others has also taken an initiative to develop a vegetation classification based on remote sensing with the aim of producing a land cover map of the world. Les trois conventions internationales organises aprs la confrence de Rio laissent place  la surveillance du changement global. Une telle surveillance est essentielle si les intentions des conventions pour l'amenagement, la politique et la recherche doivent tre excutes. Cependant, il n'existe pas de systme complet et integr pour recueillir les donnes de l'usage des terres et de leur couverture. Les activits et les buts actuels dans le GTOS sont dcrits, comprenant la hirachie  cinq tages de l'chantillonage des donnes. Une activit en collaboration internationale majeure du FAO, de l'UNEP et du ITC, existe sur le sujet d'une classification de l'usage global des terres. L'IGBP a aussi entrepris une initiative, avec d'autres corps, pour dvelopper une classification de la vgtation base sur une recherche tlcommande ayant pour but de produire une carte de la couverture terrestre du monde. Los 3 convenciones internacionales acordadas despus de la conferencia en Rio incluyen la provisin para monitorear el cambio global. Tal monitoreo es esencial si se desean alcanzar los designios de las convenciones con respecto a polticas, administracin e investigacin. Todava no hay un sistema integrado total para la recoleccin de datos de cobertura de la tierra y vocacin de uso del suelo. Se describen los objetivos y actividad actual dentro del Sistema de Observacin Terrestre Global (GTOS), incluyendo los cinco niveles de jerarqua de toma de datos. Una actividad colaborativa mayor a nivel internacional por parte de la FAO, UNEP y el Instituto Internacional para el Estudio Aeroespacial y las Ciencias de la Tierra (ITC) se encarga de la clasificacin de uso del suelo a nivel global. EL IGBP (Programa Internacional de Biosfera-Geosfera) en colaboracin con otros programas ha tambin tomado una iniciativa para desarrollar una clasificacin de la vegetacin basada en percepcin remota con el propsito de producir un mapa mundial de cobertura de la tierra.
42606683|This study was carried out at Sao Hill Forest Project, Southern Tanzania, to determine the extent and effects of dieback on growth of Pinus patula, P. caribaea and P. elliottii of ages between 5 and 11 years old. 41 plots of size 0.04 ha were sampled to determine the impact of dieback on height growth and its distribution in relation to stocking, age of stands and catenary position. Results showed that there was statistically significant differences in heights between dieback affected and non-affected trees. It was also found that young stands were mostly affected in height growth and that P. patula was more attacked than the other two species. Mean height to the point of infection (deformation) was 4.0 m, a length which can be utilized by the Sao Hill sawmill and the Southern Pulp and Paper mill. Dieback distribution was neither related to stocking nor age of stands. Distribution of the disease was found to be related to the position of stands along the catena. El estudio se llevo a cabo en el Proyecto Forestal de Sao Hill al sur de Tanzania, con el fin de determinar la amplitud y efectos de la muerte regresiva (del apice hacia abajo) sobre el crecimiento de Pinus caribaea; P. patula and P. elliottii de edades entre los 5 y 11 anos. 41 parcelas de 0.04 Ha fueron muestradas para determinar el impacto de dicha enfermedad sobre el crecimiento en altura y su distribucion con relacion a la densidad, edal del rodal y poscicion en cadena. El analisis estadistico mostro diferencias significativas en altura entre arboles afectados por la muerte regresiva y los no afectados. Tambien se encontro que los rodales mas jovenes fueron mayormente afectados en altura y que la influencia de la enfermedad se manifesto principalmente en P. patula, siendo menor en las otras dos especies. La altura media del punto de inveccin (deformacion), fue de 4.0 m, longitud que puede ser utilizada por el Aserradero de Sao Hill y la Fabrica de Pulpa y Papel del Sur. La distribucion de la muerte regresiva no se asocio con la densidad ni la edad de los rodales. Se encontro que dicha distribucion esta relacionada con la poscicion de los rodales a lo largo de la cadena.
42609020|The relationship between Pinus patula stand productivity and infestation density of Pineus pini was studied at Sao Hill forest plantation. Trees between 7 and 9 years old, growing in two different site classes, were sampled. The frequencies of infested trees were equally high on both good and inferior sites, but population densities were highest on trees on poor sites. This indicates that susceptibility of P. patula to P. pini is equally high on good and inferior sites, but suitability for aphid development is better on the inferior sites. La relation entre la productivit d'un peuplement de Pinus patula et le degr d'infestation de Pineus pini affectant celle-ci a t tudie sur le site des plantations forestires de Sao Hill. Des individus gs de 7  9 ans rpartis sur deux sites de classes de fertilit diffrentes ont t retenus pour l'chantillonnage. Les frquences d'infestation releves sur les arbres situs sur ls deux, types de sites ne prsentaient pas de diffrence significative mais les densits de population de Pineus pini taient plus leves sur les individus situs sur les sites de basse fertilit. Ceci indique que la fertilit du site ne semble pas affecter le degr d'infestation par Pineus pini d'un peuplement de Pinus patula et que, d'autre part, les sites pauvres semblent prsenter des conditions plus favorables au dveloppement des pucerons. En la estacin forestal de Sao Hill se estudi la relacin entre la productividad Pinus patula y la densidad de infestacin de Pineus pini. Se muestrearon rboles entre 7 y 9 aos, creciendo en diferentes clases de sitios. Las frecuencias de rboles infestados fueron igualmente altas en sitios tanto buenos como inferiores, pero las ms altas densidades de poblacin fueron en rboles encontrados en sitios pobres. Esto indica que la susceptibilidad de P. patula a P. pini es igualmente alta en sitios buenos e inferiores, pero que las condiciones para el desarrollo del fido son mejores en sitios inferiores.
42604305|The general phenological characters of Triplochiton scleroxylon are described noting the irregularity of flowering. Factors suggested by various authors as causing this irregularity are discussed. Sparse records of flowering years dating back to 1900 are recorded together with limited rainfall data from some West African countries. The theory that flowering is associated with a relatively low July/August rainfall receives further support. The possible influence of cambium activity is mentioned and also the nutrient status which may be affected by defoliation.
42609989|Interfascicular and fascicular buds were induced by spray applications of BAP at two levels to ortets of Pinus oocarpa. Both types of bud were transferred to agar medium and cultured in vitro. The elongation of these buds was measured to determine whether BAP applications retarded elongation of the shoots in vitro. Stem buds were not retarded at either level. Fascicle buds treated with 100 mg/1 elongated more readily than those treated with 200 mg/1, at this level there was virtually no response. The elongated shoots were transferred to root induction mdium, followed by root elongation medium including a soluble NPK proprietry fertiliser, where rooting was achieved. After transplanting to in vivo conditions, establishment was assessed of the plan tie ts using a comparison of two types of growing-on media. A second comparison included plantlets from in vitro with trimmed roots and untrimmed roots. Better establishment developed from those with trimmed roots. Des bourgeons interfasciculaires et fasciculaires ont t induits par des applications  pulvrisateur de BAP  deux concentrations  des pieds-mres de Pinus oocarpa. Les deux types de bourgeon ont t repiqus sur un milieu  agar-agar et cultivs in vitro. L'allongement de ces bourgeons a t valu pour dterminer si les applications de BAP ont retard l'allongement des pousses in vitro. Les bourgeons de tige n'ont pas t retards, quelle que soit la concentration. Les bourgeons fasciculaires traits avec 100 mg/1 ont allong plus facilement que ceux traits avec 200 mg/1;  cette concentration il n'y avait presque pas de raction. Les pousses allonges ont t repiques sur un milieu de rhizogenese, puis sur un milieu d'allongement des racines qui comprenait un engrais de marque soluble  NPK, o la rhizogenese a pris place. Aprs repiquage dans les conditions in vivo, l'tablissement des plantules a t valu par une comparison de deux types de milieu de culture. Dans une seconde comparaison de plantules d'origine in vitro avec des racines lagues, l'tblissement a t mieux avec des plantules  racines lagues.
42605293|In a computer simulation exercise, samples of trees of various sizes were drawn from assessment plots of 36 trees in two Sitka spruce experiments. Experimental means from the different sample sizes never deviated far from the statistics of the analyses of the complete assessment plots, variances decreasing uniformly with increasing sample size. The observed residual mean squares corresponded very closely with the expected values. It is concluded that little extra information is gained by measuring more than 20 trees in any treatment plot and that as few as 12 will give acceptable results. Lors de recherches de simulation  l'ordinateur, ds chantillons d'arbres de diffrentes dimensions ont t labors  partir des placeaux d'valuation de 36 arbres choisis pour deux essais concernant le sapin Picea sitchensis. Les moyennes exprimentales provenant des diffrentes tailles d'chantillons ne se sont jamais loignes trs sensiblement des statistiques des analyses des placeaux d'valuation complte. Les variances dcroissent uniformment  mesure que la taille de l'chantillon augmente. Les variances rsiduelles observes correspondent trs exactement aux valeurs prvues. On en conclu qu'on ne peut attendre que bien peu d'information supplmentaire en mesurant plus de 20 arbres dans un placeau d'observation et mme qu'en s'en tenant  12 on obtiendrait des rsultats acceptables. En un ejercicio de simulacin de computadora, muestras de rboles de taumaos diferentes fueron escogidas en parcelas de evaluacin de 36 rboles en dos ensayos de pcea de sitka. Promedios experimentales de las muestras de diferentes tamaos nunca se apartaron mucho de la estadstica de los anlisis de las parcelas completas, diminuyndose las variaciones uniformemente con el aumento en el tamao de la muestra. Los cuadrados medios residuos observados se correspondieron muy bien con los valores esperados. Se concluye que poca informacin adicional se obtiene midiendo ms de 20 rboles en cualquier parcela, y un mnimum de 12 dar resultados aceptables.
42605408|New Zealand has remaining approximately 2,820 million cubic feet (80 million cubic metres) of indigenous forest timber which is merchantable by today's standards. Despite a reduction in the rate of cutting from 45 million cubic feet (1.3 million cubic metres) in 1965 to 20 million cubic feet (566 thousand cubic metres) in the year 2000 and beyond, this resource will be depleted in 110 years unless some sure method of sustained yield is attained. Approximately 40% of the remaining podocarp resources (equals 33% of the total indigenous resource including hardwoods) are located on the west coast of the South Island of New Zealand and parts of this area appear suitable for selection forest management and sustained yield production. The forest is briefly described as are past management techniques. This is followed by a description of the selection management methods which are being implemented and the effects these methods are likely to have on the forest structure. The possible implementation of group selection vis a vis stem by stem selection is discussed.
42603100|Dothistroma Blight, a foliage disease caused by the imperfect fungus Dothistroma pini Hulbary, has caused serious damage to young Pinus radiata crops in Kenya. Crops less than eight years of age have been so severely defoliated as to result in widespread deaths. A wide range of species of pine has been found to be susceptible to the disease, but none are so severely attacked as P. radiata. The incubation period of the fungus is in the region of two months after which needle necrosis and sporulation of the fungus occurs. Conidia are splash dispersed within the plantation and may be spread over longer distances by wind and cloud. Fungicides have been found to control the disease but only when applied at uneconomical rates.
42603046|This paper introduces the new Forestry Commission Management Tables which are in course of preparation and which will take the place of the Revised Yield Tables published in 1953. The Management Tables comprise General and Local Yield Tables, Thinning Forecast Tables, Thinning Control Tables and Stand Assortment Tables. The paper introduces a new method of classifying stands into yield classes according to their maximum mean annual increment in place of the existing method of classification into quality classes according to their height/age relationships. Three production classes, based upon total volume production at any given height, are recognised within each yield class. This means that local conditions of growth may be taken into account and thereby enables the general yield tables to be converted into local yield tables. The thinning intensity assumed in the yield tables is the highest which can be applied without reducing total production. This is almost exactly the same as that which, in the great majority of cases, results in the greatest profit. A method of forecasting and controlling thinning yields is described. This method is based upon age, yield class and production class and, within the range of stockings normally encountered, is independent both of type of treatment and of the current level of growing stock. This enables one set of thinning forecast tables to be applied to the whole country and, within fairly wide limits, makes it unnecessary to adjust production forecasts if thinnings are delayed.
42606992|This paper reviews firstly, the dissemination of phytopathogenic organisms either on, in, or together with, various forms of forest tree germplasm. It concludes that relatively few dangerous pathogens are transmitted by tree germplasm in the form of cleaned seed, pollen, or tissue cultures, but that many are disseminated by vegetative tissues, such as cuttings and scions. Secondly, it reviews traditional and modern procedures for the detection and quantification of phytopathogenic organisms which form the basis of disease indexing. Lastly, the paper contains a brief rsum of seed health testing and plant quarantine in relation to transfers of tree germplasm and concludes that rapid, cheap screening and diagnostic techniques are needed to ensure that the currently increasing transfers of germplasm are securely achieved. Dans un premier temps, cet article passe en revue la dissmination des organismes phytopathognes  la fois sur, dans ou avec les diffrents types de matriel gntique utiliss dans le cas d'arbres forestiers. Il conclut que relativement peu d'organismes pathognes sont transmis par l'intermdiaire de matriel gntique d'arbres sous la forme de semences propres, pollen ou cultures de tissus, mais que beaucoup sont dissmins par la voie vgtative, tels que par plants ou greffons. Dans un deuxime temps, on passe en revue les procds traditionnels et modernes de dtection et de quantification des organismes phytopathognes, procdures qui constituent la base de l'indexation des maladies. Finalement est prsent un bref rsum des techniques d'valuation sanitaire des semences et de mise en quarantaine des plantes en relation avec les techniques de transport de matriel gntique. L'article conclut que des techniques de dpistage et de diagnostic peu coteuses sont ncessaires pour assurer que la diffusion de matriel gntique, activit en nette croissance pour le moment, soit conduite en toute scurit. Este artculo revisa primeramente, la diseminacin de organismos ftopatgenos ya sea en, o junto con, diversas formas de germoplasma del rbol de bosque. Concluye que relativamente pocos patgenos peligrosos se transmiten por el germoplasma del rbol en la forma de semilla limpia, polen, o cultivo de tejidos, pero que muchos se propagan por tejidos vegetativos, tales como cortes y vstagos. En segundo lugar, revisa los procedimientos tradicionales y modernos para la deteccin y cuantifcacin de organismos ftopatgenos que forman la base del ndice de enfermedades. Finalmente, el artculo contiene un breve resumen de pruebas de salud de semilla y cuarentena de plantas con relacin a las transferencias de germoplasma de rbol y concluye que se necesitan tcnicas de diagnstico rpidas y baratas para garantizar que se logren efectivamente, las actualmente crecientes transferencias de germoplasma.
42607110|The literature on induction and manipulation of flowering in tropical forest trees is reviewed. The promotion of flowering by water-stress, temperature, photoperiod, defoliation, bark-ringing, gibberellins and growth retardants is considered. Carbohydrate accumulation and an interruption to the vegetative growth of the tree are identified as factors often associated with increased flower initiation. Three approaches to flowering research are identified: phenological studies; single factor experiments; and modelling the processes involved in floral initiation and development. La littrature sur l'induction et la manipulation de la floraison dans les arbres des forts tropicales est rvise. La promotion de la floraison par le stress hydrique, la temprature, la photopriode, l'effeuillage, le ceinturage des arbres, les rgulateurs de croissance, et les retardateurs de croissance est considre. L'accumulation de carbohydrates et l'interruption de la croissance vgtale de l'arbre sont identifis comme des facteurs souvent associs  une plus grande initiation florale. Trois approches de la recherche de la floraison sont identifies: les tudes phnologiques, les expriences  facteur unique, et le simulation du processus impliqu dans l'initiation et le dveloppement floral. Se revisa la literatura en induccin y manipulacin de la floracin en rboles forestales tropicales. Se estudia la promocin de la floracin por estrs por agua, temperatura, fotoperodo, defoliacin, anillado de la corteza y retardantes del crecimiento. Se identifican, la acumulacin de carbohidratos y una interrupcin del crecimiento vegetativo del rbol, como factores a menudo asociados con un incremento en la iniciacin de la floracin. Se identifican tres enfoques para la investigacin de la floracin: estudios fenolgicos, experimentos factoriales simples; y modelar el proceso involucrado en la iniciacin y desarrollo de la floracin.
42607879|This paper describes and gives the results of research conducted by the author on two solar kilns during 1978 and 1979. A system was developed so that the overall performance of the kiln(s) could be analysed in terms of energy input, energy loss and work done to dry the timber. The initial phase of the research was conducted on a truss type kiln during the summer of 1978. During the spring of 1979 a new standing frame kiln which would more easily allow the use of double glazing insulation was designed and built. The kiln was tested and compared to the truss kiln during the summer of 1979. The results showed that the new kiln seemed to perform better than the truss kiln. Two double glazing insulation tests were conducted on the new kiln. The results clearly indicated that the use of double glazing was beneficial; heat loss by conduction and convection was significantly reduced though a slight increase in the amount of radiation lost by reflection and transmission was noticed. Cet article dcrit et donne les resultats des recherches effectues par l'auteur en 1978 et 1979 sur deux schoirs solaires  bois. Un systme a t mis au point permettant d'analyser la performance d'un schoir en termes de l'nergie incidente, des pertes d'nergie et du travail effectu dans le schage. Dans un premier exercice en t 1978 la recherche a port sur un schoir  fermes. Au printemps de 1979 on a conu et construit un schoir  charpente dresse, ce qui facilitait l'utilisation d'un isolement  vitres doubles. Ce nouveau schoir a t test et compar au prcdent pendant l't de 1979, et les rsultats ont confirm la supriorit du nouveau. Deux essais de vitres doubles ont t effectus sur le nouveau schoir, et ont indiqu l'utilit de cette innovation; les pertes de chaleur par la conduction et par la convection ont t reduites, mais une faible partie de l'energie incidente a t perdue par rflexion et par transmission. Este artculo describe los resultados de la investigacin conducida por el autor en dos hornos solares durante 1978 y 1979. Se desarroll un sistema que permite analizar el funcionamiento general del(los) horno(s) en trminos de necesidades de energa, prdida de energa y el trabajo realizado para el secado le la madera. La fase inicial de la investigacin se llev a cabo en un horno solar comn durante el verano de 1978. Durante la primavera de 1979 se dise y construy un horno de marco vertical, el cual permite ms facilmente el uso de aislamiento con vidrio doble. El horno fue probado y comparado con el horno solar comn durante el verano de 1979. Los resultados mostraron que el comportamiento del nuevo horno es aparentemente mejor que el del horno solar comn. Se realizaron dos pruebas de aislamiento de vidrio doble en el horno nuevo.Los resultados indicaron claramente que el uso del vidrio doble fue beneficioso; la prdida de calor por conduccin y conveccin fue reducida significativamente, aunque se noto un pequeo incremento en la prdida de radiacin por refleccin y transmisin.
42610010|Currently there is unprecedented loss of biological diversity, as well as rapidly disappearing cultures and languages that encode traditional ecological knowledge (TEK) on the sustainable use and management of natural resources. The Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) calls for the 'wider use and application' of traditional knowledge, innovations, and practices of indigenous and local communities to enhance in situ biodiversity conservation. The conservation strategy employed by the Kayap Indians of the Brazilian Amazon is taken as an exemplary model. It interlinks forest and agriculture as poles of a classification continuum that focuses on useful Non-Domesticated Resources (NDRs) found in transitional anthropogenic ecosystems, such as savanna ' forest islands', forest openings and old agricultural fields. Kayap TEK has applications for Amazonia and beyond, but equitable utilisation of indigenous knowledge and management models requires guarantees of basic human rights for indigenous and traditional peoples. This includes protection of knowledge and genetic resources, as well as adequate benefit-sharing from their use. International law and practice already require this, but many scientists and environmentalists are unaware of their obligations to fulfil post-CBD requirements. On constate  prsent une perte sans prcdent de la diversit biologique, ainsi que des cultures et des langages qui codifient la connaissance cologique traditionelle (CET) de la grance et de l'usage pouvant tre maintenu des ressources naturelles. La Convention sur la Diversit Biologiue a lanc un appel pour une utilisation et une application plus large de la connaissance traditionnelle, des innovations et des pratiques des communauts indignes et locales pour renforcer la conservation de la biodiversit sur le terrain. Les Indiens Kayap de l'Amazonie Brsilienne tablissent un lien entre la fort et l'agriculture comme poles d'une classification continue qui se centre sur les ressources utiles nondomestiques que l'on trouve dans les cosystmes transitoires anthropogniques comme les 'les forts' de la savanne, les clairires, et les anciens champs agricoles. Ces cosystmes sont grs essentiellement au cours des annes comme cotones cologiques. La CET Kayap offre des applications pour l'Amazonie et mme au-del, mais une utilisation quitable des modles de grance des terres selon la connaissance indigne requiert  la base des garanties de respect des droits de l'homme pour les peuples indignes et traditionnels. Cela comprend une protection de la connaissance et des ressources gntiques, ainsi qu'un partage adquat des bnfices provenant de leur usage et de leur application. La loi et la pratique internationales requirent dj cela, mais beaucoup de scientifiques et d'agents de conservation de l'environnement ne sont pas conscients de leurs obligations de respecter les requtes de la Convention pour la Diversit Biologique. Existe actualmente una prdida sin precedentes de la diversidad biolgica, as como de culturas y lenguajes que codifican el Conocimiento Ecolgico tradicional (TEK) sobre el uso y el manejo sostenible de las riquezas naturales. La Convencin de Diversidad Biolgica hace un llamado a un ' uso y aplicacin ms amplia' del conocimiento tradicional, innovaciones, y prcticas de comunidades indgenas y locales para realzar la conservacin in situ de la biodiversidad.
