The structure of the model used and the processes of calibrating and initialising it for use in the experiment are described. Some qualitative behaviour produced by the model is consistent with that observed in the field, but the figures for growth and yield are low compared with others in the literature. Suggestions on how future versions of the model could be improved and applied for sustainable forest management are included. La prdiction de la croissance et du rendement d'une fort tropicale sous des scnarios de gestion diffrents est un lment important de toute stratgie pour la gestion forestire durable. Le cadre SYMFOR de modlisation utilise des modles individuels montrant la position des arbres pour faire des prdictions. Le cadre est facile  utiliser et trs flexible. Il est possible de construire des modles adapts aux besoins particuliers pour les types forestiers prciss et pour les mthodes de gestion diffrentes se servant du cadre. On prsente une tude des effets de la dure de la rotation; ceci est destin  montrer l'utilit de la mthode plutt que de faire des estimations prcises de croissance et de rendement. On dcrit la structure du modle utilis et les processus de son talonnage et sa prparation pour l'exprience. Un comportement qualitatif produit par le modle est compatible avec les rsultats sur le terrain, mais les chiffres pour la croisance et la rendement sont bas en comparaison avec d'autres dans la littrature. Incluses sont des suggestions pour l'amlioration des versions futures du modle et pour leur application  la grance forestire durable. La prediccin del crecimiento y produccin de bosques tropicales bajo diferentes escenarios de manejo es una parte importante de cualquier estrategia para la administracin sostenible de bosques. La estructura de modelacin SYMFOR utiliza modelos de posicin de rboles, basados en forma individual, para hacer la predicciones. La estructura es tanto, fcil para el usuario como muy flexible. Es posible construir modelos para tipos de bosque especficos y para opciones de manejo particulares utilizando esta estructura. Se presenta un estudio de un caso prctico que considera el efecto de la longitud del ciclo de tala; esto pretende demostrar la utilidad del enfoque ms bien que hacer estimativos precisos de crecimiento y produccin. Se describen la estructura del modelo utilizado y los procesos de calibracin e inicializacin para su uso en el experimento. El comportamiento cualitativo producido por el modelo es consistente con lo observado en el campo, pero las cifras para crecimiento y produccin son bajas comparadas con otras en la literatura. Se incluyen sugerencias de cmo se pueden mejorar las versiones futuras del modelo.
42606595|The rapid and widespread destruction of forests to provide firewood, and the use of dung and crop residues as fuel, is causing widespread concern. While attention is frequently focussed on the silvicultural problems in providing alternative sources of fuel, the equally important need to involve the local inhabitants in any programme is often overlooked. The whole-hearted co-operation of the local inhabitants is necessary to make any scheme a success and stems largely from the way it is planned and administered. This is as important as the silviculture. Stratagems to involve the local villagers, the quantity of fuelwood required, and the choice of species are discussed. La destruction tendue et rapide de forts pour fournir du bois de chauffage, et l'utilisation de fumier et de rsidus de cultures comme combustibles, donnent des inquitudes partout. Pendant qu'on se proccupe frquemment des problmes forestiers de la fourniture de sources alternatives de combustible, on oublie souvent le besoin aussi important d'engager la population locale dans n'importe quel programme. Il faut avoir le concours consentant de la population locale pour russir un projet, et cela depend de l'organisation et la gestion du projet. Cela est aussi important que la sylviculture. Des stratagmes pour engager la population locale, la quantit de bois de chauffage exige, et la slection des essences sont discuts. La prctica creciente y difundida de destruccin de los bosques en bsqueda de lea, y del uso de estircol y residuos agrcolas como combustible, est causando preocupacin general. La atencin al problema de proveer una fuente alterna de energa a las comunidades, ha sido generalmente dirigida hacia el aspecto silvicultural, mientras que otro aspecto igualmente importante como lo es el involucrar a la poblacin local en el programa, es frecuentemente descuidado. La cooperacin de la poblacin local por convencimiento y necesidad sentida, es necesaria para que cualquier programa sea exitoso; este xito depende en gran medida de la manera en que el programa sea planificado y administrado. Esto es tan importante como el aspecto silvicultural. Se discuten estrategias para involucrar a la poblacin local, as como el volumen de lea requerido y la seleccin de las especies.
42608766|Sustainable forest management depends on the sustainable employment of a qualified workforce. In most developing countries forestry operations are carried our under poor working conditions by untrained labourers. This results in excessive waste, environmental damage, breakage of equipment, a high accident frequency, excessive labour-turnover and reduced economic benefits. An effective measure to start overcoming this impasse is to arrange dialogues with the workers, to find out about their problems and to address them. Workforce surveys in Tanzania, Fiji and Zimbabwe provide good examples for how this can be done. La grance soutenue des forts dpend de l'emploi prolong d'une main d'oeuvre qualifie. Dans la plupart des pays en voie de dveloppement, les oprations de foresterie sont excutes dans de mauvaises conditions de travail par des ouvriers non forms. Il en rsulte un gchis excessif, une atteinte  l'environnement, une dtrioration de l'quipement, une frquence haute des accidents, un changement de main d'oeuvre excessif et des bnfices conomiques rduits. Pour surmonter cette impasse, une mesure efficace est le dialogue avec les ouvriers, pour dcouvrir leurs problmes et s'y attaquer. Des tudes sur la main d'oeuvre en Tanzanie,  Fiji et au Zimbabwe fournissent des exemples utiles de moyens d'approche de cette question. El manejo sostenible del bosque depende del empleo sostenible de mano de obra calificada. En la mayora de pases en vas de desarrollo, las operaciones de ingeniera forestal se llevan a cabo bajo condiciones de trabajo pobres por jornaleros sin entrenamiento. Esto da como resultado un desperdicio excesivo, dao ambiental, rotura de equipo, una alta frecuencia de accidentes, un volumen de trabajo excesivo y beneficios econmicos reducidos. Una medida efectiva para comenzar a vencer este obstculo es dialogar con los trabajadores, averiguar acerca de sus problemas y solucionarlos. Estudios de la fuerza laboral en Tanzania, Fiji y Zimbabwe proveen buenos ejemplos de como puede enfocarse esto.
42606412|The Merenberg Forest Reserve is located in the east-central Colombian Andes and lies between 2,000 and 2,500 m above sea level. The average amount of rainfall is 2,000 mm and the mean temperature is 15C. The forest is made up of primary and secondary highland hardwood species dominated by Quercus humboldtii Bompl., Billia columbiana Planch & Lind., Ficus spp., Weinmania spp., and Cecropia spp.. Over 200 bird species have been observed. The forests provide one of the last safe habitats in the region for some mammals, e.g. howler monkeys, tapirs, and nosebears. Merenberg is frequented by scientists and students and it serves as a rich genetic resource for Colombia and other tropical highland areas. Major road construction has been the cause of spontaneous migration into the Merenberg region, and now, after 50 years of sympathetic management, the forest is threatened with destruction unless management can modify the influence of the peasant farmers who, out of necessity, mine the capital of the area's resources. To address this problem, the Foundation has initiated programmes of seed collection, and propagation of native and exotic species for use in reforestation, woodlots and agroforestry and silvipastoral systems. The Andean alder, Alnus jorullensis HBK., and the willow, Salix humboldtiana Willd., have already been successfully established for such systems and the alder has also served as an effective nurse crop for some primary hardwoods. Despite its very limited size, only 350 ha, Merenberg has proved to be large enough for a rich community of plants and animals to perpetuate itself. It is the intention of the Foundation for the reserve to serve as a model conservation project, and to help to educate the local residents to recognise and realise the potential of the forest to raise their own standard of living. La reserva forestal Merenberg est ubicada en la parte oriental-central de los Andes Colombianos. Se la encuentra entre 2,000 y 2,500 m de altitud snm. La precipitation es del orden de 2,000 mm anuales y la temperatura media de 15C. El bosque se constituye de especies latifoliadas de la montaas dominado por Quercus humboldtii Bompl., Billia columbiana Planch & Lind., Ficus spp. y Cecropia spp. Se han observado ms de 200 especies de aves. Los bosques proveen uno de los ltimos medioambientes segures para los mamferos, por ejemplo, mono aullador, danta (tapir) y cosumbo. Cientficos y estudiantes visitan con frecuencia a Merenberg la cual representa un recurso gentico rico para Colombia y otras reas tropicales altas. La construccin de carreteras ha estimulado migracin espontnea hasta la regin de Merenberg, y an despus de 50 aos de administracin responsable, el bosque est en peligro de desparicin al menos de que la administracin pueda modificar la influencia de los campesinos que por necesidad explotan el capital de los recursos de la regin. Para enfrentar este problema, la fundacin ha iniciado programas de decoleccin de semillas y propagacin de especies indgenas y exticas para reforestacin, lea, sistemas agro-forestales y silvo-pastorales. Se han establecido ya el aliso andino, Alnus jorullensis HBK, y sauce Salix humboldtiana Willd., con xito para estos sistemas y el aliso ha servido como un rbol protector efectivo para las frondosas de primera calidad. A pesar de su extensin limitada, 350 ha, Merenberg se encuentra de un tamao adecuado para la perpetuacin de una comunidad rica de plantas y animales. La fundacin quiere la reserva sirve como proyecto modelo de la conservacin, y que ayudara educar y asistir a la poblacin local reconocer y realizar las posibilidades del bosque para mejorar su nivel de vida.
42608328|This paper notes the polarisation in the UNCED follow-up of intergovernmental initiatives aimed at developing criteria and indicators of sustainable forest management at national level. In an effort to chart a possible convergence or harmonisation process, the paper examines some aspects of the conceptual basis of criteria and indicators, and concludes that criteria and indicators have not yet been fully developed by the ongoing initiatives. It issues a warning against over optimism concerning their potential contribution to sustainable forest management but affirms the need for an international harmonisation process. Cet article prend note de la polarisation dans les actions de l'UNCED faisant suite aux initiatives intergouvernementales visant  dvelopper les critres et les indicateurs d'une organisation maintenue des forts au niveau national. Dans un effort pour faire le graphique d'un possible processus de convergence ou d'harmonisation, l'article examine certains aspects de la fondation conceptuelle des indicateurs et critres, et il en conclut que ces derniers n'ont pas encore t pleinement dvelopps par les initiatives courantes. Il met une mise en garde contre un optimisme excessif quant  leur contribution potentielle  une organisation forestire maintenue tout en affirmant le besoin existant d'un processus d'harmonisation international. Este artculo hace notar la polarizacin en el seguimiento del UNCED de las iniciativas inter-gubernamentales dirigidas a desarrollar criterios e indicadores de manejo sostenible de bosques a nivel nacional. En un esfuerzo para diagramar la convergencia o proceso de armonizacin posibles, el artculo examina algunos aspectos de la base conceptual de criterios e indicadores, y concluye que esos criterios e indicadores no han todava sido desarrollados completamente por las iniciativas recientes. Emite una advertencia contra el sobre optimismo que concierne a su contribucin potencial al manejo sostenible de bosquesy afirma la necesidad de un proceso de armonizacin internacional.
42606693|In 1981 IUFRO assumed responsibility for the control, maintenance and development of the 'Oxford system of decimal classification for forestry" (ODC). Project Group P.6.01-00 was set up and its work outlined. The system is of value to forestry research now, and can make a greater contribution in the future as it can overcome language barriers and is suitable for computer processing. The results of the 18th IUFRO World Congress are presented.
42603221|We have all heard the famous saying "whoever could make two ears of corn, or two blades of grass, to grow upon a spot of ground where only one grew before, would deserve better of mankind". This today is the challenge that all of us have to face in India, on the eye of a major industrial revolution. This article discusses how the forester, industrialist, landowner and Government can set about planning for the efficient establishment of wood based industries in India, and for producing all the raw material that will be required to feed the new paperpulp and rayon mills. The task set before the forester is to evolve better methods of growing more industrial wood on less area; the task before the industrialist is to create an incentive for the raising of trees by paying reasonable prices; the duty of Government is to evolve an effective policy of controlling prices of raw material, and lastly the poor cultivator has a wonderful opportunity of improving his economy by growing trees on his holding.
42607111|Conservation of Australia's biodiversity requires six specific issues to be addressed: 1) conservation of biodiversity across Australia; 2) integrating biodiversity conservation and natural resource management; 3) management of threatening processes; 4) improvement of knowledge; 5) engaging community involvement; 6) international extension. Examination of the Australian Tree Seed Centre's program reveals it to constitute a good model system which comprehensively addresses all six issues even though the Centre's objectives are not focused directly to biodiversity. Much of the recent worldwide input to biodiversity has been at issue, policy and theoretical level. In contrast, the Centre's program is shown to have achieved effective physical progress in forest biodiversity conservation. Six questions spcifiques doivent tre adresses pour assurer la conservation de la biodiversit Australienne: 1 ) conservation de la biodiversit sur toute l' Australie, 2) intgration de la conservation de la biodiversit avec l'organisation des ressources naturelles, 3) cntrole des processus menaants, 4) largissement des connaissances, 5) engager l'implication des communauts, 6) extension internationale. Un examen du programme du Centre de Semences Arboricoles Australien rvle qu'il constitue un bon systme modle qui adresse dans leur totalit toutes les six questions, malgr le fait que les objectifs du Centre ne se concentrent pas directement sur la biodiversit. L'essentiel de la contribution mondiale  la biodiversit s'est effectu au niveau thorique, s' occupant des questions poses et des lignes de conduite. Par contraste il est montr que le programme du Centre a rsult en un progrs physique efficace dans la conservation de la biodiversit des forts. La conservacin de la biodiversidad de Australia requiere que se estudien seis temas especficos: 1) conservacin de la biodiversidad a travs de Australia; 2) integrar conservacin de la biodiversidad y manejo de recursos naturales; 3) manejo de procesos amenazadores; 4) mejoramiento del conocimiento; 5) comprometer la participacin de la comunidad; 6) extensin internacional. Un examen del programa del Centro Australiano de Semillas Arbreas lo revela como lo que constituye un buen modelo de sistemas, el cual estudia exhaustivamente todos los seis temas aun cuando los objetivos del Centro no estn enfocados directamente en biodiversidad. Mucho de el reciente aporte mundial de la biodiversidad ha sido dirigido a los niveles poltico y terico. En contraste, el programa del Centro muestra que ha alcanzado un progreso fsico efectivo en la conservacin de la biodiversidad forestal.
42607849|A high incidence of cankers was observed on Terminalia ivorensis (A. Chev.) at Awi, Ikom, and Oni-Gambari in Southern Nigeria. Incidence was related neither to topography of landscape nor to spacing, and severity increased significantly with plantation age at Awi and Ikom. Investigations designed to reduce its severity through fertilizer application yielded promising results.
42606870|Public forest tenures in Canada share many common features and common problems. Increasing demands on forests for a variety of nonconsumptive goods and services are not handled well by a property rights framework designed, primarily, to attract capital necessary for the orderly exploitation of a naturally occurring timber inventory. Furthermore, resource conservation and the future of industrial timber supplies are threatened by a tenure system which offers few incentives for investments in silviculture on privately management public land. Major changes in forest policy in Canada are anticipated. Management responsibilities for public forests will continue to be divided between the public and private sectors. However, private rights and obligations will be redefined and it is likely that direct public involvement in forest resources management will increase. Les droits de jouissance sur les forts publiques au Canada partagent de nombreuses caractristiques et problmes communs. Les demandes accrues sur les forts pour une quantit de biens non consommables et de services sont mal contrles par un rseau de droits de proprit, primitivement destin  attirer le capital ncessaire  l'exploitation ordonne du stock naturel de bois d'abattage. De plus, la conservation des resources naturelles ainsi que le future de l'approvisionement en bois d'abattage industriels sont menacs par un systme, de droits de jouissance n'encourageant que peu des investissements dans la sylviculture sur des terrains publiques grs de manire prive. Des changements importants dans la politique forestire au Canada sont anticips. Les responsabilits de gestion des forts publiques continueront d'tre partages entre le secteur public et priv. Mais les droits et obligations du secteur priv seront redfinies et il est probable que l'implication directe du secteur public dans la gestion des resources forestires sera augmente. La tenencia de bosques comunales en Canada poseen en comn cietas caractersticas y problemas. El aumento en la demanda de una variadad de bienes y servicios forestales noconsumidores no est bien manejado por la estructura de derechos de propiedad que fue diseada principalmente para atraer el capital necesario para la explotacin ordenada de un inventario de madera que ocurre por naturaleza. Ademas, la conservacin de recursos y el futuro del suministro de madera industrial son amenazados por una sistema de tenencia que ofrece muy pocos incentivos para inversin de fondos en silvicultura en tierras comunales administradas por empresas privadas. Cambios profundos en el programa forestal de Canada estn previstos. Responsibilidades administrativas para los bosques comunales seguirn siendo divididos entre el sector privado y el sector pblico. Sin embargo, derechos y obligaciones privadas sern redefinidos y es muy probable que el compomiso publico en la administracin de recursos forestales aumentar.
42606972|Actions at a variety of levels may positively or negatively affect tropical forests. In Madagascar and Cameroon, sweeping donor-led institutional and land classification changes have taken place; but consultation with local-level officials and villagers has so far been limited, despite a commitment to integrating conservation and development. Meanwhile, at the forest boundary itself, villages each manage a clearly demarcated terrain containing both planted and fallowed farmer plots and a protected forest area used for hunting and/or gathering. Communally-held resources and privately owned fallow lands often present problems for national land tenure systems: though some form of village area tenure within which villagers manage their own disputes would usually solve them. A project approach which identified and supported such village land and forest tenure arrangements would not only be of great rural development value to villagers, but would also often be the most realistic approach to resource sustainability. Des actions prises  diffrents niveaux peuvent affecter les forts tropicales de manire positive ou ngative. A Madagascar et au Cameroun, des changements radicaux se sont produits au sein du systme de classification des terres et des institutions bailleresses de fonds; mais la consultation des officiels et des paysans au niveau local a t fortement limite, malgr une volont d'intgrer conservation et dveloppement. Entre-temps,  la limite mme de la fort, les villages amnagent eux-mmes une superficie clairement dmarque reprenant  la fois une zone de parcelles agricoles plantes et sous jachre et une zone de fort rserve utilise pour les activits de chasse et/ou de cueillette. Les ressources dtenues par une communaut et les terres en jachre dtenues par des privs reprsentent souvent un problme pour le systme foncier national, bien qu'une sorte de droit foncier coutumier grce auquel les villageois rglent leurs conflits, pourrait gnralement rsoudre ces questions. Une approche de projet qui identifierait et supporterait de tels arrangements de droit foncier coutumier, portant sur les terres villageoises et les forts, ne serait pas seulement de grande valeur pour les villageois au point de vue du dveloppement rural mais aussi, elle constituerait souvent l'approche la plus raliste d'un amnagement des ressources qui peut tre soutenu  long terme. Acciones a diferentes niveles pueden afectar positiva o negativamente el bosque tropical. En Madagascar y Camern, cambios institucionales radicales, encabezados por los donantes, y de clasificacin de la tierra han tenido lugar; pero las consultas con oficiales a nivel local y aldeanos han sido hasta el momento limitadas, a pesar del compromiso de integrar la conservacin y el desarrollo. Mientras tanto, en la frontera forestal misma, cada una de las aldeas administra un terreno claramente demarcado que contiene tanto parcelas plantadas como baldas y un rea de bosque protegida utilizada para cacera y/o recoleccin. Recursos mantenidos comunalmente y tierras baldas de propiedad privada frecuentemente presentan problemas para los sistemas nacionales de tenencia de la tierra; aunque algn tipo de aldea con un rea de tenencia en la cual los aldeanos manejen sus propias disputas podra generalmente resolver estos problemas. Un enfoque del proyecto que identificara y apoyara tales arreglos de rea de aldea y tenencia de bosques, no solamente sera de gran valor para el desarrollo rural de los aldeanos, sino que tambin sera frecuentemente un enfoque ms realista para la sostenibilidad del recurso.
42608859|An insight into the problems and opportunities facing foresters in the Mongolian Peoples Republic and those who depend upon the continued well-being of the land, its vegetation and livestock. Un aperu des problmes et possibilits qui confrontent les forestiers dans la Rpublique populaire de Mongolie et ceux qui faire fond sur le bien-tre continu de la terre, de sa vgtation et de son btail. Se presenta un anlisis de los problemas y oportunidades que encuentran los silvicultores en la Repblica Popular de Mongolia y aquella poblacin que depende del continuo bienestar de la tierra, su vegetacin y de los animales de cra.
42604545|Outbreaks of 'Sudden Death' of Anthocephalus cadamba, a disease of unknown etiology, have been sufficiently severe in Costa Rica to justify the abandonment of the planting of this exotic species. The disease is widespread in the region but confined to A. cadamba. The symptoms are typical of a root infection, as the disease occurs in patches and affected trees show cambial and sapwood staining spreading upwards from the roots. Death of feeding roots is another early symptom. Cylindrocladium parvum was closely associated with roots of diseased trees but inoculation tests gave negative results. Les pidmies soudainis entrainant la "mort subite" de Anthocephalus cadamba, un mal d'tiologie encore inconnu, ont t suffisamment svres  Costa Rica pour justifier l'abandon de toute plantation de cette espce exotique. Le mal est largement rpandu dans la rgion mais reste confine  A. cadamba. Les symptmes sont ceux typiques d'une infection de la racine, et la maladie se rpand en taches, et les arbres qui en sont affects prsentent une dcoloration du cambium et de l'aubier qui s'tend  partir des racines. La necrose des racines nourricires reprsente un autre des premires symptmes. On a trouve le fongus Cylindrocladium parvum en association troite avec les racines des arbres affectes, mais les tests d'inoculations se sont rvls ngatifs. Los ataques de 'muerte repentina' de Anthocephalus cadamba, una enfermedad de etiologa desconocida, han sido suficientamente serios en Costa Rica para justificar el abandono de esta especie extica como especie de plantacin. La enfermedad, de distribucin amplia en la regin, est restringida al A cadamba. Los sntomas son tpicos de una infeccin de la raiz, porque la enfermedad ocurre en manchas y los rboles afectados demuestran una descoloracin del cambium y del albura que crece desde las raices por arriba. La muerte de las raices de alimentacin es otro sntoma inicial. Cylindrocladium parvum fue asociado con las raices de rboles enfermos, pero pruebas de inoculacin dieron resultados negativos.
42605292|A method is described for making practical use of Kitamura's method of estimating volume per hectare as the sum of "critical heights" multiplied by the angle count factor (= "basal area factor"), the critical point being defined as the point up each selected tree stem which is exactly covered by the chosen relascope angle (as viewed from the sampling point) in an angle count sample. It is generally too difficult to locate the critical point by actual measurements. Instead, its height is to be obtained from a taper function computed for the species and locality. This function is put in a convenient form, as the "critical height function", which requires only the breast height diameter in relative units ("relascope units") and the total height in metres, to give the critical height of each sample tree in metres. Suitable approximate functions can be derived by computer from data already recorded, or from data specially collected, for example by using the new Telerelaskop. A pocket programmable computer can then be used, with the appropriate critical height function incorporated in its program, and with data easily obtained using a "wide scale" Relaskop (or even with callipers, tape and any kind of "hypsometer" or clinometer) to compute the critical heights, and hence the volume per hectare. It is further shown that the data collected give very simple methods for computing various weighted stand indices, viz. Lorey's stand height, stand form height, and stand form factor. The individual critical heights can also be used as "volume weightings" to allocate total volume estimates to assortments, quality classes, etc. The weightings can also be used when testing or correcting the local critical height functions themselves, so that the system is capable of continuous refinement. Description d'une mthode permettant l'utilisation pratique de l'estimation volumtrique par hectare de Kitamura que l'on obtiendrait en multipliant la somme des "hauteurs critiques" par le coefficient de la mesure angulaire (= coefficient de la surface terrire). Le point critique est dfini comme le point le plus lev de la partie du tronc de l'arbre slectionn qui est couverte par l'angle de mesure choisi pour le Relascope (et vu  partir du point de vise), lors de l'valuation angulaire d'un chantillon. Il est gnralement trop difficile de localiser le point critique  l'aide de mesures relles. Il convient plutt d'obtenir la hauteur du ft  partir d'une fonction de la conicit (dcroissance du ft) calcule pour chaque espce et chaque site. Cette fonction est labore sous une forme qui ne ncessite que le diamtre  hauteur d'homme en units relatives ("units relascope") et la hauteur totale en mtres, pour donner la hauteur critique de chaque arbre chantillon en mtres. Des fonctions approches peuvent tre labores  l'ordinateur  partir de donnes dj enregistres ou spcialement collectes, en utilisant, par exemple, le nouveau Telerelascope. On peut utiliser, alors, un calculateur de poche, en incorporant dans son programme la fonction approprie pour obtenir la hauteur critique  partir des donnes obtenues facilement avec un Relascope  grande chelle (ou mme avec diffrents dendromtres, clisimtres etc.) et calculer ensuite le volume par hectare. On indique ensuite dans cet article, que les donnes collectes permettent de calculer trs simplement diffrents indices pondrateurs tels que la hauteur de peuplement de Lorey, la hauteur de forme d'un peuplement et le coefficient de forme d'un peuplement. Les hauteurs critiques de ft, prises individuellement, peuvent tre utilises comme pondrateurs de volume pour dterminer les cubages par catgories, les classes de qualit etc. par rapport aux estimations du volume total. Ces lments de pondration peuvent galement, tre utiliss lors de l'apprciation ou de la correction des fonctions mmes de hauteur de critique locale, de telle faon que la mthode soit susceptible de donner une prcision approche continue. Se describe un mtodo de hacer uso prctico del mtodo de Kitamura de estimar volumen por hectrea como la suma de 'alturas crticas' multiplicada por el factor de cuenta de ngulo (='factor de rea basal'), siendo definido el punto crtico como el punto del tronco de cada rbol escogido que est cubierto precisamente por el ngulo escogido del relascopio (visto desde el punto de muestreo) en una muestra de cuenta de ngulo. En general, es demasiado difcil localizar el punto crtico por medicin directa. En cambio, su altura se obtiene de una funcin de ahusado, computada por la especie y la localidad. Esta funcin se pone en una forma conveniente, como la 'funcin de altura crtica', que necesita solamente el dimetro a la altura del pecho en unidades relativas ('unidades de relascopio') y la altura total en metros, para dar la altura critica de cada rbol muestra en metros. Funciones aproximadas apropiadas pueden ser derivadas por computadora, utilizando datos ya registrados o datos cosechados de propsito, por ejemplo utilizando el nuevo 'telerelaskop'. Luego, se puede utilizar una computadora programable porttil, con la funcin apropiada de altura crtica incorporada en su programa y con datos fcilmente obtenidos por un relascopio de 'escala amplia' (o aun con calibrador, cinta mtrica, e cualquier clase de hipsmetro o clinmetro) para computar las alturas crticas y de ahi el volumen por hectrea. Adems, se demuestra que los datos recogidos permiten el empleo de mtodos muy simples para computar varios ndices ponderados de masa v. gr., altura de masa de Lorey, altura de forma de masa, y factor d forma de masa. Tambin, se pueden usar las alturas crticas individuas como 'ponderados de volumen' para asignar estimativos de volumen total a surtidos, clases de calidad, etc. Adems, se pueden usar los ponderados cuando se efectan pruebas o correcciones a las mismas funciones de la altura crtica local, siendo el sistema susceptible, por tanto, de un refinamiento continuo.
42605049|Costs and effectiveness of fire control, need for hazard reduction, slash disposal policy, history of slash burning, opportunities for prescribed burning, as well as fire effedts, costs and benefits are described briefly. Most attention is given to the Vancouver Forest District of British Columbia. However, much of the information presented should help quantify some elements in hazard reduction and illustralte the costs and benefits involved generally. Stress is placed on the means to reduce the uncertainty in planning systems for fire control and use. It is suggested that the case for or against fire must be soundly founded in analyses of the costs and probabilities of loss and damage, balanced against the values risked. As recreational and habitational values of forest and associated wildlands increase, values of goods and services produced by, or saved from fire, must be weighed ever more carefully against the desires for a safe, high-quality environment throughout the year in our urbanised valleys. Nevertheless, prescribed fire seems to have an economically defensible role in forest resources management for many years to come.
42608023|The problems of distinguishing Pinus patula Schiede and Deppe ssp. tecunumanii (Eguiluz and Perry) Styles from P. oocarpa Schiede in mixed natural stands in Central America prompted this taxonomic investigation which examines relationships within and between provenances of the two taxa. Orthodox taxonomic descriptions are shown to be unsatisfactory in aiding discrimination between them. A pilot study was planned using 200 trees from five populations of 20 trees from each of the two taxa. Linear discriminant and canonical variable analyses of fifteen needle and cone morphological characters (variables) were carried out. Seven variables were found to contribute significantly to a discriminant function which identified trees as belonging to one or other of the two taxa with only 3% mis-classified. A second discriminant function which used only easily measurable (non-microscopic) variables was calculated; this separated the two taxa with the proportion mis-classified increasing to 9.5%. Canonical variable analysis using the same variables as in the first discriminant function confirmed the presence of two classes (species) and showed that P. patula ssp. tecunumanii is a much more variable taxon than P. oocarpa. Data from further provenances of disputed identity were then included in the analyses. These showed that the following provenances in the CFI International Provenance Trials of P. oocarpa are in fact P. patula ssp. tecunumanii: Mountain Pine Ridge, Belize; San Rafael, Yucul and Las Camelias, Nicaragua. Mexican provenances of P. oocarpa to which the varietal name ochoterenae Martnez is attached are also clearly classified as P. patula ssp. tecunumanii. Finally analysis of data from two provenances of P. patula are presented. This suggests that the citation of the Tecun Umn Pine as being a subspecies of P. patula is correct. Des analyses linaires discriminantes et de variables canoniques employant des combinaisons diffrentes de caractristiques morphologiques ont tabli une distinction entre P. oocarpa Schiede et P. patula Schiede et Deppe spp. tecunumanii (Eguiluz et Perry) Styles. Les rsultats dmontrent que plusieurs provenances dans les Essais Internationaux du CFI sur les provenances de P. oocarpa sont en fait P. patula spp. tecunumanii. Celles-ci incluent les provenances de Mountain Pine Ridge (Belize) et de Yucul, San Rafael et Las Camelias (Nicaragua). Analisis discriminante lineal y analisis de variables canonicas con combinacines diferentes de caracteristicas morfolgicos escogio entre Pinus oocarpa Schiede y P. patula Schiede and Deppe spp. tecunumanii (Eguiluz and Perry) Styles. Los resultados mostraron que algunas procedencias, entre ellas Mountain Pine Ridge, Belize; Yucul, San Rafael y Las Camelias, Nicaragua, en los ensayos internacionales de P. oocarpa y son realmente P. patula spp. tecunumanii.
42606945|In the United Kingdom, the national forest estate has increased substantially since 1950. During this time, forest managers have striven to minimize the combined costs of fire prevention, fire fighting and fire losses. The Forestry Commission has led in the development and application of new technical aids relevant to the scale and dispersed location of UK forests, their climate and terrain. As a consequence, the long-term average size of forest fires in the UK is small, larger fires occurring almost exclusively in periods of prolonged and widespread drought. Currently in the UK, the most effective fire prevention and control requires: (1) a knowledge of the actuarial risk of fire costs and losses, so that strategic budgets can be planned at the correct level; (2) detailed advance planning, provision of equipment and training; (3) at a fire, coordinated deployment of men on the ground and ground-based machines and equipment; (4) the ability to call out small helicopters whenever a fire seems unlikely to be controlled by ground-based crews; (5) the ability to mobilize, control and sustain substantial forces, on the less frequent occasions when a substantial fire develops. Depuis 1950, le domaine des forts nationales du Royaume Uni a considrablement augment. Pendant ce temps, les forestiers se sont efforcs de minimiser les cots de la prvention anti-incendie. Le Service Forestier (Forestry Commission) a dvelopp et mis en pratique des techniques d'aide adquates, fonction de la superficie et de la localisation des forts, du climat et des sites. De ce fait, la grandeur moyenne des feux est modeste, les grands incendies se produisant uniquement en priodes de svres scheresses prolonges. D'une faon gnrale, la prvention et les contrles anti-incendies efficaces au RU, demandent: (1) une bonne connaissance des risques, des cots et des pertes dus aux incendies, afin que les budgets soient planifis en consquence; (2) des plans d'entranement dtaills, et des prvisions de stocks d'quipement prcis; (3) lors d'un incendie, une bonne coordination des hommes, du materiel et des quipements; (4) la possibilit de faire appel  de petits hlicoptres ds qu'il apparat qu'un feu ne pourra tre contrl par les quipes au sol; (5) la possibilit de mobiliser, contrler et assurer des moyens importants dans les cas plus rares de grands incendies. En el Reino Unido, el rea de florestas nacionales ha crecido substancialmente desde 1950. Durante este tiempo, gerentes forestales se han esforzado en reduzir los costos combinados de prevencin de incendios, combate y perdidas en estos. La comisin forestal ha sido lder en el desarollo y aplicacin de nuevas ayudas tcnicas relevantes a la escala y ubicacin dispersas de las florestas en el Reino Unido de su clima y terreno. Como consecuencia, el tamao medio a largo plazo de los fuegos forestales en el Reino Unido es pequeo, incendios mayores ocurren casi exclusivamente en perodos de sequa prolongada y generalizada. Actualmente en el Reino Unido la ms efectiva prevencin y control de incendios requiere: (1) un conocimiento del risgo real de los costos y perdidas de los incendios de modo que un presupuesto estratgico puedan ser planeados a un nivel apropriado; (2) planeamiento previo y detallado, provision de equipo y entrenamiento; (3) en el momento de un incendio, la disposicin de personal de combate, maquinas y equipo; (4) la capacidade de llamar pequeos helicpteros si un fuego parece difcil de ser controlado por personal de combate en tierra; (5) capacidad de mobilisar, controlar y mantener fuerzas substanciales en las ocasiones menos frecuentes cuando ocurre un gran incendio.
42610002|From its severely utilitarian beginnings after World War I, British forest policy has expanded to embrace social, ecological, heritage, aesthetic and even spiritual values largely as a result of the insights and persuasiveness of (often critical) commentators from outside forestry. Such diversity creates problems for policy formulation of achieving balance which depends on an understanding of the relative importance of the various outputs. Many are not traded in markets, so benefit-cost analysis is the obvious tool. Some progress has been made in valuing non-priced outputs, but the 'discovery' of new values has outstripped the development of assessment techniques and the collection of data. Meanwhile the Government has sought to extend markets into new areas. Despite this, direct political pressure is still the most influential 'tool' of policy change and consultation remains the most common means of negotiating such changes. De ses dbuts fortement utilitaires aprs la premire guerre mondiale, la ligne de conduite britanique des forts s'est tendue et embrasse  prsent valeurs sociales, cologiques, de patrimoine, esthtiques, et mme spirituelles, grce aux points de vue des commentateurs extrieurs  la foresterie et  leurs arguments persuasifs. Une telle diversit pose des problmes pour formuler la ligne de conduite et pour atteindre un qulibre qui dpende d'une comprhension de l'importance relative des divers apports. Grand nombre ne sont pas commercialiss sur le march, ce qui rend l'analyse bnfice-cot l'outil vident. Des progrs ont t faits dans l'estimation des apports non valus financirement, mais la 'dcouverte' de nouvelles valeurs a pris le part sur le dveloppement des techniques d'valuation et la collecte des donnes. Le gouvernement s'efforce au mme moment d'tablir des marchs dans de nouveaux secteurs. Malgr tout cela, la pression politique directe est toujours "l'outil" le plus influent pour modifier les lignes de conduite et la consultation reste le mode le plus courant pour ngocier ces changements. Desde sus principios enormemente utilitarios despus de la Primera Guerra Mundial, la poltica de forestal Britnica se ha expandido para cobijar valores sociales, ecolgicos, de herencia, estticos y hasta valores ampliamente espirituales como resultado de los conocimientos y persuasividad (a menudo crticas) de los comentadores por afuera de la ingeniera forestal. Tal diversidad crea problemas para la formulacin de polticas de balance exitosas que dependen de una comprensin de la importancia relativa de los diversos productos. Muchos no son comercializados en mercados, de manera que el anlisis de costos es la herramienta obvia. Se ha hecho algn progreso en valorar productos sin-precio, pero el "descubrimiento" de nuevos valores han aventajado el desarrollo de tcnicas de evaluacin y recoleccin de la informacin. Mientras tanto el Gobierno ha buscado extender los mercados en nuevas reas. A pesar de esto, la presin poltica directa es an la herramienta de cambio ms influyente y la consulta permanece como el medio ms comn de negociacin de tales cambios.
43737736|The deterioration of merchantable trees over time is often assumed to be negligible in growth models and yield calculations. Although the annual probability of becoming unmerchantable is small, the cumulative probability over a cutting cycle is significant, and should be included in yield studies. Logistic regression analyses of permanent sample plot data revealed that changing merchantability can be modelled using species, stand basal area, tree size and time since last logging. The equation developed for the rainforests of north Queensland indicates that up to ten percent of trees may become unmerchantable during a forty year cutting cycle. Il est souvent suppos, dans les modles de croissance et les calculs de la possibilit, que la dtrioration des arbres marchands au cours du temps est ngligeable. Quoique la probabilit annuelle qu'un arbre cesse d'tre marchand soit faible, la probabilit cumulative au cours d'une rotation est significative et l'on devrait l'incorporer dans les tudes de la possibilit. Des analyses par rgression logistique de donnes relatives  des placettes d'chantillonnage permanentes ont montr que l'on peut crer un modle des changements de la qualit marchande en utilisant l'essence, la surface terrire du peuplement, la grandeur de l'arbre et le temps coul depuis la dernire rotation. L'quation dveloppe pour les forts denses humides du nord de la Queensland indique que jusqu' dix pour cent des arbres peuvent cesser d'tre marchands au cours d'une rotation de quarante ans. Con frecuencia, en modelos de crecimiento y clculos de productin, se asume que el deterioro de rboles comerciales a travs del tiempo es insignificante. No obstante de que la probabilidad anual de perder su valor comercial es pequea, la probabilidad acumulativa sobre un ciclo de corte es importante, y debe ser incluida en estudios de produccin. Los anlisis logsticos de regresin de datos de parcelas permanentes revelaron que los cambios de valor comercial pueden modelarse utilizando especies, rea basal del rodal, tamao del rbol y tiempo desde la ltima explotacin forestal. La ecuacin desarrollada para los bosques tropicales del norte de Queensland indica que ms de un diez por ciento de los rboles pueden perder su valor comercial durante un ciclo de corte de cuarenta aos.
42608329|In many countries eucalypt and acacia seed orchards are being established to provide a reliable source of genetically improved seed for reforestation. Yield of seed from some orchards has been disappointingly low and a lack of appropriate pollinators has been suggested as a possible cause. In a study to determine what limits seed production, we found that the number of seeds formed per capsule in eucalypts through natural open-pollination was low in relation to the number of ovules in the flower. Controlled-pollination generally increased the number of seeds per capsule, indicating that the amount of pollen reaching the stigma under open-pollination may be a limiting factor in seed production. Placing hives in seed production areas increased seed quantity and quality (outcrossing rate) at the same time producing useful amounts of honey. Beekeeping products such as honey, honey dew, pollen and propolis, have significant economic value in a number of countries and play an important role in many forestry enterprises. Dans plusieurs pays, des vergers de graines d'eucalyptus et d'acacia sont en train d'tre tablis pour fournir une source sre de graines amliores gntiquement pour le reboisement. La rcolte de graines dans certains vergers a t dcevante, et l'on suggre comme l'une des causes possibles de cette faible production le manque d'agents de pollinisation appropris. Dans une tude pour dterminer ce qui limite la production de graines, nous avons trouv que le nombre de graines formes par capsule par la pollinisation ouverte naturelle chez les eucalyptus tait basse en relation avec le nombre d'ovules dans la fleur. La pollinisation contrle faisait gnralement crotre le nombre de graines par capsule, indiquant que la quantit de pollen atteignant le stigmate dans la pollinisation ouverte pouvait tre un facteur limitatif dans la production de graines. L'tablissement de ruches dans les zones de production de graines accrut la quantit et la qualit des graines tout en produisant en mme temps des quantities utiles de miel. Les produits de l'apiculture comme les diffrentes formes de miel, le pollen et le propolis ont une valeur conomique significative dans de nombreux pays et jouent un rle important dans plusieurs entreprises de foresterie. En muchos pases, los huertos de semilla de eucalipto y acacia estn siendo establecidos para proveer una fuente confiable de semillas genticamente mejoradas para la reforestacin. La produccin de semilla de algunos huertos ha sido decepcionantemente baja y se ha sugerido una carencia de polinizadores apropiados como una causa posible. En un estudio para determinar los factores limitantes en la produccin de semillas, encontramos que el nmero de semillas formadas por cpsula en eucalipto a travs de polinizacin natural abierta fue baja en relacin con el nmero de vulos en la flor. La polinizacin controlada aument generalmente el nmero de semillas por cpsula, indicando que la cantidad de polen alcanzando el estigma bajo la polinizacin abierta puede ser un factor limitante en la produccin de semillas. La colocacin de colmenas en reas de produccin de semillas aument la cantidad y calidad de semillas produciendo al mismo tiempo cantidades importantes de miel. Los productos apcolas como miel, jalea de miel, polen y propolis, tienen valor econmico significativo en un nmero de pases y juegan un papel importante en muchas empresas de ingeniera forestal.
42607493|At rotation age the oldest stands of second rotation Pinus patula were slightly less productive than the first, showing a decline of about 7 per cent in volume yield. Substantial decline was largely confined to one forest block; in the other four blocks productivity of the two rotations was about equal. This final, rather poor performance of the second crop, compared with the position both in 1969 and 1973, appears almost wholly due to prolonged winter droughts in recent years. There is no evidence yet of a long-term productivity problem arising from site degrade due to short-rotation plantation forestry. Les peuplements les plus anciens de Pinus patula ont t un peu moins productifs  la fin de la deuxime rvolution qu'ils l'avaient t lors de la premire, le volume fourni subissant une chute d'environ 7 per cent. Un seul secteur de la fort a subi cette diminution de faon prononce alors que les quatre autres ont donn  peu prs autant pendant la deuxime rvolution que pour la premire. Si on la compare avec les chiffres de 1969 et 1973, cette performance finale assez mdiocre semble avoir surtout pour origine less scheresses hivernales des dernires annes et il n'y a encore  ce jour aucune raison d'envisager l'apparition de problmes de productivit dus  an appauvrissement du site provenant d'une technique forestire base sur des rvolutions courtes. Los rodales ms viejos de Pinus patula de segundo turno fueron un poco menos productivos (a la edad del turno) que los de primer turno-obervndose una reduccin de 7 per cent approximadamente. La disminucin ms importante se limit en general a un solo bloque forestal; en los restantes cuatro bloques, la productividad de los dos turnos fue aproximadamente igual. Parece que este bajo rendimiento al cabo del segundo turno (considerado pobre en comparacin con los resultados de 1969 y 1973) se debe casi totalmente a prolongadas sequas invernales sufridas en los ltimos aos. No existe todava prueba de problemas en la productividad a largo plazo, debidos a la degradacin del sitio como resultado de plantaciones de turno corto.
42603655|This paper notes previous methods of determining the effects of trees on soil properties and lists reasons why these approaches are unsatisfactory for practical purposes. An approach based on site assessment techniques is suggested and developed. The results, which formed part of a thesis by the author (Page, 1967), refer to those soil factors of most significance to tree growth and their effects through time. Explanations for the course of events are put forward in terms of current management practices, and the implications of the results in relation to the maintenance of soil fertility are discussed.
42603274|The opepe shoot borer, Orygmophora mediofoveata Hmps., bores in shoots of Nauclea diderrichii, often causing severe stunting of young trees. Chemical control holds little promise of economic success, except in nurseries, because the insect has several overlapping generations each year and the larvae are concealed. Some control might be achieved through disposal of debris created when transplants are stumped.
42607399|The flexibility of the Gompertz function is demonstrated with data on three mature species groups - Western red cedar, Lodgepole pine and Douglas fir. Trends in the behaviour of the estimated coefficients in the model were detected. It is suggested that use could be made of such trends to evolve generalized yield equations for individual species group or combined species groups. Cet article dmontre la souplesse de la fonction de Gompertz applique aux donnes provenant de trois groupes d'espces  maturit (Thuja plicata, Pinus contorta et Pseudotsuga menziesii). Des tendances ont t constates dans l'volution des coefficients dans ce modle. Il est suggr que l'on pourrait exploiter de telles tendances afin de dvelopper des quations gnralises de rendement pour des groupements d'espces individuelles ou runies. Queda demostrada en este artculo la flexibilidad de la funcin Gompertz, utilizando datos de tres grupos de especies maduros (Thujaplicata, Pinus cortorta y Pseudotsuga menzisi). Se averiguaron las tendencias en el comportamiento de los coeficientes estimados del modelo. Se sugiere que tales tendencias podran utilizarse para desarrollar ecuaciones generales de rendimientos para grupos individuales de especies o para grupos de especies juntadas.
42603889|In 1967 a United Nations survey mission visited West Irian (formerly Netherlands New Guinea) to prepare an economic development plan for investment of U.S. $30 milliona fund established in 1963 when the territory was transferred from the Netherlands to Indonesia, but which was unable to operate significantly before Indonesian withdrawal from the U.N. Over $3 million has been allocated to forestry projects. This paper describes the economic background to forest industrial investment in a country much of which is literally still in the Stone Age; the strategy of development is outlined, and two projects are described in more detail. One of thesethe establishment of a Forest Industries Development Corporationis of interest because it creates a precedent for a U.N. Agency (other than the World Bank) involving direct investment in an exploitative venture intended above all to make profits; it envisages a tripartite structure with U.S. $6 million provided in equal parts of $2 million by private enterprise, the U.N. and the Government of Indonesiawhose contribution will be in the form of cutting rights to 500,000 hectares of climax forest, free of royalties, licence fees or other financial encumbrance. Another project described relates to the development of a village-based wood-carving industry in the Asmat regiona primitive area Where head-collecting and cannibalism are still practised. These projects illustrate the theme that the role of the forester in a developing country demands interests and expertise far removed from those fostered by traditional forestry training; and that attitudes and institutions derived from a developed economy, or a colonial rgime, are often inappropriate to the needs of newly-emergent nations.
42607118|Results from a spacing trial of two species of Eucalyptus grown in the Dry Zone of Sri Lanka are presented. Equations predicting yield of dry stemwood based on initial stocking are derived. Assumptions made in the analysis are discussed.
42603293|The article describes the investigations carried out into the problems of plantation establishment of Klinki Pine in New Guinea. A method of timing of seed collection by means of embryo size observation was developed through the study of cone maturity and fertility. The usual rapid deterioration of Klinki seed was prevented by cool, moist, airtight storage at 38F. Several factors affecting the germination and establishment of seedlings were studied, and recommendations were made on the best combination of seed cover and overhead shade. Heavy losses in the nursery, shown to be due to a time-induced iron deficiency and a root-rot caused by a non-obligatory pathogen, were eliminated by an improvement of the chemical and physical properties of nursery soils. The poor survival on transplanting was traced to an unfavourable top-root ratio of the transplants. The factors influencing survival after planting out were studied and recommendations were made of the best size of planting stock and optimum planting season. The ecological study of secondary succession on cleared plantation sites was used as the basis for timing and method of early tending.
42605079|Describes the construction and use of a simple device, somewhat similar to a circular slide rule, which gives true tree heights from clinometer readings in a few seconds. The device corrects both for varying lengths of baseline and for slope in the ground along which the baseline is measured.
42608535|Bangladesh has a multi-pronged strategy of increasing its wood resources through tree planting and conservation measures. Vast areas of land which were once covered by closed forests are currently denuded (covered by shrubs and grasses) and are awaiting re-afforestation. The costs of tree planting are rising and it may be faster and cheaper to bring the denuded areas under complete forest cover by assisting natural regeneration, rather than through tree planting. This study investigates this possibility. Afin d'augmenter ses ressources en bois, le Bangladesh suit une double stratgie axe sur les plantations et les mesures de conservation. Alors que de vastes surfaces de terres autrefois densment boises, recouvertes aujord'hui de quelques herbes et buissons clairsems, attendant d'tre reboises, le cot des plantations augmente. Il serait peut-tre moins coteux et plus rapide de recrer les forts par la rgnration naturelle que par les plantations. Cette tude enqute sur cette possibilit. Bangladesh tiene una estrategia multiple para aumentar sus recursos forestales a travs de la planta de rboles y otras medidas conservadores. Terranos vastos que estaban cubiertos por bosques estn ahora desnudos (cubiertos solamente por arbustos y pasto) y estn esperando la repoblacin forestal. Los costos de plantar rboles est aumentando y puede que sea ms rpido y ms barato someter los reas denudos a cubierto forestal completo a travs de la regeneracin natural que por la planta de rboles. Este estudio investiga esta posibilidad.
43737756|Biomass Equations to predict total biomass of eight hardwood multipurpose tree species from Australia and Papua New Guinea were derived using data from 10 to 12 trees of each species aged 16 months and 30 months in trials in Zimbabwe. Regressions based on logarithmic transformations of both dependent and independent variables were found to provide best estimates of total biomass. Diameter alone was found to be a good predictor of total biomass. Height was not significant as an additional independent variable but crown diameter was in many cases. When data was pooled to allow comparison of regressions the slopes were found not to be significantly different but the intercepts were significantly different. The best regression equation was obtained when diameter and crown diameter were used as the independent variables. Les quations de biomasse pour prdire la biomasse totale de huit essences feuillues  usages multiples de l'Australie et la Papouasie Nouvelle-Guine furent drives en utilisant des donnes de 10  12 arbres de chaque essence gs de 16 mois et de 30 mois dans des essais en Zimbabwe. Des rgressions bases sur des transformations logarithmiques de variables et dpendantes et indpendantes donnrent les meilleures valuations de la biomasse totale. Le diamtre seul fut un bon paramtre pour predire la biomasse totale. La hauteur ne fut pas significant comme une variable indpendante supplmentaire mais le diamtre de la cime le fut dans beaucoup de cas. Quand les donnes furent mises en commun pour permettre la comparaison des rgressions les pentes ne furent pas significativement diffrentes mais les intercepts le furent. La meilleure quation de rgression fut obtenue quand le diamtre et le diamtre de la cime furent utiliss comme les variables indpendantes. Se derivaron ecuaciones de biomasa para predecir biomasa total de ocho especies de rboles de uso mltiple de Australia y Papua Nueva Guinea utilizando datos de 10 a 12 rboles para cada especie con edades de 16 meses y 30 meses en ensayos en Zimbabwe. Se encontr que las regresiones basadas en transformaciones logaritmicas de variables dependientes e independientes dieron las mejores estimaciones de biomasa total. El dimetro dio una buena prediccin de biomasa total. Como una variable independiente adicional la altura no fue significativa mientras que el dimetro de la copa lo era en muchos casos. Un conjunto de datos, para permitir una comparacin de las regresiones, no mostr diferencias significativas para las pendientes pero si para las intercepciones. La mejor regresin se obtuvo cuando se utilizaron el dimetro del fuste y de la copa como variables independientes.
42608860|Bench felling was introduced to Britain in the late 1970s but instability of felled trees and produce prevented the system's use on steep slopes. Contour felling gives safe working on such slopes and the ergonomie and produce concentration advantages of bench felling. Work is organised in 15 m wide strips running along the contour. Bench trees are felled to lie uphill and give support for trees subsequently felled across them and along the contour. A modified "sink" cut leaves trees on a hinge retained until snedding is completed. Gravity then assists with movement of tree lengths to the timber zone on the lower edge of the strip and where stopper trees prevent further downhill movement. Crosscutting takes place in the timber zone. Sawlogs remain in situ and small roundwood is moved to and stacked in a secondary timber zone. Ergonomic advantages lead to significantly increased felling outputs, particularly with larger trees; and concentration of produce gives greatly increased cablecrane output. The system is also advantageous for forwarders on firm soil conditions where a continuous brash mat is not necessary for travel. L'abattage en gradins a t introduit en Grande Bretagne dans les annes approchant 1980 mais l'instabilit des arbres abattus et des produits a empch l'utilisation du systme sur des pentes rapides. L'abattage suivant les courbes de niveau permet de travailler sans danger sur de telles pentes et donne les avantages ergonomiques et de concentration de produits de l'abattage en gradins. Le travail est organis en bandes de 15 m de large le long de la courbe de niveau. Des arbres gradins sont abattus  s'tendre vers l'amont et  soutenir des arbres abattus dans la suite en travers d'eux et suivant la courbe de niveau. Une coupe 'sink' modifie laisse debout des arbres sur une charnire jusqu' ce que l'branchage soit accompli. Alors, la gravit aide le transport de fts entiers au parc  bois sur le bord d'aval de la bande et o des arbres limites empchent plus de mouvement en aval. Le trononnage prend place dans le parc  bois. Les grumes de sciage restent in situ et de petit bois rond est dplac et empil dans un parc  bois secondaire. Les avantages ergonomiques aboutissent  des rendements d'abattage significativement augments, surtout avec de grands arbres; et la concentration de produits donne un rendement de grue  cble beaucoup augment. Le systme est aussi avantageux pour les dbusqueuses sur des sols compacts o un tapis continu de rmanents n'est pas ncessaire pour le transport. La tala sobre banco fue introducida en Gran Bretaa a finales de la dcada de los setenta, sin embargo, la inestabilidad tanto de los rboles derrabados como del producto, impidi el uso de este sistema en pendientes pronunciadas. La tala en fajas a nivel permite un trabajo seguro en tales pendientes y adems, ofrece las ventajas ergonmicas y de concentracin del producto que promueve la tala sobre banco. El trabajo es organizado en fajas de 15 m de ancho que corren a lo largo de las curvas de nivel. Los rboles soporte son derrubados de manera a quedar orientados paralelos a la pendiente y as servir de banco de los rboles que sern subsecuentemente derrubados sobre ellos y a lo largo de las curvas de nivel. Seguidamente se hace un tipo de corte tal que permita que el rbol al caer quede sostenido del tocn hasta el momento del desrame. La gravedad ayuda entonces al movimiento de las trozas hacia la zona de madera en la parte baja de la faja, donde otros rboles de soporte previenen que el deslizamiento continue. El troceo se da en esta zona. Las trozas permanecen in situ y las piezas pequeas de madera redonda se transportan y se apilan en otra zona secundaria de madera. Ventajas ergonmicas llevan a un incremento significativo en el rendimiento de la tala, particularmente con rboles de gran volumen; adems, la concentracin del producto promueve un gran aumento en el rendimiento del transporte por cablegra. El sistema sera tambin ventajoso para autocargador, debido a que en condiciones de suelo firme, este no tendra problemas de desplazamiento sobre una superficie cubierta de ramas y hojarazca.
42607880|It is suggested that proper timber utilisation is the key to successful management of lowland tropical forests. Past practice in managing these forests has been to utilise one or a very few species of timber and this influenced silvicultural and management systems. Up to the present time, except under certain special conditions, there is no silvicultural system that will ensure adequate natural regeneration of the desired species in the lowland tropical forest. It is suggested that fuller utilisation of the species found in these forests will give more flexibility to silviculture and management which may lead to a management system that will ensure adequate natural regeneration and make other options more attractive. A few suggestions are made as to how fuller timber utilisation can be brought about.
42610004|Forestry issues have become the focus of intense conflicts between environment interest groups and forest products companies in a number of countries. The efforts of groups in the U.K., Germany and the United States to organise a boycott against Canada's largest forest company, MacMillan Bloedel, are described. The boycott against the company focused on the logging of old growth forests in beautiful Clayoquot Sound on the west coast of Vancouver Island, British Columbia. Local environment groups extended their geographic reach and increased the pressure on MacMillan Bloedel, and indirectly on the provincial government, by spurring their counterparts in other countries to boycott the company's products. Assessment of the consequences of the threatened boycotts is difficult, first because it is impossible to disentangle the effects of different pressure techniques, and secondly because some of the most important effects on forest companies may be indirect and delayed. Les questions de foresterie sont devenues le foyer d'intenses conflits entre les intrts environnementaux et les compagnies de produits forestiers dans nombre de pays. Les efforts de groupes de Grande-Bretagne, d'Allemagne et des USA pour organiser un boycott contre la plus importante compagnie forestire du Canada, MacMillan Bloedel, sont relats. Le boycott contre la compagnie se centrait sur la coupe de forts anciennes dans le beau dtroit de Clayoquot sur la cte ouest de Vancouver Island, British Columbia. Des groupes environnementaux locaux tendirent leur champ gographique et accrurent la pression sur MacMillan Bloedel, et, indirectement, sur le gouvernement provincial, en encourageant leurs contreparties dans d'autres pays, de boycotter les produits de la compagnie. Les valuations sur les consquences des menaces de boycotts sont difficiles  effectuer, d'une part parce qu'il est impossible de sparer les effets des diffrentes techniques de pression, et, d'autre part, parce que certains des effets les plus importants sur les compagnies forestires pourraient tre indirects et agir  retardement. La Administracin del rea del Clayoquot Sound en la Columbia Britnica se ha convertido en el foco de actividad de grupos medio ambientales en aos recientes utilizando, o intentando utilizar, boicoteos transnacionales de los productos de las firmas de la industria forestal. Se describen los mtodos empleados por estos grupos y la respuesta del gobierno y de las firmas involucradas.
42604518|By small expenditures of energy in fire-making and herd-protection, mankind has for many thousands of years been able to change the pathways of huge quantities of energy in the atmosphere. Recent meteorological research suggests that the climatic consequences may have been very great. En dpensant peu d'nergie pur provoquer des incendies et pour protger ses troupeaux, l'homme est depuis des millnaires capable de modifier les circuits suivis par d'normes quantits d'nergie atmosphrique. La recherche mtoroligique recente suggre que les consquences climatiques en ont pu tre considrables.
42608679|The debate on forests and their possible role in mitigating effects of climate change has been dominated by analyses related to the physical potential of forests to sequester and store carbon. In comparison, very few economic studies have been carried out, although the role of any activity such as forestry in relation to climate change is, to a large extent, an economic question, and not one that can be determined by calculations based solely on physical measurements. A brief overview is presented of economic analyses concerning forests and climate change, and forestry and the carbon balance. The most important economic analyses necessary for future policy direction are identified. Le dbat sur les forts et leur rle potentiel dans la mitigation des effets du changement climatique a t domin par les analyses concernant le potentiel physique des forts de squestrer et d'accumuler le carbone. En comparaison, trs peu d'tudes conomiques ont t effectues. Cependant, le rle de toute activit comme la foresterie en ce qui concerne le changement climatique est en grande partie une question conomique, et donc ne peut pas tre dtermine par des calculs bass seulement sur les mesures physiques. Un court rsum est prsent des analyses conomiques concernant les forts et le changement climatique, et la foresterie et la balance du carbone. Les analyses les plus importantes pour la direction de la politique future sont identifies.
42608675|The rehabilitation of degraded forest ecosystems is one of many options available to mitigate the effects of greenhouse gases. The Face Foundation has gained experience with such an abatement strategy since the early 1990s in several Joint Implementation projects. Standards and criteria being developed by various organisations are assessed alongside the principles employed by Face in the execution of its reforestation projects. It is concluded that a combination of additionality, cost-effectiveness and sustainability warrants a viable development of forestry and carbon sinks in developing countries. It is recommended that policy makers accept the challenge and take steps to define clear rules for sinks in CDM and accompanying certification. La rhabilitation des cosystmes forestiers dgrads est un des plusieurs moyens disponibles pour temprer les effets des gaz qui causent l'effet serre. La Face Foundation a gagne de l'exprience de cette stratgie de diminution depuis le dbut des annes 1990 avec plusieurs projets conjoints. Des modles et des critres en voie de dveloppement de diverses organisations sont valus  ct des principes employs de Face pendant l'excution de ses projets de reboisement. On conclut qu'une combinaison d'additionalit, d'conomie et de durabilit mrite un dveloppement viable de la foresterie et des rserves de carbone dans les pays en voie de dveloppement. On conseille aux dcideurs d'accepter le dfi et de faire des efforts pour dfinir les rgulations nettes pour les rserves en CDM et la certification qui l'accompagne.
42606636|This study presents the results of an analysis of early genetic variation in Guazuma ulmifolia. The test was established in Nandayure, Guanacaste, Costa Rica, with eight seed sources, and was evaluated during the first 2.6 years. Slight genetic variation was detected between provenances, principally in height growth, stem form and leaf form. Nevertheless important differences in growth and stem form were found between the best and poorest seed sources under study. This is an indication that a considerable genetic variation may exist within the natural range of distribution, which could be detected by studying seed sources from a whole range of climatic conditions, where the species is growing naturally. Cette tude prsente les rsultats d'une analyse de variabilit gntique prcoce en Guazuma ulmifolia. L'essai a t tabli en Nandayure, Guanacaste, Costa Rica, avec huit origines des graines et a t valu pendant les premires 2.6 annes. On a aperu une lgre variabilit gntique entre provenances, principalement pour l'accroissement en hauteur, la forme de la tige et la forme des feuilles. Nanmoins, on a trouv des diffrences importantes d'accroissement et de la forme de la tige entre les meilleures et les plus mauvaises origines des graines tudies. Cela indique qu'une variabilit gntique considrable peut exister  l'intrieur de l'aire naturelle d'extension, qui pourrait tre discerne en tudiant des origines des graines de toute une gamme de conditions climatiques o l'essence se trouve naturellement. Este documento presenta los resultados de un estudio de variacin gentica en Guazuma ulmifolia. La prueba fue realizada en Nandayure, Guanacaste, Costa Rica, y se probaron ocho fuentes de semilla, las que fueron evaluades durante los primeros 2,6 aos. Se detect una ligera variacin gentica entre procedencias, principalmente en crecimiento en altura total, forma del fuste y de las hojas. Las diferencias observadas para estos caracteres entre la major y la peor procedencia fueron considerables. Esto es una indicacin de que es posible esperar una variacin gentica considerable si se estudia una mejor representacin de todo el rango de distribucin natural de la especie.
42607084|The paper considers the changing relationships between forestry and conservation (particularly nature conservation) from the late 1940s to the present day; and compares what has happened on the world scene with that in Britain. It traces the development of ideas during this period  a period which has seen a steady widening of the context in which questions of land use are viewed. There is a table of the chronology of the main events. L'article examine les changements survenus dans les relations de la sylviculture avec la conservation (en particulier la conservation de la nature) de la fin des annes quarante  nos jours, et compare ces changements sur la scne mondiale avec ceux du Royaume-Uni. Un tableau chronologique des principaux vnements est prsent. El artculo considera las relaciones cambiantes entre ingeniera forestal y conservacin (particularmente conservacin de la naturaleza) desde fines de 1940 al presente da; y compara lo que ha ocurrido en la escena mundial con lo que ha pasado en Inglaterra. 42603521|Studies were undertaken to evaluate the effect of various steaming conditions on the reduction of moisture content in green gurjan sleepers, and to determine the effect of steaming on absorption of 60-40 creosote-petroleum preservative. The steaming did not provide an effective means of seasoning green gurjan, nor did it contribute to better absorption. It was, however, determined that treating pressure and temperature had a significant effect on absorption. It was also found that treatment of gurjan sleepers did not provide adequate absorption and distribution of the preservative.
42608370|The damage occasioned by harvesting in a planned manner is assessed. The main features of the approach to damage reduction were: previous surveying and careful construction of roads and skidding trails, climber cutting and directional felling. Harvested volume was 20 m ha. The number of damaged trees over 10 cm in diameter was 5.3 per tree logged and the volume of damage was 0.27 m per cubic metre extracted. Damage caused to the canopy by road and trail cutting, provision of landings and felling damage amounted to a maximum canopy opening of 15%. Les dgts occassionns par une rcolte planifie sont valus. Les principaux aspects de l'approche pour la rduction des dgts taient: les examens prcdents, la construction soigne de routes et de pistes de drapage, coupe des plantes grimpantes et chute dirige. Le volume de la rcolte tait de 20 m3 hectares-1. Le nombre d'arbres abms sur 10cm DHB tait de 5.3 par arbre coup et le volume des dgts tait de 0.25m3 par mtre cube extrait. Les dgts causs  la frondaison par l'ouverture de routes et voies et par la prvision de zones de chute et de dgts ds  la coupe atteignent un maximum d'ouverture de frondaison de 15 %. Se evalan los daos ocasionados por la cosecha en una manera planificada. Las principales caractersticas del enfoque para la reduccin de daos fueron: evaluacin previa y construccin cuidadosa de caminos y senderos de acarreo, corte de enredaderas y tala direccional.
