42608368|The paper underlines the need for sustainable forest development in the tropics and emphasises a broader concept of forest harvesting utilising wood and non-wood forest products. Attention is drawn to the need for environmental impact assessment of harvesting in order to better monitor forest development and utilisation in the tropics. Reference is made to the need for comprehensive planning and control of operations to introduce environmentally friendly and sustainable forest practices with the aim of reducing harvesting costs and the damage to the forest stand, soil and terrain. Examples of recently introduced innovative forest harvesting systems and techniques in tropical forests are highlighted. The FAO Programme on Environmentally Sound Forest Harvesting and Engineering is reviewed. L'article souligne le besoin d'un dveloppement forestier maintenu dans les tropiques et met l'accent sur un concept de rcolte plus large, utilisant les produits forestiers, de bois ou autres. On attire l'attention sur le besoin d'une valuation de l'impact environnemental associ  la rcolte pour mieux contrler le dveloppement et l'utilisation des forts dans les tropiques. Il est fait rfrence au besoin d'une organisation complte et d'un contrle des oprations pour introduire des pratiques forestires  mme d'tre maintenues et soucieuses de l'environnement, ayant pour but de rduire le cot de la moisson et les dgts affectant la position, le sol et le terrain de la fort. Quelques exemples de techniques et systmes innovateurs de rcolte forestire dans les forts tropicales sont mis en lumire. Le programme du FAO sur l'engineering et la rcolte forestiers adapts  l'environnement est pass en revue. El artculo esboza la necesidad de un desarrollo sostenible de bosques en los trpicos y enfatiza un concepto ms amplio de cosecha utilizando productos forestales madereros y no madereros. Se da atencin a la necesidad de evaluar el impacto al medio ambiente asociado con la cosecha para monitorear mejor el desarrollo de los bosques y su utilizacin en los trpicos. Se hace referencia a la necesidad de una planeacin comprensiva y control de operaciones para introducir prcticas forestales sostenibles y benignas con el medio ambiente, con el fin de reducir costos de cosecha y daos a las hileras, suelos y terrenos forestales. Se dan ejemplos de sistemas y tcnicas innovativas de cosecha forestal introducidas recientemente en bosques tropicales. Se revisa el programa de la FAO en cosecha e ingeniera forestales benignas con el medio ambiente.
42603251|Existing resources of raw material in tropical areas can be used as a basis for a whole range of forest products industries. By promoting the economic growth in many presently low income countries, these forest products industries will become very important factors in the national economy of the countries concerned. At present, the trade balance of forest products of the African Continent is passive, in spite of existing forest resources, because the profits drawn from the exportation of round timber do not cover the costs of the importation of processed wood and pulp and paper. But in time industrialisation of tropical countries will take place, and in this respect different branches of the forest products industries, such as sawmilling, plywood industry and veneer manufacture, particle board industry, production of cement-bonded wood-wool boards as well as fibre board and pulp and paper industry will play an important part in the different stages of the development of tropical forest industries. Therefore, the conditions, possibilities, and prospective limits of these forest products industries were discussed with relation to the various processing techniques, degrees of mechanisation, requirements of investment funds and technical training of workers, raw material demand, production costs, utilisation of residues etc. The optimum utilisation of all wood-producing species in tropical areas calls for the erection of horizontally and vertically integrated forest industries, the plants of which have to complement one another in raw material utilisation and power supply. To stimulate development in this direction, some sort of assistance by the government authorities is necessary in the early stages of industrialisation as long as there exist only small local markets and serious lack of capital in tropical countries.
42608767|Shorea leprosula stem cuttings can be successfully rooted in both non-mist and mist propagation systems as long as a consistently low leafto-air vapour pressure deficit (VPD) can be maintained. The rooting percentages obtained were 53% and 55% in non-mist and mist systems respectively. However, significantly more roots were produced in cuttings rooted in the non-mist compared with the mist system (4.6 versus 3.6). Number of roots was negatively correlated with cutting volume. The non-mist system is adaptable for use in remote areas and villages where it may be operated by local people. Les boutures de Shorea leprosula peuvent tre enracines avec succs dans les systmes brumeux et non-brumeux, tant qu'un dficit de pression de la vapeur feuille -  - air peut tre maintenu constamment bas. Le pourcentage d'enracinement obtenu tait de 53% et de 55% en systme respectivement non-brumeux et brumeux. Cependant, la production de racines tait beaucoup plus importante dans les boutures enracines dans le systme non-brumeux que celles du systme brumeux (4.6 au lieu de 3.6). Le nombre de racines tait en corrlation ngative avec le volume de coupe. Le systme non-brumeux est adaptable  un usage dans les rgions et villages retirs o il peut tre opr par des personnes locales. Cortes de tallo de Shorea leprosula pueden enraizar exitosamente tanto en sistemas de propagacin con y sin rocio en tanto como se pueda mantener un dficit de presin de vapor hoja-a-aire consistentemente bajo. El porcentaje de enraizamiento obtenido fue de 53% y 55% en sistemas sin y con rocio respectivamente. Sin embargo, se produjeron significativamente ms races en cortes enraizados en el sistema sin rocio comparado con el sistema con rocio (4.6 contra 3.6). El nmero de races estuvo correlacionado negativamente con el volumen del corte. El sistema sin rocio puede ser adaptado para su uso en reas y aldeas remotas donde puede ser operado por gente local.
42606990|Bole volumes were measured for 3488 trees of 61 species from seven Forest Reserves representing the forest types found in the high forest region of Ghana. Measurements were made using diameter tapes on felled trees and wide angle Spiegel relascope on standing trees with good consistency between the two measurements. From these data two sets of regional volume equations were derived using a single parameter power model based on measurements of diameter at breast height. The model was fitted using a log-normal transformation. Des volumes de fts ont t mesurs pour 3488 arbres comprenant 61 espces et issus de 7 rserves forestires reprsentant les diffrents typologies forestires de la rgion de fort dense humide au Ghana. Les mesures de diamtre ont t ralises en utilisant des rubans sur les arbres abattus et en utilisant un relascope de Bitterlich, modle grand angulaire, sur les arbres debout. Les rsultats obtenus par les deux mthodes ont montr une bonne cohrence. A partir de ces donnes, deux types d'quations de volume rgionales ont t produits en utilisant un modle  paramtre unique bas sur la mesure du diamtre  1,3 mtre. Le modle a t ajust en utilisant une transformation logarithmique normale. Se midieron los volmenes de tronco de 3488 rboles de 61 especies de siete Reservas Forestales que son representativas de los tipos de bosque encontrados en la regin de bosque alto en Ghana. Las mediciones se hicieron utilizando cintas de dimetro en rboles talados y el relascopio Spiegel de ngulo ancho en rboles en pie con una buena consistencia entre las dos mediciones. A partir de estos datos, se derivaron dos conjuntos de ecuaciones de volumen regionales utilizando un modelo de poder de parmetro nico basado en mediciones del dimetro a la altura del pecho. El modelo se ajust utilizando una transformacin log-normal.
42607677|An account is given of a brief visit to the tropical zone of China in Guangdong Province, including impressions of trees planted in farmland, villages and urban areas, agro-forestry in a commune in the Pearl River delta, a remnant of natural forest and some activities of the provincial Forest Research Institute. The high priority accorded to forestry in China and their wish to learn from the experience of the United Kingdom and other Commonwealth countries are mentioned.
42608025|Emphasis given to man-made forestry and artificial regeneration has focussed attention on proper seed storage but reliance has tended to be placed on sophisticated rather than simple methods. The paper describes the use of laminated plastic bags in which seeds were sealed for storage in a vacuum, in air, carbon dioxide, and in nitrogen, and kept at four temperatures ranging from 5 to 35C for up to a year. Germination capacity and energy, and seedling vigour were best maintained by storage in nitrogen followed by carbon dioxide, a vacuum and air, irrespective of temperature. The simple and inexpensive techniques described offer effective, yet low-cost storage of forest tree seed. L'accent donn  la forestrie de plantation et  la rgnration artificielle a concentr l'attention sur le stockage appropri de graines mais les mthodes employes ont tendance  tre sophistique plutt que simples. L'article dcrit l'usage de sacs en plastique lamin dans lesquels les graines sont stockes hermtiquement sous vide, avec de l'air, du dioxide de carbone et de l'arzote, et maintenues  quatre tempratures variant de 5  35c pour jusqu' une anne. La capacit de germination et la vigueur des semis taient maintenues le mieux par stockage avec l'arzote suivit du dioxide de carbone, du vide et de l'air, indpendament de la temprature. Les techniques simples et bon marches qui sont dcrites offrent la possibilit de stockage effectif et  prix rduit de graines d'arbres forestiers. Con los esfuerzos dedicados al plantaciones forestales y regeneracin artificial se ha llamado la atencin a la importancia de los mtodos del almacenamiento efectivo de semillas. Se ha confiado en mtodos sofisticados ms que en mtodos sencillos previamente. Se describe el uso de bolsas de plastico laminado para almacenar semillas en vaco, en aire, en bixido de carbono y en nitrgeno y su almacamiento subsecuente a cuatro temperaturas de 5 hasta 35C durante perodos hasta un ao. El almacamiento en nitrgeno mantuvo mejor la capacidad de germinacin, la energa y vigor de las plantulas con relacin a bixido de carbono, vaco y aire. El efecto de la temperatura no fue significativo. Los mtodos sencillos descritos son baratos y efectivos para el almacenamiento de las semillas forestales.
42608099|Physico-chemical properties of soil under two distinct forest covers, logged forest and teak plantation (23.4  3.3 years), at three different locations in the high forest zone of Ghana were compared using one-way analyses of variance (ANOV A). A total of 28 [20m  20m] random sample plots representing 14 teak/logged forest pairs were included in the study. Particle size and parent material analysis justified subdividing the 14 pairs into five pairs in the loamy sand texture at Bosomoa, six in the loam at Tain II, and three in the sandy loam at Yaya. Higher surface soil horizon bulk densities (Db's) under teak plantation (1.33 g cm) were found at Bosomoa. In contrast, surface soil horizon Db's under teak plantation were lower at Tain II (1.23 g cm) and at Yaya (1.10 g cm). There were no significant differences in Db's between vegetation types within locations. Within the Bosomoa and Yaya locations, ANOVA showed significantly higher nitrogen and magnesium concentrations and organic matter contents in the surface soil horizons under logged forest than under teak plantations. Also phosphorus and potassium concentrations were significantly higher under logged forest at Bosomoa. At the Tain II sites, there were no significant differences among soil nutrient concentrations under teak and native logged forest. In B-horizons, higher calcium in soils under teak plantations in all the study locations was attributed to the active role of teak in pedogenesis. Les proprits physico-chimiques du sol sous deux couverts forestiers distincts - la fort exploite et la plantation de teck (23.4  3.3 ans) -  trois localits diffrentes de la zone de fort  haute altitude du Ghana ont t compares avec l'aide des analyses de variance unidirectionelles (ANOVA). Une totalit de 28 [20m  20m] parcelles choisies au hasard reprsentant 14 paires teck/fort exploite ont t tudies. La grandeur des particules et l'analyse du matriau d'origine ont justifi la subdivision des 14 paires en cinq paires dans la texture de sable glaiseux  Bosomoa, six dans le limon  Tain II, et trois dans le limon sableux  Yaya. Des densits apparentes (Db) plus leves de l'horizon du sol superficiel sous la plantation de teck (1.33 g cm-3) ont t trouves  Bosomoa. Par contraste, les Db de l'horizon du sol superficiel sous la plantation de teck taient plus basses  Tain II (1.23 g cm-3) et  Yaya (1.10 g cm-3). Il n'y avaient pas de diffrences importantes en Db entre les types de vgtation dans les locations. Dans les limites des locations  Bosomoa et  Yaya, ANOVA a dmontr des concentrations d'azote et de magnsium et un volume de matire organique significativement plus leves dans les horizons du sol superficiel sous la fort exploite que sous les plantations de teck. En plus, les concentrations de phosphore et de potassium taient beaucoup plus leves sous la fort exploite  Bosomoa. Aux sites Tain II il n'y avait pas de diffrences significatives parmi les concentrations des lments nutritifs du sol sous la fort teck et sous la fort indigne exploite. Dans les horizons B, plus de Ca dans les sols des plantations de teck dans toutes les locations de l'tude a t attribu au rle actif du teck dans la pdognse. Se compararon las propiedades fsico-qumicas de suelos de dos coberturas boscosas diferentes, bosque en explotacin y plantacin de teca (23.4  3.3 aos), en tres diferentes ubicaciones en la zona forestal alta de Ghana, utilizando un anlisis de varianza de una va (ANOVA). Se incluyeron en el estudio un total de 28 [20 m  20 m] parcelas de muestra aleatorias representando 14 pares de bosque de teca /en explotacin. Los anlisis de tamao de partcula y material parental, justific la subdivisin de los 14 pares en cinco pares en la textura franco arenosa de Bosomoa, seis en la textura franca en Tain II, y tres en la textura arenosa franca en Yaya. La ms altas densidades del horizonte superficial del suelo, bajo la plantacin de teca (1.33 g cm-3) se encontraron en Bosomoa. En contraste, la densidad del horizonte superficial del suelo bajo la plantacin de teca fue ms baja en Tain II (1.23 g cm-3) y en Yaya (1.10 g cmr-3). No hubo diferencias significativas en densidad entre tipos de vegetacin dentro de sitios. Dentro de los sitios de Bosomoa y Yaya, el ANOVA mostr cantidades de nitrgeno y concentraciones de magnesio y materia orgnica contenida en los horizontes superficiales del suelo bajo bosque en produccin significativamente ms altas que bajo plantaciones de teca. Tambin las concentraciones de potasio y fsforos fueron significativamente ms altas bajo bosques explotados en Bosomoa. En los sitios Tain II, no se encontraron diferencias significativas entre las concentraciones nutrientes de suelo bajo teca y bajo bosque nativo en explotacin. En los horizontes B, los contenidos ms altos de Ca en suelos bajo plantaciones de teca en todas las locaciones del estudio fue atribuido al papel activo de teca en la pedogenesis.
42603295|Since a large portion of the numerous species found in the tropical rain forest of South America have low frequency distributions, it is not practical to prepare a volume table for each species. This paper describes a practical and economical method of volume table preparation for heterogeneous forests, which was tried by the writer, in British Guiana.
42603519|The use of slash pine (Pinus elliottii Engelm.) and loblolly pine (P. taeda L.) as exotics is becoming widespread, particularly in Commonwealth countries. The Agricultural Research Council of Central Africa is currently assisting the Forest Departments of Malawi and Rhodesia in arranging seed supplies or designing the field plans for extensive provenance trials of these species. As a further aid, the present article is intended to survey the natural variation in these species and the results of existing provenance studies, many of which have been undertaken in America and described in publications that are not readily available. The following conclusions are drawn from this review. Provenance variation exists in many characters of both adaptive and non-adaptive significance. This variation is more pronounced in loblolly pine, but in both species within-provenance or within-plantation variability may obscure between-provenance differences. For some characters provenance variation is random, but for the majority of traits the patterns of variability in both natural stands and planted provenance tests tend to be clinal with respect to latitude and longitude, resulting in an overall trend from northwest to southeast. This pattern is closely related to the patterns of distribution of low temperature and warm-season precipitation, although plant response may be regulated by photoperiod. Generally, but not exclusively, local sources have proved more adaptable than distant sources to the test site. Conclusions based on early measurements have not always been confirmed by later observations and it is stressed that provenance trials should be continued ideally throughout a complete rotation.
42606283|Casuarina seedlings planted near LaBelle, Florida, failed to form root nodules, and subsequently died. Accordingly, methods of inoculating Casuarina prior to outplanting were investigated. Leaf litter, soil, and root nodules collected near mature C. cunninghamiana were mixed into the potting media of C. glauca. A root nodule concentrate was also tested as a suspension root dip. Leaf litter, soil, and chopped root nodules resulted in 90 per cent nodulation when comprising 9, 50, and between 0.1 and 1 per cent of the potting media respectively. Drying root nodules at 70 C did not affect their inoculating ability. Inocula derived from a root nodule extract was effective only at high concentrations. Des semis de Casuarina plants prs de La Belle, Florida, ont pri, ne pouvant pas former de nodules sur les vacines. On a donc tudi les mthodes d'inoculer les Casuarina avant de les planter. De la litire, du sol et des nodules ramasss sous des specimnes adultes de C.cunninghamiana ont t mlangs a la terre autour des vacines de C. glauca. Un extrait des nodules a t test comme suspension dans laquelle on a tremp les vacines d'autres plantes. Pour des concentrations allant de 9,50 a 0.1% l'utilisation de la litire, du sol et des nodules a donn une russite sur 90% des serris. Les schage des nodules  70 n'affectait pas leur utilit pour l'inoculation. Le trempage dans une suspension, par contre, n'tait efficace qu'a des concentrations fortes. Plntulas de Casuarina, sembradas cerca de La Belle, Florida, no formaron nudillos de las raizes, y subsecumentamente se murieron. En consecuencia, se investigaron los mtodos de inoculacin para la Casuarina antes de su planteo en el campo. Se colectaron las hojas cadas, suelo, y nudillos de las raizes cerca de los rboles maduros de C. cunninghamiana, y estos fueron incorporados en la mesela usada para los recipientes en los cuales se sembraron C. glauca. Tambin, se ensay un concentrado hecho de los nudillos de las raizes, utilizado como una suspensin, en la cual las raizes fueron sumergidas. Las hojas cadas, suelo, y los nudillos tajados de las raizes resultaron en una formacin de nudillos en 90% de las plntulas cuando estas sustancias formaron 9%, 50%, y 0.1% respectivamente de la mesela an los recipientes. El secado de los nudillos de las raizes a 70C no produjo un cambio en su capacidad de inoculacin. Las inculas derivadas de un extractivo de los nudillos de las raizes solamente tuvieron efecto en las concentraciones altas.
42608320|One of the major issues surrounding the debate on sustainability of management of tropical forests is the impact of different forest management strategies on biodiversity. Recent research has suggested a number of options for minimising the risks to biodiversity of forestry operations. The maintenance of extensive conventional national parks and equivalent reserves still constitutes the best option from the purely biological standpoint. However, social, economic and demographic realities, coupled with increased knowledge of the ecology and distribution of tropical forest species, suggests that appropriate forestry practice can also contribute significantly to biodiversity conservation. The optimal strategy should be based upon a system of conventional protected areas, complemented by improved harvesting practices and the retention of unlogged refugia in logged-over forests. L'impact des diffrentes stratgies d'organisation sur la biodiversit est l'une des questions priphriques principales dans le dbat sur le maintien de l'organisation des forts tropicales. La recherche rcente suggre plusieurs options visant  minimiser les risques pour la biodiversit lors des oprations forestires. D'un point de vue purement biologique le maintien tendu des parcs nationaux conventionnels et des rserves quivalentes est encore la meilleure option. Nanmoins, le mariage des ralits sociales, conomiques et dmographiques avec la connaissance plus tendue de l'cologie et de la distribution des espces des forts tropicales suggre qu'une pratique forestire approprie peut contribuer d'une faon significative  la conservation de la biodiversit. La stratgie optimale devrait tre base sur un systme de zones protges connvcntionelles complt par une rduction de l'impact de la rcolte et par la rtention des refuges intacts dans les forts exploites. Uno de los mayores temas en el debate del manejo de la sostenibili-dad de bosques tropicales es el impacto de diferentes estrategias de administracin de bosques en la biodiversidad. Investigacin reciente, ha sugerido un nmero de opciones para minimizar los riesgos a la biodiversidad en operaciones de ingeniera forestal. El mantenimiento de parques nacionales convencionales extensivos y las reservas equivalentes constituye an la mejor opcin desde el punto de vista puramente biolgico. Sin embargo, las realidades sociales, econmicas y demogrficas en conjunto con el incremento del conocimiento de la ecologa y distribucin de especies tropicales forestales, sugieren que una prctica de ingeniera forestal apropiada puede contribuir significativamente a la conservacin de la biodiversidad. La estrategia ptima debera estar basada en un sistema convencional de reas protegidas, complementadas por una reduccin del impacto de la cosecha y la retencin de refugios sin talaren bosques sobre-explotados.
42608798|Camellia grijsii Hance occurs infrequently as a small tree in south China. The fruit contains edible oil which is of interest in medicine as well as nutritionally. Fruit capsules have been shown to be highly resistant to an anthracnose disease (Colletotrichum camelliae Massee) of another Camellia species. Breeding programmes have been in progress for some years which aim to increase seed oil yield; some interest also attaches to breeding for oil quality, flower size and colour and attraction to honey bees. Le Camellia grijsii Hance apparat parfois sous forme d'arbuste en Chine du Sud. Les fruits contiennent une huile comestible qui offre un intrt mdicinal ainsi que nutritif. Les capsules de fruit se sont montres trs rsistantes  la maladie d'anthracnose (Colletotrichum camelliae Masse) d'une autre espce de Camellia. Depuis quelques annes des programmes de culture ont t dvelopps, visant  augmenter la production d'huile provenant des graines. Un intrt est aussi exprim dans la culture pour l'attraction des abeilles  miel, la taille des fleurs et leur couleur. Camellia grijsii Hance es un pequeo rbol que se encuentra poco frecuentemente en China central. La fruta contiene aceite comestible el cual es de inters tanto en medicina como en nutricin. Las cpsulas de la fruta han mostrado ser altamente resistentes a una antracnosis (Colletotrichum camelliae Massee) de otra especie de Camellia. Se han desarrollado por espacio de varios aos, programas de mejoramiento con el fin de incrementar la produccin de aceite de la semilla; ha habido tambin un inters en mejoramiento para la atraccin de abejas, tamao y color de la flor.
42608794|Efficient methods were developed for collecting, storing and analysing growth data from natural moist tropical forest. Permanent sample plots measuring 40m  250m (1 ha) were laid down in three main climatic/geographic regions of Nigeria. Only the centre line was demarcated; two plots were established per 2 km of forest. Trees over 5 cm dbh were measured, and taper functions were used to estimate diameters along the bole in order to calculate the volume of each tree. Plots were reassessed after intervals of 2 or 3 years. Average annual increment for standing bole volume of the entire tree stand was about 5 m ha, of which half was of exploitable timber species, including a quarter of veneer-quality species. Results suggest that THF is robust and can withstand removals of about 50 m ha from the standing bole volume on a 25-year felling cycle. Des mthodes efficaces ont t dveloppes pour recueillir, stocker et analyser les donnes de croissance provenant des forts naturelles humides. Des lots de terrain permanents mesurant 40m  250m (1ha) ont t instaurs dans trois des principales rgions climatiques/gographiques du Nigeria. Seule la ligne mdiane a t dmarque, deux lots ayant t tablis pour 2.5 km de fort. Les arbres de 5cm dbh ont t mesurs et des fonctions attnues ont t utilises pour estimer les diamtres le long du tronc, afin de calculer le volume de chaque arbre. Les lots ont t r-valus aprs des intervalles de 2 ou 3 ans. La croissance moyenne annuelle pour le volume de troncs de l'ensemble du groupe d'arbre tait d'environ 5 m ha, comprenant dans sa moiti des espces de bois exploitable, dont un quart d'espces de qualit de revtement. Les rsultats suggrent que THF est robuste et peut supporter des depletions d'environ 50m ha du volume d'ensemble dans un cycle de coupe de 25 ans. Se desarrollaron mtodos eficientes para recopilar, almacenar y analizar informacin del crecimiento del bosque hmedo tropical natural. Se escogieron parcelas de muestreo permanentes midiendo 40m  250m (1 ha) en tres principales regiones climticas/geogrficas de Nigeria. Se establecieron dos parcelas por 2 km de bosque; solamente se demarc la lnea central. Los rboles 5 cm dbh fueron medidos, y se utilizaron funciones de ahusado para estimar los dimetros a lo largo del tronco, con el fin de calcular el volumen de cada rbol. Las parcelas fueron re-evaluadas despus de intervalos de 2  3 aos. El incremento promedio anual para el volumen de tronco en pie para la parcela completa de rboles fue de aproximadamente 5 mha, del cual la mitad eran especies madereras explotables, incluyendo un cuarto de especies para enchapado. Los resultados sugieren que los bosques hmedos tropicales son robustos y puede soportar remociones de cerca de 50 m ha del volumen de troncos en pie en un ciclo de tala de 25 aos.
42606968|The incentives for landholders to conserve wildlife were removed when colonial governments expropriated this resource from landholders. In Zimbabwe, this process has been reversed with some success under the Communal Areas Management Programme for Indigenous Resources (CAMPFIRE). Government has devolved the authority for wildlife to rural communities. Rural communities now manage and market their wildlife, receive benefits from its sale directly, and are beginning to value and conserve it. This paper uses an example to illustrate some of the principles underlying CAMPFIRE, and shows how these practices are spreading throughout the country. It argues that wildlife will only survive in most of Africa if profitable sustainable utilization is combined with defined access to resources. It attacks 'protectionism' because removing the value from wildlife will remove its ability to compete for space and will ultimately sabotage programmes like CAMPFIRE that at least have some chance of succeeding. Les stimulants qui poussaient les propritaires fonciers  conserver la faune ont t supprims lorsque les gouvernements coloniaux ont retir cette ressource de leurs mains. Au Zimbabwe, ce processus a t invers avec un certain succs par l'intermdiaire du Programme de Gestion des Espaces Communs au Profit des Ressources Indignes (CAMPFIRE). Le gouvernement a dlgu l'autorit dans le domaine de la faune aux communauts rurales. Celles-ci grent et commercialisent maintenant leur faune, elles tirent un bnfice des ventes qui en dcoulent directement et elles commencent  y accorder une certaine valeur et  vouloir la conserver. Cet article utilise un exemple pour illustrer quelques-uns des principes qui constituent les fondements de CAMPFIRE et montre comment ces pratiques se rpandent  travers tout le pays. Il soutient que la faune subsistera dans la plupart des pays africains seulement si une utilisation rmunratrice et soutenable  long terme est combine avec un accs aux ressources clairement dfini. L'article attaque galement la notion de protectionnisme parce que le fait de dvaluer la faune supprimerait sa capacit de combattre pour son espace et finalement minerait dfinitivement des programmes tels que CAMPFIRE lesquels, au moins, prsentent certaines chances de succs. Los incentivos para los terratenientes para conservar la vida salvaje fueron retirados cuando los gobiernos coloniales les expropiaron este recurso. En Zimbabwe, este proceso ha dado marcha atrs con algn xito bajo el Programa de Manejo de Areas Comunales para los Recursos Indgenas (CAMPFIRE). El gobierno ha delegado la autoridad para la vida salvaje a las comunidades rurales. Las comunidades rurales ahora administran y comercializan su vida salvaje, reciben los beneficios de su venta directamente y estn comenzando a valorarla y a conservarla. Este artculo utiliza un ejemplo para ilustrar algunos de los principales fundamentos del CAMPFIRE y muestra como estas prcticas se estn esparciendo a travs de todo el pas. Discute que la vida salvaje solamente sobrevivir en la mayora de Africa si se combina su utilizacin rentable y sostenible con acceso definido a los recursos. Ataca al 'proteccionismo' porque retirando el valor de la vida salvaje, se retirar su habilidad para competir por espacio y finalmente sabotear programas como CAMPFIRE que al menos tienen alguna posibilidad de xito.
42606809|Pinus maximinoi H. E. Moore has been attracting increasing interest as a species suitable for planting on medium to high altitude sites in the tropics and sub-tropics. The results from the assessment of seven provenance trials in Southern Africa are discussed. Of the 15 provenances from Central America represented in this series of trials, only between 7 and 11 were represented on any one site. Analyses of variance were initially carried out on each trial separately and subsequently across-sites analyses were carried out on the full non-orthogonal data set using the REML (residual maximum likelihood) program. Although there was evidence of considerable changes in ranking of provenance performance with site, the Honduran provenances of Dulce Nombre, Tatumbla and Cofrada showed consistently higher volume production than other provenances. Consistently poor producers were the Nicaraguan provenances of Rafael and Jinotega. Provenance by site interactions were found to be very highly significant for all traits considered except basic density. On porte de plus en plus d'intrt  Pinus maximinoi H. E. Moore, qui parat tre une essence qui se prte bien  la plantation dans des sites tropicaux et subtropicaux  une altitude leve ou moyenne. On examine les rsultats de l'valuation de sept tests de provenance raliss au Sud de l'Afrique. Des 15 provenances de l'Amrique centrale reprsentes dans cette srie de tests, entre 7 et 11 seulement taient reprsentes dans un site quelconque. D'abord on a fait des analyses de variance pour chaque test sparment et ensuite on a fait des analyses entresites sur l'ensemble des donnes non-orthogonales en utilisant le programme REML (probabilit rsiduelle maximum). Le classement de la performance des provenances paraissait changer de manire considrable selon le site, mais les provenances honduriennes de Dulce Nombre, Tatumbla et Cofradia montraient rgulirement une production de volume plus leve que celle des autres provenances. La production des provenances nicaraguayennes de Rafael et Jinotega s'avrait rgulirement mdiocre. On a trouv que les interactions des provenances par site taient fort significatives pour tous les traits tudis  part la densit basale. Productividad de distintas variedades de Pinus maximinoi en el Sur de Africa. Pinus maximinoi H. E. Moore ha ido atrayendo gran inters como especie apropiada para plantarse en zonas de altitud media a alta en reas tropicales y subtropicales. En este trabajo se discuten los resultados obtenidos en 7 pruebas realizadas con distintas variedades en el Sur de Africa. De 15 variedades originarias de America Central presentes en esta serie de experimentos, slo entre 7 y 11 estaban representadas en todas las reas. Los anlisis de varianza se realizaron inicialmente en cada ensayo por separado, y ms tarde se llevaron a cabo anlisis cruzados no ortogonales con la serie completa de datos, usando el programa REML (probabilidad residual mxima). Aunque hay evidencias de cambios considerables al comparar variedades y reas, las variedades hondurenas de Dulce Nombre, Tatumbla y Cofrada muestran siempre mayor volumen de produccin que las otras variedades. Igualmente se repite, que los productores ms pobres son las variedades nicaragenses de Rafael y Jinotega. Se encuentra, que la relacin variedad-interaccin con el entorno es altamente significativa para todos los caracteres considerados, excepto para la densidad bsica.
42606279|The closed-cone pine group (Oocarpae) of Central America contains Pinus patula Schiede and Deppe, P. oocarpa Schiede, P. greggii Engelm., P. pringlei Shaw and P. tecumumanii Schwerdtfeger. P. oocarpa has the widest distribution but P. patula is the most important exotic. P. tecumumanii is more widely distributed in Central America than hitherto realized and some outstanding populations of P. oocarpa are now re-attributed to this species. Monographic studies show close taxonomic affinities with P. patula and it will be re-named P. patula subsp. tecumumanii. Species of the group are adapted to a wide range of environments from 13 to 28N latitude and 600 to 2,500 m altitude. They could become the most widely planted conifers in the tropics. La section Oocarpae du genre Pinus en Amrique Central  cones renferms, comprend P. patula, Schiede et Deppe, P. oocarpa, Schiede, P. greggii, Engelm, P. pringlei, Shaw and P. tecumumanii. Schwerdtfeger. P. oocarpa est l'espce la plus largement rpandue, mais P. patula est la plus importante comme essence exotique de plantation. P. tecumumanii est plus frquent qu'il n'tait suppos, et certaines populations de P. oocarpa, de qualit exceptionelle, sont maintenant rattribues  cette espce. Les tudes monographiques montrent des affinits taxonomiques troites avec P. patula, d'o la nouvelle appelation P. patula subsp. tecumumanii. Les espces de cette section sont adaptes  une forte varit de milieux compris entre 13 et 28 de latitude et entre 600 m et 2500 m d'altitude. Elles pourraient devenir les essences rsineuses les plus largement utilises dans les tropiques. El grupo de pinos con conos cerrados (Oocarpae) de America Central comprende las especies Pinus patula Schiede y Deppe, P. oocarpa Schiede, P. greggii Engelm., P. pringlei Shaw y P. tecumumanii Schwerdtfeger. P. oocarpa tiene la distribucin ms extensiva, pero P. patula es la especie extica ms importante. P. tecumumanii tiene una distribucin ms amplia que se pensaba hasta ahora y algunas poblaciones sobresalientes de P. oocarpa se identifican nuevamente como esta especie. Los estudios morfolgicos demuestran que esta especie tiene similaridades taxonmicas estrechas con P. patula, y que se debe clasificarla nuevamente como P. patula subsp. tecumumanii. Las especies del grupo estn adaptas a un rango amplio de ambientes con un latitud de 13-28N y altitud de 600-2500m. Ellas podran llegar a ser las coniferas ms extensivamente plantadas dentro de los trpicos.
42608768|Growth ring widths were studied in four tropical savanna species at four widely separated experimental sites in Zimbabwe. Measurable increments were produced by Colophospermum mopane and Combretum apiculatum; rings were consistently wider in the latter species. A lack of correlation between the amount of wood produced and annual rainfall and mean maximum temperatures suggested that growth models of a different form from those used in temperate regions must be adopted before accurate predictions of wood production in savannas can be made. Measurements could not be made for Acacia karroo and Acacia tortilis where the correlation between growth ring boundary indicators and annual increments could not be demonstrated. La croissance des largeurs d'anneaux a t tudie dans quatre espces de la savane tropicale sur quatre sites exprimentaux bien spars au Zimbabwe. Des augmentations ont t produites par le Colophospermum mopane et Combretum apiculatum; les anneaux taient plus larges de faon constante dans cette dernire espce. Un manque de corrlation entre la quantit de bois produite, la chute de pluie annuelle et les tempratures maximales suggre que des modles de procdure exprimentale diffrents de ceux utiliss dans les rgions tempres doivent tre adopts avant que des prdictions prcises sur la production du bois dans la savane puissent tre donnes. Les mesures ne purent tre prises pour l'Acacia karroo et l'Acacia tortilis, cas o la corrlation entre les indicateurs de limites de la croissance des anneaux et la croissance annuelle ne pouvait tre dmontre. Se estudi el ancho de los anillo de crecimiento en cuatro especies tropicales de sabana en cuatro sitios experimentales ampliamente separados en Zimbabwe. Colophospermum mopane y Combretum apiculatum, produjeron incrementos medibles; los anillos fueron consistentemente ms amplios en esta ltima especie. Una carencia de correlacin entre la cantidad de madera producida y la precipitacin anual y temperaturas mximas promedio sugieren que se deben adoptar modelos de procedimiento experimental diferentes de aquellos utilizados en las regiones templadas antes que se puedan hacer predicciones exactas de la produccin de madera en sabanas. No se pudieron realizar mediciones para Acacia karroo y Acacia tortilis, por lo cual no se pudo determinar la correlacin entre indicadores del borde de los anillos de crecimiento y los incrementos anuales.
42605108|Nigeria is a thickly populated country with a density in excess of 180 persons per square mile. Consequently the pressure on available forest land is high and shifting agriculture destroys vast forest areas annually. Widespread food shortage may result unless quick measures are taken to control its spread to residual forest lands within and outside the forest estate. Cash-cropping and taungya were early attempts at multiple use of the land. The former has led to deficit food-cropping while the latter mainly benefits a minority of farmers. This article suggests that a system of multiple use outside state-controlled forests which combines the benefits of cash-cropping and taungva and which is wholly operated by the farmers may arrest forest destruction and create viable rural communities.
42608067|The genus Daphne provides the main source of raw material for the production of hand-made paper in Nepal. This paper describes the development of a Daphne biomass table to be used in the management of the crop in mixed-age, natural forests in the hills of Nepal. Data was collected in Eastern, Central, and Western regions. Height and diameter at 30 cm above ground (D30) are tested as potential biomass predictor variables and an inner bark biomass table based on D30 is presented. A previous biomass model produced by Forestry Services (March 1983), using height alone as the predictor variable, was found to be unreliable for general application. Stem disc examples (taken at D30) were analysed at the Commonwealth Forestry Institute, Oxford and results permit a reasonably accurate estimate of age. Based on these research findings, management recommendations, commensurate with stand conservation and sustained utilisation, are outlined. Le genre Daphne fournit la principale source de matires premires pour la production de papier fait main en Npal. Cette communication dcrit le dveloppement d'une table de biomasse de Daphne pour tre utilise dans l'amnagement de la rcolte dans les forts naturelles inquiennes des montagnes de Npal. Les donnes taient recueillies dans les rgions Centre, de l'Est, et de l'Ouest. La hauteur et le diamtre  30 cm au-dessus de terre (D30) sont tests comme des variables potentielles de prdiction de biomasse, et une table de biomasse d'corce interne, base sur D30, est prsente. On a trouv qu'un modle pralable de biomasse mise au point par Forestry Services (1983), en utilisant seulement la hauteur comme variable de prdiction, n'tait pas fiable pour des applications gnrales. Des rondelles de tige (prises  D30) taient analyses au Commonwealth Forestry Institute, Oxford et les rsultats permettent d'estimer l'ge assez exactement. Bases sur ces rsultats de recherche, des recommandations d'amnagement, proportiones  la conservation de peuplements et la production soutenue sont esquissss. La especie Daphne proporciona la fuente principal de materia prima para la produccin de papel hecho a mano en Nepal. Este escrito relata el desarrollo del indice de la biomasa Daphne que se debe utilizar en el control de la cosecha de bosques naturales de edades diferentes de Nepal. En las regiones del Centro, Este y Oeste se recogieron datos. Se han heculo pruebas de la altura y dimetro a 30 cm por encima del nivel del suelo (D30)como variables de un predictor con potencia de la biomasa y del indice de la parte interna de la corteza basado eu D30. Un modelo de biomasa anterior producido por el Servico Forestal (1983) que usaba la altura solamente como predictor variable probo no ser relevante para una aplicacin general. El Instituto Forestal de la Commonwealth, eu Oxford, analiz muestras del disco del tronco cuyo resultado permite, con una exactitud razonable, acertar la edad. Basado en los hallazgos de estas investigaciones, se subrayan las recommendaciones del control teniendo encuenta tanto la actitud de conservacin como la utilizacin probada.
42604766|Straight line regression equations for the prediction of crown diameter from stem diameter are developed for a range of yield classes. The amount of variation in crown diameter accounted for was not significantly increased by the inclusion of tree height in the regression equation for all the data combined. The results are briefly discussed in the light of previous work.
42608321|The oldest African experiment on the dynamics of woody vegetation in relation to brush fires was set up by Aubrville in 1936 at Kokondkro, Cote d'Ivoire. The findings from the most recent assessment show reforestation in the plot protected from fires (117 species present) and a savanna-type development in the plot affected by late fires. Development is variable in the plot affected by early fires, depending on soil fertility. Regeneration of exotic species into the plots has now complicated the picture. La plus ancienne exprience africaine sur la dynamique de la vgtation ligneuse en relation avec les feux de brousse fut prpare par Aubrville en 1936  Kokondkro, Cte d'Ivoire. Les rsultats du rapport le plus rcent montrent un reboisement dans la zone protge du feu (117 espces prsentes) et un dveloppement de type savanne dans le secteur affect par les feux tardifs. Dans la zone affecte par les feux prcoces, le dveloppement varie selon la fertilit du sol. La rgnration des espces exotiques dans les zones complique maintenant le tableau. El experimento Africano ms antiguo en la dinmica de la vegetacin maderera en relacin con los incendios de charral fue establecido por Aubrville en 1936 en Kokondkro, Costa de Marfil. Los resultados de la evaluacin ms reciente muestran reforestacin en las parcelas protegidas de incendios (117 especies presentes) y el desarrollo de una vegetacin de tipo de sabana en las parcelas afectadas por los ltimos incendios. El desarrollo es variable en las parcelas afectadas por incendios tempranos, dependiendo de la fertilidad del suelo. La regeneracin de especies exticas en las parcelas ha ahora complicado la imagen.
42603222|Scots pine growing on blanket peat at 1,875 ft. (572 m) O.D. were found to be chlorotic and slow growing compared with trees on an adjacent area of redistributed peat. The relationships between growth and leaf nutrient concentrations were examined on both sites by correlation and multiple regression techniques. It was clear that, although the potassium content of the blanket peat was higher than peats at lower elevations which support Scots pine with normal growth, this element was seriously deficient in trees on the blanket peat site, and was responsible for the slow growth, and almost certainly the chlorosis. It is suggested that under extreme climatic conditions, climate influences tree nutrition to such an extent that analysis of the peats, while useful for supporting conclusions drawn from the foliage analysis, can be misleading when used alone to diagnose deficiencies or assess site fertility with regard to a particular tree species.
42603225|In building up a programme of tree breeding in Nigeria emphasis has been laid on collection and preservation of phenotypically superior material (plus trees) in order to study variation within the various species and at the same time secure working material for further breeding. As seed supply both in quantity and quality is of such great importance for the expanding planting programmes, the first seed orchards are being established based mainly on plus tree selection. As an interim measure selected stands for seed collection have been demarcated. The technique of vegetative propagation plays an important role for the development of the breeding programme. Therefore a good deal of the efforts have been spent on solving this problem. Budding and grafting has succeeded for the following species: Tectona grandis, Gmelina arborea, Eucalyptus sp., Azadirachta indica (Neem), Terminalia ivorensis, and Nauclea diderrichii. An outline is given of the characteristics of the various species, purpose of selection and their special problems.
42606414|The CFI has collected seed of 13 provenances of Liquidambar styraciflua L. in Mexico and Central America. Background information is given on the taxonomy, ecology, silviculture and utilisation of the species. Its potential and limitations for tropical plantation are outlined. Site details are presented for all provenances and seed availability for the establishment of an International Provenance Trial is discussed. Le CFI a rcolt des graines de 13 provenances de Liquidambar styraciflua L. au Mexique et en Amrique Centrale. Des renseignements de base sont donns concernant la taxonomie, l'cologie, la silviculture et l'utilisation de l'essence. Son potentiel et ses limitations comme essence de plantation tropicale sone mentionns. El CFI ha colectado semillas de 13 procedencias de Liquidambar styraciflua L. de la parte tropical del rango natural en Mexico y Centroamrica. Se discuten los conocimientos sobre la taxonoma, ecologa, silvicultura y aprovechamiento de la especie. Su potencial y limitaciones para plantacin en los trpicos se delinean. 42604796|Most forest managers control an area of forest which already carries merchantable growing stock, and the most important financial decision which they have to take is whether or not to continue in the business of growing trees. A very simple decision rulenamely that the manager should persist so long as returns cover costsis postulated; and is developed through an investigation of the individual components of cost and revenue. Some items in the expanded "cost equals returns" equation lie outside the control of the forest manager; others, while they can be varied over time, are subject to biological restraints. Others again can be readily increased or decreased at the manager's discretion. The restrictions are used to develop the concept of a "feasible space" within which the manager may operate, while still meeting the basic criterion that returns equal or exceed costs. Movement within this space in the direction of higher returns relative to costs is discussed, and the complexity and difficulty of the decisions which the forest manager must take in the real world are revealed.
42606732|Seedlings and rooted cuttings of Eucalyptus camaldulensis Dehn, were grown in containers with dimensions in combinations of 3 diameters (1.9, 2.5 and 3.8 cm) and 4 lengths (5, 10, 15 and 20 cm) to determine the effects of container dimensions on planting stock characteristics. Large differences in container diameters and lengths caused only small differences in seedling shoot heights and root-collar diameters, while increasing container diameters or lengths resulted in more marked increases in seedling shoot and root dry weights. Large increases in root dry weight resulted from lengthening containers. Increases in seedling sizes could be partially explained by increasing volume. However, the influence of volume diminished rapidly past an optimum size. Shoot to root ratio of seedlings was greatly influenced by container length, but not diameter. The responses of rooted cuttings to changing container dimensions was similar, but not identical, to that of seedlings. These results indicate that planting stock characteristics can be controlled by the choice of appropriate container dimensions for both seedlings and rooted cuttings. Des semis et des boutures enracines de Eucalyptus camaldulensis Dehn, ont t cultivs dans des conteneurs de 3 diamtres (1.9, 2.5 et 3.8 cm) combins avec 4 profondeurs (5, 10, 15 et 20 cm) pour dterminer les effets des dimensions des conteneurs sur les caractristiques du matriel de reproduction. De grandes diffrences dans les diamtres et profondeurs des conteneurs n'occasionnaient que de petites diffrences dans les hauteurs des pousses et les diamtres des collets des racines des semis, tandis que l'augmentation des diamtres ou profondeurs des conteneurs menaient  des accroissements plus marqus des poids secs des pousses et racines des semis. Des augmentations importantes des poids secs des racines rsultaient de l'augmentation de la profondeur des conteneurs. Des augmentations des tailles des semis s'expliquaient en partie par des volumes croissants. Pourtant, l'influence du volume s'amoindrissait rapidement aprs une taille optimum. Le coefficient systme foliac/systme racinaire des semis tait beaucoup influenc par la profondeur des conteneurs mais pas par le diamtre. Les rponses des boutures enracines aux variations dans les dimensions des conteneurs taient semblables mais pas identiques  celles des semis. Ces rsultats montrent que les caractristiques du matriel de reproduction peuvent tre matrises par le choix de dimensions de conteneurs appropries et pour semis et pour boutures enrancines. Se reprodujeron plntulas por semilla y por estaca de Eucalyptus camaldulensis Dehn., en recipientes con dimensiones en combinaciones de 3 dimetros (1.9, 2.5 y 3.8 cm) y 4 alturas (5, 10, 15 y 20 cm), con el fin de determinar el efecto de la dimension del recipiente en las caractersticas del material de plantacin. Grandes diferencias en el dimetro y la altura de los recipientes, causaron apenas pequeas diferencias en la altura y el dimetro del cuello de las plntulas por semilla, sin embargo, el aumento del dimetro o altura del recipiente result en un aumento ms marcado del peso seco de la parte area y del sistema radicular. Un mayor incremento en el peso seco de las races fue producido por el aumento de la altura del recipiente. El aumento del tamao de las plntulas por semilla podra explicarse en parte por el aumento del volumen. Sin embargo, la influencia del volumen disminuy rpidamente despus de alcanzarse un tamano ptimo. La relacin parte area-sistema radicular de las plntulas por semilla, fue grandemente afectada por la altura del recipiente, pero no por el dimetro. La respuesta de las plntulas por estaca a los cambios en la dimensin del recipiente fue similar, pero no idntica, a la respuesta de las plntulas por semilla. Estos resultados indican que las caractersticas del material de plantacin pueden ser controladas por una correcta seleccin de las dimensiones del recipiente, tanto para plntulas reproducidas por semilla como por estaca.
42603490|Mylone (3, 5-dimethyl tetrahydro-1, 3, 5, 2H-thiodiazine-2-thione), applied at rates of 150 and 3001b/acre of the 80 per cent WN formulation two to three weeks prior to sowing, effected a significant reduction in damping off of Pinus elliottii var. elliottii Engl. seedlings under artificial conditions creating high hazard. Under normal nursery bed conditions of low hazard, only slight reduction in damping off was obtained. Under glasshouse conditions growth was stimulated by sterilisation. Mycorrhizal infection and the balance of nitrogen and phosphorus in the seedlings were unaffected by treatment. Weed populations were significantly reduced, there being a pronounced selectivity in favour of control of grasses and sedges. The responses to treatment were unaffected by methods of application involving drench and broadcast treatments, or by the use of polythene covers to effect a surface seal.
42608695|Extensive natural forests of common walnut, Juglans regia L., occur in the mountains of Kyrgyzstan in Central Asia. These remote forests are likely to be an important genetic resource for J. regia, not only for in situ conservation, but also as a resource for tree breeding. The origins, environmental conditions and current health of the Kyrgyz walnut forests, which are increasingly under threat, are discussed. A British-based research project has made eleven provenance collections from Kyrgyzstan, which in combination with nine provenances from other countries, will be tested in British conditions. Studies of genetic diversity are being undertaken to assess intraspecific variation in walnut, both in Kyrgyzstan and across the remainder of the natural and introduced ranges. On traite des origines, des conditions environnementales et de l'tat actuel de sant des forts de noyer Kirghizes, qui sont de plus en plus menaces. Un projet de recherche base en Grande Bretagne a fait onze collections de provenance de Kirghizistan, qui seront testes, avec neuf provenances d'autres pays, sous les conditions britanniques. On tudie la diversit gntique pour valuer la variation intraspcifique du noyer, en Kirghizistan et dans le reste des aires de rpartition naturelle et artificielle. Existen en las montaas de Kyrgyzstan en Asia Central, bosques naturales extensivos de nogal comn, Juglans regia L. 42607193|The Conference resolved that the major challenges to sustainable forest management in the 21st century include: the diminishing forest resource base, inadequate recognition of the forestry sector, limited community participation and the declining support to forestry support services such as research, extension and training. Potential solutions to these challenges were also proposed and are presented in this paper. The need for political commitment at all levels in tackling these challenges featured prominently throughout the conference. Le Congrs a identifi les principaux dfis confrontant la grance orestire soutenable dans le 21me sicle comme suit: La base diminuant de ressources forestires, une reconnaissance insuffisante du secteur forestier, la participation communitaire limite, et la diminution du soutien des services de soutien forestier, comme la recherche, la vulgarisation et la formation. On a propos des solutions possibles et elles sont prsentes dans cet article. Le besoin de l'engagement politique  tous les niveaux pour rpondre  ces dfis ressortaient pendant tout le congrs. La Conferencia resolvi que los principales retos para la administracin sostenible de bosques en el siglo 21 incluyen: la disminucin del recurso forestal de base, el reconocimiento inadecuado del sector forestal, la limitada participacin de la comunidad y el apoyo declinante a servicios forestales tales como la investigacin, la extensin y la capacitacin. Tambin se propusieron las soluciones potenciales a estos retos las cuales se presentan en este artculo. Se enfatizo a travs de la conferencia, la necesidad de un compromiso poltico a todos los niveles para enfrentar estos retos.
43737726|Single and multiple stem cankers and gum exudation of E. grandis, first noticed at one site in 1986, have since been reported from several areas around the country. Trees two years and older are affected. At one site the incidence of disease was 18.2% and 3.5% of trees in one seed orchard died within a period of two months. Preliminary observations show that once a tree is affected it eventually dies. The cause of the disease has been tentatively ascribed to a basidiomycete. A survey of eucalypt plantations around the country has been initiated while collaborative efforts to conclusively determine the causal agent are underway.
42608569|For centuries the forest resources in Papua New Guinea have provided communities with a multiplicity of products, a source of cultural values and identity. The current utilization of the forests is essentially for timber, while the Non-Timber Forest Products (NTFP) are largely being ignored. This paper presents a review of the status of the NTFP and their future potential in Papua New Guinea. Their importance in generating additional foreign exchange earnings for the Government and the resource owners is noted. More needs to be done to develop and promote these products at both national and international level. The attitudes of both the government and traditional landowners towards forests as a 'free resource' must be fundamentally changed if the forests and their multiplicity of products are to be developed sustainably into the future. Pendant des sicles, les ressources forestires de la Papouasie Nouvelle Guine ont fourni aux communauts locales une multitude de produits et elles ont constitu pour celles-ci une source de valeurs culturelles et d'identit. L'utilisation actuelle des forts est principalement axe sur l'exploitation de bois d'oeuvre, alors que les autres produits forestiers sont en grande partie ignors. Cet article passe en revue et prsente la situation des produits forestiers autres que le bois d'oeuvre, ainsi que leur potentiel futur en Papouasie Nouvelle Guine. Leur importance dans la cration de bnfices en devises fortes pour le gouvernement et les propritaires des ressources est mise en vidence. Il est toutefois ncessaire de mettre en oeuvre plus de moyens pour dvelopper et promouvoir ces produits aux niveaux national et international. L'attitude, et du gouvernement, et des propritaires fonciers traditionnels, envers la fort, considre comme une ressource libre, doit tre fondamentalement change, si on veut dvelopper durablement les forts et la multiplicit de leurs produits. Durante siglos, los recursos forestales en Papa Nueva Guinea han provedo a las comunidades con una multiplicidad de productos, una fuente de valores e identidad cultural. El uso actual de los bosques es esencialmente para la produccin de madera, mientras los Productos Forestales No-Madereros (NTFP) se ignoran ampliamente. Este artculo presenta una revisin del estado actual de los NTFP y su potencial futuro en Papua Nueva Ginca. Se hace notar su importancia en la generacin de ganancias adicionales de divisas para el Gobierno y para los propietarios de este recurso. Se necesita hacer ms para desarrollar y promover estos productos tanto a nivel nacional como internacional. Las actitudes, tanto del gobierno como de los terratenientes tradicionales, de considerar los bosques como un 'recurso libre' tienen que cambiar fundamentalmente si se han de desarrollar en forma sostenible los bosques y su multiplicidad de productos en un futuro.
42604833|This article describes the fourth of a series of sawmill studies, designed to test empirically the physical effectiveness and economic value of pruning. The sample of 76 logs 18 feet long came from a stand planted in 1933 and felled in part and thinned in part in 1965. The average d.b.h.o.b. of the sample trees was 19.7 inches with a range from 13.4 inches to 32.7 inches. Pruning had been carried out from 1938/39 at intervals of two years to remove branches up to and including 16 feet, giving usually a clear bole length of over 18 feet. The results proved to be less favourable than those of an earlier sample from a farm near Masterton, described in a previous article (Brown, 1965). A number of reasons are adduced for this. It is suggested that for the purpose of forecasting probable results of present-day commercial pruning of radiata pine designed to give a knotty core of under 9 inches the following intermediate equation would be appropriate: y = .5x  70 where y is the clearwood in board feet per 18 foot log and  is the square of the small end diameter in inches inside bark at 18 feet. An attempt to assess the financial profitability of the pruning confirmed the conclusion from the Masterton trial that the pruning of the first 18 feet at least of the final crop trees should be profitable. The threshold of profitability appears to be located at about 15 inches d.b.h.o.b. The chances and margin of profitability increase very rapidly with increase in felling diameter thereafter.
42608534|In spite of the general lack of growth and yield data from managed natural tropical forests, foresters must attempt to quantify the effects of proposed silvicultural prescriptions to assess sustainability. A generalized diameter class growth model was developed for this purpose. Data from the literature were used to derive the required accounting equations. The model was encoded into a spreadsheet programme and used in an illustrative study of a community forest under management in the Osa Peninsula of Costa Rica. A prescription devised by the second author was shown to produce a sustainable yield of approximately 26 m/ha every 15 years from a small forest on the Osa. While both the total volume and basal area per hectare stabilized after seven cutting cycles, the diameter distribution was still in flux. Practising foresters should find the modelling approach demonstrated here useful in the design of conservative management practices while awaiting improved data on the growth and yield of managed tropical forests. Malgr un manque gnral de donnes de production et de croissance dans les forts tropicales amnages, les forestiers doivent tenter d'valuer les effets de certaines prescriptions silviculturales sur une gestion quilibre de l'environnement. Pour ce propos, un modle standard de la croissance des classes de diamtre a t mis au point. Les donnes bibliographiques ont t utilises pour tablir les quations ncessaires et le modle, codifi sur un tableur, a t utilis dans une tude sur une fort communautaire de la Pninsule Osa au Costa Rica. La mthodologie suivie par le deuxime auteur a permis une production durable d'environ 26 m/ha tous les 15 ans  Osa. Alors que le volume total ainsi que la surface terrire par hectare se sont stabiliss aprs 7 cycles de coupe la rpartition des diamtres dans le tableau des classes de diamtre variait encore. Bien que la prcision des rsultats sur la croissance et la production demandent  tre amliors, les forestiers devraient trouver cette modlisation utile pour la conception de pratiques d'amnagement durable de la fort tropicale. A pesar de la falta general de datos sobre el crecimiento y productividad de bosques tropicales, naturales, administrados, los ingenieros de montes deben tratar de cuantificar los efectos de las prescripciones silviculturales propuestos para evaluar sostenabilidad. Un modelo generalizado de crecimiento del dimetro fue desarrollado con esta intencin. Se us datos de la literatura para sacar les ecuaciones de contabilidad requeridas. El modelo fue cifrado en el programa de una hoja electrnica y usado en un estudio ilustrativo de un bosque comunal bajo administracin en la Pennsula Osa de Costa Rica. Una prescripcin inventada por el segundo autor produjo un rendimiento sostenible de aproximademente 26 mVha cada 15 aos en un bosque pequeo en la Osa. Mientras el volumen total y el rea basal haban stabilizado despus de siete ciclos de corte, la distribucin de dimetro estaba continuamente cambiando. Para los ingenieros de monte el mtodo aqu demostrado les ser til en el diseo de prcticas de administracin conservadores mientras estn esperando datos mejorados sobre el crecimiento y la productividad de bosques tropicales administrados.
42608902|Forests, which account for a third of the area of Diqin Prefecture, constitute a resource of outstanding botanical importance. The main objective of forest management is to provide coniferous timber, 75% of it used locally, while protecting the rich ecosystems which exist. In the past fire associated with grazing caused widespread damage, but in recent years numbers of incidents have fallen dramatically as a result of legislation, extension and improved monitoring. Felling is of old-growth spruce, fir and larch worked, since 1986, under a form of shelterwood system. Owing to the high ecological interest of the region the formation of Forest Parks is recommended to assure protection of areas for nature conservation combined with tourism. L'abbatage d'picas originels, de sapins et de mlzes dans une fort contrle est effectu sous forme de systme de coupe d'abri. En el pasado, incendios asociados con pastos causaron un extenso dao, pero en aos recientes el nmero de incidentes ha decado dramticamente como resultado de la legislacin, y el mejoramiento de la extensin y monitoreo. Se talan rboles maduros de abeto, pino y alerce, manejados desde 1986, bajo un sistema de cortes sucesiyos. 42606383|Over 600 native and exotic tree species have been evaluated in trials in Australia. Many of these species have potential for timber production and some would be suitable for fuelwood production in developing countries. This paper reviews reports of trials and summarises the variety of species which have been evaluated. The possible use of information from these trials to assist in the development of compendia describing species characteristics is briefly discussed. Il discutent brivemont l'utilisation ventuelle de cette information dans le dveloppement de banques de donnes sur les espces.
