42607637|It is stressed that fire is a natural phenomenon which is part and parcel of the savanna ecosystem and any attempt to eliminate burning completely from this ecological zone could be detrimental to animals and their environments. The use of fire in pasture management, farm clearing, pest control, forestry and tree production, soil and water conservation, and wildlife management is described. It is pointed out that most of the burning experiments in African savannas were either aimed at tree production or pasture management. Only a few are sited in wildlife habitats, and these are not comprehensive enough to investigate the effects of time and frequency of burning on the habitats as well as the impact of grazing under different burning treatments. All these factors were taken into consideration while planning the burning and grazing experiment at Kainji Lake National Park in Nigeria. Some results of the experiment are presented. It is recommended that such experiments should be sited in major game reserves, forest reserves, grazing reserves and national parks in African savannas. L'auteur insiste sur le fait que les feux de brousse constituent un phnomne qui est une partie intgrante et l'lment essentiel de l'cosystme que forme la savane. Toute mesure qui tendrait  l'liminer compltement les feux de cette zone cologique, serait prjudiciable aux animaux comme  leur milieu de vie. Il en dcrit l'usage dans l'amnagement des pturages, les dfrichements agricoles, la destruction des espces nuisibles, en foresterie et pour la production forestire, la conservation du sol et de l'eau et l'amnagement des rserves de gibier. Il fait remarquer que la plupart des essais sur l'action des brlis, dans les savanes africaines, concernaient soit la production forestire, soit l'amnagement des pturages. Quelques-uns seulement ont t entrepris dans les habitats d'animaux sauvages ou pour juger l'action du pturage sur diffrents modes de mise  feu. Tous ces facteurs ont t pris en considration pour laborer le protocole d'essai sur le brlis et le pturage au Parc National du lac Kainji, en Nigeria. Quelques rsultats de ces essais sont prsents. Il est conclu et recommand que de tels essais devraient tre entrepris dans la plupart des rserves de gibier, parcs nationaux, rserves forestires et de pturages, des savanes africaines. Se recalca que el fuego es un fenmeno natural que forma parte del ecosistema de la savana y que cualquier intento de eliminar el incendio completamente de esta zona ecolgica podra ser perjudicial para los animales y sus hbitats. Se describe el uso del fuego en la ordenacin de pastizales, el desembarazo de tierras para agricultura, para el control de plagas, para la dasonoma y produccin de rboles, para la conservacin de agua y de los suelos y para la ordenacin de los animales salvajes. Se hace la advertencia que la mayora de los experimentos de incendio en las savanas africanas se destinaron principalmente a la produccin de rboles o la ordenacin de pastos. Muy pocos experimentos se sitan en hbitats de animales salvajes y estos no son lo sufientemente comprensivos para investigar los efectos que el momento do quemar y la frecuencia de incendio tienen en los habitats, tambin como el impacto de pastoreo bajo diferentes regmenes de incendio. Se tomaron en consideracin todos estos factores al planificar el experimento de incendio y pastoreo cerca del lago Kainji en el Parque Nacional de Nigeria. Se presentan algunos resultados del experimento. Es recomendacin que tales experimentos deben situarse en importantes reservas forestales, de caza y de pastoreo y en los parques nacionales de las savanas africanas.
42603388|Small scale field screening trials of fungicides for protectant action against Dothistroma Blight (Dothistroma pini Hulbary) of Pinus radiata, have shown that materials based on copper compounds are particularly active in this respect and that dithiocarbamates are ineffective. Large scale field trials of copper fungicides have indicated that these may provide economical control measures for Dothistroma Blight if application difficulties are overcome.
42607809|The frontier between forestry and agriculture is not sharp, and various terms have been proposed for activities that lie across it. The widespread use in English of the word 'agroforestry" has not added to clarity of thought, and it is misleading in that it implies a third category of land use different from either of the others. It is suggested that an expression is needed that includes both forestry and agriculture, and the recent FAO proposal "land husbandry" is adopted. Foresters are urged to play a full part in land husbandry and ensure that their concern for the long-term welfare of complex ecosystems is not lost from view. La frontire entre la silviculture et l'agriculture n'est pas nette, et l'on a propos divers termes pour les activits qui la chevauchent. L'utilisation par les anglophones du mot agroforestry n'a pas contribu a la clart; au contraire, il implique  a tort  l'existence d'une troisime forme de production distincte des deux autres. L'auteur suggre que l'on a surtout besoin d'une expression qui recourvre  la fois la silviculture et l'agriculture, et il adopte celle de land husbandry propos par la FAO. Les specialistes des questions forestires doivent assurer que dans cette nouvelle connaissance intgre de la gestion des ressources biologiques leur comprhension de la staibilit a long terme des cosystmes complexes joue pleinement son rle. La frontera entre forestacin y agricultura no es nitida y han sido propuestos varios trminos para las actividades que implican. El amplio uso en ingls de la palabra "agroforestry" no solo no ha contribuido a su clarificacin, sino que por el contrario implica una tercera categora de produccin diferente de las otras dos. El autor sugiere la necesidad de contar con una expresin que incluya ambas, forestacin y agricultura y es adoptado el trmino "land husbandry". Los especialistas en cuestiones forestales tendrn que jugar un rol preponderante en este nuevo conocimiento integrado, para asegurar que su incumbencia en la conservacin a largo plazo de ecosistemas complejos no se pierda de vista.
42603199|An interim assessment of a trial to assess the effect of high pruning seven years old patula has been analysed. The effect of pruning on both height and basal area was shown to be significant though not greatly so in the case of height. There was also an indication that the effect on form will be considerable. Volume estimates based on the data given suggest that pruning to a minimum diameter of three inches or less, or to removal of more than half the living crown is causing a significant and serious loss of increment.
42604516|Shoot-tip necrosis of Eucalyptus spp. occurred in the Solomon Islands in 1973 shortly after transferring 6-9-month-old seedlings to the field. The vertical growth of affected trees ceased, lateral branching was stimulated and trees became squat, bushy and quite unsuitable for industrial use. The symptoms, as they developed in trial plots of E. deglupta, E. urophylla and E. tereticornis, are described together with the unsuccessful attempts to isolate pathogenic organisms. Both nymphs and adults of the coreid bug Amblypelta cocophaga cocophaga were abundant on trees with die-back. Caging experiments with this insect reproduced symptoms. Control was achieved by completely clearing the vegetation between the Eucalyptus trees and introducing the ant Oecophylla smaragdina into the trial plots.
42608003|Intermittent small trial plantings of Pinus kesiya were made in the Northern Territory from 1962/63. Results are presented for one of these plantings, embracing 7 provenances and a Honduras Caribbean comparison, which reflects performance in this region. Standard procedures were used for assessment of 15 growth and form traits at age 9 years. Few notable differences are apparent between the P. kesiya provenances, but trait expression may have been modified under local climatic conditions. Although the growth of Pinus kesiya in this region has been relatively poor, the results may complement data from established international trials in defining the environmental limits for successful growth of this species in the tropics. Des essais  petite chelle de P. kesiya ont t tablis  des intervalles irrgulires dans le Territoire du Nord depuis 1962/63. Les rsultats prsents ici pour un de ces essais portent sur sept provenances et sur un pin caribben. Les mesures habituelles ont t effectues pour 15 facteurs  9 ans. Peu de diffrences se manifestent entre les provenances,  cause peuttre du climat local. La croissance tait mdiocre mais ces donnes pourront complter celles qui proviennent d'essais plus connus en montrant les limites du milieu pour la croissance de cette espce. Se plantaron parcelas experimentales pequeas de Pinus kesiya en los aos 1962/3. Se presentan los resultados de algunas de estas plantaciones que incluyen siete procedencias y un testigo de P. caribaea desde Honduras que representa el comportamiento promedio de la regin. Procedimientos normales fueron aplicados para la evaluacin de 15 carcteres del crecimiento y de la forma a una edad de 9 anos. No se ve diferencias notables entre las procedencias de P. kesiya aunque la expresion de los carcteres pudo haber sido modificada baja las condiciones climticas locales. Aunque el crecimiento de P. kesiya en esta regin estaba relativamente mal, los resultados pueden aumentar los datos de ensayos internacionales ya establecidos para definir los lmites del medio ambiente para el cultivo con xito de esta especie en los trpicos.
42603194|The primary function of the Timber Physics Section of the recently established Forest Research Laboratory at Chittagong, East Pakistan, is to determine the physical strength properties of approximately 400 species. With the limitations of equipment, manpower and money, it was found necessary to establish the most efficient procedures for determining the strength properties. The sampling methods developed are based on statistical principles, and will provide the estimated mean value at a predetermined precision and with a known variance. It was found that the procedures developed for Australian species were not directly applicable to the timbers of East Pakistan, and consequently modifications were made.
42606411|Cordia alliodora can be raised on Vanuatu to produce a commercial timber which might sustain a timber exporting industry. Cordia alliodora peut tre plant  Vanuatu pour produire un bois industriel qui pourrait soutenir une industrie d'exportation de bois. Se puede cultivar Cordia alliodora en Vanuatu para fines de produccin de madera comerciable capaz de apoyar una industra maderable de exportacin.
42607272|Foresters and water engineers often have different perceptions regarding the hydrological role of forests. Foresters tend to believe that forests attract rainfall, increase infiltration, regulate flows and reduce floods. Hydrologists, while recognising the generally beneficial aspects of forests in relation to their effects on climate, are less sanguine concerning their other hydrological impacts, particularly as they affect evaporation and catchment runoff. Hydrologists' concern is that trees will intercept more of the rainfall during wet periods and, because of their deeper root systems, transpire more water during dry periods and thus deplete groundwater and surface water resources. This paper reviews some of the experiments that have been carried out at both the plot and catchment scale to investigate the water use of forests, relative to shorter vegetation types, in different parts of the world. Recent applications of forest water use models to questions of water resource and land use management are outlined. Les forestiers et le ingnieurs des eaux ont souvent des perceptions diffrentes quant au rle hydrologique des forts. Les forestiers ont tendance  croire que les forts attirent les pluies, facilitent l'infiltration, rgularisent l'coulement et rduisent les inondations. Les hydrologues, tout en reconnaissant les aspects gnralement bnfiques des forts quant  leurs effets dur le climat, sont moins optimistes pour ce qui est de leurs autres impacts hydrologiques, particulirement du fait qu'elles affectent l'vaporation et les fuites du bassin hydrographique. Le souci des hydrologues vient du fait que les arbres vont intercepter davantage d'eau pendant les priodes humides et qu'ils vont transpirer davantage d'eau pendant les priodes sches; du fait de leurs systmes de racines plus profonds, et ainsi rduisent l'eau du sol et les ressources d'eau en surface. Cet article passe en revue certaines des expriences faites tout  la fois au niveau du lot de terrain et au niveau du bassin hydrographique pour examiner l'usage d'eau des forts en relation avec des types plus petits de vgtation dans diverses parties du monde. Etes applications rcentes des modles de l'usage d'eau des forts pour les questions de ressources d'eau et d'amenagement de l'usage du terrain sont mises en lumire. Los ingenieros forestales y de manejo de agua tienen frecuentemente diferentes percepciones con respecto al papel hidrolgico de bosques. Los ingenieros forestales tienden a creer que los bosques atraen precipitacin, incrementan infiltracin, regulan flujos y reducen inundaciones. Los hidrlogos, mientras que reconocen los aspectos beneficiosos generales de los bosques con relacin a sus efectos en clima, son menos optimistas en lo que concierne a otros impactos hidrolgicos, particularmente ya que ellos afectan la evaporacin y el vaciamiento de las zonas de captacin. La preocupacin de los hidrlogos es que los rboles interceptarn ms de la precipitacin durante perodos lluviosos y, debido a su sistema radicular ms profundo, transpiran ms agua durante perodos secos y agotando as los recursos hdricos del suelo y de superficie. Este artculo revisa parte de los experimentos que se han estado llevado cabo tanto a escala de parcela como de zonas de captacin para investigar el uso del agua de bosques, con relacin a los tipos de vegetacin ms corta, en diferentes partes del mundo. Se esbozan aplicaciones recientes de modelos de uso de agua de bosque a problemas de recurso acutico y a la administracin del uso de la tierra.
42608007|Mother tree seed collections were made of Pinus tecunmanii (Schw.) Equiluz and Perry in the provenances of San Jernimo and San Lorenzo, Guatemala in 1980 and 1981. Provenance/progeny tests were established with the seed from these collections at 570 m, 1200 m and 2400 m elevation on three sites in Brazil and Colombia. Included in the tests were control lots of Pinus oocarpa Schiede from Mt. Pine Ridge, Belize and Chiquimula, Guatemala. Analyses of one-year height data indicates that at 2400 m elevation, the San Jernimo provenance of P. tecunumanii statisically out performed the San Lorenzo source (mean height 96 cm vs. 84 cm). Also, at 2400 m elevation, ninety percent of the P. tecunumanii families from the San Jernimo provenance grew as well as the Mt. Pine Ridge, P. oocarpa control. At the mid and low elevation sites (1200 m and 570 m) no statistical differences were detected in height growth between the two P. tecunumanii provenances; the Mt. Pine Ridge, P. oocarpa control was superior to P. tecunumanii. Pinus tecunumanii statistically out performed the P. oocarpa Guatemala control at 2400 m and 1200 m elevation; no differences were detected between the two species at the 570 m site. Des essais de provenance ont t stablis sur trois placettes aux altitudes de 570 m, 1200 m et 2400 m, avec des graines de P. tecunumanii prises en Guatemala. Les dones pour la hauteur  un an montre une nette supriorit pour la provenance San Jernimo  2400 m. A la mme altitude 90% des familles de cette provenance dpassaient le contrle de P. oocarpa. Aux altitudes moyenne et faible les provenances ne diffraient pas de faon significative et se montraient infrieur au controle de P. oocarpa, provenance Guatemalenee. Se recolectaron semillas de rboles padres de Pinus tecunumanii (Schw.) Equiluz and Perry de las procedencias de San Jernimo y San Lorenzo, Guatemala en 1980 y 1981. Ensayos de procedencia y progenie se establecieron con semillas de estos recoltes a elevaciones de 570, 1200 y 2400 msnm a tres localidades en Brasil y Colombia. Los ensayos incluyeron ejemplares de P. oocarpa como control que provinieron del Mountain Pine Ridge en Belice y Chiquimula en Guatemala. El anlisis estadstico del crecimiento en altura despus de un ao a 2400 msnm mostr que la procedencia San Jernimo fue mejor que la de San Lorenzo (alturas promedias de 96 cm y 84 cm respectivamente). A una elevacin de 2400 msnm tambin noventa por ciento de las familias de P. tecunumanii de San Jeronimo se desarrollaron tan bien como el ejemplar control de P. oocarpa desde el Mountain Pine Ridge. En los sitios de mediana o baja elevacin no se encontraron diferencias estadsticas entre el crecimiento en altura de las dos procedencias de P. tecunumanii. El control de P. oocarpa fue mejor de P. tecunumanii. P. tecunumanii creci mejor que el control de P. oocarpa de Guatemala a 2400 y 1200 msnm, pero no hubo diferencias estadsticas entre los dos especies en el sitio ms bajo (570 msnm).

42608502|The Mexican government is developing tropical plantations with Pinus caribaea var. hondurensis in order to produce raw material for its paper mills in the Gulf of Mxico coastal plain. This programme started in 1974. The area is savanna type. The climate is hot with a mean annual temperature of 25C and 2300 mm of rainfall. The dry season is from January to April. The natural vegetation is made up of isolated trees of 'encino' (Quercus spp.), 'nanche' (Byrsonima crassifolia), and 'tachicon' (Curatella americana). The data were obtained from stem analysis of 104 dominant trees and dominant height of 52 permanent plots measured four times. Site index equations were fitted to the Chapman-Richards model (Hd = a [1 ebA]c) using the algebraic difference approach. The equation obtained is as follows: SI = Hd [(1 e.A)/(1 e.*A)]. where: SI = site index; Hd = dominant height; A = index or base age; A = stand age; e = base of the natural logarithms; a, b, c = parameters to be estimated. Le gouvernement du Mxique dveloppe des plantations tropicales de Pinus caribaea var. hondurensis afin de produire de la matire premire pour ses papeteries dans la plaine ctire du golfe du Mxique. Ce programme a commenc en 1974. La rgion est de type savane. Le climat est chaud: la temprature annuelle moyenne est 25C et il y a 2300 mm de prcipitations par an. La saison sche est de janvier  avril. La vgtation naturelle se compose d'arbres isols des types 'encino' (Quercus spp.), 'nanche' (Byrsonima crassifolia) et 'tachicon' (Curatella americana). Voici l'quation obtenue: SI = Hd [(1 e.A)/(1 e.*A)]. lorsque: SI = indice des emplacements; Hd = hauteur dominante; A = indice ou ge de base; A = ge du peuplement; e = base des logarithmes naturels; a, b, c = paramtres  estimer. SI = Hd [(1 e.A)/(1 e.*A)]. donde: SI = ndice de sitio; Hd = altura dominante; A = edad base; A = edad del rodal; e = base de los logaritmos naturales; a, b, c = parmetros e estimar.
42608504|The flowering cycle of Balanites aegyptiaca in the wild normally commences at 5-7 years. 42608048|At the beginning of the 20th century the creation of mining towns in Upper Shaba brought about the development of large urban centres and a resulting increase in their wood needs. The surrounding vegetation, mainly open forest, was exploited. Today the forest, for 70 km around Lubumbashi, is menaced with destruction, whilst an area of 30 km radius has already been completely clear-cut. Only unproductive derived savannas and a few rare vegetable plots in the valleys have replaced it. The present stage of destruction of the original forest has reduced forest product capital by 19%, and future developments indicate complete deforestation of the square degree of Lubumbashi in 2050 Plantation and afforestation solutions are known, but the probability of their being applied in the coming years is slight, even though just 20% of the area being given over to forestry would be enough to satisfy the woodfuel needs of the population. Au dbut de ce sicle le dveloppement des mines dans le Chaba suprieur a cr de nouveaux centres urbains ayant des besoins importants en bois. La vgtation des alentours, en grande partie de la fort tait mise en exploitation. Aujourd'hui sur un rayon de 30 km autour de Lubumbashi rien ne reste, et le menace de destruction pse sur un rayon de 70 km. Seules les savannes secondaires et pauvres subsistent, mis  part quelques champs de lgumes dans les valles. L'tat actuel de la fort reprsente la perte de 19% du capital forestier, et l'on prvoit le dboisement total du degrcarr autour de Lubumbashi d'ici l'an 2050. Les solutions par le rboisement existent mais ne seront probablement pas appliques  temps, bien que 20% de la superficie soit suffisant pour subvenir aux besoins en bois de chauffage de toute la population. En los inicios del siglo 20 la creacin de pueblos mineros en Upper Shaba result en el desarrollo de grandes centros urbanos. Esto traj como consecuencia un aumento en sus necessidades por productos forestales y la explotacin de los bosques aledaos. Actualmente 70 km de bosques alrededor de Lubumbashi se encuentran en peligro de destruccin, mientras que el area en un radio de 30 km ya ha sido completamente devastada, solamente reemplazada por savanas improductivas y escasas parcelas agricolas en los valles. La destruccin de bosques hasta el momento ha reducido la capital de productos forestales por un 19% y se crea que la explotacin futura dejar completamente deforestada un area de 100 km por 100 km alrededor de Lubumbashi en el ao 2050! La solucin mediante reforestacin es bien conocida pero la posibilidad de su aplicacin en los aos venideros es remota, an cuando el 20% del area, si fuera plantacines, seria suficiente para satisfacer las necessidades para lena de la poblacin.
42608374|Understanding of the impacts of external and internal policy measures on the forest sector remains limited. A particular problem of forestry is the extent of externalities. Nine gaps in our knowledge are identified: these urgently require research. La comprhension des impacts des plans d'action extrieurs et intrieurs sur le secteur forestier demeure limite. 42608098|The Virgin Jungle Reserves (VJR) of Peninsular Malaysia are a network of small protected areas largely located within selectively logged natural forest. Their two main purposes are to provide: (a) undisturbed areas of natural vegetation for non-destructive scientific research, in particular control sites for forest research; (b) protected examples of the country's national heritage as nature reserves. There have been numerous calls for greater emphasis to be put on the second major aim of the network. Because the network is made up of very small areas of forest, this factor has in the past contributed to its neglect and the network is not considered to be complete in implementation by its own Rules. The network, therefore, requires consistent management and protection and also extension. This can largely be done by ensuring that rules of the VJRs are consistently applied. It is concluded that such networks have an important role to play in biodiversity conservation and that the VJR network in Peninsular Malaysia could be used as a 'template' for any country which does not yet have its own system of small protected areas but which does have both the natural resources (i.e. forest) and the infrastructure (i.e. a Forestry Department) to support such a system. Les Rserves de Jungle Vierge (RJV) de la pninsule malaise sont un rseau de petites zones protges situes pour une large part dans la fort  rcolte d'crmage. Leurs deux objets les plus importants sont de fournir: (a) des zones de vgtation naturelle non dranges pour les recherches scientifiques non-destructrices, en particulier des sites tmoin pour la foresterie; (b) des exemples protgs du patrimoine du pays comme rserves naturelles. Il y a eu de nombreux appels pour qu'on insiste sur le deuxime but principal du rseau. Le rseau tant constitu de trs petits morceaux de fort, il a t nglig autrefois, et il n'est pas jug tre utilis  fond selon sa propre rglementation. Le rseau a donc besoin d'une gestion consistente, de protection et aussi d'extension. Cela peut tre fourni en grande partie si les rgles des RJV sont appliques consquemment. On conclut que de tels rseaux ont un rle important  jouer dans la conservation de la biodiversit, et que le rseau RJV dans la pninsule malaise pourrait tre utilis comme 'gabarit' pour tout pays qui n'a pas encore son propre systme de petites zones protges, mais qui possde les ressources naturelles (c'est--dire les forts) et l'infrastructure (c'est--dire un dpartement de foresterie) pour soutenir un tel systme. Las Reservas de Junglas Vrgenes (VJR) de Malasia Peninsular son una red de pequeas reas protegidas localizadas principalmente dentro de bosques productivos seleccionados. Sus dos propsitos principales son proveer: (a) reas inalteradas de vegetacin natural para la investigacin cientfica no-destructiva, en particular sitios control para ingeniera forestal; (b) ejemplos protegidos de la herencia nacional del pas como reservas naturales. Han habido numerosos llamados para dar un mayor nfasis al segundo propsito de la red. Debido a que la red est hecha sobre reas muy pequeas de bosque, este factor en el pasado contribuy a su descuido y se considera que la red no est completamente implementada de acuerdo a sus propias reglas. La red, por lo tanto, requiere administracin y proteccin consistentes y tambin extensin. Esto puede lograrse ampliamente asegurndose que las reglas de los VJRS sean aplicadas en forma consistente. Se concluye que tales redes tienen un papel importante que jugar en la conservacin de la biodiversidad y que la red de la VJR en Malasia Peninsular puede ser utilizada como un modelo para que cualquier pas que todava no tenga su propio sistema de pequeas reas protegidas pero que tiene tanto las riquezas naturales (i.e. bosques) y la infraestructura (i.e. un Departamento de Ingeniera Forestal), apoye tal sistema.
42606946|Casuarina equisetifolia L., a fast growing exotic tree of multiple end uses, has been planted extensively in tropical and temperate zones of India in habitats ranging from desert to high rain-fall coasts. Although various limiting factors affect its successful cultivation, incidence of diseases is most important especially in the wet tropics. Fungal pathogens attack all stages of the tree growth -seedlings, saplings and young trees. Rhizoctonia solani state of Thanatephorus cucumehs is the major pathogen causing high mortality of seedlings in nurseries. In plantations, trees are vulnerable to stem canker, die-back, pink disease, root infection and blister bark disease, etc. Trichosporium vesiculosum, blister bark disease pathogen and Phomopsis casuarinae, causing stem canker and dieback resulting in between 10 to 15 per cent mortality in coastal plantations in Kerala, are the most economically important diseases. The paper highlights the present status of diseases of Casuarina in India and discusses the disease management strategies. Le Casuarina equisetifolia L., une espce exotique  croissance rapide et  usages multiples, a t plante en Inde sur un large espace aussi bien dans la zone tropicale que tempre, dans des habitats allant des dserts aux rgions ctires humides. Bien qu'un certain nombre d'autres facteurs compromettent le succs de sa culture, la frquence des maladies, surtout en zone humide, est le problme le plus important. Les virus fongiques attaquent tous les stades de la croissance de l'arbre, le plant et les jeunes arbres. Rhizoctonia solani, un tat de Thanatephorus cucumeris, est le pathogne majeur, cause des fortes mortalits de plants dans les ppinires. Dans les plantations les arbres sont atteints de dprissement terminal, d'infection des racines; l'ecoree, les tiges sont galement attaques. Trichosporium vesiculosum, le virus de la rouille vesiculeuse et Phomopsis casuarinae, provoquant le chancre de la tige et le dprissement terminal, cause de 10  15% de la mortalit dans les plantations ctires du Kerala sont les maladies les plus graves du point de vue conomique. L'article fait le point sur la situation des maladies du Casuarina en Inde et discute les stratgies de lutte. Casuarina equisetifolia L. un rbol extico de rpido crecimiento y de multiple uso, ha sido plantada extensivamente en zonas tropicales y temperadas de la India en ambientes variando desde el desierto hasta las costas de alta lluviosidad. Aunque varios factores limitantes afectan un exitoso cultivo, la incidencia de enfermedades es lo ms importante especialmente en los trpicos humedos. Los hongos patgenos atacan todas las faces del crecimiento del rbol  plntulas, jvenes y rboles jvenes. Rhizoctonia solani face de Thanatephorus cucumeris es el principal patgeno que causa alta mortalidad en plntulas en viveros. En las plantaciones los rboles son vulnerables al chancro del tallo, secamiento, mal rosado, infeccin de raiz y la vejiga enfermedade de la cascara, etc. Trichosporium vesiculosum, el patgeno de la vejiga enfermedade de la cascara y Phomopsis casuarina, son causa del chancro del tallo y secamiento resultando entre el 10 to 15 por ciento de mortalidade en las plantaciones de la costa en Kerala. Estos son las enfermedades ms importantes econmicamente. El artculo resalta el estado actual de las enfermedades de Casuarina en la India y discute las estrategias en manejo de enfermedades.
42606967|Three distinguishing features of developing countries are: a history of State control of natural resources, especially forests; high incidence of poverty, high population growth and dependence on land-based activities; and emergence of democratic forms of governance. An analysis of trends emerging in the management of natural resources in these countries shows that there is (i) a shift from state control to individual or collective tenure, (ii) devolution of management functions to the local people, and (iii) a changing role of government agencies controlling the forest resources. Inherent in these changes is the realization that people's participation is vital for forest protection and conservation. Analysis based on examples from Asian countries shows that people's participation becomes feasible under the following conditions: a policy framework recognizing people's role in the management of forests; clear delineation of the rights and responsibilities of the local communities; and establishment of people's institutions to give effect to such local rights and obligations. The Participatory Forest Management Programme in India is attempting to provide the framework for meaningful involvement of people in forest management. Trois caractristiques distinctes des pays en dveloppement sont: un pass de main mise de l'tat sur les ressources naturelles, particulirement les forts, un important phnomne de pauvret, croissance dmographique leve et dpendance vis--vis d'activits bases sur la terre et l'mergence de formes dmocratiques de gouvernement. L'analyse des tendances qui apparaissent dans le cadre de la gestion des ressources naturelles dans ces pays montre qu'il y a (i) un transfert du contrle de l'tat vers un droit de jouissance individuelle ou collective, (ii) une transmission des fonctions de gestion aux populations locales, et (iii) un volution du rle des agences gouvernementales qui contrlent les ressources forestires. La prise de conscience que la participation des populations locales est vitale dans un processus de protection et de conservation des forts est inhrent  cette volution. Une analyse qui se base sur des exemples issus de pays asiatiques dmontre que la participation populaire devient ralisable sous les conditions suivantes: un cadre politique qui reconnait le rle tenu par la population dans le processus de gestion des forts, une dlimitation claire des droits et responsabilits des communauts locales et l'tablissement d'institutions populaires pour rendre effectifs de tels droits et obligations locaux. Le Programme de Gestion Participante des Forts en Inde est en train de tenter de fournir un cadre pour un engagement srieux de la population dans la gestion des forts. Tres caractersticas distintivas de los pases en vas de desarrollo son: una historia del control por parte del Estado, de las riquezas naturales especialmente bosques; alta incidencia de pobreza; alto crecimiento de poblacin y dependencia de las actividades basadas en la tierra; y la emergencia de las formas democrticas de gobierno. Un anlisis de las tendencias emergentes en el manejo de los recursos naturales en estos pases muestra que hay (i) una conmutacin de control del estado a tenencia individual o colectiva, (ii) devolucin de las funciones de administracin a la gente local y (iii) un papel cambiante de las agencias gubernamentales en el control de lo recursos naturales. La comprensin que la participacin popular es vital para la proteccin y conservacin del bosque, es inherente en estos cambios. Anlisis basados en ejemplos de pases Asiticos muestran que la participacin de la gente puede ser posible bajo las siguientes condiciones: un marco poltico que reconozca el papel de la gente en el manejo de los bosques, la delincacin clara de los derechos y responsabilidades de las comunidades locales; y el establecimiento de instituciones populares para dar efecto a tales derechos y obligaciones locales. El Programa de Participacin en Administracin Forestal en India est intentando proveer la estructura para la participacin significativa de la gente en la administracin de bosques.
42607956|The classification of forestry literature is discussed together with recent developments in information retrieval. A valuable aid in the past, the ODC continues to be used throughout the world and its future is assured.
42606766|The present status of Multiple Use Forestry in New Zealand is considered. How that approach to forest resource management is applied to a Corporately owned industrial exotic forest is looked at in detail using as an example the exotic forests of NZFP Forests Limited, a division of Elders Resources NZFP Limited. The sustained production of a substantial annual volume of mill logs is emphasised. At the same time the Company must meet national and local requirements as a land owner. A much more liberal attitude towards opening up exotic forests in New Zealand is being taken by all forest owners. The policies and practical experiences are described as well as some of the problems. There are conflicting interests and concerns which have to be addressed. Special reference is made to recreation and hunting, both of which require considerable administrative time. A reasonable balance between all these uses has been reached but not without its problems and risks, the worst of which are human safety, forest fire and vandalism. La situation actuelle de la foresterie  objectifs intgrs en Nouvelle-Zlande est analyse. On examine en dtail comment cette mthode d'amnagement de ressources forestires est mise en pratique dans une fort industrielle d'essences exotiques dont le propritaire est une socit commerciale, en citant l'exemple des forts exotiques de NZFP Forests Limited, une division de Elders Resources NZFP Limited. La production soutenue d'un volume annuel important de bois de sciage est souligne. En mme temps la compagnie doit satisfaire aux exigences nationaux et rgionaux d'un propritaire foncier. Tous les propritaires forestiers commencent  prendre une attitude beaucoup plus librale envers l'ouverture de forts exotiques. Les politiques et les expriences pratiques sont dcrites, en mme temps que quelques-uns des problmes. Il y a des intrts et des affaires contradictoires qui doivent tre abords. On fait mention particulire de la rcration et de la chasse, dont l'une et l'autre demandent du temps administratif important. On est arriv  un quilibre acceptable entre toutes ces utilisations, mais non sans des problmes et des risques, dont les pires sont la scurit des gens, les feus de fort et le vandlisme. Se considera el estado de la silvicultura con fines multiples en Nueva Zelandia. Se examina en detalle como se aplica este enfoque en el manejo de recursos forestales en una plantacin industrial corporativa. Se usa como ejemplo las plantaciones con especies exticas de la NZFP Forests Limited, una divisin de Elders Resources NZFP Limited. Se enfatiza la produccin sostenida de un volumen anual sustancial de trozas para aserro. Al mismo tiempo la empresa como propietaria de terreno debe cumplir con otros requisitos nacionales y locales. Todos los dueos de bosques estn tomando una actitud ms liberal hacia el uso de especies exticas en Nueva Zelandia. Se describe las polticas y las experiencias prcticas as como algunos de los problemas. Existe intereses conflictivos y preocupaciones que deben ser confrontados. Se hace referencia especial a la recreacin y caza, las cuales requieren considerable tiempo administrativo. Se ha alcanzado un balance razonable entre todos estos usos, aunque no sin sus problemas y riesgos, siendo los peores la seguridad de las personas, incendios forestales y vandalismo.
42607200|This paper reviews key questions concerning biodiversity in Australia's forests and outlines government actions to ensure biodiversity conservation in forest ecosystems. The scale of biodiversity in Australian forests is indicated using the southeast forests as an example. Since European settlement in 1788 over one million square kilometers of land have been cleared for agriculture. Though some species have been lost as a result of clearing of land for agriculture there is no evidence of species being lost as a result of continuing commercial forestry operations. However, information on biodiversity is sparse in many forest areas. Recognising public concern about forest conservation, successive Federal Governments have commissioned major reports which led to the development of a National Forest Policy. This policy requires the preparation of Comprehensive Regional Assessments leading to Regional Forest Agreements. These aim to ensure that at least 15 per cent of the pre-1750 distribution of each forest community is represented in statutory conservation reserves. The need for conservation of larger areas of forest and woodland is not incompatible with meeting Australia's needs for forest products, but debate over the extent of additional forest areas to be conserved may cause some continuing conflicts. Cet article fait la revue des questions essentielles concernant la biodiversit dans les forts australiennes. ll bauche les actions gouvermentales pour assurer la conservation de la biodiversit dans les cosystmes forestiers. Les forts du sud-est sont utilises comme exemple pour indiquer l'tendue de la biodiversit dans les forts australiennes. Depuis le commencement de la colonisation europenne en 1788 plus d'un million kilomtres carrs de terre ont t dfrichs pour l'agriculture. Quelques espces ont t perdues au cours de ce dfrichement, mais il n'y a pas d'vidence de perte d'espces  cause des oprations forestires commerciales continuantes. Cependant, dans beaucoup de rgions de forts il manque les informations sur la biodiversit. La Politique Nationale des Forts exige la prparation des valuations Rgionales Comprhensives aboutissant aux Accords Forestiers Rgionaux. Ceux-ci visent  garantir qu'au moins 15 pour-cent de la distribution d'avant 1750 de chaque communaut forestire sera reprsente par des rserves de conservation statutaires. Le besoin de conserver plus de forts et de bois n'est pas incompatible avec la demande australienne des produits forestiers. Nanmoins, le dbat sur l'tendue des zones forestires additionnelles destines  la conservation pourrait entraner des conflits dans le futur. Este artculo revisa las preguntas principales que conciernen con la biodiversidad en bosques Australianos y seala las acciones del gobierno Australiano para garantizar la conservacin de la biodiversidad en ecosistemas forestales. Se indica el grado de biodiversidad en los bosques Australianos utilizando los bosques del sureste como un ejemplo. Desde la colonizacin Europea en 1788, ms de un milln de kilmetros cuadrados de tierras de bosques se han despejado para la agricultura. Aunque se han perdido algunas especies como resultado de la limpieza de tierra para agricultura no hay evidencia de que se hayan perdido especies debido a las operaciones continuas de ingeniera forestal comercial. Sin embargo, informacin sobre la biodiversidad es escasa en muchas reas forestales. La Poltica Nacional Forestal requiere la preparacin de Evaluaciones Regionales Completas que conlleven a Acuerdos Forestales Regionales. Estos tienen el propsito de garantizar que al menos 15 por ciento de la distribucin pre-1750 de cada comunidad forestal est representada en reservas estatutarias para conservacin. La necesidad de conservacin de reas mayores de bosque natural y comercial no es incompatible con satisfacer las necesidades de Australia de productos forestales, pero el debate sobre la extensin de reas de bosque adicionales para ser conservados puede provocar algunos conflictos continuos.
42608662|Typical patterns of within-tree variation in tracheid morphology in Pinus spp. are described and interpreted in terms of the mediating role of the crown between the external environment and xylem development on the bole. While the patterns essentially reflect genetically predetermined changes in the activity and location of foliar organs, important modifications are attributable to external factors, both natural (e.g. weather) and artificial (e.g. silvicultural practice), affecting the crownstem relationship. Des modles typiques de variation dans l'arbre de la morphologie des trachides de Pinus spp. sont dcrits et interprts en fonction du rle mdiateur de la couronne entre l'environnement externe et le dveloppement du bois de ft. Pendant que les modles refltent essentiellement des changements dtermins gntiquement d'avance dans l'activit et l'emplacement d'organes foliaires, des modifications importantes peuvent tre attribues aux agents externes et naturels (p. ex. le climat) et artificiels (p. ex. traitement silviculturel) qui ont des effets sur le rapport couronne-tige. Se describen e interpretan patrones tpicos de variacin-dentro de un rbol-, de la morfologa de traqueidas en especies de Pinus, en trminos de la mediacin de la copa entre el medio ambiente externo y el desarrollo del xilema en el tronco. Aunque los patrones esencialmenta reflejan cambios predeterminados genticamente, en la localizacin de los rganos foliares, se pueden atribuir importantes modificaciones a los factores externos, como los naturales (intemperie) y los artificiales (prcticas silviculturales) que afectan la relacin copa-tronco.
42608594|The rehabilitation of mangrove forests results in both marketed economic products and in the enhancement of coastal protection services. This latter indirect benefit is important where hazards such as storm surges and floods make communties vulnerable to climate risks. Estimates are presented of the benefits of mangrove restoration undertaken to enhance sea defence systems in three coastal districts of northern Vietnam. Mangrove rehabilitation can be desirable from an economic perspective based solely on the direct use benefits by local communities. Such activities have even higher benefit cost ratios with the inclusion of the indirect benefits resulting from the avoided maintenance cost for the sea dike system which the mangrove stands protect from coastal storm surges. La rhabilitation de la mangrove cr la mise en vente des produits et facilite la protection ctire. Ce dernier bnfice indirect joue un rle l o les dangers comme les temptes et les dluges rendent les communauts vulnrables aux hasards du climat. On estime les bnfices du rtablissement des mangroves entrepris pour rehausser les systmes de protection contre la mer dans trois rgions de Vit-nam du nord. La rhabilitation des mangroves peut tre avantageuse d'un point de vue conomique bas uniquement sur les bnfices d'utilisation directs des communauts locales. De telles activits ont des rapports avantages-cots plus hauts encore avec l'inclusion des bnfices indirects rsultant de la rduction des cots d'entretien du systme des digues, que les mangroves protgent contre les orages ctiers. La rehabilitacin de bosques de mangle resulta tanto en la comercializacin de productos econmicos como en el mejoramiento de los servicios de proteccin costera. Este ltimo beneficio indirecto es importante donde peligros tales como marejadas e inundaciones hacen a las comunidades vulnerables a los riesgos climticos. En el artculo se presentan estimados de los beneficios de la restauracin del mangle llevada a cabo para mejorar los sistemas de defensa contra el mar en tres distritos costeros del norte de Vietnam. La rehabilitacin del manglar puede ser deseable desde una perspectiva econmica basada solamente en los beneficios de uso directo por las comunidades locales. Tales actividades tienen an unas razones de costo beneficio ms altas con la inclusin de los beneficios indirectos que resultan de la reduccin de los costos de mantenimiento del sistema de diques marinos, los cuales son protegidos por los manglares de las marejadas.
42603417|The resistance of Chlorophora regia to the type of Phytolyma gall bug occurring outside the normal range of this tree is leading to increasing interest in it as a plantation species. The distribution, and what is known of the silviculture, of C. regia is compared with the better known C. excelsa (Iroko in West Africa, Mvule in East Africa). The appearance and mechanical properties of the two species are compared. The results of tests on C. regia, although limited, show it to be within the wide range of values reported for C. excelsa. For all practical purposes the timbers from these two trees need not be distinguished.
42607096|An area of flooded forest called vrzea in the Amazon Basin is described. Since 1992 the Brazilian National Research Council, the British Overseas Development Administration, World Wide Fund for Nature, European Union and Wildlife Conservation Society have been supporting a project the aim of which is to conserve biodiversity and develop the capacity of the local communities to manage the area in a sustainable way. As well as fostering democratic and participatory structures in the community, the project also supports research into fish stocks and timber resources. Basic health and education services are also being strengthened. Although fishing is the main source of livelihood there is an important lesson for foresters. If people really value a resource they will get together and form plans as to how to manage it sustainably. Une descrition est donne de la rgion inonde du Bassin Amazonien appele vrzea. En parallle, les services de sant lmentaire et les services ducatifs, sont galement renforcs. Bien que la pche soit la principale source d'existence de cette rgion, il en ressort une importante leon pour les forestiers: si la population tient  une ressource, elle se regroupe pour laborer des plans pour l'entretenir  long terme. 42603132|Mathematical models play an important part in modern forestry research, and make possible the simulation of practical situations for purposes of description, prediction, and the making of decisions. Practical uses of such models in forestry include the maintenance of stocks of forest seed, the production and allocation of nursery stock, the recruitment of industrial labour, the cost of establishment of plantations, the allocation of supervisory staff, and production planning.
42603522|Basic drying theory was employed to establish a simple statistical model for deriving kiln drying schedules. The diffusion equation for moisture movement through porous solids was simplified to arrive at a linear equation of rate of drying with moisture content and temperature. A restriction that temperature should vary linearly with moisture content was imposed on the rate equation and the model was further simplified. Two empirical equations were derived on the basis of specific gravity on exponential in form, to determine the initial moisture content, and the other linear in form, to determine drying co-efficient. Combination of these two equations and the simplified model gave daily mosture contents, and the use of the temperature restriction gave the temperature schedule.
42608764|This paper discusses the organisational and economic issues related to the Joint Forest Management programme in India by reference to Soliya Village in Gujarat. Based on private-benefit cost analysis (PBCA), the case study suggests that it is a financially feasible scheme but needs revision of sharing arrangements between the Forest Department and village communities. Cet article examine les questions conomiques et d'organisation lies au programme de Grance Associe des Forts en Inde, en faisant rfrence au village de Soliya au Gujarat. Este artculo discute los temas econmicos y de organizacin relacionados con el Programa Conjunto de Administracin Forestal en India con referencia a la aldea de Soliya en Gujarat. El estudio de un caso prctico, basado en un anlisis privado de costobeneficio (PBCA), sugiere que es un plan financieramente posible pero necesita revisin de los arreglos compartidos entre el Departamento Forestal y las comunidades de las aldeas.
42605184|Pressler borers have been used in the past to estimate moisture content in standing trees but there has been some diversity of opinion as to the reliability of moisture content values obtained in this way. Experiments on Japanese larch suggest that if precautions are taken to minimize weighing and evaporations errors valid results can be obtained and that perhaps the largest potential error in the past has been the lack of attention given to core geometry in relation to tree structure.
42608677|Projects wishing to generate Emission Reduction Units have to demonstrate carbon achievements by providing information on the size of the project's carbon pools and the changes to these pools. This paper outlines how the Protected Areas Project [PAP] in Costa Rica deals with this issue. The PAP covers 27 of the National Parks and Biological Reserves and aims to protect the area from land use and further degradation by buying the land, transferring the ownership to the State, and actively protecting the entire area from encroachment and fire. The carbon achievements of the project are quantified using various assumptions for the required parameters. The scientific methodologies underlying these assumptions were assessed in the certification process conducted by SGS, and values of the main parameters were verified. Specific emphasis was placed on the project's stratification using ecotypes; biomass estimates; determination of land cover; and deforestation rates. The outcome of the assessment overall was positive but some corrective action requests were raised to improve the availability and quality of the used data sets. This was reported to four independent peer reviewers who scrutinised the assessors' work and the report. After addressing the concerns articulated by the reviewers, SGS' professional judgement was approved. Les projets voulant gnrer des Units de la Rduction d'missions doivent dmonstrer les taux de carbone en fournissant des informations sur la grandeur des rserves de carbone et les changements de ces rserves. Cet article indique comment le Projet des Zones Protges (PZP) au Costa Rica aborde cette question. Le PZP comprend 27 des Parcs Nationaux et Rserves Biologiques, et a pour but de protger la zone contre l'exploitation et la dgradation supplmentaire en achetant les terres, transferrant le droit de proprit  l'tat, et protgeant la zone entire contre l'empitement et le feu. Les realisations de carbone du projet sont quantifis en utilisant de diverses suppositions pour les paramtres ncessaires. Les mthodologies scientifiques  la base de ces suppositions taient values au cours de la certification dirige par SGS, et les valeurs des paramtres les plus importants taient vrifies. On a appuy sur la stratification du projet, les valeurs estimes de la biomasse, l'estimation du couvert de la terre, et les taux de dboisement. Le rsultat gnral de l'valuation a t positif, mais il y avaient quelques demandes pour des mesures correctives pour amliorer la disponibilit et la qualit des groupes de donnes utilises. Quatre critiques pairs indpendents ont reu le rsultat et ont scrut le rapport et le travail des critiques. Aprs avoir rpondu aux soucis exprims par les contrleurs, le jugement professionnel de la SGS a t approuv.
42608537|In both commerce and forestry, cypress timber, mostly Cupressus lusitanica, occupies the leading position in Kenya and at least parts of the neighbouring countries. As a contribution towards its efficient structural applications, a country-wide sample of the commercial timber was obtained and subjected to standard strength tests of small clear specimens. Results of the tests on green wood are presented. Testing of the dry timber is still in progress. The tests yielded measures of the mean strength values and standard deviations necessary in derivation of basic strength from which grade and design stresses will be developed. National standards and structural engineering authorities are playing a part in these derivations. Several correlations were studied, including relations with density and age. Correlation coefficients were rather low while coefficients of variation tended to be high. Au Kenya, ainsi que dans certaines rgions des pays voisins, le bois de cyprs, essentiellement Cupressus lusitanien, est trs apprci,  la fois dans le commerce et en foresterie. Afin de tester ses potentialits en matire de construction, un chantillonnage national a t soumis  un test standard de rsistance. Alors que les tests sur le bois vert sont encore en cours, les rsultats prsents ici concernent le bois sec. Les tests ont produit des mesures de la valeur de solidit moyenne, ainsi que des types ncessaires  la drive de la solidit de base, desquels seront dvelopps les degrs et les courbes de pression. Plusieurs corrlations ont t tudies, incluant le rapport  la densit et  l'ge. Les coefficients de corrlation sont plutt faibles alors que les coefficients de variations tendent  tre forts. Tanto en el commercio como en la silvicultura, la madera de ciprs, por su mayor parte Cupressus lusitanica, ocupa una posicin principal en Kenya y en ciertas zonas de los pases vecinos. Como una contribucin hacia su aplicacin estructural eficiente, se tom unas muestras a escala nacional de la madera commercial y se puso especmenes pequeos y claros a las pruebas normales de resistencia. Los resultados de las pruebas de madera verde estn aqu presentados. Las pruebas de la madera seca estn todava en el proceso de realizarse. Las pruebas dieron medidas de los valores medios de resistencia y las desviaciones estndares que son necesarias para la derivacin de la resistencia bsica de lo cual los estrses de grado y diseo sern desarrollados. Los estndares nacionales y las autoridades de ingeniera estructural estn tomando ppeles en estas derivaciones. Varias correlaciones, inclusive la relacin entre la densidad y la edad fueron investigadas. Los coeficientes de las correlaciones salieron muy bajos mientras los coeficientes de variacin solan ser muy altos.
42606388|In just over 80 years, the Nigerian timber industry has developed from disorganised extraction along waterways, via an important export trade with large integrated mills, to eventually producing entirely for the home market being substantially dependent on forest reserves as the source of raw material.
42608570|The current economic orthodoxy that advocates the use of increased royalties on timber volume harvested as a means of improving natural forest management by concessionaires is challenged. An alternative scheme, which assigns both long-term cutting rights and responsibility for forest management through competitive public bidding on the value of performance guarantee bonds, is proposed. The implementation of such a scheme in the Philippines through a new type of forest lease instrument, the Industrial Forest Management Agreement, is described. This incorporates a performance guarantee bond but, due to constitutional provisions, retains both high volume-based timber royalties and a 50-year limit on tenure. The paper summarizes experience with the scheme after two years' implementation and suggests possible improvements. L'orthodoxie conomique du moment, qui prconise l'augmentation des impts et des droits perus par unite de volume de bois extrait comme le meilleur moyen d'amliorer la gestion des forts naturelles publiques par des concessionaires privs, est mis en question. L'octroi des concessions forestires ainsi que la responsabilit de gestion forestire  long terme au moyen d'enchres publiques portant sur le montant des garanties financires consenties par l'exploitant est propos en alternative. La mise en oeuvre d'un tel systme au Philippines, au moyen d'un nouveau type de contrat d'exploitation - l'Accord de Gestion de Fort Industrielle - est dcrite. Ce contrat incorpore une garantie financire mais pour des raisons lies  la Constitution de la Rpublique des Philippines, conserve  la fois une lourde imposition des volumes coupes et une dure maximale du contrat d'exploitation de 50 ans. Cet article rsume l'exprience acquise au cours de l'introduction de ce systme il y a deux ans et suggre des amliorations possibles. Se desafa la ortodoxia econmica actual que defiende el uso de comisiones aumentadas por volumen de madera cosechada como medio de mejorar la administracin del bosque natural por los concesionarios. Se propone un esquema alternativo, el cual asigna tanto derechos de corte a largo plazo, como responsabilidad para la administracin de bosques a travs de licitaciones pblicas competitivas sobre el valor de los bonos de garanta de desempeo. Se describe la implementacin de tal plan en las Filipinas a travs de un nuevo tipo de medida para alquiler de bosques con opcin de compra, el Acuerdo Industrial de Administracin Forestal. Este incorpora un bono de garanta de desempeo, pero debido a disposiciones constitucionales, retiene tanto las comisiones basadas en alto volumen de madera, como el lmite de 50 aos de tenencia. El artculo resume la experiencia con el plan despus de dos aos de implementacin y sugiere posibles mejoras.
42605280|Observations concerning the pathology of Araucana cunninghamii, A. hunsteinii, Agathis dammara, A. macrophylla, and Eucalyptus deglupta in West Malaysia are reported. Both Araucaria spp. suffer pre-emergence damping-off, which can be severe with some seed lots, and several minor nursery problems. A. cunninghamii is also susceptible to termite damage throughout its life. Routine applications of the fungicide Daconil, and to a lesser extent Colloidox, were shown to be phytotoxic giving rise to foliage symptoms and reduced mycorrhizae. Old plots of both Agathis spp. have suffered considerable mortality, the cause of which remains unknown. The remaining trees are healthy except for cankers and dead-tops at some sites. Sixteen macrofungi were recorded on decaying logs of A. cunninghamii.
42607811|The relationship between forestry and agriculture is an important facet of forestry development in many parts of the Third World. Using the development of forestry in India as a case in point, the paper describes the multi-faceted contribution of forestry to agriculture and demonstrates the need for clearly defined policy direction with regard to the forestry/agriculture interface. The treatment of this interface is traced from the initial enunciation of Indian forest policy in 1865 and its reformulation in 1894 to the National Forest Policy of 1952 and current deliberations over forest policy revision. Attention is then directed to some of the unresolved issues that have resulted from changing policy directions. Three issues are used for purposes of illustration: the cowdungfirewood dilemma, the establishment of village forests, and the conflict between forestry and agriculture for land. The paper concludes with a discussion of the broader implications of the Indian example and the lessons that may be drawn from it. The importance of policy continuity is stressed along with the need to develop forest policy in the broader socio-political context of national development. Les relations entre foret et agriculture sont un aspect important du dveloppement forestier dans de nombreuses parties du Tiers monde. Utilisant le dveloppment de la foresterie en Inde comme exemple, cet article dcrit les multiples facettes de la contribution de la foresterie  l'agriculture et dmontre les besoins d'une direction politique clairement dfinie en ce qui concerne l'interface foresterie/agriculture. Le traitement de cette interface est suivi depuis renonciation initiale de la politique forestire indienne en 1865 et sa reformulation en 1894 jusqu' la Politique Forestire Nationale de 1952 et aux dlibrations actuelles sur la rvision de la politique forestire. On porte ensuite attention  certains des points non rsolus ont result des changements de direction politique. Trois questions sont utilises comme illustration: le dilemme bouse de vache/bois de feu, la mise en place de forts de village et le conflit entre foresterie et agriculture vis  vis des terres. L'article conclut par une discussion sur la porte de l'exemple indien et les leons qui peuvent en tre tires. La relacin entre forestacin y agricultura es una faceta importante del desarrollo forestal en muchas partes del Tercer Mundo. Utilizando el desarrollo de la forestacin en India como caso, el documento describe la contribucin multifactica de la forestacin a la agricultura y demuestra la necesidad de una direccin poltica definida claramente respecto a la interfase forestacin/agricultura. El tratamiento de esta interfase es trazado desde la enunciacin inicial de la poltica forestal ind en 1865 y su reformulacin en 1894 hasta la Poltica Forestal Nacional de 1952 y corrientes deliberaciones sobre la revisin de la poltica forestal. La atencin es entonces dirijida a algunas de las cuestiones no resueltas que han resultado de cambios en las direcciones de la poltica. Son usados tres problemas con propsitos de ilustracin: el dilema estiercollena, el establecimiento de bosques de aldeas y el conflicto entre forestacin y agricultura por la tierra. El documento concluye con una discusin de las ms amplias implicancias del ejemplo ind y las lecciones que pueden inducirse de l.
42605439|The layout of stand density experiments on various sites in Kenya and the environmental conditions relating to these sites are described. The height growth of black wattle is studied and the construction of site index curves is discussed. It was found that the influence of stand density on mean height is negligible and that height differences between sites are proportional. Different growth rates were found, necessitating the construction of polymorphic site index curves.
42608943|The advantages of vegetative propagation as a production method for indigenous tree species of Malaysia is evaluated. Methods of vegetativei propagating tree species indigenous to Malaysia are then reviewed; factors found to influence the formation of adventitious roots are simile to those which regulate rooting in other tropical tree species. Examples of species propagated by grafting, air layering, tissue culture and ster cuttings are cited. Most researchers have taken softwood stem cuttings and the factors found to influence their rooting ability are reporte Although tree species indigenous to Malaysia, particularly Dipterocarps, have the reputation of being difficult to root, a total of 75 species hav been successfully propagated, a third of which belong to the genus Shorea. Cet article value les avantages de la technique de propagation vgtative comme mthode de production d'arbres d'espces indignes en Malaisie. Il passe ensuite en revue les diffrentes mthodes de propagation vgtative des essences d'arbres indignes rencontres en Malaisie. Les facteurs identifis comme ayant une influence sur la formation des racines adventives sont similaires  ceux qui rgissent les mcanismes d'enracinement d'autres essences tropicales. Sont cits des exemples d'espces propages par greffage, marcottage  l'air libre, culture de tissus et bouturage. La plupart des chercheurs travaillent sur des boutures de tiges de bois tendres et rapportent les facteurs dont il a t trouv qu'ils influenaient leur capacit d'enracinement. Bien que les espces forestires indignes en Malaisie, et plus particulirement celles de la famille des Dipterocarpaceae, soient rputes pour s'enraciner difficilement, un total de 75 espces ont t propages avec succs; un tiers de cellesci appartenait au genre Shorea. Se evalan las ventajas de la propagacin vegetativa como mtodo de produccin de especies arbreas indgenas de Malaysia. Se revisan los mtodos de propagacin vegetativa de especies arbreas indgenas de Malaysia; se encontr que los factores que influyen en la formacin de races adventicias son similares a aquellos que regulan el enraizamiento en otras especies arbreas tropicales. Se citan ejemplos de especies propagadas por injerto, acodo, cultivo de tejidos y estacas. Se reportan los factores que influyen la habilidad de enraizamiento de estacas tiernas, ya que la mayora de los investigadores han trabajado con este tipo de estacas. A pesar de que las especies arbreas indgenas de Malaysia, particularmente dpterocarpos; tienen la reputacin de ser difciles de enraizar, un total de 75 especies han sido exitosamente propagadas, un tercio de las cuales pertenece al gnero Shorea.
42608427|Agroforestry research is being implemented in Victoria, Australia, and in Zimbabwe, to develop technologies for improving the production of farming systems at a sustained level. In both countries, similar institutional arrangements and research strategies have been used in setting up the programmes. A two-level management structure has been adopted, the top level being a steering committee responsible for policy and management of the programme, the second level a research committee that designs and implements specific projects. These are interdepartmental committees, though for the long-term, the preference is for an agroforestry research unit with an institutional focus. The research is a complementary mix of on-station and on-farm experiments, designed to evaluate agroforestry opportunities identified after description and analysis of existing farming systems. In both Victoria and Zimbabwe, agroforestry is recognised for its high potential to redress some of the serious problems of land degradation, and government has incorporated this type of land use into strategies for conservation of rural resources. Des recherches agrisylvicoles sont en train en Victoria, Australie, et en Zimbabwe pour dvelopper des technologies pour amliorer la production de systmes agricoles d'une manire soutenue. Dans les deux pays, des dispositions institutionnelles et des stratgies de recherche semblables ont t utilise dans l'tablissement des programmes. Une structure d'amnagement  deux tages a t adopte, l'tage suprieur tant un comit d'organisation charg de la politique et l'administration du programme, l'tage infrieur un comit de recherche qui prpare et met en train des projets spcifiques. Ce sont des comits interdpartementaux, bien qu' long terme on donne la prfrence  une unit de recherches agrisylvicoles avec un foyer institutionnel. La recherche est un mlange complmentaire d'expriences au centre de recherches et sur ferme, conues pour valuer des possibilits agrisylvicoles identifies aprs la description et l'analyse des systmes agricoles actuels. Et en Victoria et en Zimbabwe, on reconnait le grand potentiel de l'agrisylviculture pour redresser quelques-uns des problmes graves de la dgradation de la terre, et le gouvernement a incorpor ce type d'utilisation du sol dans des stratgies de conservation des ressources rurales. En Victoria, Australia y en Zimbabwe, se viene implementando investigacin agroforestal con el fin de desarrollar tecnologas para el mejoramiento de la produccin en sistemas de fincas a un nivel sostenido. Para llevar a cabo los programas, se han utilizado en ambos pases arreglos institucionales y estrategias de investigacin similares. Se ha adoptado una estructura administrativa de dos niveles, donde el comit directivo ocupa el nivel ms alto y es el responsable por las polticas y el manejo del programa; el segundo nivel es el comit de investigacin, el cul disea e implementa los proyectos especficos. Estos son comits interdepartamentales, aunque la preferencia para el largo plazo es hacia una unidad de investigacin agroforestal con un enfoque institucional. La investigacin se realiza bajo una combinacin complementaria de experimentos en estaciones experimentales y en fincas de productores, diseados para evaluar oportunidades agroforestales identificadas despus de la descripcin y el anlisis de los sistemas de produccin existentes. Tanto en Victoria como en Zimbabwe, se reconoce a la agroforestera por su alto potencial para corregir algunos de los problemas serios de degradacin del suelo y los gobiernos han incorporado este tipo de uso de la tierra en las estrategias para la conservacin de los recursos rurales.
42607756|The conifer genus Agathis of the Eastern lowland tropical rain forests has 13 species. Several have considerable potential for plantation or enrichment planting. In a project at Oxford between 1974 and 1980 existing knowledge was collated, research (much of it collaborative) was conducted on seed storage, vegetative propagation and taxonomy. A species and provenance trial involving nine taxa and 23 locations was established. This note draws attention to the main publications on Agathis likely to be of interest to tropical foresters which resulted from this project. Conifre de la fort tropicale humide orientale de basse altitude, le genre Agathis comporte 13 espces, dont plusieurs qui pourraient avoir une importance considerable, dans les reboisements ou dans l'enrichissement de la fort naturelle. Un projet ralis  Oxford entre 1974 et 1980 a permis de runir les connaissances actuelles et d'organiser des recherches (en grande partie collaborative) sur la prservation de la graine, sur la propagation vgtative et sur la taxonomie. On a aussi tabli un essai d'espces et de provenances portant sur neuf taxa dans 23 stations diffrentes. La note suivante tire l'attention sur les principales publications issues de ce projet et pouvant intresser les silviculteurs tropicaux. El gnero de coniferas Agathis de los bosques tropicales hmedos de las tierras bajas orientales, tiene 13 especies. Algunas tienen un considerable potencial para plantacin o enriquecimiento de las mismas. En un proyecto realizado en Oxford entre 1974 y 1980 fue coleccionado el conocimiento existente y comparado en detalle, investigacin (mucha de ella en colaboracin) fue conducida, en almacenamiento de semillas, propagacin vegetativa y taxonoma. Fue establecido un ensayo de especies y procedencias incluyendo nueve taxones y 23 localidades. Este trabajo destaca las principales publicaciones sobre Agathis cuyo probable inters para los forestales de los trpicos result de este proyecto.
42608091|Ugandans have grown matoke and trees together on the same plot of land for many centuries, as both were economically and culturally desirable. For over 40 years the tendency has been to grow matoke in monoculture without the tree component. There has been no quantifiable information regarding the interactive relationship between matoke and trees and the sustained productivity of matoke. The observation plot at Entebbe was set up to study the effect on such productivity. In order to relate the results of this plot to those obtainable from other matoke farms in the country, maintenance and other cultural practices have conformed to those of other farmers. The plot contains about 138 trees/ha ranging from seedlings to mature ones, shrubs and herbs. Maintenance of the crop has been as recommended by the Department of Agriculture and involves keeping the plot free of weeds and maintaining a continuous surface mulch. There has been deviation from the practices carried out by other farmers in that pruning of healthy banana leaves and removal of sheaths has not been done as it is considered unnecessary and undesirable. The plot has produced 280 bunches per hectare per year valued at $1445 which is considered a good return. Only matoke has been given value, other crops like cassava, vegetables and fruits have not been given monetory value, but are considered important as they provide food items which would otherwise be purchased. Declining productivity of matoke on farms in Entebbe and surrounding districts is attributed to the elimination of trees on these farms, in particular trees of the leguminaceae family which used to be common. It has been demonstrated that matoke can grow and produce valuable large bunches under the canopy of big trees, provided that the branches of such trees are pruned to create sufficient vertical spacing, so that the matoke can still enjoy morning and afternoon sunlight. Les ougandais ont cultiv le matok et des arbres ensemble sur la mme parcelle de terrain pendant plusieurs sicles, parce que tous les deux taient conomiquement et culturellement avantageux. Pour plus de 40 ans on a eu tendance  cultiver le matok en monoculture sans arbres. Il n'y a pas eu de renseignements quantifiables quant au rapport  action rciproque entre le matok et les arbres et la productivit soutenue du matok. La placette d'observation  Entebe tait tablie pour tudier l'influence de ce rapport-l sur telle productivit. Afin d'tablir un rapport entre les rsultats de cette placette et ceux qu'on peut obtenir d'autres fermes de matok du pays, l'entretien et les autres oprations culturales ont conform  ceux d'autres cultivateurs. La placette comprend environ 138 arbres/ha, de semis  arbres adultes, des arbustes et des herbes. L'entretien de la culture a suivi les recommandations du Ministre d'Agriculture et entrane le maintien de la placette dbarrasse de mauvaises herbes et le maintien d'un paillage de surface continu. On s'est cart des soins des autres cultivateurs dans la mesure o l'lagage de feuilles de banane saines et l'enlvement de gaines n'ont pas t ralis parce qu'on ne les considre pas ncessaire ou dsirable. La placette a produit 280 rgimes par hectare par an, valus  $1445, qu'on considre comme un bon bnfice. On a donn un valeur seulement au matok; d'autres cultures comme la cassave, des vgtaux et des fruits n'ont pas t donn une valeur montaire, mais sont considrs comme important parce qu'ils fournissent des produits alimentaires qui seront autrement achets. La productivit baissante de matok des fermes  Entebbe et le pays d'alentours est attribue  l'limination d'arbres sur ces fermes, surtout d'arbres de la famille des Leguminaces qui taient frquents autrefois. On a dmontr que le matok peut pousser et produire de grands rgimes de valeur sous le couvert de grands arbres, pourvu que les rameaux de tels arbres soient lagus pour crer assez d'espace vertical de sorte que le matok peut encore bnficier de la lumire matinale et d'aprs-midi. En Uganda se ha venido practicando por muchos siglos el asocio de banano con rboles con beneficios econmicos y culturales. En los ltimos 40 aos sin embargo, la tendencia ha sido el monocultivo sin el componente arbreo. No existe informacin que cuantifique la interaccin de los dos componentes y la produccin sostenida del banano. Se estableci en Entebbe una parcela de observacin con el fin de estudiar el efecto de la asociacin en ia productividad del banano. Para permitir comparar los resultados de la parcela con otras fincas del pais, se ajustaron las prcticas culturales a las mismas realizadas por los agricultores, que consistieron en mantener la parcela libre de malezas y favorecer la presencia de mulch en el suelo, tal como lo recomienda el Departamento de Agricultura. Algunos agricultores practicaron la poda de hojas sanas y la remocin de algunas vainas en el banano; estas prcticas no se realizaron en la parcela por considerarse innecesarias e indeseables. La parcela present alrededor de 138 rboles/ha (jvenes hasta adultos), arbustos y hierbas. Se obtuvo una produccin de 280 racimos/ha/ao, valorados en $1445 lo ue es considerado un buen ingreso. No se valor otros cultivos como yuca, vegetales y frutas, considerados de gran importancia como fuente alimenticia, los cuales de otra manera deberan ser comprados. La disminucin de la productividad de los bananales en Entebbe y alrededores se atribuye a la eliminacin del componente arbreo del sistema, especialmente los de la familia Leguminosae que fueron muy comunes. Se ha demostrado que se puede producir racimos de alta calidad bajo sombra de rboles grandes, siempre que estos sean podados de manera que permitan al banano recibir suficiente luz por las maanas y las tardes.
42603277|A description is presented of a reconnaissance survey in a hitherto unknown forest region on the north coast of West Irian. This survey was designed to provide within a short period the necessary information to select areas where both the forest quality and the accessibility were of a sufficient standard to warrant expenditure on a forest inventory. On aerial photographs of the area, the forest was subdivided into various classes of forest quality and accessibility according to a classification which had been evolved in forest regions of which the composition was known. In the selected area a few representative sample plots were measured. Subsequently, the measured tree volumes were grouped into three utility classes according to their physical properties. An estimate of the minimum area over which an inventory survey would be necessary to obtain a reasonably accurate result is provided by statistical treatment of the obtained volume figures of the three utility classes.
42608280|The main elements of the prognosis are these. Tropical moist forests will be reduced in extent (but not as much as current rates would suggest) and in quality; the proportion and area of TMF set aside in 'Protected Areas' will increase (slightly) though the effectiveness of 'protection' will remain questionable; biodiversity loss will continue, but is unlikely to reach the catastrophic levels widely predicted. Although the number of confirmed species extinctions is small, the number of threatened species is very large and increasing rapidly, with major implications for conservation biology and management. The effects of climate change on changes on TMF, and vice versa, are very difficult to predict, but it seems probable that increased ecological stresses may arise from the need to adapt to (relatively) rapidly changing conditions. Fewer people will be living in TMF or deriving their livelihoods from extraction of products (though opportunities to generate livelihoods from marketing environmental services may increase); the monetary contribution from TMF to societies will probably decline relatively arid in absolute terms, even while their non-monetary importance increases.
