42609017|Energy transfer rates were measured around an Oxford Solar Kiln containing 3800 kg of oak in equilibrium with the air inside the kiln. The energy transfer rates due to convection from and radiation through each wall of the kiln and its roof were measured using simple flux plates and net radiometers respectively. Conduction through the floor was also estimated using a flux plate. In spite of the difficulties in closing the energy balance, this study demonstrated experimental techniques for measuring the transfer rates around a solar kiln. Important features include the need to measure the temperature of the wood stack at more than two points and the need to account for radiative effects when using flux plates of the type used here to measure the energy transfer rates due to convection. Although the large discrepancy in the energy balance suggests that some of the measurements may be unreliable, the measurements do indicate that there is scope for reducing the net energy losses from the walls by insulating them. The size of the energy losses through the floor reported by other workers has not been confirmed, with these results suggesting a net energy loss of only 1% of the total incoming solar radiation. Les niveaux de transfert d'nergie ont t mesurs dans l'environnement d'un four solaire de schage de bois, d'un type labor  Oxford, contenant 3.800 kg de chne en quilibre avec l'air  l'intrieur du four. Les niveaux de transfert d'nergie dus aux phnomnes de convection et de radiation de et  travers les parois latrales et la paroi suprieure ont t mesurs en utilisant respectivement de simples bandes d'alignement de thermocouples et des radiomtres. La conduction  travers le plancher a galement t estime grce  l'utilisation de bandes d'alignement de thermocouples. La ncessit de mesurer la temprature du tas de bois  plus de deux diffrents points et la ncessit de tenir compte des phnomnes de rayonnement qui se produisent lors de l'utilisation de bandes d'alignement de thermocouples telles celles utilises dans ce cadre pour la mesure des niveaux des transferts d'nergie dus  la convection, constituent des caractristiques importantes du systme. Bien qu'une importante diffrence dans la balance nergtique suggre la non-fiabilit de certaines mesures, les mesures indiquent clairement qu'il subsiste une marge d'action pour rduire les pertes nergtiques nettes qui se produisent par les parois latrales du four. Une meilleure isolation de celles-ci pourrait amliorer la situation. L'ordre de grandeur des pertes nergtiques  travers le plancher report par d'autres travailleurs n'a pas t confirm. Ces rsultats suggrent une perte nette d'nergie de seulement 1% de l'nergie solaire totale absorbe. Se midieron las tasas de transferencia de energa alrededor de un horno solar Oxford que contena 3800 kg de roble en equilibrio con el aire contenido dentro del horno. Las tasas de transferencia de energa debido a la conveccin y la radiacin a travs de cada una de las paredes del horno y su techo fueron medidas utilizando platos de flujo simple y radimetros netos respectivamente. Tambin se estim la conduccin a travs del piso del horno utilizando un plato de flujo. Las caractersticas ms importantes incluyen la necesidad de medir la temperatura de la pila de madera en ms de dos puntos y la necesidad de tener en cuenta los efectos de la radiacin cuando se usan platos de flujo del mismo tipo que los usados aqu para medir la tasas de transferencia de energa debido a conveccin. Aunque la gran discrepancia en el balance de energa sugiere que algunas de las medidas pueden no ser confiables; las medidas s indican que hay un efecto de reducir las prdidas de energa neta de las paredes cuando stas se aslan. El tamao de las prdidas de energa a travs del piso reportadas por otros investigadores no ha sido confirmada por estos resultados, los cuales sugieren una prdida de energa neta de solamente 1% del total de la radiacin solar entrante.
42606733|Destruction of the endemic forest and extensive soil erosion followed early settlement of the Island of St. Helena. In the 18th Century, Governors appointed by the East India Company introduced temperate and tropical tree species. However it was only in the second half of the present Century that large-scale reafforestation began under the auspices of the Overseas Development Administration. Forestry today is concentrating on the afforestation of steep upland ridges, the development of a sawmilling and timber treatment enterprise and the conservation, propogation and expansion of the endemic tree species which have survived. La destruction de la fort endmique et l'rosion tendue du sol suivaient la colonisation initiale de l'le de Sainte-Hlne. Au 18e sicle des gouverneurs nomms pra la Compagnie des Indes orientales introducisaient des essences forestires tempres et tropicaux. Pourtant, il n'tait que dans la seconde moiti du sicle actuel que la restauration forestire  grande chelle a commenc sous les auspices de l'Administration de Dveloppement Outremer. Aujourd'hui, la foresterie se concentre sur le reboisement des chanes raides des hauteurs, le dveloppement d'une entreprise de sciage et de traitement de bois et la prservation, la multiplication et l'extension des essences forestires endmiques qui ont survcu. En el siglo 18 se introdujeron especies forestales templadas y tropicales, por parte de gobernadores contratados por la East India Company. Sin embargo, fue apenas en la segunda mitad de este siglo en que se inici un programa de reforestacin a gran escala, auspiciado por la la Administracin para el Desarrollo de Ultramar (ODA) del Reino Unido. El programa se concentra actualmente en la reforestacin de laderas con pendientes pronuciadas, el desarrollo de una empresa de aserro y tratamiento de madera, y la conservacin, propagacin y expansin de las especies forestales endmicas que han sobrevivido.
42603585|In an attempt to reduce the cost of controlling weed growth in a teak clonal garden established in 1960, two rates, 60 gallons and 40 gallons per acre, of a mixture of 2,4-D and 2,4,5-T were used. Both concentrations appeared to have been too heavy and affected the trees; the higher rate of application resulted in more severe damage and more numerous deaths both of ordinary stock and grafted clones.
42605247|Forestry offers challenging prospects, both for economic growth and social development. Often, however, its many-sided developmental role is appreciated insufficiently. With only 2 per cent of the total area of the country under productive high forests, forestry and forest industries have been and could continue to be an economic pacemaker. In addition to the exports of cocoa, groundnuts, cotton and palm produce, forest products had been the mainstay of the country's favourable balance of payments in the past. Of all the Nigerian exports, wood products command the highest range of international currencies. The forests also provide raw materials which satisfy local consumer demands and investment needs. Forest exploitation and the resulting industries create employment and increased earnings which are essential objectives of economic development policies. However, the forestry economic boom that had occurred was in response to overseas demands while the benefits of value added accrued to foreign-based investors. The recent rapid economic development has generated a great deal of wood-processing activities, particularly at the primary stage of sawmilling. Present wood requirements are exceedingly large and there would probably be a shortage before very long. Yet, there are needs for the restoration of the national forest-cover that go far beyond the need to balance wood demand and supply. Reforestation for ecological purposes on a very large scale has become a necessity for many eroded and wind-swept areas of the country. Just as the loss of forest-cover means ultimate destruction of agricultural production, climate, and living conditions, reforestation is the indispensable starting phase for a new cycle of ecological rehabilitation and the introduction of a new set of human endeavours. Such large-scale plantations for purposes of ecological rehabilitation and sustained yield production of forest resources must include comprehensive measures such as the introduction of business-oriented forest services, provision of adequate and unfettered financial resources, the establishment of modern forest villages through agri-silvicultural practices, and the development of research programmes which would facilitate full and efficient utilization of forest resources.
42606410|The results of tests to evaluate some timber properties of ten year old Cordia alliodora grown in Vanuatu are reported. The wood combines an attractive appearance with some good technical properties, notably stability and durability; it offers prospects of being an excellent joinery timber and suitable for furniture and manufacture, flooring and other solid-wood applications. Les rsultats de tests pour valuer certaines qualits de bas de Cordia alliodora ags de 10 ans et originant de Vanuatu sont rapports. Le bois associe une apparence attrayante  de bonnes qualits techniques notamment la stabilit et la durabilit; il offre la possibilit d'tre un excellent bois de menuiserie et convenant  la production de meubles, de paraquets et  d'autres applications en bois massif. Se presentan algunos resultados de pruebas para evaluar las propriedades de rboles de Cordia alliodora de diez aos de edad cultivados en Vanuatu. Se juntan en el madera un bien aspecto con unas propriedades buenas, incluso estabilidad y durabilidad; es una especie prometadora que podra ser excelente para la carpintera y apta para la construccin de meubles, pisos y ostras aplicaciones del madero slido.
42604514|Destruction of Britain's forests during 4,000 years had severe ecological effects, but plants and animals had time to adapt to a denuded landscape. In only 50 years foresters, through applied ecology and supported by sustained research, have created on deserted, impoverished land, new forests to restore a part of Britain's plundered forest wealth. Plants and animals are adapting to the new forests which, in addition to growing wood at three times the rate of former forests in more fertile environments, provide our richest wildlife resource for centuries. Patience is necessary: prospects for greater enrichment through continued research are great. La destruction des forts de la Grande-Bretagne pendant 4,000 ans a entran des consquences cologiques svres; mais les vgtaux et les animaux ont eu le temps de s'adapter  un paysage dnud. En 50 ans seulement, les forestiers ont cr sur un sol appauvri et nu de nouvelles forts, grce  l'cologie applique et en se fondant sur les rsultats d'une recherche soutenue. Ils ont ainsi restaur une partie de la richesse forestire qui avait t dilapide. Vgtaux et animaux s'adaptent aux nouveaux milieux forestiers qui produisent, sur les sites les plus fertiles, un volume de bois trois fois suprieur  celui de la fort spontane antrieure et permet le dveloppement le plus important de la vie sauvage qui se soit produit depuis des sicles. La patience est ncessaire car les perspectives d'une plus grande extension au terms de recherches continues sont riches de promesses.
42605333|A systems analysis and simulation approach is used to trace the consequences of the present rapid economic changes in Nigeria on wood consumption. The human population is grouped into traditional and non-traditional groups on the bases of income and rural-urban location. The wood-using sectors are grouped into those, such as housing, in which the services of a wooden structure are distributed over time time and those, such as fuelwood consumption, in which the wood is consumed at a point in time. Some of the consequences of changing income on wood consumption are delayed; the duration of the delay depends on how long it takes to modernize the wood consumption behaviour of large numbers of individuals through public actions which would improve income and income distribution. Les consquences pour la consommation du bois au Nigria de l'actuelle volution rapide de l'conomie sont tudies au moyen d'une analyse de systmes avec simulation. La population est classe en deux catgories, traditionelle et non traditionelle, selon les revenues et la domiciliation. On distingue entre deux secteurs utilisateurs de bois; l'un concernant les usages durables, par exemple la construction, l'autra par la consommation instantane, par exemple pour le chauffage. Certaines des consquences des chargements de revenue pour la consommation sont retardes, la dure du retard tant fonction du temps ncessaire  la modernisation du comportement de trs nombreux consommateurs par des actions gouvernementales destines  amliorer le niveau de vie.
42605990|The World population is expected to double by the year 2025, placing unprecedented demands on the world's resources, creating tensions between nations which put at risk the very future of mankind. Hydro-carbon supplies of oil, coal, peat and gas created partly by decomposition of our first primeval forest millions of years ago, may be exhausted within a few generations. Wood supplies from our natural forest, the second forest, are likely to fall short of demand by the turn of the century. Oil exporting countries, with their huge cash surpluses currently exceeding $100bn per annum, Britain with anticipated oil revenues of $35bn by 1985 and other industrialised countries have a special responsibility to bridge the timber supply gap and provide employment by helping create future wealth in the World's Third Forest. A further significant contribution to world re-afforestation could be made by a levy on the annual $5bn worth of tropical timber exports. One of the world's largest importers of timber, Japan, has already recognised the need to increase self sufficiency and secure future wood supplies by substantial long term investments in other countries. Does Britain require a similar strategy? The Third Forest of manmade fuel-wood and industrial plantations are estimated to require a sustained annual investment of $5bn to the end of the century. Could the "World's Third Forest" be the vehicle to take us forward?
42606684|Antigua is a Caribbean island that was almost entirely deforested during the 1600's for establishment of a sugar industry. With the decline of this industry a mixture of natural and introduced vegetation has succeeded onto abandoned agricultural lands. Inventory of one 0.2 ha (0.5 acre) quadrat at the Wallings Reservoir Forest Reserve in southwestern Antigua by J. S. Beard (Colonial Forest Service) in 1944 documented a young pole forest 15.2 to 21.3 m tall. This forest had a basal area of 22.8 m per ha, a quadratic mean diameter of 20.6cm and 20 tree species. A resurvey of the same vicinity in 1988 indicates that the stand has a canopy height of 9.0 to 11.0 m, with a basal area of 19.8 m per ha (trees 10 cm dbh and greater), a quadratic mean diameter of 19.3 cm, and 26 tree species; ten of these species are evidently new to the stand. Candlewood (Guettarda scabra), a pioneer species, is now the most common tree, while Spanish oak (Inga laurina) was most common in 1944. The changes in composition are being strongly influenced by "selective" harvesting of preferred species. It appears development towards a late successional forest is being held in check by this activity. L'Antigua est une le des Carabes qui tait presque entirement dboise pendant le dix-septime sicle pour tablir une industrie sucrire. Avec le dclin de cette industrie, un mlange de vgtation naturelle et introduite a succd sur des friches. L'inventaire d'un quadrat de 0.2 ha (0.5 acre)  la Rserve Forestire de Wallings reservoir au sud-ouest de l'Antigua par J. S. Beard (Service Colonial des Forts  en 1944 documentait une jeune fort de poles de 15.2  21.3 m de hauteur. Cette fort avait une surface terrire de 22.8m par ha, un diamtre moyen quadratique de 20.6 cm et 20 essences forestires. Un reinventaire du mme endroit en 1988 montre que le peuplement a une hauteur de couvert de 9.0  11.0 m, avec une surface terrire de 19.8 m par ha (arbres avec un diamtre  hauteur d'homme de 10 cm et plus), un diamtre moyen quadratique de 19.3 cm, et 26 essences forestires; dix de ces essences sont videmment toutes nouvelles pour le peuplement. Guettarda scabra, une essence pionnire, est maintenant l'arbre le plus frquent, tandis qu'Inga laurina tait le plus frquent en 1944. Les changements du mlange sont fortement influencs par la rcolte 'slective' d'essences prfres. Il parat que le dveloppement vers une fort de fin de succession est frein par cette activit. La isla caribea de Antigua fue casi enteramente deforestada durante los aos de 1600 para el establecimiento de la industria azucarera. Con el decaimiento de esta industria, una mezcla de vegetacin natural e introducida se estableci sobre las tierras que se utilizaron para la actividad agrcola. En el ano de 1944, se realiz un inventario de cuadrantes de 0.2 ha. (0.5 acres) en la Reserva Forestal Wallings al suroeste de Antigua, elaborado por J. S. Beard (Servicio Forestal Colonial), el cual menciona la precencia de un bosque joven de postes entre los 15.2 y 21.3 metros de altura, un rea basai de 22.8 m por ha., un dimetro cuadrado medio de 20.6 cm y 20 especies de rboles. La misma rea se volvi a inventariar en 1988, para entonces el rodal present una altura de cobertura entre los 9.0 y 11.0 metros, con un rea basal de 19.8 m por ha. (arboles mayores de 10 cm dap), un dimetro cuadrado medio de 19.3 cm y 26 especies de rboles; diez de estas especies fueron evidentemente nuevas en el rodal. El rbol de candela (Guettarda scabra) especie pionera, es actualmente la especie ms comn, mientras que el Roble espaol (Inga laurina) lo fue en 1944. Los cambios en la composicin del bosque estn siendo fuertemente influenciadas por la corta "selectiva" de las especies de mayor demanda. Aparentemente el desarrollo hacia un bosque sucecional tardio esta siendo alterado por los efectos de esta actividad.
42608281|Dry woodlands occupy very large areas in many tropical countries. Particularly where population pressures are high, such woodland types constitute increasingly important elements in land uses which integrate woodland management with crop and livestock production. In southern Africa, colonial and post-colonial management objectives commonly failed to satisfy the end-use requirements of those most dependent on miombo. With ever-growing pressures on this vegetation type, the empowerment of local people is seen as the most promising means of satisfying wants and avoiding the alternative of woodland destruction. Past community controls are by no means necessarily the means of ensuring survival of miombo with its multifarious range of products, including environmmental protection. The necessary reorientation of miombo management calls for a deeper understanding of the impacts of past measures and practices, combined with the equitable devolution of responsibility for natural resources to locally-based management. These steps together with information on household requirements and improved operation of markets will help to assure the future of miombo which will otherwise continue to be degraded and destroyed. Les terres forestires sches occupent des secteurs trs vastes dans plusieurs pays tropicaux. De tels types de terres forestires sont des lments d'importance croissante dans les usages de la terre intgrant la grance des terres forestires  la production de rcolte et de troupeaux, particulirement dans les zones de forte pression dmographique. En Afrique mridionale, les objectifs de grance coloniaux et post-coloniaux chouent en gnral  satisfaire les demandes d'usage final de la plupart de ceux qui dpendent du miombo. Avec les pressions sans cesse grandissantes sur ce type de vgtation, l'autorit donne aux populations locales est perue comme le moyen le plus prometteur de satisfaire aux besoins et d'viter l'alternative de la destruction des terres forestires. Les contrles communautaires passs ne sont certainement pas ncessairement le moyen d'assurer la survie du miombo avec son ventail multiple de produits, et la protection environnementale. La ncessit de changer l'orientation de la grance du miombo demande une comprhension plus profonde des impacts des mesures et des pratiques passes allant de pair avec une dvolution quitable de la responsabilit des ressources naturelles  une grance base localement. Ces pas combins  une information sur les demandes des foyers et  une opration amliore des marchs aidera  assurer le futur du miombo qui continuerait autrement  tre dgrad et dtruit.
42606522|In lowland dipterocarp forest in Malaysia, woody vines increase damage associated with felling and slow rates of regeneration after selective logging. When trees connected by vines are felled, they tend to pull each other down. Vines have flexible stems and generally survive falling. The fallen vines sprout profusely and give rise to many of the vines that infest the trees that are supposed to constitute the next timber crop. Vine cutting prior to logging has advantages over post-felling vine control. If the vine treatment is sufficiently in advance of logging for the stems to decay, logging damage is decreased. Although the rooted stumps of cut vines may sprout, by making sure that vine stems are dead before they fall, a major source of vines in regenerating forest is removed. Dans les forts basses de Diptrocarpaces de la Malaisie les vignes ligneuses accentuent lesdgts lis  l'abattage et la lenteur de la rgnration aprs des coupes slectives. Quand des arbres lis par des vignes sont abattus, ils ont tendance  s'abattre. Les vignes ont des tiges souples et en gnral survivent  l'abattage. Les vignes tombes  terre produisent beaucoup de pousses et engendrent beaucoup des vignes qui infestent les arbres qui doivent constituer la prochaine culture de bois d'oeuvre. La coupe des vignes avant l'abattage peut tre plus profitable que la lutte contre les vignes aprs abattage. Si le traitement des vignes a lieu assez en avance de l'abattage, afin que les tiges puissent dprir, les dgts lis  l'abattage sont rduits. Bien que les souches enracines des vignes coupes puissent pousser, on enlve une source principale de vignes dans les forts rgnrantes en assurant que les tiges des vignes sont mortes avant qu'elles tombent  terre. En bosques dipterocarpios de tierras bajas en Malasia, las enredaderas leosas aumentan el dao asociado con la tala de rboles y una lenta regeneracin despus de una tala selectiva. Cuando se cortan rboles conectados por enredaderas, tienden a derribarse los unos a los otros. Las enredaderas tienen tallos flexibles y generalmente sobreviven la tala. Las enredaderas cadas germinan profusamente y producen muchas de las enredaderas que infectan los rboles que van a formar la nueva cosecha de madera. El cortar las enredaderas antes de los rboles, tiene ms ventajas que el cortarlas despus. Si el tratamiento de la enredadera se lleva a cabo lo bastante antes de la tala para que los tallos se pudran, el dao que sufren las maderas es menor. Aunque los muones arraigados de las parras pueden germinar, si nos aseguaramos de que los tallos estn muertos antes de que caigan, nos deshacemos de la mayor fuente de enredaderas en bosques en estado de regeneracin.
42605380|Some social and economic factors in Nigeria today call for an intensive timber management system that involves a radical decrease in rotation length. Such short rotation culture will be helpful in encouraging investment in timber growing, correcting the uneven distribution of timber resources in Nigeria, supplying the needed raw material for pulp and paper industry and contributing to rural employment.
42608670|The Kyoto Protocol has spurred many sectors to examine the potential issues and opportunities related to reducing greenhouse gas emissions. In the forest sector it appears that major opportunities will flow from the capability to establish new forests that act as carbon sinks, to expand forest biomass-based electricity generation and to substitute wood products for more energy-intensive building materials. The implementation of trading in credits or securities related to these initiatives could provide a major inflow of capital into the forest sector. To take advantage of these opportunities, the forest sector will need to establish new cross-sectoral partnerships with the energy, mining, transport, construction and industrial sectors. These partnerships should lead to innovative investment vehicles and initiatives that will address greenhouse emissions in an economically and environmentally sensitive way. Le Protocole de Kyoto a peronn nombreux secteurs  examiner les questions et les opportunits autour de la rduction des missions des gaz qui causent l'effet de serre. Dans le secteur forestier il semble qu'on trouvera nombreuses opportunits dans la capacit d'tablir de nouvelles forts fonctionnant pour squestrer carbone, de dvelopper la production de l'lectricit base sur la biomasse forestire, et de substituer les produits de bois pour des matriaux de construction moins gaspilleurs d'nergie. Le commerce des crdits et des titres manant de ces initiatives pourrait fournir une affluence majeure de capital dans le secteur forestier. Pour tirer parti de ces opportunits, le secteur forestier aura besoin d'tablir de nouvelles associations commerciales avec les secteurs de l'nergie, de l'industrie minire, du transport, de la construction et de l'industrie. Ces associations devraient apporter des moyens d'investir et des initiatives d'investissement innovateurs qui aborderont les missions des gaz qui causent l'effet deserre, tout en respectant l'conomie et l'environnement.
42606768|It is argued in this paper that the sophistication of technology available for information servicing (including biotechnology) is ahead of our capacity to use it. There is a danger that research projects may be designed to demonstrate the tools of our trade rather than to further the purposes of that trade. Innovation in technology reveals problems that are not merely technological: their solution requires judgement, reason and integrity. We face a dilemma in that numeracy may overshadow literacy, to the detriment of judgement; there is a contradiction between our advocacy of genetic diversity in natural forest conservation and the single mindedness with which we engineer clones of single purpose species. The distinction between "science" and "technology" (and between "discovery" and "invention") is no longer valid. The definition of plant species, which technological innovation now makes possible, should allow for the allocation of property rights to naturally occurring genotypes and could serve a conservation function. New developments call for new directions in research and its management, and for higher standards of scientific integrity and professionalism. Il est propos dans cet article que la complexit de la technologie disponible pour traiter l'information (y compris la biotechnologie) dpasse notre capacit de l'utiliser. Il y a un risque que des projets de recherche seront conus pour dmontrer les outils de notre mtier plutt que d'avancer les objets de ce mtier. L'innovation technologique dcouvre des problmes pas seulement technologiques: la rsolution de ceux-ci exige du jugement, de la raison et de l'intgrit. Nous trouvons devant le dilemme que les capacits au calcul vont peuttre clipser l'alphabtisation au dtriment du jugement; notre plaidoirie en faveur de la diversit gntique dans la dfense des forts naturelles est en contradiction avec la rsolution avec laquelle nous manipulons des clones d'essences  un usage. La distinction entre "la science" et "la technologie" (et aussi entre "la dcouverte" et "l'invention") n'est plus valable. La dfinition d'espces vgtaux, que l'innovation technologique rend maintenant possible, doit permettre l'attribution de droits de proprit sur des gnotypes qui se produisent naturellement et pourrait aider la prservation. Des dveloppements nouveaux demandent des directions nouvelles dans la recherche et son amnagement, et des niveaux plus levs d'intgrit et de professionalisme scientifiques. Se discute como el nivel sofisticado de la technologa que est disponible para servicios de informacin (incluyendo biotecnologa), est ms avanzado que nuestra capacidad para hacer uso de esta tecnologa. Existe el peligro de que los proyectos de investigacin se disenen ms para demostrar las herramientas disponibles en nuestra disciplina, en vez de apoyar las funciones de la misma. Innovacin en tecnologa revela problemas que no son meramente tecnolgicos: su solucin requiere juicio, razonamiento e integridad. Enfrentamos un dilema en que la habilidad en los mtodos numricos puede hacer que se subestime el entendimiento, en detrimento del juicio; existe la contradiccin entre nuestra promocin de la diversidad gentica en la conservacin de bosques naturales y el razonamiento simplista con que producimos clones de especies de un nico uso. La distincin entre "ciencia" y "tecnologa" (y entre "descubrimiento" e "invencin") ya no es vlida. La definicin de especies vegetales que la innovacin tecnolgica hace ahora posible, debe permitir la asignacin de derechos de propiedad a genotipos que ocurran naturalmente y puedan cumplir una funcin de conservacin. Avances nuevos requieren direccionamientos nuevos de la investigacin y de su manejo, y mejores estndares de la integridad cientfica y profesionalismo.
42608050|Twenty-five years of experience in attempting to cultivate the south-west fringes of the Gobi Desert has shown the benefit of fostering the indigenous vegetation in conjunction with shrub and tree shelter belts. An agriculturally based community of 26,000 people now flourishes in an area which was previously inhospitable and virtually uninhabited.  26000. 25 ans d'exprience  essayer de cultiver les bords sud-ouest du dsert Gobi a montr l'avantage de nourrir la vgtation indigne de concert avec les des arbustes et des arbres. Una comunidad agrcola conformada de 26,000 personas disfruta de condiciones estables en un rea que era previamente inhospitable y virtualmente inhabitable.
42603689|The long period of waiting before trees mature, risk of substitution, scarcity of relevant data, lack of institutions, paucity of efficient management and insufficient public awareness are all disadvantages of the tree growing enterprise. All these and some possible ways of overcoming them are analysed.
42603011|A brief account of the forests of New Zealand is given, and the methods used to assess their resources, both indigenous and exotic, are described. The volumetric results of the 1945-55 indigenous survey have been published and the volume of available timber totalled 2,453 million cubic feet softwood and 982 million cubic feet hardwood; at the present rate of cutting, this represents 50 years of life for the softwood resource and 200 years for the hardwoods. The comprehensive silvical data collected during the survey is now being used to obtain an understanding of the forest spectrum, the relationships between forest types, and the effects of damage by introduced animals; this will form a foundation for management, future intensive research and as a basis for re-appraisals. Special attention is being paid to the problems of the protection forests, scrublands and grasslands in the mountains, with emphasis on erosion and water rgimes. The exotic survey will produce only volumetric results, and these are not yet available as field work begun in 1959 is incomplete. The uses of aerial photography in both basic inventories is reviewed, and suggestions are made for research into certain problems of resource assessment.
42607810|The selection of suitable provenances is essential for achieving maximum productivity in forest plantations. As few countries have the resources for provenance testing over a wide range of sites, a thorough appraisal of the relative merits of different provenances can only be achieved through international cooperation and exchange of information. The establishment of the Pinus caribaea Morelet and Pinus oocarpa Schiede international provenance trials under the coordination of the Commonwealth Forestry Institute, Oxford, led to the creation of a provenance assessment data base which revealed that certain provenances grew well in a wide range of environments across countries. La slection de provenances appropries est essentielle pour obtenir une productivit maximale dans les plantations forestires. Etant donn que peu de pays ont les ressources ncessaires pour tester les provenances sur un large chantillon de sites, une approche minutieuse des mrites relatifs des diffrentes provenances peut seulement tre ralise grce  la coopration internationale et  l'change d'informations. La mise en place des tests de provenance internationaux de Pinus caribaea Morelet et de Pinus oocarpa Schiede coordonne par le Commonwealth Forestry Institute, Oxford a conduit  la cration d'une base de donnes d'valuation des provenances qui a rvl que certaines des provenances ont une croissance satisfaisante dans une large gamme d'environnements  travers le monde. La seleccin de procedencias adecuadas es esencial para la obtencin de una productividad mxima en plantaciones forestales. Como pocos pases tienen los recursos para pruebas de procedencias sobre un amplio rango de sitios, una prueba cabal de los mritos relativos de diferentes procedencias puede obtenerse solamente a travs de la cooperacin internacional e intercambio de informacin. El establecimiento de ensayos internacionales de procedencias de Pinus caribaea Morelet y Pinus oocarpa Schiede bajo la coordinacin del Commonwealth Forestry Institute, Oxford, llev a la creacin de una base de datos de valoracin de procedencias los cuales revelaron que ciertas procedencias crecieron bien en un amplio rango de ambientes a travs de pases.
42605296|A programmable pocket calculator can be a useful field aid for Barr and Stroud dendrometer users. Three programs are described. The first uses dendrometer readings to calculate diameter at the point of sight, and the vertical distance, slope distance, and horizontal distance from the instrument to the point of sight. The other two programs calculate instrument inclinometer readings to enable users to sight at predetermined heights on the tree bole.
42609963|A dynamic simulation modelling system for forestry planning is described. Known as TIMPLAN, the system provides a generalised model of timber production and processing, and enables users' to create and manipulate specific models to deal with their particular situation and conditions. It can be used in any country at national level or for regions, areas or projects. The system is based on 'Systems Dynamics' principles and can be run on most types of small business microcomputers equipped with disk storage. It has a modular structure and is built from standard components which are handled by subroutines in a suite of computer programs written in Basic. TIMPLAN has so far been used in three countries (Argentina, Korea and Zambia) and the results of this experience are briefly described. Un systme simulateur de modlisation dynamique pour l'amnagement forestier est dcrit. Connu sous le nom de TIMPLAN, le systme fournie un modle gnralis de la production de bois d'oeuvre et des oprations de conversion, et permet aux utilisateurs de crer et de manipuler des modles spcifiques pour traiter leur propre situation et conditions. Il peut tre utilis en n'importe quel pays au niveau national ou pour des rgions, zones ou projets. Le systme est bas sur des principes de 'Dynamiques de Systmes' et on peut le faire marcher sur la plupart des petits micro-ordinateurs commercials munis d'emmagasinage sur disque. lia une structure modulaire et est construit de composants de srie qui sont manis par des sous-programmes dans une suite de programmes crits en Basic. Jusqu'ici, TIMPLAN a t utilis en trois pays (l'Argentine, la Core et la Zambie), et les rsultats de cette exprience sont brivement dcrits. "Un sistema de planificacin para el desarrollo de industrial basadas en madera." Describe un sistema dinmico de smbolos de modelo para planificacin forestal. Llamado "Timpln", al sistema provee un modelo generalizado del proceso y produccin de madera y permite a los usuarios crear y manipular modelos especificos para tratar en su situacin y condiciones especficas. Se puede usar en cualquier pas a nivel nacional o en regiones, zonas o projectos. El sistema est basado en principios "Systmes Dynamics" y se puede operar en la mayor parte de microcomputadores equipados de disco de almacenaje. Tiene una estructura modular y esta construido con componentes estandarizados que se pueden operar con una serie de programas computados escritos en Bsico. Timpln se ha usado en tres pases: Argentine, Korea y Zambia y los resultados son brevemente descritos.
42608372|A description is provided of the land use, agricultural and forestry background in Vietnam. A remarkable change in the policy affecting land use, part of the process of doi moi (innovation), has led to Vietnam becoming the world's third largest exporter of rice. Forest land is in process of allocation to smallholders who are being mobilised to carry out tree planting on barren lands. Outside support and the provision of extension services are essential elements in ensuring the success of the reforestation policy. 42608793|The growth and yield of neem grown in individual and community plantations in the Tamale Forest District of Northern Ghana was investigated in 1995. The measurement of 120 temporary sample plots in 30 plantations in the Tamale District provided the data for the construction of local and standard volume table equations and the development of a yield table. The yield table indicated mean annual increments of Site Class I, II and III neem plantations of 12.9, 8.1 and 4.3 m 3 ha 1 on maximum volume production rotations of 5, 7 and 11 years respectively. La croissance et la production de neem ayant pouss en plantations individuelles et communautaires dans le district de la fort Tamale dans le Ghana du Nord ont t examines en 1995. Les prises de mesure dans 120 lots d'chantillons temporaires dans 30 plantations dans le District du Tamale ont fourni les donnes pour la construction de tables d'quation de volume standard et local et pour le dveloppement d'une table de production empirique. La table de production indiquait des croissances annuelles moyennes des classes de sites I, II et III de plantations de neem de 12.9, 8.1 et 4.3 m ha sur rotations de production maximale de 5, 7 et 11 ans respectivement. Se investig el crecimiento y la produccin de neem que crece en plantaciones individuales y de la comunidad en el Distrito Forestal de Tamale en el norte de Ghana en 1995. La medicin de 120 parcelas temporales de muestreo en 30 plantaciones en el Distrito de Tamale provey la informacin necesaria para la construccin ecuaciones de volumen local y estndar y para el desarrollo de una tabla emprica de produccin. La tabla de produccin indic incrementos promedios anuales de las plantaciones de neem Clase de Sitio I, II y III de 12.9,8.1 y 4.3 m ha en rotaciones de mxima produccin de volumen de 5, 7 y 11 aos respectivamente.
42606236|Since 1977, bamboo stems mainly from mountain bamboo Arundinaria alpina have been used in some Tanzanian villages as water pipes. About 70,000 people are currently being supplied with water under the bamboo water project scheme. The preservation of bamboo is being studied.
42608330|Eight volume equations were compared based on fit and validation statistics using data collected from Eucalyptus saligna stands in Cameroon. Results obtained indicate that an equation may fit very well to a data set, but may not necessarily be the best when it comes to predictions using an independent data set collected from the same population. The contrasting results obtained between model fitting and model validation go strongly to support the need for model validation, often neglected, as a crucial step in model building process in order to avoid wrong choices. Validation helps to build some confidence when using the model and can also help in identifying some deficiencies inherent in the model that require some revision. The Schumacher and Hall (1933) equation and the Combined Variable equation (Spurr 1952) gave the best results and recommendations have been made on their usage.
42604637|The results of six fertilizer experiments with Eucalyptus grandis are discussed and the development of various tree parameters with age are studied. It is shown that in the initial years of growth mean height and breast height diameter are increased as a result of fertilizing at the time of planting, but the absolute differences between fertilized and unfertilized trees remain more or less constant with increasing age. Fertilizing increases total basal area also, and consequently timber yield, but this increase becomes greater up to at least nine years of age or final felling. These increases in timber yield economically justify fertilizing at planting. Brief recommendations are given of how best to conduct field experiments designed to study fertilizer application
42606306|Most of the world's farmed and settled land was once forest. Forest is now again in rapid retreat to provide land for growing food. Only a prodigious programme of forest renewal can provide sufficient future timber and fuelwood, safeguarding the quality of soil and water, preserving the genetic resource of the remaining forest. La plupart du terrain agricole du monde tait autrefois des forts. Les forts qui existent maintenant, disparaissent por donner des endroits o on peut faire pousser de la nourriture. Seulement si un programme est organis pour replanter des forts il y aura  l'avenir du bois d'oeuvre et du bois de chauffage. Les forts protgent la qualit de la terre et de l'eau, aussi les ressources gntiques. La mayor parte de la tierra cultivada y habitada del mundo fue en una ocasin bosque. El bosque est ahora nuevamente en disminucin rpida para proveer tierra para el cultivo de alimentos. Solamente un programa prodigioso de renovacin del bosque puede proveer suficiente madera y combustible en el futuro, salvaguardando la calidad del suelo y del agua, y preservando el recurso gentico del bosque residual.
42607975|Taxonomic problems have caused some confusion in the International Provenance Trials of the Pinus pseudostrobus complex organized by the Commonwealth Forestry Institute (CFI). A study of variation and taxonomy of the Pseudostrobus group was recently completed at the CFI and this paper summarizes the work done. Principal Components Analysis and Canonical Discriminant Analysis were used to examine data from range wide collections. It was discovered that there are three well defined species in the group P. pseudostrobus Lind1., P. maximinoi H.E. Moore (the correct name for P. tenuifolia Benth.) and P. douglasiana Martinez. The very variable P. pseudostrobus was found to have two infraspecific taxa P. pseudostrobus subsp. apulcensis (Lind1.) Stead and P. pseudostrobus var. oaxacana (Mirov) Harrison. Analysis of voucher specimens and results from a CFI trial in Honduras indicate that seed lots of two species, P. pseudostrobus and P. maximinoi, have been included in the trials. The correct names for all the seed lots included in trials are given in a table. Problemas taxonmicos han causado una cierta confusin en los ensayos internacionales de procedencia del complejo Pinus pseudostrobus, organizados por el Instituto Forestal de la Mancomunidad (CFI). Un estudio de variacin y taxonoma del grupo Pseudostrobus fue recin completado en el Instituto, y este papel presenta un resumen del trabajo hecho. Se utilizarn anlysis de componentes principales y anlysis discriminante canonical en un examen de datos procedentes de muestras colectadas en la distribucin geogrfica entera. Se descubri que existen tres especies bien definidas en el grupo; P. pseudostrobus Lind1., P. maximinoi H.E. Moore (el nombre correcto de P. tenuifolia Benth.) y P. douglasiana Martinez. Se encontr que el muy variable P. pseudostrobus tiene dos taxa infra-especificas, P. pseudostrobus subespecie acapulcensis (Lind1.) Stead y P. pseudostrobus var. oaxacana (Mirov) Harrison. Anlysis de muestras de referencia y resultados de un ensayo CFI en Honduras indican que se han incluido en los ensayos lotes de semillas de dos especies, P. pseudostrobus y P. maximinoi. Se dan en un cuadro los nombres correctos de todos los lotes de semillas incluidos en ensayos.
42608593|This paper reviews valuation issues which arose from using three different techniques in case studies of resource valuation in Zimbabwe. These involve an exploration of contingent valuation to value alternative uses of a forest, the use of observed behaviour to value one forest product (firewood), and the use of derived demand techniques to value a variety of forest products. Our studies suggest that despite some problems associated with each of the three techniques, they all have promise in specific contexts of forest resource valuation. However, in each case the technique must be applied with much care to be appropriate to the particular institutional, social and cultural setting. Les trois tudes individuelles dcrites dans l'article incluent une exploration de revaluation contingente pour valuer les utilisations alternatives de la fort; le comportement observ pour valuer le bois  brler; et les techniques de la demande drive pour valuer de divers produits forestiers. Les tudes suggrent que malgr quelques problmes associs  chacune des techniques, elles ont toutes du potentiel dans les contextes spcifiques de l'valuation des ressources forestires, dans chaque cas, la technique devrait tre applique trs soigneusement et d'une manire approprie  la situation institutionnelle, sociale et culturelle particulire. Se describen tres estudios de caso que involucran una exploracin de las tcnicas de valoracin contingente con el fin de evaluar usos alternativos para el bosque, tcnicas de comportamiento observado para valorar lea y tcnicas derivadas de la demanda para evaluar una variedad de productos forestales. Los estudios sugieren que a pesar de algunos problemas asociados con cada una de las tcnicas, todas ellas son prometedoras en contextos especficos de la evaluacin del recurso forestal. En cada caso, la tcnica se debe aplicar con mucho cuidado para que sea apropiada a un escenario particular a nivel institucional, social y cultural.
42608288|The process of Genetic Modification (GM) involves the direct transfer of DNA into the nucleus of the host genotype. It offers more rapid variety improvement than is possible with conventional brreeding. Production of GM trees will be most practicable where the technique can be applied to clones which are already of proven operational value. The first commercial use of GM trees will probably be herbicide tolerant eucalypts. Technical problems with more general uptake of GM technology include the practicability of cloning and the need to work with tested clones, which can be planted on an operational scale after GM, in order to provide a return on investment in reasonable time. Institutional issues include the need for management of intellectual property rights, the prevailing regulatory procedures and public attitudes. Biotechnology is providing new tools for conventional tree breeding - it is not to be regarded as a substitute. Gaining the necessary technical and legal expertise is expensive, but it is considered that forestry should be well placed over the coming decades to benefit from the opportunities offered by GM. Le processus de manipulation gntique (MG) implique le transfert direct de l'ADN dans le noyau du gnotype hte. Il offre une amlioration des varits plus rapide que celle possible par l'levage traditionnel. La production d'arbres MG sera la plus praticable quand la technique peut tre applique aux clones ayant dj une valeur oprationnelle prouve. Le premier usage commercial d'arbres MG sera probablement les eucalyptus tolrant l'herbicide. Les problmes pratiques causs par une adoption plus gnrale de la technologie MG comprennent le potentiel pratique du cloning et la ncessit de travailler avec des clones tests sur une chelle oprationnelle MG, afin de produire un retour de l'investissement en un temps raisonnable. Les questions institutionnelles comprennent le besoin d'une grance des droits de la proprit intellectuelle, les procds de rgle dominants, et les attitudes du public. La biotechnologie fournit de nouveaux outils  l'levage conventionnel des arbres; il ne faut pas la prendre pour un substitut. L'acquisition de l'expertise technique et lgale est coteuse mais on considre que la foresterie pourrait tre bien place pour bnficier des opportunits offertes par la MG dans les prochaines dcennies.
42602979|A basic communication system is essential to any Forest Service and of the various divisions of Forestry, Forest Protection probably offers the most communication problems and depends most upon integrated field units for its efficiency. The firefighter in British Columbia is up against thousands of fires annually, many of them of massive dimensions, and the locale of his fire fighting lies on the slopes of high mountain ranges and in the valleys between them. Radio communication is the co-ordinating link in the battle to save the forests and the article which follows attempts to describe the methods briefly used.
42603099|A description is given of the heavyweight Holt Breaker and its operation in broadleaved scrub. The results of this method of preparing ground for planting and subsequent treatment are analysed and costed from four years experience of this work.
42606810|The effect of controlled release granular (CRG) insecticide formulations of carbofuran, chlorpyrifos and carbosulfan on termite attack on seedlings of Eucalyptus tereticornis in Malawi was examined and compared with aldrin in nursery and field applications. Applied at the rate of 0.5g and 1.0g a.i. per seedling, all three CRG insecticides significantly reduced termite-related mortality in both the nursery and the field. Carbosulfan, when applied at the rate of 0.5g a.i. per seedling in the nursery, was found to be the most effective throughout the study period reducing the mortality by 34 per cent. Two years after planting, nursery applications of the CRG insecticides were significantly more effective than field applications. Although aldrin indicated acceptable levels of control in the first year, it was found to be ineffective in subsequent years. L'effet des applications d'insecticides granuls  dgagement contrl (CRG) formuls de carbofuran, chlorpyrifos et carbosulfan sur des attaques par les termites contre des semis d'Eucalyptus tereticornis au Malawi a t examin et compar  l'effet des applications d'aldrine, dans la ppinire et sur le terrain. Appliqus  0,5g et 1,0g i.a. par semis, tous les trois insecticides CRG ont rduit de manire significative le taux de mortalit cause par les termites dans la ppinire ainsi que sur le terrain. Le carbosulfan, appliqu  0,5g i.a. par semis dans la ppinire, s'est avr le plus efficace pendant toute la priode tudie, rduisant le taux de mortalit par 34%. Deux ans aprs le plantage, les applications des insecticides CRG dans la ppinire taient nettement plus efficaces que les applications sur le terrain. Quoique l'aldrine offrait une lutte acceptable dans la premire anne, il s'est avr inefficace dans les annes suivantes. El efecto de insecticidas granulares de emisin controlada (CRG) de composiciones de carbofuran, chlorpyrifos y carbosulfan en ataques de termitas a plntulas de Eucalyptus tereticornis en Malawi fue examinado y comparado con aldrin en aplicaciones en vivero y campo. Utilizado aplicaciones de 0.5 g y 1.0 g de ingrediente activo por plntula, los tres insecticidas CRG redujeron significativamente la mortalidad relacionada con termitas, tanto en el vivero como en el campo. Cuando se utiliz el carbosulfan a un promedio de 0.5 g de ingrediente activo por plntula en el vivero, result ser el ms efectivo durante todo el perodo de estudio, disminuyendo la mortalidad en un 34 por ciento. Dos aos despus de la siembra, las aplicaciones de los insecticidas en el vivero fueron significativamente ms efectivas que las aplicaciones en el campo. No obstante que el aldrin mostr niveles de control aceptables en el primer ao, se encontr que no resulta efectivo en los aos subsecuentes.
42606808|The Department of Forestry at the Australian National University was founded in 1965. One of the primary aims in the establishment of the Department was to develop postgraduate training in forestry. In the subsequent 25 years over 250 postgraduate degrees have been awarded to candidates from 38 different countries. The paper outlines the postgraduate programmes which are available and discusses their development and the trends in the numbers and the origins of the candidates who have taken the various courses. Le Dpartement de Foresterie  l'Universit Nationale Australienne a t cr en 1965. L'une des raisons principales pour l'tablissement du Dpartement tait le dveloppement de la formation de troisime cycle en foresterie. Depuis ce temps on a dcern plus de 250 diplmes  des candidats de troisime cycle originaires de plus de 38 pays diffrents. Cet article passe brivement en revue les programmes d'tudes de troisime cycle que l'on peut suivre et considre leur dveloppement, ainsi que les nombres et les origines des candidats qui ont suivi les diffrents cours. En 1965 se fund el Departamento Forestal de la Universidad Nacional Australiana. Uno de los objetivos primordiales en el establecimiento del Departamento era el de desarrollar cursos de preparacin a nivel postgrado en foresteria. En los 25 aos siguientes, se han otorgado ms de 250 ttulos de postgrado a candidatos de 38 pases diferentes. 42603654|The role of forestry and the forest products industries in the economic advancement of the developing countries is frequently overlooked. Yet there are strong grounds for believing that the potential of forestry in these respects is quite considerable. Serious obstacles are encountered, however, in making quantitative evaluations of the contribution of forestry in either advanced or developing countries. These difficulties can be particularly important in relation to the future of tropical forestry under the pressures for agricultural development in developing countries. A comparison from southern Australia of development in two almost adjacent regions with markedly different industrial structures in terms of forest-based industries provided a way round many of these difficulties. It was found that industrialisation, based on forest resources, had provided a greater impetus to economic development than industrialisation based on agricultural land use.
42604546|The effects of broadleaved vegetation on the age-class structure and growth rates of Pinus caribaea Morelet was investigated in the Mountain Pine Ridge savanna, Belize. The broadleaved vegetation was floristically poor and dominated by a few abundant species such as Byrsonima crassifolia and Miconia albicans. Pine ageclass structure was remarkably uniform under all environmental conditions and regardless of the abundance of broadleaved species. Stands of mature pine were broadly even-aged with insufficient young pine to ensure re-stocking, apparently because of the infrequency of fires in recent years. The growth rates of pine were unaffected by environmental conditions or by interference from broadleaved species at the prevailing densities. The absence of competitive interference is attributed to the low nutrient requirements of pine, and the suggestion is made that broadleaved vegetation may play an important role in nutrient conservation in this environment. Suggestions for future silvicultural management are made in the light of these results. Des recherches ont t entreprises, dans les savanes de la "Mountain Pine Ridge" de Belize, pour juger des effets de la prsence des feuillus sur la structure des classes d'ge et des taux de croissance du Pinus caribaea Morelet. Les feuillus constituent une vgtation floristiquement pauvre et domine par quelques espces abondantes, telles que le Byrsonima crassifolia et le Miconia albicans. La structure des classes d'ge du Pinus caribaea est remarquablement uniforme dans toutes les conditions de milieu et quelque soit l'abondance des espces feuillues. Les peuplements de pins,  maturit, sont approximativement quiennes, avec un nombre par trop insuffisant de jeunes tiges pour assurer le repleuplement. Il semble que la raret des feux, au cours des rcentes annes, est en cause. Les taux de croissance du Pinus caribaea ne sont affectes ni par les conditions de milieu, ni par l'interfrence des espces feuillues, ceci pour les taux de densits prdominants. L'absence de concurrence est attribue  la frugalit de ce pin. On en tire la conclusion que la vgtation feuillue pourrait jouer un rle important dans la conservation des lments fertiles de ce milieu. A la lumire de ces rsultats, des suggestions sont prsentes pour un futur traitement sylvicole. Los efectos de la vegetacin latifoliada sobre la estructura de las clases de edad y sobre la velocidad de credimiento de Pinus caribaea Morelet fueron investigados en la sabana de Mountain Pine Ridge, Belize. La vegetacin latifoliada era muy pobre floristicamente y fue dominada por algunas pocas especies abundantes, como Byrsonima crassifolia y Miconia albicans. La estructura de las clases de edad del pino era notablemente uniforme bajo todas las condiciones ambientales, a pesar de la abundancia de las especies latifoliadas. Los rodales maduros de pino eran en general de una edad, con una insuficiencia de pinos jvenes para asegurar repoblacin, debida aparentamente a la poca frecuencia de incendios en los aos recientes. La velocidad de credimiento del pino no fue afectada por las condiciones ambientales, ni por la interferencia de las especies latifoliadas a las densidades actuales. La ausencia de interferencia competitiva sta atribuida a los requisitos bajos de nutrientes del pino, y se sugiere que la vegetacin latifoliada pueda ser un factor importante en la conservacin de nutrientes en este ambiente. Se haven varieas sugerencieas parael manejo silvicultural futuro a vista de estes resultados.
42607086|This paper provides an overview of economic aspects of forestry and conservation issues, focusing particularly on the problem of assessing non-market 'biodiversity' values and appropriate policies for reconciling conservation versus exploitation decisions. Two main themes are the focus. The first concerns the need to assess the economic value of foregone biodiversity and other non-market environmental values lost through exploitation of tropical forests for timber. The failure to assess these foregone values may mean that timber exploitation is not socially 'optimal' and thus 'excessive'. However, precisely because such values are unknown and involve future impacts they are difficult to assess. Hence, the second theme of the paper is concerned with the wider policy considerations surrounding the estimation of non-market conservation values. The issue of exploiting forests for timber today as opposed to conserving them for the future raises complicated issues for policy-makers to resolve. A major problem is the presence of both market distortions and policy interventions that are biased against non-market environmental values in forestry. The result is too much conversion and not enough conservation. In conclusion the paper argues that these concerns suggest a 'middle way' that emphasizes reconciling forestry with conservation through sustainable management of timber production in permanent forests and maximizing biodiversity regeneration in plantation forests. Cet article donne une vue d'ensemble des aspects conomiques de la sylviculture et de la conservation. L'accent est mis particulirement surle problme de l'estimation des valeurs de la biodiversit noncommerciale et des lignes de conduite appropries pour reconcilier les dcisions de l'exploitation avec celles de la conservation. L'article est construit sur deux thmes principaux. Le premier thmes souligne le besoin d'une valuation de la valeur conomique de la biodiversit disparue ainsi que celle d'autres lments non-commerciaux, valeurs ayant t perdues au cours de l'exploitation du bois dans les forts tropicales. L'absence d'une valuation de ces valeurs disparues pourrait signifier que l'exploitation du bois n'est pas "optimale" socialement et, par consquent, "excessive". Toujours est-il que ces cots sont difficiles a valuer, du fait qu'ils sont inconnus et que leur impact n'est pas immdiat. De ce fait merge le second thme de l'article qui s'intresse aux lignes de conduite plus gnrales qui encadrent l'valuation des valeurs de conservation non-commerciales. Le dilemme entre l'exploitation immdiate des forts pour le bois et le souci de les conserver pour le futur cre des problmes compliqus  rsoudre pour les planificateurs. Un des problmes majeurs est la prsence  la fois de distortions du march et d'interventions gouvernmentales ayant un a-priori contre les valeurs de l'environnment non-commerciales en sylviculture. Il en rsulte trop de conversion et un manque de conservation. En conclusion, l'article maintient que ces questions suggrent une voie mdiane qui met l'accent sur une rconciliation de la sylviculture avec la conservation en veillant  assurer la production du bois  long terme dans les forts permanentes tout en encourageant la rgnration de la biodiversit dans les forts de plantation. Este artculo provee un esbozo de los aspectos econmicos de la ingeniera forestal y la conservacin, enfocndose particularmente en el problema de la evaluacin de los valores no mercadeables de la biodiversidad y en polticas apropiadas para reconciliar decisiones de conservacin contra decisiones de explotacin. Se enfocan dos temas principales. El primero concierne a la necesidad de evaluar el valor econmico predeterminado de la biodiversidad y otros valores medio ambientales no mercadeables perdidos a travs de la explotacin de bosques tropicales para madera. El fracaso al evaluar estos valores predeterminados pudiera significar que la explotacin de madera no es 'socialmente' ptima y por lo tanto 'excesiva'. Sin embargo, precisamente porque tales valores son desconocidos e involucran impactos futuros que son difciles de evaluar. El segundo tema del artculo trata con consideraciones ms amplias de polticas que rodean la estimacin de valores no mercadeables de la conservacin. El tema de la explotacin de bosques para madera como contraposicin a conservarlos para el futuro, levanta hoy temas complicados de ser resueltos por los formuladores de polticas. Un problema mayor es la presencia de tanto distorsiones como intervenciones de polticas y de mercados que estn prejuiciados en contra de los valores medio ambientales no mercadeables en ingeniera forestal. El resultado es demasiada conversin y no suficiente conservacin. En conclusin, el documento argumenta que estas preocupaciones sugieren un 'camino medio' que enfatiza la reconciliacin de la ingeniera forestal con conservacin a travs del manejo sostenible de la produccin de madera en bosques permanentes y la maximizacin de la regeneracin de la biodiversidad en bosques de plantacin.
42608765|The evolution of India's National Forest Policy (NFP) 1988 is outlined. In 1990, within the framework of that policy, the Ministry of Environment and Forests, Government of India asked the State Governments to pass resolutions to facilitate involvement of village communities in the regeneration of degraded forests. Jusqu' prsent, 16 Etats ont pass la rsolution ncessaire. L'tude de ces rsolutions et des progrs achevs dans leur mise en oeuvre a identifi un nombre de questions requrant une attention d'urgence. Ne pas prendre ces questions en compte pourrait rsulter en un chec de l'approche participationnelle dans la grance des ressources naturelles. En 1988, se esboza la evolucin de Poltica Forestal Nacional de la India (NFP). Une nouvelle Classification Dcimale Forestire, version abrge trilingue, autrefois le Systme de la classification dcimale d'Oxford pour les sciences forestires (ODC), a t prsente au congrs mondial de l'IUFRO  Montral en 1990. El grupo de proyecto P6.01-00, patrocinado por IUFRO, ha vuelto a poner en uso la Clasificacin Decimal Forestal. 42607635|Because increasing the supply of a commodity affects its market price, expansion of export volumes may be accompanied by declining foreign exchange earnings to developing countries. Arguments for ignoring the effect are fallacious. Its distributive consequences are inequitable. By examining the determinants of price elasticity of demand, analysts may gauge the relevance of the effect for forest products. Production for home markets or development of timber processing may circumvent the problem.
42604448|Forest Inventory has been conducted in Burma ever year since 1963. Survey designs applied have been mainly (a) stratified two-stage sampling using topographical plots; and (b) stratified replicated sampling using artificial units made up of circular plots.
42607198|Flat-bladed cutting tools are among the most important production implements in Ethiopia, and most are currently maintained using flat sandstone rocks. This technology is unsuitable and inefficient. 36 circular grindstones that could be manually operated were produced using local materials and basic technology. All sharpened an iron bar of uniform thickness adequately and efficiently. Comparisons were made of material quality, maintenance efficiency and rate of wear. The best of the locally made grindstones were compared further with imported ones, and they were found to be equally good in most respects. The cost of local production is, moreover, a small fraction of the purchasing and delivery costs of imported stones. Local grindstone production technology is simple, cheap and appropriate for developing countries and can be readily taught. Les outils  couper  lames plates sont parmi les outils de production les plus importants en thiopie, et leur entretien s'effectue prsentement avec des pierres plates en grs. Cette technologie est mal adapte et inefficace. 36 meules circulaires qui pourraient tre utilises manuellement ont t construites avec des matriaux locaux et la technologie de base. Toutes ont afft une barre de fer d'une paisseur uniforme suffisamment et efficacement. On en a fait la comparaison de la qualit des matriaux, l'efficacit de l'entretien et du taux de la dgradation. Les meilleures des meules locales ont t compares avec les meules importes, et se sont montres galement bonnes  presque tous les gards. Le cot de la production locale est en plus une petite portion du prix d'achat et des frais de livraison des pierres importes. La technologie de fabrication locale des meules est simple, ne cote pas cher, est bien adapte aux pays en voie de dveloppement, et facile  enseigner. Las herramientas cortadoras de hoja plana estn entre los implementos de produccin ms importantes en Etiopa y actualmente a la mayora se les da mantenimiento utilizando piedras de afilar planas. Esta tecnologa es inadecuada e ineficiente. Se produjeron 36 piedras de afilar circulares, que podan ser operadas manualmente, utilizando materiales locales y tecnologa bsica. Todas afilaron una barra de hierro de espesor uniforme en forma adecuada y eficiente. Se realizaron comparaciones de la calidad del material, eficiencia de mantenimiento y tasa de desgaste. Se compararon adems, las mejores de las piedras de afilar hechas localmente con piedras importadas y se encontr que eran igualmente buenas en la mayora de los aspectos. El costo de produccin local es, sin embargo, una fraccin pequea de los costos de compra y despacho de piedras importadas. La tecnologa local de produccin de piedras de afilar es simple, barata y apropiada para pases en vas de desarrollo y pueden ensearse rpidamente.
42603098|The Yoma-Gola National Forest near Bomi Hills, Liberia, is formed of true tropical rainforest, both of the mixed and the single dominant type. One hundred and eight species are recorded and the forest is described. A special study of the Tetraberlinia tubmaniana forest, combined with a profile diagram, gives a more detailed insight in the structure of this single dominant forest type.
42608690|The current economic policy of the Government of Zimbabwe requires that public enterprises reform in such a way that the developmental activities are clearly separated from commercial activities with the commercial activities being self-supporting and in competition with the private sector. The Forestry Commission is being restructured in line with this policy. At restructuring the Forestry Commission will be split into two broad sections: the new Forestry Commission, which will be responsible for all developmental activities carried out on the behalf of the Government, and the new Forestry Company of Zimbabwe which will take over the commercial role of the Forestry Commission. Approval for restructuring has been granted by Cabinet. The paper discusses issues that are being addressed and those that need to be addressed prior to privatisation. La Commission forestire subit une rforme selon cette politique, le but tant de crer deux larges sections: La nouvelle Commission forestire, qui aura la reponsabilit de toutes les activits dveloppementales dclenches au nom du gouvernement; et la nouvelle Socit de foresterie de Zimbabwe, qui se chargera du rle commerciale de la Commission forestire. Le cabinet a ratifi la rforme. L'article traite des questions qu'on est en train d'aborder et de celles qui doivent tre abordes avant la privatisation. La Comisin de Ingeniera Forestal est siendo estructurada de acuerdo con esta poltica. Al reestructurar la Comisin de Ingeniera Forestal esta ser divida en dos secciones amplias: la nueva Comisin de Ingeniera Forestal, que ser responsable de las actividades de desarrollo llevadas cabo en nombre del Gobierno, y la nueva Compaa de Ingeniera Forestal de Zimbabwe que tomar el papel comercial de la Comisin de Ingeniera Forestal. La aprobacin para esta reestructuracin ha sido otorgada por el Gabinete. El artculo discute temas que estn siendo tratados y aquellos que necesitan tratarse previamente a la privatizacin.

42606767|Southland Beech (Nothofagus menziesii) has been an important indigenous commercial timber in New Zealand. The techniques for its propagation and establishment make continued industrial production a possibility but government policy needs to be educated to enable the species to play an economic role instead of just being treated as an ornament. La haya del sur (Nothogagus menziesii) es una especie indgena maderable comercial de importancia en Nueva Zelandia. Las tcnicas para su propagacin y establecimiento han hecho posible su produccin industrial continua. Sin embargo, es necesario educar la poltica gubernamental para permitir que la especie juege un papel econmico, en vez de tratarla apenas como una especie ornamental.
42607197|Evaluation of growth and biomass yield was conducted in Casuarina equisetifolia (L.) Forst belonging to three sex groups (male, female and monoecious) in shelterbelt plantations at three sites along the coast of Orissa, India. The plant height, stem girth, fresh and dry biomass yield, and chlorophyll content of 3,5,8,13 and 18-year-old-trees were determined. Male plants were the most efficient producers of vegetative growth and total biomass followed by the monoecious and female plants at all the locations irrespective of the site conditions. On a valu la croissance et le rendement de biomasse de Casuarina equisetiolia (L.) Forst appartenent  trois groupes sexuels (mle, femelle et monoque) dans les plantations rideauxabri sur trois sites longeant les ctes d'Orissa, Inde. On a mesur la hauteur, la circonfrence de la tige, le rendement de biomasse frache et sche, et la quantit de chlorophylle des arbres de 3,5,8,13 et 18 ans. Les plantes mles ont produit le plus de croissance vgtative et de biomasse totale, suivi des plantes monoques et femelles,  toutes les locations, indpendemment des conditions du site. Se llev a cabo una evaluacin sobre el crecimiento y la produccin de biomasa de Casuarina equisetifolia, la cual tiene tres grupos de sexuales (masculino, femenino y monoico), en plantaciones en tres sitios a lo largo de la costa de Orissa, India. Se determinaron la altura de la planta, el grueso del tallo, la produccin de biomasa fresca y seca y los contenidos de clorofila de rboles de 3,5, 8, 13 y 18 aos de edad. Las plantas masculinas fueron las productores ms eficientes de crecimiento vegetativo y biomasa total seguidas por el monoico y las plantas femeninas en todas las ubicaciones sin consideracin de las condiciones del sitio.
42605217|This paper examines the market for forest products in Britain in 1971, and gives projections for demand for the future. Processing industries are studied for their most efficient organisation and scale of operations. Forecasts are made of raw material supply from the forests in state and private ownership, and from industrial residues. Proposals are made for long term regional planning of integrated forests and forest industries, for full viability and efficiency. Agriculture is considered in the light of an expanding area under trees and, with careful land use planning, for greater productivity in both agriculture and forestry. Opportunities are discussed for landscape planning, wild life conservation, shooting, fishing and deer, recreation and amenity, with special reference to the National Parks. Employment possibilities are considered, with the contribution of forestry to the national and regional economies. Recommendations are made for the future. Regional planning is essential for economic success, and it is concluded accordingly that Britain should be divided (see Map) into eleven regions where commercial forestry will be of primary concern, and six others where recreation and amenity will be the more dominant consideration. Landscape planning will be effective in all regions. Imports of forest products in 1971 were valued at  769 million, but had Britain been able to rely on the production of a managed coniferous forest of 1.6 million hectares in sustained yield, with integrated industries, there would have been in that year an import saving of around 500 million. The forest now stands at about 1.2 million hectares and with new planting should rise to 1.6 million in the next decade. If thereafter the annual planting rate is reduced by one-half the nation should reach the target which was set in the 1943 Post-War Policy Review of 2.0 million hectares by the turn of the century. With a rising population and increased market demand Britain may then become not less than onethird self-supporting in wood products. There will be employment possibilities for more than 70,000 people, with more than 80% of these in Scotland, Wales and the North of England. The Treasury's cost benefit study of June 1972 is not accepted, for the reasons listed in paragraph 6(b)2 of this paper. Its conclusions, based on an era of forest immaturity, imbalance of age classes, inadequate acreage under plantations and necesarily low productivity and profits, are misleading and damaging to the best interests of the nation. It should be withdrawn, and redrafted in consultation with the Forestry Societies.
42603272|The pulp and paper industry in India will become one of the major industries in the near future and the forestry sector will have to play an increasingly important role in providing the woody raw material for the industry. The per capita consumption of paper is expected to rise from the present figure of 1 kilogram to 7 kilograms within the next 15 years. The requirements of organic raw material will be in the neighbourhood of 15 million tons. Through the setting up of paper and rayon mills a new outlook on forestry can take shape, inasmuch as forests will hold the key to an era of progress and prosperity. Foresters in India can look forward to the time when the great part being played by Forestry in the building of the nation will receive the recognition it deserves.
42603223|This paper deals essentially with pruning to produce knotless wood, but other functions of pruning are referred to, including its possible value, in special cases, for stimulating the vigour of the upper part of the crown of unhealthy trees: an example of dieback in P. radiata being prevented (at least, up to 10 years of age) by pruning on a site in the Mt. Burr Forest in South Australia is discussed. Pruning tools, and the occlusion of the pruning wound are discussed, and the literature briefly reviewed. Factors affecting the width of the core of knotty wood, and increases in the effective width of the core due to defects associated with the stubs and to bends in the stem are discussed. Foresters can keep the effective width of the core to a minimum by growing trees with small branches and straight trunks, and by using tools and methods with which the pruning cut is made as close as practicable to the trunk and without damaging it. The relation between internode length in P. radiata and the size of the swellings at the whorls, and thus the width of the knotty core is referred to. Although longinternode types tend to have relatively big knotty cores, the cost of pruning them (per unit length of trunk) tends to be less than that of types with short-internodes. The effect of pruning on the growth and development of the tree is discussed. Experiments on the effects of different pruning schedules on the rate of growth and form and on the width of the resulting knotty core of P. radiata in the Mt. Burr Forest are described. A knotty core diameter of $5\frac{3}{4}$ inches would seem to be about the minimum practicable in stands spaced 8 ft.  8 ft. on good quality sites on this forest. A pruning schedule that produced such a core resulted in a substantial reduction in growth, but such an increment loss may be justified by the benefits obtained. Pruning deserves more research. Firstly, because of the very high cost of pruning and the substantial differences in stub length resulting from the use of different tools, research is needed into pruning tools, particularly into the possibility of mechanising the operation. Secondly, research is needed on the development of pruning schedules and thirdly, on future wood needs, with the aim of forecasting the amount of knotless wood required in the future.
42605329|The immensity of Amaznia poses unusual problems for forest development. The floodplain occupying two per cent of the area is more important to agriculture and forest industries than the largely uninhabited dry land. Annual flooding replenishes nutrients by deposition of sediments eroded from the Andes, and successions of annual crops can be grown without the addition of artificial fertilizers. Hand logging and water transport is still the predominant method of supplying the forest industries, which are expanding at about ten per cent a year in a number of mills. Diversification of forest products is proceeding rapidly, partly forced by shortage of logs of preferred species and sizes.
