42608591|Policy failure is at the root of many forest problems. There is increasing understanding of the kinds of policies and policy processes which enable the transition to more sustainable forest management. This paper presents the preliminary conclusions of an IIED-coordinated comparative study across six countries  Zimbabwe, Ghana, India, Pakistan, Costa Rica and Papua New Guinea  where teams from local institutions are carrying out case studies. In every one of these countries, traditional, normative government procedures have constituted the policy process. The resulting layers of policy and decision-making frameworks have become out of touch with current realities. As a result, conflicts escalate and forest goods and services are inequitably distributed. Yet policy processes have recently begun to open up, sometimes reaching multi-stakeholder agreements, and issuing rights and responsibilities so that local stakeholders may play their roles as effective forest stewards. Preliminary conclusions suggest that policies that work for forests and people will build on processes that generate multi-stakeholder understanding and commitment, that link policy-making with its outcomes, and deal better with change. Beaucoup de problmes sont enracins dans l'chec de la politique forestire. On comprend mieux les types de politique et des mthodes politiques qui facilite la transition  la gestion forestire plus durable. Cet article prsente les conclusions prliminaires d'une tude compare gre de l'IIED comprenant six pays (Zimbabwe, Ghana, l'Inde, Pakistan, Costa Rica et Papouasie-Nouvelle-Guine) o des collaborateurs des institutions locales font les tudes individuelles. Dans chacun de ces pays, les procdures de gouvernement tradionnelles et normatives ont constitu la prise de dcision politique. L'embrouillement des procdures et des dcisions politiques a perdu contact avec la ralit. Il ensuit que les conflits s'intensifient et le bois et les services forestiers sont distribus inquitablement. Nanmoins, les procdures politiques ont rcemment commenc  s'ouvrir. Quelquefois, les contrats incluent des partenaires multiples, et on rdige les droits et responsabilits  ce que les partenaires locaux puissent remplir leur rle de grant de fort efficacement. Les conclusions prliminaires suggrent qu'une politique utile pour les forts et les gens se basera sur des procds qui crent de l'entente et de l'engagement parmi les partenaires multiples, qui lient les dcisions politiques avec leurs rsultats, et qui s'adaptent mieux aux changements. Las fallas en las polticas son la raz de muchos problemas forestales. Existe un entendimiento creciente de los tipo de polticas y procesos de polticas los cuales permiten la transicin a un manejo forestal ms sostenible. Este artculo presenta las conclusiones preliminares de un estudio comparativo coordinado por IIED en seis pases, Zimbawe, Ghana, India, Pakistn, Costa Rica y Papua Nueva Guinea en los cuales, miembros de personal de las instituciones locales estn llevando a cabo estudios de caso. En cada uno de estos pases, los procedimientos tradicionales y normativos del gobierno han constituido el proceso poltico. Los diferentes niveles de poltica y marcos para la toma de decisiones, resultados de este proceso, han llegado a estar por fuera de las realidades actuales. Como resultado, los conflictos aumentan y los productos y servicios forestales se distribuyen inequitativamente. Los procesos polticos han empezado recientemente ha abrirse, algunas veces alcanzando acuerdos entre los interesados y emitiendo derechos y responsabilidades tales que los beneficiarios locales puedan jugar sus papeles como administradores forestales efectivos. Las conclusiones preliminares sugieren que las polticas que funcionan para los bosques y la gente, se construirn en procesos que generen un entendimiento y compromiso multi-partidista, que eslabonen los procesos polticos con sus resultados y que se enfrenten mejor con el cambio.
42604832|The immense forest resources of Canada provide the raw material base for a large, diversified and export-oriented forest industry. Output of the forest industries and the cut of wood have shown an expanding trend in recent years, and a strong surge in investment in pulp and paper mills occurred in the mid 1960' s. The cut of wood has increased somewhat less rapidly than output of finished products, as wood is now used more efficiently and the export of roundwood has become relatively less important than previously. The situation with respect to the volume of forest resources in Canada is favourable for further expansion of industry. The resource as a whole is still being used at a relatively low level of intensity and expansion appears to be possible in all regions of the country. However, east of the Rocky Mountains resources suitable for sawlogs are limited and the sawmill industry in that part of the country has not expanded in recent years. Forestry in Canada is on an extensive basis. The bulk of production still comes from virgin stands of old-growth timber. Production from second-growth stands is expected to increase gradually in the future but virgin stands will continue to provide most of the production for several decades. While much information about Canada's resources is now available, the economic potential of the resource is not yet fully understood. More economic information to supplement technical data is required to provide a sound basis for evaluating future prospects.
42607273|South African forest plantations, by virtue of their presence in very limited areas of high rainfall, and their increased water use relative to preafforestation vegetation, have caused significant reductions in streamflow from afforested catchments. The demand for both water and wood products is expected to increase strongly in the future, challenging the forestry industry to increase efficiency, both in timber production and in minimising the impacts of forest plantations on water supplies. Climate change adds a degree of uncertainty to future scenarios. As GCM predictions improve and regional predictions of climate change become more certain, the consequences to forests and water supplies must be comprehended and anticipated. This paper reviews aspects of these relationships with potential significance for the minimisation of water use of plantations and for the prediction of climate change consequences. Les forts de plantation d'Afrique du Sud, de par leur prsence dans des rgions trs limites de fortes prcipitations et leur usage d'eau accru par rapport  la vgtation pr-boisement, ont caus des rductions significatives de l'coulement des bassins hydrographiques boiss. La demande pour l'eau et les produits du bois va grandir fortement dans le futur, lanant un dfi  l'industrie sylviculturelle d'accrotre son efficacit dans la production de bois et la limitation de l'impact des forts de plantation sur les ressources d'eau. Le changement climatique ajoute un degr d'incertitude aux scnarios du futur. Alors que les prdictions du GCM s'amliorent et les prdictions rgionales du changement de climat deviennent plus sres, les consquences pour les forts et les ressources d'eau doivent tre comprises et planifies. Ce processus va lancer un dfi  notre comprhension des relations climat/fort/coulement, dans les diverses rgions sylviculturelles du pays. Cet article passe en revue des aspects de ces relations pouvant avoir une signification potentielle pour minimiser l'usage de l'eau dans les plantations et prvoir les consquences du changement de climat. Las plantaciones de bosques sur africanas, por virtud de su presencia en reas muy limitadas de alta precipitacin, y por su incremento en el uso de agua con relacin a la vegetacin previa a la repoblacin forestal, ha provocado reducciones significativas en las corrientes de agua provenientes de zonas de captacin repobladas de rboles. Se espera que la demanda tanto de productos madereros como de agua se incremente fuertemente en el futuro, desafiando a la industria forestal a aumentar la eficiencia, tanto en produccin de madera, como al minimizar los impactos de la plantaciones de bosques en los abastecimientos de agua. El cambio de clima aade un grado de incertidumbre a escenarios futuros. A medida que las predicciones GCM mejoran y predicciones regionales de cambio de clima llegan a ser ms ciertas, se tiene que comprender y planear sus consecuencias en los bosques y en los abastecimientos de agua. Este proceso retar nuestra comprensin de las relaciones clima/bosque/corrientes de agua en las diversas regiones de ingeniera forestal del pas. Este artculo revisa los aspectos de estas relaciones de importancia potencial para minimizar el uso de agua en las plantaciones forestales, y predecir las consecuencias de cambio de clima.
42608631|Acacia auriculiformis A. Cunn. has been widely planted on the island of Java for fuelwood production and environmental management such as control of Imperata grass and erosion as well as for roadside planting. The outstanding characteristic of this species is its ability to grow well on a wide variety of soil types including its good performance on impoverished sites. The species is mostly planted on private lands, where it is able to fulfil the wood requirements of local people.The species has been recommended for more extensive cultivation in other tropical countries, this paper discusses the Indonesian experiences regarding cultivation and management.
42605220|Over the past few years, a new reforestation technique, called the Styroblock Reforestation System, has been developed in British Columbia, whereby tree seedlings are grown, transported and planted from rigid modular containers called styroblocks. The tree seedling, which is extracted from the container with the soil mass intact around its root system, has been labelled a "plug". Not only are these plug seedlings transported to the planting site with little appreciable root disturbance, they can also be planted at twice the rate of conventional 2-0 bare-root stock. This article describes the original field trials of the plugplanting concept and outlines the basis on which a decision was made to adopt the Styroblock System in British Columbia.
42603588|Studies on the relationship between the two growth attributes diameter at breast height and length of clear bole, and fuel yield components of Prosopis cineraria were conducted on 131 mature trees. Two approaches for predicting the total fuel yield of a tree were: (i) measuring d.b.h. and predicting with the help of an allometric equation, and (ii) estimating the weight of branches with the help of d.b.h. plus weight of clear bole by a multiple regression equation. Diameter at breast height is highly correlated with all the fuel yield components and the total fuel yield. Since the extent of relationship between values observed and values obtained by both the methods are of the same magnitude, d.b.h. can be taken as a valid parameter for predicting fuel yield as it is the most easily measurable growth attribute.
42606437|The natural forests in Iraq, and to a lesser degree, forest plantations, are poorly stocked and for a number of centuries have been suffering from persistent damage caused by adverse factors  both physical and socio-economic. Despite their poor quality, however, these forests can still play a complimentary role in a land-use policy based on a better understanding of their potential; they may contribute more for soil and water conservation than for timber production. Extensive reforestation projects are important for the rehabilitation of large areas where they can conserve the environment and offer opportunities for recreation. Les forts naturelles de l'Iraq, et dans une moindre mesure les plantations, sont peu denses et souffrent depuis des sicles des dgats provoqus par des facteurs adverses aussi bien physiques que socio-conomiques. Malgr leur pauvret, cependant, ces forts peuvent toujours jouer un rle complmentaire dans une politique d'amnagement rationnel des terres; elles peuvent tre plus utiles pour la conservation du sol et de l'eau que pour la production de bois. Des projects de reboisement  grande chelle seront importants pour la remise en valeur de rgions entires. Los bosques naturales en Iraq y tambin las plantaciones forestales (pero a menor grado) han sufrido daos continuos por factores fsicos y socio-econmicos desde hace muchos siglos. A pesar de su pobre calidad estos bosques todavia juegan un papel complementario en la poltica terrenal basada en la comprensin de supotencia. Los bosques pueden contribuir ms para la conservacin, del agua y el terreno que para la produccin de madera. 42608945|One metre billets of known volume were piled in 1 m stacks to estimate a stacked to solid volume conversion ratio. An average conversion factor of 0.44 for stacked to solid volume was calculated. Mean stackwood yield (m) per m of basal area removed was 16.1 m m. Stand basal area (mha) and height (m) varied between sample plots. There was no significant correlation between total plot basal area (m) and yield (m) per m basal area removed, but there was a significant correlation between tree height (m) and yield. Regression models of stackwood yield against basal area removed and mean height were developed for the estimation of stackwood volume for miombo woodland in Malawi. Un facteur de conversion de volume de bois empil en volume rel de bois a t calcul; la valeur moyenne obtenue est de 0,44. La rcolte moyenne de bois  empiler (exprim en m) par m de surface terrire prleve, tait de l'ordre de 16,1 m m. La surface terrire des peuplements (m ha) et la hauteur (m) variaient entre les diffrentes parcelles d'chantillonnage. Il n'a pas t possible d'tablir une corrlation significative entre la surface terrire de l'chantillon complet (m) et la rcolte (m) par m de surface terrire prleve. Par contre on a pu observer une corrlation significative entre la hauteur des arbres (m) et le volume de rcolte. Des modles de rgression du volume de rcolte de bois  empiler par rapport  la surface terrire prleve et la hauteur moyenne des arbres ont t dvelopps dans le but d'estimer le volume de bois pour la rgion du Miombo au Malawi. Leos de un metro de un volumen conocido, fueron apilados en montones de 1 m para estimar un radio de conversin de volumen apilado a volumen slido. Se calcul un factor promedio de conversin de 0.44 de volumen apilado a slido. La produccin promedio de madera (m) por m de rea basal removida fue de 16.1mm. Fueron desarrollados modelos de regresin de produccin de madera por rea basal removida y por promedio de altura para estimar el volumen de madera en bosques de Miombo en Malawi.
42606771|This paper describes the needs of the Ministry of Forestry servicing and research fields for efficient storage, retrieval, transformation and display of spatial information. Applications of TERRASOFT, a Geographic Information System based on a personal computer, are discussed for the mapping, inventory and harvesting planning for a 550 ha forest, including specialist applications for viewable area analysis and visual impact assessment in landscape design. Cet article dcrit les besoins des domaines de service et de recherche du Ministre des Forts pour la conservation, la recherche, la transformation et l'affichage efficaces d'informations spatiaux. On discute des applications de TERRASOFT, un Systme d'Information Gographique bas sur un ordinateur personnel, pour la cartographie, l'inventaire et la planification de l'exploitation d'une fort de 550 ha, y compris des applications spcialises pour l'analyse de la superficie visible et l'valuation de l'impact visuel dans la planification du paysage. Se incluye tambin aplicaciones especialisadas para la visualizacin del anlisis de areas y la evaluacin del impacto visual en el diseno paisajstico.
42603198|Smelter poles are used for reducing the oxygen content of copper during the refining processes. The indigenous "miombo" species used at present are satisfactory, but are slow growing, and a large area of woodland would be required to meet the future demands. An investigation showed that Eucalyptus salignagrandis, which can be grown rapidly, would be a suitable replacement.
42606970|The Iwokrama Rain Forest Programme has its origins in a visionary offer by the then President of Guyana, Desmond Hoyte, to set aside a large block of primary rain forest in the interior of Guyana for conservation, and experimental research into sustainable utilization. This offer was made during a meeting of Commonwealth Heads of Government in October 1989, and this case study traces the evolution of the programme over the intervening four years. The paper describes the difficulties in launching an ambitious international venture. Despite these difficulties progress has been steady, based on building a sound scientific foundation and ensuring agreement by all the stakeholders. The Commonwealth, both official and unofficial, has played an important role in translating the vision of the original offer into a pragmatic programme which can be supported by local people, accepted by local and international agencies, and funded by donors. Le Programme de Fort Ombrophile d'Iwokrama trouve son origine dans une offre visionnaire de Desmond Hoyte, alors Prsident de Guyane. Cet offre proposait de rserver une surface importante de fort ombrophile primaire au centre de la Guyane  des fins de conservation et de recherche exprimentale dans le domaine des techniques d'utilisation reproductibles  long terme. Cet offre avait t formule au cours d'une assemble des chefs de gouvernements du Commonwealth en octobre 1989; cet article retrace l'volution de ce programme au cours de ces quatre annes d'existence. Il dcrit les difficults rencontres pour lancer une ambitieuse entreprise internationale. Malgr ces difficults, les progrs ont t continus grce  la constitution d'une fondation scientifique solide et  la volont de prendre des accords qui font l'unanimit. Le Commonwealth, aussi bien au niveau officiel qu'au niveau informel, a jou un rle important dans la transformation des ides de l'offre originale vers un programme pratique qui peut tre soutenu et adopt par les populations locales et les agences internationales, et financ par les bailleurs de fonds. El programa Iwokrama para la selva tropical, tiene sus orgenes en una oferta visionaria hecha por el entonces presidente de Guyana, Desmond Hoyte, de separar un bloque grande de la principal selva tropical en el interior de Guyana para su conservacin e investigacin experimental en utilizacin sostenible. Esta oferta fue hecha durante una reunin de Jefes de Gobierno de la Comunidad Britnica de Naciones en octubre de 1989 y este estudio rastrea la evolucin del programa en sus cuatro primeros aos. El artculo describe las dificultades al lanzarse en una aventura internacional ambiciosa. A pesar de estas dificultades, el progreso ha sido constante, basado en la creacin de una base cientfica slida y asegurando el concenso de todas las personas que han invertido en el proyecto. La Comunidad Britnica de Naciones ha jugado un papel importante, tanto oficial como no-oficialmente, al traducir la visin de la oferta original en un programa pragmtico el cual puede ser apoyado por gente local, aceptado por las agencias locales e internacionales y financiado por donaciones.
42603650|Biosystematics, or experimental taxonomy, is discussed in relation to the early assessment of geographic variation in forest trees. It is suggested that biosystematic methods which are of value in this regard are embraced by the science of genecology, and that the basic propositions of such studies are genecologic rather than biosystematic. Theoretical and practical reasons are given to justify studies of geographic variation in juvenile populations of forest trees, and also studies of morphological variation in mass collections of reproductive organs and foliage collected from mature populations in the wild. Examples illustrating both forms of variation are presented. It is concluded that pre-provenance trial, short term studies, such as those referred to above, can rapidly yield information which is of immediate practical value in the silviculture, selection, and breeding of the species under study. It is also concluded that such studies provide criteria for the selection of provenances for field trials, and criteria for the selection of climatic zones for the testing of these provenances.
42607881|The generally heavy undergrowth, multilayered storeys, and the heavily-buttressed trees prevent easy application of the conventional inventory sampling schemes for determining growing stock volume in tropical forests. Crude and in many cases expensive methods have been proposed for inventorying these forests.One such technique is the 'Stockmapping' method used in Uganda's natural forests. The stockmapping technique has some very serious limitations. The 3P sampling scheme is suggested to be used to improve the efficiency of the stockmapping technique in estimating volume in the tropical forests.
42603420|The need for simple fire-heated hot and cold open tank plants for creosoting long length poles in Zambia is outlined. The design and operating procedure for such a plant is described and discussed.
42605050|The activities of the forestry sector are rated, where possible numerically, by investment criteria standards. Tree growing is found not to be a highly attractive activity for underdeveloped economies, if considered by itself. The harvesting phase and the primary forest industries are rated by most criteria as attractive investments. These findings are in complete agreement with the empirical evidence.
42603271|The stamens of Chlorophora excelsa, an important timber tree, dehisce explosively (as do those of some other Moraceae and Urticaceae), thus ensuring efficient wind pollination in a scattered population of trees which are normally dioecious, though two monoecious trees have been found. The pollination of Antiaris toxicaria and Musanga cecropioides provides interesting comparisons. In East Africa fruit bats, mainly Eidolon helvum, are the most important means of seed dispersal for Chlorophora, their speedy digestion and wide range rendering them particularly effective; moreover their digestion may stimulate germination. Bats are also important in the dispersal of seed of Ficus spp. Other fruits known to be eaten regularly include Antiaris toxicara, Parnar excelsa and probably bananas. Pollen analysis of bat excreta is of help in tracing food sources. Merely eating the fruit could not however account for the large quantities of Parkia filicoidea pollen in some excreta, and it is deduced that the bats visit the flowers for nectar, thus effecting pollination. Trees regularly occupied by flocks of several hundred thousand roosting bats are severely damaged.
42608500|Regression equations were derived to determine total above-ground biomass and above-ground woody biomass (kg per tree) as a function of tree diameter at breast height (D, cm) as the sole predictor, as well as (D  H (height, m)) as the predictor, for the tabonuco, colorado and dwarf forests in the Luquillo Experimental Forest of Puerto Rico. L'on a driv des quations de rgression afin de dterminer la biomasse totale au-dessus du sol et la biomasse ligneuse au-dessus du sol (kg par arbre) comme une fonction du diamtre  hauteur d'homme (D, cm) comme le seul predictor, ainsi que (D  H (hauteur, m)) comme le predictor, pour les forts de tabonuco, colorado et nain dans la Fort exprimentale de Luquillo en Porto Rico. Se derivarn equaciones de regresion para determinar biomasa total sobre el terreno y biomasa de madera sobre el terreno (kg por rbol) como una funcion del diametro al pecho (D) como el unico predictor, tanto como (D  H (altura)) como el predictor, para los bosques de tabonuco, colorado y enano en el Bosque Experimental de Luquillo en Puerto Rico.
42606282|Hurricane Allen damaged plantations of Pinus caribaea, Eucalyptus species and Hibiscus elatus and natural Montane Rain Forest in Jamaica. Pine and Eucalyptus suffered serious windthrow while Hibiscus elatus was debranched and the natural forest defoliated. Defoliation of the natural forest did not increase the weight of litter beyond that found in a normal year. Insect damage in live pine increased dramatically after Allen but not as much as expected. Fomes (Heterobasidium annossum) was discovered to be a serious pathogen and the hurricane aggravated this condition. L'ouragan Allen a endommag les plantations de Pinus caribaea d'Eucalyptus spp et de Hibiscus elatus ainsi qu' des forts naturelles de montages  Jamaique. Les pins et les eucalyptus ont t devacins, tandis que les Hibiscus ont t branchs et la fort naturelle dfoile. Cette dfoliation n'a pas augment le quantits de litres au dessus du normal. Les dgts provoqus sur les pins par les insectes on t aggravs, mais moins que prvu. Heterobasidium annosum a fait son apparition et l'ourangan a ajout a son importance. En Jamaica, el huracn Allen dao las plantaciones de Pinus caribaea, Eucalyptus, y Hibiscus elatus, y tambin el bosque pluvial montano natural. El pino y eucalypto sufireron un botado serio por el viento, mientras Hibiscus elatus perdi sus ramas, y el bosque natural fue deshojado. La defoliacin del bosque natural no aument el peso de hojas cadas ms alia de lo que se encuentra en un ao normal. El dao a los pinos vivos debido a los insectos aument dramticamente despus del huracn Alien, pero no tanto como se esperaba. El Fomes (Heterobasidium annossum) se descubri ser un patgeno serio, y el huracn exager esta condicin.
42604869|In Ghana, as in most West African countries, forestry practice has centred on exploitation rather than afforestation. The need for a plantation programme is already recognised but its implementation will take some time. The Forest Products Research Institute has launched a tree improvement programme for Triplochiton scleroxylon, Afrormosia data, Cedrela odorata and Tectona grandis. These four species will be the major plantation crops for some years. The work to date has been mainly selection of outstanding phenotypes and centralisation of selected trees by grafting.
42607678|Product quantity and quality have been substantially improved in many previously unselected forest tree populations by one generation of selection. Estimated and realized heritabilities have been appreciable for numerous traits and may well increase under more intensive culture. However, environmental variations are higher than for most agricultural crops and more diverse sites for afforestation are expected in the future. Also, unlike most agricultural crops, trees take several years to mature both sexually and economically. Therefore the changes in ecological and economic desiderata per breeding cycle are large and demand that breeding populations be adaptable for variable futures. These factors require that screening for yield be highly efficient in use of time and materials and hence necessitate the use of multiple trait and indirect selection, use of information on relatives, and tests performed in a wide range of environments. Screening procedures thus commonly involve use of progeny tests with mating and environmental designs which efficiently estimate entry means, genetic and environmental variance-covariance matrices and genotype-environment interactions, and which often also provide materials for recurrent selection. Several component units of yield are assessed at various ages to estimate juvenile-mature performance correlations and the type of genetic control of each. These include anatomical, physiological, morphological and chemical traits which affect either ecological or economic utility. In addition to efficiency in screening for yield among trees within populations, we believe it to be essential to screen among populations for present and potential future value. Since the option of backcrossing from wild, unimproved stocks into otherwise improved varieties is very costly in forestry, and since many natural populations are being lost, breeding populations of future value must be developed now. Many tree breeding agencies and the Commonwealth Forestry Institute especially, are responsible for the long term development of several tree species and must construct and maintain useful populations for future improvements. At the population level we screen for the same kinds of traits but, with the uncertainty implicit in long range programmes, more emphasis is placed on selecting for variation among populations and for the level of genetic variances within populations. Les espces des peuplements spontans ont t sensiblement amliores quantitativement et qualitativement  la premire gnration aprs slection. On estime que par rapport aux gains possibles d'hritabilit, les caractres fixs sont dj apprciables et qu'ils augmenteront encore par des traitements plus intensifs. Mais la variabilit des conditions de milieu est plus importante dans les plantations forestires que dans les cultures agricoles, par ailleurs, les emplacements  reboiser risquent de prsenter des caractristiques trs diverses  l'avenir. De plus,  la diffrence de la plupart des espces cultives en agriculture, les arbres exigent plusieurs annes pour atteindre leur maturit, pouvoir se reproduire et prsenter une valeur conomique. Il convient donc de prvoir que les populations amliores puissent s'adapter aux conditions variables de l'avenir, en recherchant, une gamme suffisamment importante de caractristiques qui facilitent les adaptations cologiques et conomiques. Ces facteurs exigent qu'une slection trs pousse pour obtenir une productivit leve soit hautement efficiente, quant  la dure et au choix des matriels vgtaux. Ce qui ncessite donc l'utilisation de caractres hrditaires multiples, une slection indirecte, l'usage d'informations sur la parent et des essais sur un large ventail de types de milieux. Les protocoles de slection pousse ncessitent, gnralement, des tests de descendance prvoyant par fcondation et conditionnement du milieu, l'valuation effective des possibilits moyennes de sa constitution gntique, l'obtention de matrices de variance et covariance des observations effectues sur les caractres gntiques et les ractions au milieu, sur les effets de leurs interactions, toutes oprations qui, souvent, fournissent les matriaux pour obtenir certains caractres spcifiques par retroslection. Plusieurs composantes de rendement sont values  diffrents ges pour apprcier les corrlations jeunesse-maturit de leur dveloppement et le type de constitution gntique de chacune. Celle-ci comprend les caractres anatomiques, physiologiques, morphologiques et chimiques spcifiques qui affectent son adaptation cologique ou son intrt conomique. Pour tre efficiente, la slection, entreprise pour obtenir des rendements levs, ne doit pas se limiter  des individus choisis dans certaines populations, mais doit porter essentiellement sur la slection parmi les populations de caractres ayant une valeur actuelle ou potentielle pour les annes  venir. Comme les techniques d'amlioration par croisement en retour d'hybrides sauvages, avec l'un de leurs parents sont trs coteuses chez les arbres forestiers et comme beaucoup de populations de la fort spontane n'existent plus, on devrait dvelopper, ds maintenant des populations amliores possdent une valeur d'avenir. De nombreuses organisations spcialises dans l'amlioration des arbres et le C.F.I. en particulier, travaillent au dveloppement  long terme de plusiers espces d'arbres et s'attachent  crer et maintenir des populations utilisables dans de futures oprations d'amlioration des peuplements. Au niveau d'une population, la slection porte sur les mmes genres de caractres spcifiques, mais en raison de l'incertitude qui est implicite dans les programmes  long terme, on s'attache plutt  slectionner en vue d'apprcier la variation parmi les populations et de mesurer le niveau de variances gntiques dans ces populations. Se han mejorado mucho la cantidad y la calidad de productos de poblaciones previamente no seleccionadas de arboles forestales a travs de una generacin de seleccin. Los heredables estimados y obtenidos han sido sensibles para numerosas caractersticas y podran ser incrementados bajp una cultivacin mas intensiva. Sin embargo, las variaciones ambientales son ms grandes que para la majori de cosechas agrcolas y se espera encontrar sitios ms diversos para reforestacin en el futuro. Adems, a diferencia de la mayora de cosechas agrcolas, los rboles necesitan varios aos para madurarse, tanto sexualmente como econmicamente. Por consiguiente, los cambios en 'desiderata' ecolgicas y econmicas durante un ciclo de cria son grandes y demandan que las poblaciones sean adaptables a futuros variables. Estos factores requieren que la tamizacin para rendimiento sea muy eficiente en el uso de tiempo y materiales y por lo tanto exigen el uso de mltiples caractersticas y seleccin indirecta, el uso de informacin sobre parientes y pruebas realizadas en una amplia gama de ambientes. Asi', los procedimientos de tamizacin invuelven frecuentamente el uso de pruebas de progenie con reproduccin y diseos ambientales que evalan eficientamente los medios de ingreso, los matrices de variacin-covariacin genticos y ambientales y las interacciones genetipicos-ambientales, y que frecuentemente dan materiales para una seleccin recurrente. Algunas unidades componentes de rendimiento estn evaluadas a varias edades para estimar las correlaciones entre el comportamiento juvenilmaduro y el tipo de control gentico de cada uno. Estas incluyen caractersticas anatmicas, fisiolgicas, morfolgicas y qumicas que influyen en la utilidad ecolgica o econmica. Ademas de eficiencia en la tamizacin para rendimiento entre arboles adentro de poblaciones, creamos que es indispensable tamizar entre poblaciones para valoree actuales y futuros-potenciales. Como la opcin de cruzar por atrs desde existencias salvajes no mejoradas a variedades por lo dems mejoradas es muy costoso en silviculture y como se estn perdiendo muchas poblaciones naturales, las poblaciones criadoras de un futuro valor deben estar desarrolladas ahora. Varias agencias de cria de arboles y sombre todo el Instituto Forestal de la Mancomunidad son los responsables para el desarrollo a largo plazo de algunas especies arbreas y deben establecer y mantener poblaciones tiles para futuros mejoramientos. Al nivel de poblacin tamizamos para los mismos tipos de caractersticas pero con la incertidumbre inherente a los programas de largo alcance se pone mas nfasis en seleccionar para variacin entre poblaciones y para el nivel de las variaciones genticas adentro de las poblaciones.
42609016|The second half of the 1980s has seen the privatization of the bulk of New Zealand's forests. While retaining ownership of the land, the State has sold fixed term forestry rights to a range of indigenous and foreign companies. It is anticipated that around 93 per cent of New Zealand's forests will ultimately be in private hands. Current yields from planted forests are around 14.5 million m per annum, and are expected to rise substantially over the next decade. There is a considerable potential for investment in processing. However, new planting, after a decline in the 80s, needs to be increased to much higher levels. If this is done a sustainable annual yield of 65 to 70 million m per annum is possible. La seconde moiti des annes 80 a vu la privatisation de la plus grande partie des forts de Nouvelle Zlande. Tandis qu'il maintenait sa proprit sur les terres, l'tat a vendu les droits temporaires d'exploitation forestire (concession)  un ensemble de compagnies nationales et trangres. Il est prvu que la gestion d' peu prs 93% des forts de Nouvelle Zlande se retrouve finalement confie  des privs. La production actuelle des plantations forestires est d'environ 14,5 million de m par an et il est prvu qu'elle augmente substantiellement au cours de la prochaine dcade. De considrables potentialits se dveloppent pour l'investissement dans le domaine des industries de transformation. Toutefois de nouvelles plantations, aprs le dclin des annes 80, sont ncessaires et  un rythme plus lev. Ainsi une production annuelle soutenue de 65  70 million de m serait possible. A partir de la segunda mitad de los ochentas se ha visto la privatizacin de la mayor parte de los bosques de Nueva Zelanda. El Estado ha vendido los derechos forestales a trmino fijo, mientras mantiene la propiedad de la tierra, a un rango de diversas compaas nativas y extranjeras. Se ha previsto que cerca del 93 por ciento de los bosques de Nueva Zelanda pasarn en ltima instancia a manos privadas. Las actuales producciones de los bosques plantados son alrededor de 14.5 millones m por ao y se espera que se incrementen sustancialmente en la prxima dcada. Existe un potencial considerable para la inversin en el procesamiento. Sin embargo, despus de un decline en los ochentas, nuevas plantaciones necesitan ser incrementadas a niveles mucho ms altos. Si esto se hace, es posible llegar a una produccin sostenible de 65 a 70 millones m por ao.
42604716|There is a substantial market for conifer seed from north-west America. Douglas fir is the species in greatest demand for the home market, most seed in this region being used in Washington and Oregon. The organisation by seed companies of cone collectors and buyers has to be flexible and powerful enough to cope with substantial but fluctuating demands and periodic cone crops. The role of squirrels in cutting cones is of great practical importance. Control of the origin of seed is usually adequate, though there is certainly room for improvement, both within the seed trade and by independent checks. However, there are substantial difficulties in finding completely reliable systems for the control of seed origin for operations on as large a scale as those in the Pacific north-west.
42606962|The paper surveys approaches to conservation and forest management in New Zealand and Papua New Guinea., noting common elements in the strategies adopted in the recent policy reforms in both countries. There has been a redefinition of an appropriate, more limited role for politicians in forest sector decision-making, associated with the effective separation of forest ownership from forest regulation. There are now strong emphases in both countries on securing sustainable forest management and the conservation of biodiversity. Other important trends are the development of accountable and effective indigenous landowner organizations; and the development of consensual decision-making relationships with NGOs. Each of the strategies described may have wider application beyond these two countries. L'article passe en revue les approches de conservation et d'amnagement des forts en Nouvelles Zlande et en Papouasie Nouvelle Guine. En Nouvelle Zlande, la pression des O.N.G. et de l'opinion publique sur la justification des actions entreprises a conduit  la ngociation de l'Accord sur les Forts de Nouvelle Zlande. Cet accord a pour but de maintenir et d'augmenter l'tendue existante de fort indigne, en mme temps que de reconnatre l'importance des plantations forestires. Un des points faibles de l'accord est que les propritaires traditionnels voient leur droit d'usage des terres svrement rduit. En Papouasie Nouvelle Guine, une rcente commission d'enqute a tabli que des compagnies trangres exploitaient les forts au dtriment du pays et avec la complicit d'officiels du gouvernement. Des changements au niveau politique et un engagement de la Banque Mondiale  travers le 'Tropical Forestry Action Programme' ont conduit  la mise sur pied d'un programme de rforme dans lequel les O.N.G. ont jou un rle majeur. L'article met en vidence les lments communs aux stratgies adoptes dans ces deux pays et qui pourraient trouver un champ d'application plus large. El documento examina los enfoques a la conservacin y manejo de los bosques en Nueva Zelanda y Papa Nueva Guinea. En Nueva Zelanda, la presin de las ONGs y la preocupacin pblica sobre responsabilidades han conducido a la negociacin del Acuerdo de Bosques de Nueva Zelanda, dirigido a mantener y realzar el rea existente de bosques indgenas, al mismo tiempo que reconoce la importancia de la ingeniera forestal. Una desventaja del acuerdo, es que los terratenientes tradicionales estn ahora severamente restringidos en el uso de su tierra. En Papa Nueva Guinea, una reciente Comisin de Investigacin encontr que las compaas extranjeras estaban explotando los bosques en detrimento del pas y con el consentimiento de oficiales del gobierno. Los cambios polticos y la participacin del Banco Mundial a travs del Programa de Accin de Ingeniera Forestal en los Trpicos, han conducido a establecer un programa de reforma, en el cual las ONGs han jugado la mayor parte. El artculo nota los elementos comunes en las estrategias de ambos pases, los cuales pueden tener una aplicacin ms amplia.
42607531|It is widely held by Doctors of Islamic Law that Muslim households all over the world are obliged to sacrifice an animal, preferably male and preferably a sheep, with a goat as best alternative, on the day when pilgrims at Mecca commemorate Abraham's sacrifice of the ram caught in a thicket  a festival that recurs once every lunar year of 354 days. This creates a large and selective demand for livestock in addition to that which arises from nutritional needs. The peak herd size is reached at a date unrelated to biological cycles of plant and animal development and to the carrying capacity of grazing land. The resulting constraints add greatly to the difficulty of rangeland management. A study of the relevant texts shows that this sacrifice is not required by the Holy Koran, which is the fundamental source of law: it is based on passages in later and less sacred books, whose interpretation is open to debate. Any easing of the requirements pronounced by the religious authorities of the various Muslim countries could make a valuable contribution to management and conservation. Les experts en Droit Islamique prtendent en gnral que toutes les families musulmanes dans le monde entier ont l'obligation de sacrifier un animal, de preference un ovin et male si possible, ou bien un caprin comme alternative privilgie, a l'occasion de l'Aid al-kabir jour ou les pelerins parvenus  la Mecque refont le sacrifice abrahami- que du belier, (fte qui revient une fois par anne lunaire de 354 jours). Cela cre une demande considerable et slective en btail, s'ajoutant  celle que reprsentent dj les simples besoins alimentaires. L'importance du troupeau atteint son maximum a une date qui n'a aucun rapport avec les cycles biologiques du dveloppement vgtal ou animal ni avec la capacit des terrains de parcours. Il en rsulte des contraintes qui s'ajoutent a la dj considrable difficult de l'amnagement pastoral. L'tude des textes pertinents montre que ce sacrifice n'est pas exig par le Coran, qui est la source primordiale de la Loi: il n'est impos que par des livres plus recents et moins sacrs, dont l'interprtation reste discutable. Si les autorits religieuses des divers pays se prononaient pour un allgement des devoirs, cela contribuerait d'une faon utile  l'amnagement et  la conservation. Los doctores de ley islmica estipulan que todos los hogares musulmanes deben hacer sacrificio animal en el dia en que los peregrinos en la ciudad de Mec celebran la ofrenda de Abraham: el sacrificio del carnero padre cojido en una espesura. El animal preferiod es el carnero  el cabrn es el mejor alternativo. La fiesta tiene lugar una vez cada ano lunar, es decir, cada 354 dias. Por tanto existe una alta demanda selectiva para ganado  ademas de la demanda para la alimentacin. Los rebaos nacionales alcancen su tamao mayor en una fecha no relacionada con los ciclos biolgicos de desarrollo de plantas y animales, ni tampoco con la poca de major capacidad de alimento de los pastos. Las restricciones que resultan aumentan seriamente la difficultad de gestin de los pastos. Un estudio de los textos relacionados demuestra que este sacrificio no queda requerido por el Santo Alcoran  la fuente principal de la ley islmica. En cambio, se basa en pasajes de libros posteriores menos sacros, cuya interpretacion es controversial. Una moderacin de los requisitos pronunciados por las autoridades de los varios paises musulmanes podra hacer una contribucin significativa a la gestin de los pastos y a la conservacin ecologica.
42606416|Trimming the leaves on cuttings of E. camaldulensis stimulated rooting and the flushing of new leaves. Removing all leaves prevented rooting. A much greater percentage of cuttings with four foliar nodes rooted than cuttings with two foliar nodes. Removing or trimming leaves, even drastically, increased flushing over that of the control, fourwhole-leaves. Removing or trimming leaves moderately, increased rooting over the control, but drastic treatment can decrease rooting. The form of the drastic treatment was criticalremoving 75% of the leaf area by removing leaves was prejudicial, but removing 75% of leaf area by trimming was beneficial. L'effeuillage de parties de feuilles sur des boutures d'E. camaldulensis a stimul l'enracinement et la pousse de nouvelles feuilles. L'effeuillage complet a empch l'enracinement. Un pourcentage beaucoup plus grand de boutures avec quatres noeuds foliares ont pris raine que de boutures avec deux noeuds foliares. L'effeuillage, mme radical, de feuilles entires ou de parties de feuilles a augment la pousse de feuilles compar  une bouture tmoin portant quatre feuilles. Un effeuillage modr de feuilles entires ou de parties de feuilles a augment le aux d'enracinement, par contre un traitement radical peut rduire l'enracinement. La forme du traitement radical tait aussi critiqueune rduction de surface foliaire de 75% par effeuillage de feuilles entires tait ruisible, par contre une mme rduction par effeuillage de parties de feuilles tait avantageuse. La formacion de races y el despliegue de las hojas nuevas de los recortes de E. camaldulensis fueron estimulados al cortar la mitad de las hojas de los recortes. El corte de todas las hojas impidi la formacin de raices. El porcentaje de recortes que formaban races fue mucho ms grande en recortes que tenian cuatro nudos foliares de los que tenian solamente dos nudos. El despliegue de las hojas aument cuando las hojas se removieron y las hojas se cortaron an cuando fue muy drstico el tratamiento en relacin al testigo con cuatro hojas enteras. El tratamiento moderado tambin increment la formacin de races en relacin al testigo aunque el tratamiento intenso podia disminuirla. La aplicacin del tratamiento intenso fue crticola reduccin de 75% del rea removida del follaje de hojas enteras fue perjudicial, pero la reduccin de la misma area por medio de cortes de cada hoja fue beneficioso.
42603492|Forest harvesting in Trinidad is briefly described, followed by an account of the method of statistical investigation used. The results obtained from analysis of a sample of harvesting operations are presented and discussed, and the value added and employment generated per unit of royalty paid are estimated. The rewards earned by timber licensees for enterprise and risk taking are relatively large, sub-contracting is found to be widespread and forest harvesting is shown to be a labour-intensive activity.
42604416|The role of a university department of forestry is examined in relation to the socioeconomic development and ecological balance of the human environment in Africa. It is assumed that numerical projections in forestry education become meaningful only when this role is understood. Trends and issues in forestry education in industrialized societies are also discussed. It is concluded that there is little justification for the establishment of a university department of forestry of traditional form in any African state, and that a department concerned with the management of renewable natural resources, of which forestry is an important component, would be more appropriate in an African context. The Department of Forest Resources Management, University of Ibadan, is given as an example and its programme discussed in some detail in relation to the theme of the paper.
42608285|The world's supply of roundwood is reviewed and projections are made to the year 2020. These indicate serious potential deficits. This paper calls for a major and on-going re-evaluation of supply and demand balances for both industrial roundwood and fuelwood. The objective here is not to assert final truth, but rather to argue on currently available evidence that the global forest community is heading into increasing turbulence. Ignoring the implications can only worsen already serious problems and raise the costs of taking corrective action. A number of significant challenges demand attention. La provision du bois rond est considere et prvise  l'anne 2020. Ces prvisions indiques deficits potentiels serieux. Ce papier demande une evaluation nouvelle de l'approvisionnement et le demande pour le bois d'industrie et de chauffage. L'objectif ici n'est pas d'affirmer le vent absolu mais d'arguer que le futur du communaut global forestier est turbulent. Ne pas tenir compte des implications peut empirer problmes serieuses et accrotre les cots d'action corrective. Plusieurs challenges de significance demanfde attention.
42606995|Eight year results of a Pinus maximinoi provenance trial at three sites are reported. For volume, height and breast height diameter the two provenances San Juan and Tatumbla performed consistently well at all the sites. Although some provenances were not consistent in their performance, site  provenance interaction was not statistically significant. Site effect was pronounced, with provenances showing a threefold volume production at Chisengu B compared with Nyangui. Nyangui showed a high level of Pineus infestation but with a low frequency of cone production. Most provenances showed a consistently high frequency of forking at Chisengu A. San Juan showed a consistently high frequency of cone production, low Pineus infestation, low forking frequency but poor stem form at all sites. Growth of P. maximinoi appears to be good at altitudes of around 1350 m, where temperatures remain above freezing. The best provenances were Tatumbla, San Juan, Dulce Nombre and Cofradia. Cet article prsente les rsultats de huit annes d'essais de provenances de Pinus maximinoi. Ces essais ont t conduits sur trois sites. Sur base des caractristiques de diamtre  1,3 mtre, de hauteur totale et de volume, les deux provenances de San Juan et de Tatumbla se sont comportes de manire satisfaisante et avec constance sur tous les sites. Bien que certaines provenances aient fait preuve d'un comportement inconstant, l'interaction site  provenance ne s'est pas avre tre statistiquement significative. L'effet de site tait prononc; des provenances ont montr sur le site de Chisengu une production en volume trois fois suprieure  celle releve sur le site de Nyangui. Ce dernier a, quant  lui, montr un taux d'infestation en Pineus lev mais avec une frquence faible de production de cnes. Sur le site de Chisengu A, la plupart des provenances ont montr, d'une manire constante, une forte tendance  produire des fourches. La provenance de San Juan a fait preuve d'une frquence constamment leve de production de cnes, d'un faible niveau d'infestation par Pineus, d'une faible tendance  fourcher mais d'une mauvaise forme de tronc sur tous les sites. La croissance de P. maximinoi semble tre bonne  une altitude de 1350 mtres, altitude  laquelle tout gel est exclu. Les meilleures provenances sont Tatumbla, San Juan, Dulce Nombre et Cofrada. Se reportan los resultados de ocho aos de un ensayo de proveniencias de Pinus maximinoi en tres sitios. En cuanto a volumen, altura y dimetro a la altura del pecho, las dos proveniencias, San Juan y Tatumblas se desempearon consistentemente bien en todos los sitios. Aunque algunas proveniencias no fueron consistentes en su desempeo, las interacciones sitio  proveniencia no fueron estadsticamente significativas. El efecto de sitio fue pronunciado, con proveniencias mostrando una triplicacin en el volumen de produccin en Chisengu comparado con Ny angui. Ny angui mostr un nivel alto de infestacin de Pineus pero con una baja frecuencia de produccin de conos. La mayora de las proveniencias mostraron consistentemente una alta frecuencia de horquilla en Chisengu A. San Juan mostr consistentemente una alta frecuencia de produccin de conos, baja infestacin de Pineus, baja frecuencia de horquilla pero pobre forma del tallo en todos los sitios. El crecimiento de P. maximinoi parece ser bueno en altitudes de alrededor de 1350 m, donde las temperaturas permanecen por encima del punto de congelamiento. Las mejores proveniencias fueron Tatumbla, San Juan, Dulce Nombre y Cofrada.
42607196|An approach to the estimation of the socio-economic benefits arising from forestry research is described and estimates presented for the benefits from three ACIAR-supported projects on fuelwood and pole production using Australian species in Kenya, Thailand and Zimbabwe. The evaluation suggests that the projects are likely to make a positive economic impact in each of the countries; furthermore, they have generated significant scientific knowledge and gains in human resources capacity building. On dcrit une mthode de l'valuation des avantages socioconomiques drivs de la recherche forestire et on prsente les estimations des avantages manant de trois projets soutenus d'ACIAR concernant la production du bois  brler et des poteaux, utilisant les espces australiennes en Kenya, Thalande et Zimbabwe. L'valuation suggre que les projets vont probablement produire un bon effet conomique dans chacun des pays; en outre, ils ont beaucoup augment les connaissances scientifiques, et ressources humaines. Se describe una aproximacin a la valoracin de los beneficios socio-econmicos que surgen de la investigacin forestal y se presentan estimativos de los beneficios de tres proyectos apoyados por ACIAR en produccin de madera y postes utilizando especies Australianas en Kenya, Tailandia y Zimbabwe. La evaluacin sugiere que, probablemente los proyectos tengan un impacto econmico positivo en cada uno de los pases; an ms, que han generado un conocimiento cientfico significativo y ganancias en la construccin de la capacidad del recurso humano.
42603451|Plantations of exotic conifers at Stapleford Forest were severely damaged by Cyclone "Kate" in March 1962. The progress and features of the storm are described with reference to two maps. A quick estimate of the damage was made. It proved to be remarkably accurate in the light of the volume extracted during the planned salvage operation which followed. This included successful treatment of fallen trees against the blue stain fungus attack which was anticipated in those stands which could not be cleaned up for some months. The nature of damage is described in relation to species, age and past treatment. A discussion of possible long-term effects includes a statement of the interim conclusions drawn from a preliminary assessment of the onset of compression wood formation in leaning stems. The conclusion is reached that tending, in a region subject to periodic cyclones, must be concerned with the inducement of wind firmness, particularly in species such as P. elliottii which have characteristically weak root systems.
42609985|Biomass production was studied in an area of 40-year-old spruce forest in the Belgian Ardennes. The mean-tree method was used on a sample plot stratified by circumference class to evaluate the distribution of the biomass within the different organs of the tree. Total dry weight of aerial biomass was found to be 195 tonnes per hectare. The dry weight of leaves and branches was 19.5 tonnes per hectare for each of them. Needles are retained on the trees for at least 11 years. The most important part of the leaf biomass is concentrated in the upper part of the crown. The part of the tree currently used for commercial purposes was calculated at 79% of the total biomass by the method of the mean tree and at 83% by the allometric method. The total productivity of the forest is 19 tonnes per hectare per year. This study has demonstrated the use of techniques for the estimation of productivity in an evenaged spruce forest. Cette tude a pour but d'estimer la production de biomasse d'un peuplement d'picas de 40 ans situ dans les Ardennes belges par la mthode de l'arbre moyen et par relations allomtriques. Dans la placette d'chantillonnage, les arbres ont t groups par classe de diamtre. Un arbre appartenant  la classe de diamtre moyen a t entirement dcoup et pes afin d'valuer la rpartition de la biomasse dans les diffrents organes de l'arbre. La biomasse arienne totale a t estime  195 tonnes par ha, le poids sec des aiguilles et des branches tant respectivement de 19,5 tonnes par ha  la part la plus importante de la biomasse foliaire est concentre dans la partie suprieure du houppier. les aiguilles sont capables de se maintenir plus de 11 ans sur l'arbre. La part de bois commercial dans la biomasse totale a t estime  79% par la mthode de l'arbre moyen et 83% par la mthode allomtrique. Le productivit totale de la fort a t value  19 tonnes par hectare et par an. Cette tude a galement permis de tester les diffrentes mthodes pour l'valuation de la biomasse totale d'une fort quienne d'pica. Se estudi la produccin de biomasa en un rea de bosques de abeto (Picea abies) de 40 aos de edad en el sur de Blgica. Se emple el mtodo del rbol promedio de la parcela muestreada, estratificada por clases de circunferencia, para evaluar la distribucin de la biomasa de los diferentes componentes del rbol. Se encontr un peso seco total de biomasa area de 195 ton/ha. El peso seco de hojas y ramas fue de 19,5 ton/ha para cada uno de ellos. Los rboles retienen las acculas por lo menos por 11 aos. La parte ms importante de la biomasa foliar se concentra en la parte superior de la copa. Se calcul que la parte del rbol usada actualmente para propsitos comerciales es 79% de la biomasa total usando el mtodo del rbol promedio y 83% usando el mtodo alomtrico.
42606598|Current policy in the U.S. Agency for International Development places major emphasis on private enterprise and competitive markets as the key to economic growth. This guiding policy influences the design and implementation of many of the agency's projects, including those in the forestry sector. Strategies stress economic policy reform and the strengthening of forest-based private enterprises. However, a number of implementation questions must be satisfactorily resolved if this market approach is to succeed. La politique courante de l'Agence pour le Dveloppment International des tats-Unis souligne fortement le secteur priv et les marchs concurrentiels comme la clef de l'extension conomique. Cette politique directrice agit sur la planification et la mise en oeuvre de beaucoup des projets raliss par l'agence, y compris ceux dans le secteur forestier. Les stratgies insistent sur la rforme de la politique conomique et la consolidation des entreprises prives forestires. Pourtant, un certain nombre de questions de la mise en oeuvre doit tre rsolu de faon satisfaisante pour la russite de cette politique du march. La poltca actual de la Agencia para el Desarrollo Internacional de los Estados Unidos, d ms nfasis a la empresa privada y a los mercados competitivos como claves para el desarrollo econmico. Estos lincamientos influyen en el diseo e implementacin de muchos de sus proyectos, incluyendo aquellos en el sector forestal. Sus estrategias enfatizan la necesidad de reformar las polticas econmicas y el fortalecimiento de las empresas forestales privadas. Sin embargo, una serie de interrogantes en al implementacin, deben ser resueltas satisfactoriamente si se espera que este enfoque de mercado sea un xito.
42603130|Damage attributed to lightning was compared on aerial photographs taken in 1947 and 1961 respectively. The ratio of gaps to undisturbed forest was found to differ between forest types and, in the economically more valuable type, to be large enough to justify the proposal that the incidence of lightning gaps, as well as other damages, should be taken into consideration in forest inventories and management planning.
42605281|A comparison of growth and yield of two rotations of P. patula is described. At 10 years of age no significant difference was found between the two rotations. There is some evidence that the second rotation crop grew more quickly in the first few years after planting but somewhat less well thereafter. The better early growth is attributed mainly to an absence of weed competition, especially the dense swards of Highveld grasses present when establishing the first crop. Annual rainfall has been very variable but is generally on the low side for the species; the above average amounts in recent years may have stimulated growth and therefore perhaps disguised a possible fall-off in second rotation productivity. Some slight drop in yield overall (0-5 per cent) may be evident by the end of the second rotation. A continued monitoring of crop performance is strongly advocated since in a very few years, with rotation length only 12-16 years, clearfelling of the second rotation will commence and a third rotation begin to be established. The Usutu enterprise acts as a precursor, for other exotic softwood plantations in E. and S. Africa, of the effects of site: crop interaction under intensive short rotation forestry.
42604903|The paper summarises information on the diseases of Pinus patula Schl. & Deppe. It is noted that P. patula has proved resistant to several foliage diseases that have seriously damaged other introduced pines of the southern hemisphere. Seven root pathogens of potential importance are listed to which Fomes annosus is likely to be the most damaging if it spreads to areas where P. patula has been planted extensively. Two rust diseases of P. patula are known, and are at present confined to Central America. Our knowledge of reaction of P. patula to obligate pathogens is very limited, largely because this pine has not been planted in quantity in the northern hemisphere.
42604412|Contrary to popular belief the USSR appears not to possess a vast underutilized forest resource of high quality. By area and volume the potentially exploitable forests of the USSR are comparable to the combined resources of Canada and the USA. The total increment is comparable to that of the USA alone. The total annual cut is estimated to be already very near to the total annual increment of exploitable forests. Over-exploitation has been, and still is, continuing in the Scots pine and spruce forests of Western USSR, and, much of the felled forest has failed to regenerate adequately. Future industrial expansion is only possible in the predominantly larch forest of Eastern Siberia and the Far East, and, in non-conifer species (mainly birch). Because of increasing internal demand, increased future exports from USSR may not be possible. Despite considerable expansion of particle-board plants and pulp and paper mills, future exports may not increase because of the rise in internal demand. The supply situation for coniferous sawn timber will be most critical,the USSR has no plans for large scale expansion of this industry. If exports are possible they are likely to be expensive. Major importing countries, such as Britain, may have problems securing future supplies especially of coniferous sawn timber.
42604302|Regressions between average height of the five tallest trees measured on the aerial photograph and volume on the ground and regressions between crown density estimated on the aerial photograph and volume on the ground for 0.1 ha circular plots were calculated for six photographic scales in an area in Central India. The scales were 1:5,000-1:7,500-1:10,000-1:15,000-1:20,000 and 1:25,000. Applying the F test to test the significance of the regressions it was found that all the regressions were significant. Compared with the larger scales the scale 1:20,000 gave good results. A drop in the significance of the regression of the 1:25,000 scale occurred. Gross volume estimates in the deciduous forest seem to be possible using this technique. The most economic scale will probably be 1:20,000. The authors are grateful to Col. J. N. Sinha, Dean of the Indian Photo-interpretation Institute and Ir. F.C. d'Audretsch, Netherlands Project Leader of the I.P.I.-project for the opportunity given to them to carry out this study. The authors are also indebted to Shri A. N. Chaturvedi, mensuration officer of the Forest Research Institute at Dehra Dun, for his valuable suggestions and assistance.
42605006|Terminalia ivorensis is likely to become an important plantation species in West African countries. Phenological studies have been initiated to examine the seasonal variation in flower and fruit development. Though fruits are readily available many fall before reaching maturity, the germination period is long and the viability poor. The results of pre-treatment studies suggested that poor germination was due to some factor other than dormancy. Investigations led to the discovery of two weevils, Nanophyes sp., and Aidetobius sp., which are probably responsible for the fruits falling before ripening and the poor quality of mature fruits.
42603276|In a number of greenhouse and nursery trials over three years 1 to 2 1b per acre of prometryne in water was safe on seedling Pinus carbaea. Residual weed control was good if the boxes were weedfree at the time of spraying. Various other substituted triazine and urea herbicides and three oils were rejected as giving unsatisfactory weed control or being injurious to the crop. Promising results were given by prometryne in water and an oil-water emulsion on P. elliottii, P. khasya and P. merkusii as well as P. caribaea.
43737754|Twenty-seven plantations of Tectona grandis were surveyed in 5 areas of Puerto Rico. One plantation was 24 years old and the rest ranged in age from 37 to 51 years old. Total volume in the 27 plantations varied between 111 and 574 m/ha and merchantable volumes were between 61 and 230 m/ha. The mean d.b.h. for teak stems by plot ranged from 13.9 to 42.8 cm, and their mean height from 12.1 to 24.0 m. The mean d.b.h. and mean height of the dominant teak stems in the same stands varied between 19.0 and 47.7 cm, and between 16.6 and 27.1 m, respectively. Nearly half of the plantations surveyed appeared to be attaining at least 24 m in height in 50 years according to regional site class 11 for countries in or bordering the Caribbean Basin (Keogh, 1979). Vingt-sept plantations de Tectona grandis furent tudies dans 5 rgions de Porto Rico. Une des plantations fut ge de 24 ans et les autres furent ges entre 37 et 51 ans. Les volumes totaux dans les 27 plantations varirent entre 111 et 574 m/ha et les volumes marchands furent entre 61 et 230 m/ha. Le diamtre  hauteur d'homme moyen par placette pour les tiges de teck s'chelonna entre 13.9 et 42.8 cm, et leur hauteur moyenne s'chelonna entre 12.1 et 24.0 m. Le diamtre  hauteur d'homme moyen et la hauteur moyenne de tiges dominantes de teck dans les mmes peuplements varirent entre 19.0 et 47.7 cm et entre 16.6 et 27.1 m respectivement. Presque la moitt des plantations tudies parut en train d'atteindre au moins 24 m de haut en 50 ans selon la classe de fertilit rgionale II pour les pays dans ou avoisinant la mer des Carabes (Keogh, 1979). Se hiz un estudio de veintisiete plantaciones de Tectona grandis en cinco reas de Puerto Rico. Una plantacin tenia 24 anos y los dems variaron entre 37-51 anos os de edad. El volumen total en las 27 plantaciones varia entre 111 y 574 m/ha y volumen comercial entre 61 y 230 m/ha. El dap promedio para fustes de teca por parcela vari entre 13,9 y 42,8 cm y el promedio de altura de 12,1 a 24,0. Para los arboles dominantes en los mismos rodales el promedio de dap y de altura varian entre 19,0 y 47,7 cm y entre 16,6 y 27,1 m respectivamente. Casi la mitad de las plantaciones muestreadas parecen alcanzar por lo menos 24 m de altura en 50 anos, segun la clase de sitio regional II para paises dentro o alrededor de la cuenca del Caribe (Keogh, 1979).
42603453|Six types of crown-diameter to bole-diameter relation postulated by previous workers are examined in the light of recent field-work on seventeen tropical species. It is concluded that the most practical interpretation over the normal range of size of established crops is the straight line: crown-diameter=a+(bbole-diameter). If extended downwards to zero and upwards to senility the correct form is probably sigmoid, though even then differing little from the linear. In the linear interpretation a is related to tolerance of the species; intolerant species have low a values which are almost unaffected by treatment, tolerant species show a highly variable a clearly indicative of treatment. Negative a values are found in even-aged crops after thinning and in uneven-aged crops when only those trees visible on aerial photographs are sampled. High positive a is associated with excessive crop density. A technique for interpretation of limited samples of species of unknown status is described. Finally the species studied are listed with their probable crown-diameter equations, and the implications on density are reduced. These support a density range from 19 to 23 m/ha. (80-100 ft./ac.) as the limit which can be tolerated, without crown overlap, in the most even-aged tropical crops.
42608066|The frequent occurrence of shake in oak stands provides a major disincentive to growing the species. The investigation described here was to determine whether there are any anatomical features of the wood which are associated with shaken trees, and which might therefore be used in selection and breeding programmes. Radial wood specimens from the bases of 22 shaken and 19 unshaken oak trees were collected from shake-prone sites. The following observations were then recorded to the nearest 1 m for each annual growth ring from the 31st to the 60th from the pith: (1) width of one randomly chosen springwood vessel, (2) width of springwood, (3) number of springwood vessels per unit area, (4) width of annual ring, (5) A separate assessment involved the measurement of the width of parenchyma rays on a 3 cm wide tangent across the 45th annual growth ring. An analysis of the results indicated that of these characters only springwood vessel size is significantly correlated with shake: the larger the vessels, the more likely the tree is to be shaken. This character could prove of value in oak breeding programmes if it is heritable, and especially if good juvenile/mature correlations can be established. Work is needed on these aspects. L'existence frquente de fentes unilatrales dans les peuplements de chnes fournit un dcouragement important  la culture de l'essence. L'tude dcrite ci-aprs avait comme but de dterminer s'il y a des caractristiques anatomiques du bois qui sont lies aux arbres avec fentes, et qui pourraient donc tre utilises dans les programmes de slection et d'amlioration gntique. Des chantillions de bois radial issus des tiges de 22 chnes avec fentes et de 19 chnes sans fentes ont t recueillis de sites prdisposs  fentes. Les observations suivantes ont alors t enregistres jusqu'au 1 m le plus prs pour chaque cerne annuel d'accroissement du 31e jusqu'au 60e de la moelle: (1) la largeur d'un vaisseau de bois initial choisi au hasard, (2) la largeur du bois initial, (3) le nombre de vaisseaux de bois initial par unit de surface, (4) la largeur du cerne annuel, (5) une valuation indpendante entranait la mesure de la largeur des rayons de parenchyme sur une tangente de 3 cm de largeur en travers le 45e cerne annuel d'accroissement. Une analyse des rsultats montrait que, de ces caractristiques, seulement la grandeur des vaisseaux de bois initial est en corrlation significative avec les fentes: plus les vaisseaux sont grands, le plus probable il est que l'arbre contient des fentes. Cette cractristique peut tre utile dans les programmes d'amlioration gntique du chne si elle est hritable, et surtout si de bonnes corrlations juvnile/ge peuvent tre tablies. Ces aspects mritent des tudes plus pousss. La frecuente ocurrencia de rajaduras en los rodales de encino es una importante desmotivacin para la plantacin de estas especies. La investigacin descrita aqui se realiz para determinar si existen rasgos anatmicos de la madera que estan asociados con la rajadura de los arboles, y por lo tanto podrian ser usados en programas de seleccion y mejoramiento. Se colectaron ejemplares de madera radial de la base de 22 arboles de encino con rajadura y 19 sin rajadura en sitios susceptibles a rajaduras. Las siguientes observaciones se registraron al micron ms cercano para cada anillo anual de crecimiento de el 30-60 a partir del centro, (i) ancho de un vaso de la madera temprana escogido aleatoriamente, (ii) ancho de la madera temprana, (iii) nmero de vasos en la madera temprana por unidad de ria, (iv) ancho de anillo anual, (v) una evaluacin separada involucr la medicin del ancho de los rayos del parenquima en una tangente diagonal de 3 cm. de ancho del 45[symbol] anillo anval de crecimiento. El anlisis de los resultados indic qui de estas caracteristicas nicamente el tamao de los vasos en la madera temprana est significatiuamente correlacionada con las rajaduras: entre ms largos son los vasos, es ms probable que los arboles presenten rajaduras. Estos caracteres podrian ser valiosos en programas de mejoramiento de encino si fueran heredables y especialmente si se pueden establecer correlaciones juvenil/maduro. Se requiere ms trabajo en estos aspectos.
43738149|The exploitation of a larger number of species and the use of larger per hectare volumes of timber, than are currently harvested from moist tropical forest, are discussed. The environmental and silvicultural implications of doing this are considered. It is concluded that a more intensive utilisation, if planned and executed properly, is not detrimental to the environment and can create silvicultural conditions which are more favourable to the regeneration and growth of the commercially valuable species than current levels of exploitation. The importance of local timber markets in tropical countries for promotion of secondary species is stressed and methods of promotion are discussed. The composition of a draft publication 'A Guide to the Use of Mexican and Belizean Timbers' is then described and the attempts made in this publication to promote the use of more species for eighteen different end-uses are outlined.
42608536|Quantitative analysis of 32 indigenous mountain fuelwood species of Garhwal Himalaya proved that all the temperate species are best suited for firewoods as they have high calorific values, low ash and water contents, high density wood and high biomass to ash ratio. Our findings showed that Ilex dipyreana, Viburnum grandiflorum, V. cotinifolium, Betula utilis, Rhododendron campamdatum among angiosperms have promising firewood properties. Among gymnosperms, Juniperus wallichiana is the most suitable fuelwood species having the highest fuelwood value index. Une tude quantitative sur 32 espces locales de montagne trs bonnes productrices de bois de feu, en provenance de Garhwal dans l'Himalaya a prouv que toutes les espces de la zone tempre sont les plus intressantes comme combustible, ceci  cause de leur haute valeur calorifique, leur faible contenance en eau et en cendres, la haute densit du bois, ainsi qu'au fort ratio de la biomasse aux cendres. Nos rsultats ont montr que Ilex dipyreana, Viburnum grandifolium, V. cotinifolium, Betula utilis. Rhododendron campamdatum, parmi les angospermes avaient de bonnes proprits combustibles. Parmi les gymnospermes, Juniperus wallichiana est l'espce de bois de feu la plus approprie ayant le plus fort indice combustible. El anlisis de 32 especies indgenas de montaa que se usan como fuente de lea en el Himalaya Garhwal demostr que todas las especies templadas son muy bien adaptadas a producir lea porque tienen valores calorficos muy altas, contenidos muy bajos de agua y ceniza, madera densa y una alta razn de biomasa a ceniza. Nuestros resultados muestran que Ilex dipyreana. Viburnum grandiflorum, V. cotinifolium, Betula utilis y Rhododendron campamdatum entre otros angiospermos tienen propiedades de lea muy prometedores. Entre los gymnospermos, Juniperus wallichiana es lo ms indicado de los especies para lea, teniendo el exponente ms alto para el valor de la lea.
42608147|Termites are one of the major silvicultural pests in the tropics. Economic losses in forest nurseries and during the establishment of forest plantations and woodlots can be substantial. Eucalyptus sp. are particularly susceptible although other exotic genera including Cupressus sp., Pinus sp., Callitris sp. and Casuarina sp. can also attacked. Termite damage can be reduced to acceptable levels through the prophylactic use of organochlorine insecticides. However, there are serious limitations, and increasingly. restrictions associated with the application and efficacy of such chemicals. As a consequence there is growing interest in alternative approaches to termite control. Les termites sont un des principaux dprdateurs sylvicoles des tropiques. Les pertes conomiques dans les ppinires forestires et dans l'stablissement de peuplements forestires et de bois de chauffage peuvent tre importantes. Eucalyptus sp. sont particulirement sensibles, bien que d'autres genres exotiques, y inclus Cupressus sp., Pinus sp., Callitris sp. et Casuarina sp., puissent aussi tre atteints. Les dgts occasionns par les termites peuvent tre rduits aux niveaux tolerables par l'utilisation prophylactique d'insecticides organochlorines. Pourtant, il y a des limitations considrables et, de plus en plus, des restrictions associes avec l'application et l'efficacit de tels produits chimiques. Par consquent, on s'intresse de plus en plus aux mthodes alternatives de lutte contre les termites. Las termitas son una de las mayores plagas de la silvicultura en los trpicos. Las prdidas econmicas pueden ser sustanciales en los viveros y durante el establecimiento de plantaciones y bosquetes. Las especies de Eucalyptus son particularmente susceptibles, aunque algunos otros gneros exticos como Cupressus spp, Pinus spp, Callitris spp y Casuarina spp, pueden tambin ser atacados. Los daos por termitas pueden ser reducidos hasta niveles aceptables mediante el uso profilctico de insecticidas organoclorados. Sin embargo, existen limitaciones serias y cada vez ms restricciones asociadas con la aplicacin y la eficiencia de tales qumicos. Consecuentemente existe un inters creciente en mtodos alternativos para el control de las termitas.
42603657|With changing circumstances in the Commonwealth there must also be changing emphasis in the way that the Commonwealth Forestry Association fulfils its role in furthering forestry and industries dependent upon forest produce for their raw material. Suggestions are made dealing with membership, editorial policy, advertising, a special jubilee publication in 1971, meetingsparticularly outside the United Kingdom, local honorary secretaries and various projects. Throughout the paper it is apparent that expanded activities depend upon increased financial support, and members are invited to consider ways and means.
