42604478|This paper examines the impact of elephant activities on vegetation in the Borgu Game Reserve located in the Guinea savanna zone, in Nigeria between latitudes 9 45' and 10 23' N. and between longitudes 3 40' and 4 32' E. References are also made to forest zones and semi-arid savannas. Previous investigations into this subject are cited to show that the amount of damage done to the vegetation by elephant is proportional to the degree of aridity of the habitat. Because the Guinea Savanna is woody with many species of plants available for elephant food, the effects are not as serious as in the drier savannas where only few trees are present. Twenty-five tree species and five grass species were found to be utilised by elephant in Borgu Game Reserve. It was shown from an examination of elephant droppings that trees are mostly browsed by elephant in the dry season when the grass is dry and less palatable. It must be emphasised that the combined effects of elephant and fire could have a serious impact on the savanna vegetation in the absence of any form of a control programme. Effective management programmes based on scientific investigations on the effects of fire on habitats, and the utilisation of the habitats by elephant are recommended for all the game reserves which are located in the savanna grasslands. Cet article traite des rpercussions des activits des lphants sur la vgtation de la rserve de gibier de Borgu, dans la zone de savane guinenne situe, en Nigeria, entre 9 45' et 10 23' de latitude Nord et entre 3 40' et 4 32' de longitude Est. On y fait galement rfrence aux zones forestires et aux savanes semi-arides. Des recherches antrieures, faites sur le mme sujet, sont cites pour montrer que le total des dommages causs  la vgtation par l'lphant, est proportionnel au degr d'aridit de l'habitat. Si la savane guinenne est boise par de nombreuses espces qui servent de pture aux lphants, les effets qui s'en suivent, nanmoins, ne sont pas aussi srieux que dans les savanes plus sches, o l'on ne rencontre qu'un petit nombre d'arbres. On a observ, dans la rserve de gibier de Borgu, que l'lphant pture vingt cinq espces ligneuses et cinq espces de gramines. Une exprimentation a montr que les lphants ne renversent les arbres pour la pture que durant la saison sche, quand l'herbe est dessche et d'un got moins agrable que de coutume. On doit insister sur le fait que les effets combins des lphants et des feux de brousse peuvent avoir des rpercussions srieuses sur la vgtation de la savane, si aucune mesure n'est prise pour appliquer un programme de contrle. On recommande que dans toutes les rserves de gibier, situes dans le secteur des savanes herbeuses, des programmes srieux d'amnagement soient labors, se fondant sur des investigations scientifiques, mesurant les effets des feux de brousse sur les habitats et l'utilisation de ces derniers par les lphants.
43737693|Nitrogen dynamics were studied beneath stands of Abies pindrow, Cedrus deodara, Pinus roxburghi and Pinus wallichiana in the foothills of the Himalayas in northern Pakistan. The buried bag technique was used to estimate the rate of ammonification, nitrification and N-uptake or assimilation. Nitrapyrin was used to differentiate between chemoautotrophic and heterotrophic nitrification. C. deodara and P. roxburghii sites had the highest rates of ammonification (8.2 and 9.1 mg kg), nitrification (5.9 and 3.2 mg kg) and N-uptake (22.7 and 15.6 mg kg). A. pindrow and P. wallichiana sites had much slower rates of ammonification (4.7 and 4.2 mg kg) and N-uptake (3.9 and 5.9 mg kg). Little or no nitrification occurred on these sites. The nitrification on the C. deodara and P. roxburghii sites was inhibited by nitrapyrin indicating that it was due to chemautotrophic rather than heterotrophic bacteria. La dynamique de l'azote fut tudie sous des peuplements d'Abies pindrow, Cedrus deodara, Pinus roxburghii et Pinus wallichiana dans les contrefores de l'Himalaya dans le nord du Pakistan. La technique du sac enterr fut utilis pour dterminer des taux d'ammonisation, de nitrification et d'assimilation d'azote. Le nitrapyrin fut utilis pour diffrencier la nitrification chimioautotrophique de la nitrification htrotrophique. Les sites  C. deodara et P. roxburghii eurent les taux le plus levs d'ammonisation (8.2 et 9.1 mg kg), de nitrification (5.9 et 3.2 mg kg) et d'assimilation d'azote (22.7 et 15.6 mg kg). Les sites  A. pindrow et P. wallichiana eurent des taux beaucoup plus lents d'ammonisation (4.7 et 4.2 mg kg) et d'assimilation d'azote (3.9 et 5.9 mg kg). Peu ou pas de nitrification eut lieu sur ces sites. La nitrification sur les sites  C. deodara et P. roxburghii fut empche par le nitrapyrin, ce qui indique qu'elle fut attribuable  des bactries chimioautotrophiques plutot qu'htrotrophiques. Se estudi la dinmica del nitrgeno bajo rodales de Abies pindrow, Cedrus deodara, Pinus roxburghii y Pinus wallichiana en las faldas del Himalaya al norte de Pakistn. Se emple la tcnica de la bolsa enterrada para estimar la tasa de amonificacin, nitrificacin y absorcin o asimilacin de nitrgeno. Se us nitrapyrin para diferenciar entre nitrificacin quimioautotrpica y heterotrpica. Los sitios con C. deodara y P. roxburghii presentaron las tasas ms altas de amonificacin (8.2 y 9.1 mg kg), nitrificacin (5.9 y 3.2 mg kg) y absorcin de nitrgeno (22.7 y 15.6 mg kg). Los sitios con A. pindrow y P. wallichiana mostraron tasas mucho ms bajas de amonificacin (4.7 y 4.2 mg kg) y absorcin de nitrgeno (3.9 y 5.9 mg kg). Estos sitios presentaron muy poca o ninguna nitrificacin. La nitrificacin en los sitios con C. deodara y P. roxburghii fue inhibida por el nitrapyrin. Esto indica que la nitrificacin se debi a bacterias quimioautotrpicas y no heterotrpicas.
42608049|This paper demonstrates how the Bioclimate Prediction System developed by Nix, Busby and Hutchinson can assist in identifying homoclime locations where species suitable for forestry would be worth testing. As an example, mean monthly values of maximum daily temperature, minimum daily temperature and precipitation were estimated using the BIOCLIM program for 84 locations within the natural range of Eucalyptus citriodora. From these values the program calculated 12 climatic parameters for each site. The variation in these parameters across the 84 sites provided an estimate of the climatic environment of E. citriodora in Australia. A total of 508 sites in Africa were tested to determine if they satisfied some or all of these criteria. The homoclime areas so defined were compared with reports summarising the results of extensive trials of E. citriodora in Africa. The conclusion drawn from this test was that the Bioclimate Prediction System will assist in the selection of suitable species for evaluation where trials have not already been carried out. La prsence d'un climat semblable  celui d'origine est un facteur favorable pour l'introduction d'une espce exotique. On a compar la distribution des tempratures et des prcipitations de l'aire naturelle en Australie d'Eucalyptus citriodora, avec celle de E. citriodora en estos sitios mostr una correlacin suficientamente alta como para garantizar la applicacin del sistema de prediccin bioclimtica ('Bioclimate Prediction System') en otras especies y sitios. Las areas del mundo que tienen climas similares ofrecen condiciones apropiadas para el crecimiento de sus rboles respectivos. Se evaluaron las caractersticas de temperatura y pluviosidad en aquellas areas donde Eucalyptus citriodora es indigena y se compararon con las condiciones climticas de 508 areas en Africa. El comportamiento de E. citriodora en estos sitios mostr una correlacin suficientamente alta como para garantizar la applicacin del sistema de prediccin bioclimtica ('Bioclimate Prediction System') en otras especies y sitios.
42608286|Growth in consumption of paper products will continue for the next 15-20 years at a healthy pace. The types of products will shift and there will almost certainly be major differences in regional growth rates. Competitive access to uniform raw materials will be critical, both in the areas of chips as well as recycled fibre. Environmental attention will continue to be paid in the areas of forest management, recycling (conservation) and pulp and paper manufacturing (pollution reduction). The forest products industry can operate in a closed cycle and if properly managed, can expect positive growth for decades to come. La croissance de la consommation des produits du papier va continuer  augmenter au cours des 15-20 prochaines annes  un rythme sain. Les types de produit vont changer et il y aura presque certainement des diffrences dans les taux de croissance rgionales. Il sera critique d'avoir un accs comptitif aux matriaux bruts uniformes, dans le domaine des copeaux comme dans celui des fibres recycles. On continuera  tre attentif  l'environnement dans les zones de grance forestire, le recyclage (conservation) et la production de la pulpe et du papier (rduction de la pollution). L'orientation globale de la clientle et du service deviendra plus importante. L'industrie des produits forestiers peut oprer en circuit ferm et, peut s'attendre, si elle est convenablement gre  une croissance positive pour les dcennies  venir.
42604442|A Fijian programme to create 20,000 ha of new plantations of exotic species, principally Pinus caribaea, has got off to a very good start. Progress to date rests firmly on two critical elements: choice of suitable species and development of highly successful nursery practice. The nature and location of the areas to be planted, the species to be used, the nursery operations, and the planting operations are briefly described.
42608769|Long-term assessment of productivity of three rotations of Pinus patula reveals no evidence of yield decline as a general consequence of plantation forestry practices. Over most of the Usutu forest in Swaziland productivity of each successive crop has been equal to or better than its predecessor. In a small area, where soils are derived from a phosphate-poor gabbro lithology, some yield decline occurred between first and second rotations but not between second and third rotations. There has been little change in crop genetics, silviculture or site management between rotations. In the narrow-sense of wood production the intensive plantation silviculture practised appears demonstrably sustainable, at least over three rotations. Des valuations  long terme de la productivit de trois revolutions de Pinus patula ne rvle aucune preuve d'un dclin de la production en tant que consquence gnrale des pratiques de la foresterie de plantation. La productivit de chaque rcolte successive a t gale, voire meilleure que la prcdente sur la plus grande partie de la fort Usutu au Swaziland. Dans une petite partie o les sols sont drivs d'une gabbro lithologie pauvre en phosphate, une chute de la rcolte est apparue entre la premire et la troisime revolution mais pas entre la seconde et la troisime. Il y a eu peu de changement dans la gntique des rcoltes, la sylviculture ou la grance du site entre les revolutions. Dans le sens troit de la production du bois, la sylviculture de plantation intensive pratique apparat manifestement soutenable sur au moins trois revolutions. La evaluacin a largo plazo de la productividad de tres rotaciones de Pinuspatula no revela evidencia de disminucin de la produccin como una consecuencia general de las prcticas de plantacin forestales. En la mayor parte del bosque Usutu en Swazilandia, la productividad de cada cosecha sucesiva ha sido igual a o mejor que la de su predecesor. En un rea pequea, donde los suelos son derivados de una capa superficial de gabbro pobre en fosfato, ocurri una disminucin del rendimiento entre la primera y segunda rotacin pero no entre la segunda y tercera rotacin. Ha habido poco cambio en gentica de cultivos, silvicultura o manejo del sitio entre rotaciones. En el sentido estricto de la produccin de madera, la plantacin silvicultural intensiva practicada parece sostenible, al menos en tres rotaciones.
42604443|Jointed aluminium and bamboo poles, with and without a horizontal arm at the top, were used to estimate the height of Sitka spruce, Corsican pine and Douglas fir 10 to 15 m. tall growing in dense stands. Estimates of mean height made with plain poles agreed closely with felled measures. Adding the horizontal arm rendered agreement less close for Sitka spruce and Douglas fir, but not for Corsican pine. In contrast, adding the horizontal arm reduced the scatter of measurements for all species with aluminium poles, and for Sitka spruce and Douglas fir with the bamboo poles also. It is concluded that plain poles are adequate for estimating mean height in dense polestage stands, up to 15 m. tall at least, but that the horizontal arm improves precision where increments of individual trees are required.
42610009|Social scientists have brought particular insights to tropical forestry in three broad areas: the factors which govern farmers' enthusiasm for planting trees, off and on their farms; the nature of indigenous management systems and the conditions under which they are most likely to occur and continue to be of value; and mechanisms for marrying these local capabilities and institutions with the institutions of the State. These interests, originating with them but rapidly taken up by a broader range of disciplines, have now entered mainstream thinking in tropical forestry and will remain there. Les experts en sciences sociales ont apport des claircissements particuliers  la foresterie tropicale grce  de nouveaux travaux d'quipe fructueux dans trois grands secteurs: les facteurs qui gouvernent l'enthousiasme des fermiers pour planter les arbres sur leur fermes ou en dehors, la nature des systmes de grance indignes et les conditions dans lesquelles elles sont le plus  mme d'tre effectues, et de continuer  garder leur valeur, ainsi que les mcanismes pouvant oprer la fusion entre les aptitudes et les institutions locales et les institutions d'tat. Ces intrts, qui trouvent leurs origines dans les sciences sociales mais qui sont rapidement adapts par une plus large varit de disciplines ont maintenant trouv leur place dans le courant de pense de la foresterie tropicale, et ils vont y demeurer. Los cientficos sociales han trado conocimientos particulares a la ingeniera forestal tropical, como resultado de estas nuevas asociaciones fructferas, en tres grandes areas: los factores que gobiernan el entusiasmo de los granjeros para sembrar rboles, por fuera y dentro de sus granjas; la naturaleza de los sistemas de administracin indgenas y las condiciones bajo las cuales su ocurrencia sea ms probable y continua para ser de valor; y los mecanismos para juntar estas capacidades e instituciones locales con las instituciones del Estado. Estos intereses, que se originan con ellos pero muy rpidamente adoptados por un rango ms amplio de disciplinas, han ahora entrado en la principal corriente de pensamiento de la ingeniera forestal tropical y permanecer all.
42608424|Data from over 600 sites in Australia were used to determine the bioclimatic profiles of Acacia aulacocarpa, Acacia auriculiformis, Acacia holosericea, Acacia mangium, Casuarina cristata, Casuarina glauca, Grevillea robusta, Melaleuca dealbata and Melaleuca quinquinervia. It was concluded that these profiles would be useful when establishing trials outside Australia. They would provide a preliminary indication of climatic requirements and assist the selection of provenances for particular climatic conditions. Des donnes tires de plus de 600 stations en Australie ont t utilises pour dterminer les profils bioclimatiques d'Acacia aulacocarpa, Acacia auriculiformis, Acacia holosericea, Acacia mangium, Casuarina cristata, Casuarina glauca, Grevillea robusta, Melaleuca dealbata et Melaleuca quinquinervia. On a conclu que ces profils seraient utiles pour l'tablissement d'essais en dehors de l'Australie. Ils donneraient une indication prliminaire des besoins climatiques et aideraient dans la slection de provenances pour des conditions climatiques spcifiques. Se utiliz informacin de ms de 600 localidades en Australia con el fin de determinar los perfiles bioclimticos de Acacia aulacocarpa, Acacia auriculiformis, Acacia holosericea, Acacia mangium, Casuarina cristata, Casuarina glauca, Grevillea robusta, Melaleuca delbata y Melaleuca quinquinervia. Se concluye que los perfiles seran de utilidad para el establecimiento de ensayos fuera de Australia. Estos daran una indicacin preliminar de los requerimientos climticos y ayudaran en la seleccin de procedencias para condiciones climticas particulares.
42604835|Metrication is reviewed, emphasising those aspects most relevant to forestry. The implications of adopting SI units are discussed. A few suggestions are put forward for trying to obtain more uniformity in mensurational conventions. Notes are given on equipment, tables, etc., required at the time of conversion.
42607464|Positive response to applied phosphate has been obtained with Pinus caribaea and Pinus oocarpa. An optimum rate of 200g/tree of single superphosphate was found suitable in many trial plots. Effects of nitrogen varied depending on the type of N source. Urea was found to be injurious to pines with or without supplementary phosphate application; nitrochalk and ammonium sulphate increased survival and height growth only when used in conjunction with phosphate. Combination of 200g/tree of single superphosphate and ammonium sulphate respectively produced the best effect. There were positive responses to boron, nitrogen and phosphorus by different Eucalyptus species. Urea was found also to be injurious to eucalypts. A common pattern of response was the often observed positive interaction between N and P. Application of 200g of single superphosphate and 100g of ammonium sulphate per tree produced the best result for eucalypts. The field experiments showed conclusively that incidence of die-back of eucalypts is associated with boron deficiency; a routine application of 50g/tree of borate fertilizer at the time of planting would correct the deficiency. Potassium chloride depressed survival and height growth of both Eucalyptus and Pinus species. On a obtenu une rponse positive en appliquant du phosphate au pied de tiges de Pinus caribaea et de Pinus oocarpa. Dans beaucoup de placeaux d'essai, l'apport de 200 gr. par arbre de superphosphate, seul, est considr comme un optimum. Les effets des produits azots varient suivant le type d'engrais. On a observ que l'ure est nuisible pour les pins, mme si on procde  une application supplmentaire de phosphate. Le mlange de nitrate d'ammonium et de calcaire pulvris, ainsi que de sulfate d'ammonium amliore la reprise des plants et leur croissance en hauteur, mais seulement si on utilise, en mme temps, du phosphate. L'apport de 200 gr. par pied d'arbre de superphosphate, seul, ainsi que de 200 gr. de sulfate d'ammonium, produit les meilleurs rsultats. Chez plusieurs espces d'Eucalyptus, on a obtenu des rponses positives pour des applications de bore, d'azote et de phosphore. L'ure a, galement, un effect nuisible sur les Eucalyptus. On a souvent observ une rponse positive identique  l'action rciproque entre N et P. Les meilleurs rsultats ont t obtenus aprs l'application de 200 gr. de superphosphate, seul, et 100 gr. de sulfate d'ammonium par pied d'Eucalyptus. Les essais ont montr  l'vidence que le dprissement en cime chez l'Eucalyptus est associ  une carence en bore. L'application systmatique de 50 gr. de borate par pied, au moment de la plantation, devrait corriger cette carence. Les apports de chlorure de potassium ont une action dpressive sur la reprise et la croissance des plants d'Eucalyptus et de pins. Sa ha obtenido respuesta positiva al fosfato aplicado a Pinus caribaea y Pinus oocarpa. Una dsis ptima de 200 g por rbol de superfosfato simple, se indic como apta en muchas parcelas de ensayo. Los efectos del nitrgeno dieron variaciones segn el orgen del nitrgeno. Se encontr que la ureas es daosa para pinos con o sin aplicacion suplementaria de fosfato. Nitrocalco y sulfato de amonia aumentaron la supervivencia y el crecimiento de altura solamente cuando se utilizaron conjuntamente con fosfato. El mejor rendimiento result de la combinacin de 200 g por rbol de superfosfato simple y sulfato de amonia. Ha habido respuesta positiva a la aplicacin de boro, nitrgeno y fosfato para especies diferentes de Eucalyptus. Se descubri que la urea es daosa igualmente para los eucaliptos. Una respuesta observada con frecuencia fue la interaccin entre el nitrgeno y el fsforo. La aplicacin de 200 g por rbol de superfosfato simple y 100 g por rbol de sulfato de amnia dio los mejores resultados con los eucaliptos. Las experiencias de campo demostraron decisivamente que se asocia la defienda de boro con muerte regresiva. Una aplicacin rutinaria de 50 g de fertilizante de borato por rbol en el momento de transplantar, corregira esta deficiencia. El cloruro de potasio empeor la supervivencia y el crecimiento de altura en eucaliptos y pinos.
42604792|The promises of increasing the productivity of the savanna of central Brazil include the production of fast-growing, high-volume forest species for charcoal and paper. Observations indicate that Eucalyptus spp. require the addition of nutrients to the savanna soils to develop at a rate similar to that of the high forest zone. In the experiment described here, 18 fertilizer treatments were repeated 3 times on a physically uniform area with soil described as "sandy red cerrado." Seedlings of E. saligna Sm. in "torro paulista" planting blocks were set out in December, 1965, after sub-soiling to 60 cm. depth. In January, 1966, fertilizers were applied in a circle of 50 cm. diameter around each seedling and lightly mixed with surface soil. Height measurements were made on the 25 central trees of 9-by-9-tree squares, the trees being spaced at 2-by-2 metres. Height measurements after one and two years of growth and diameter measurements after two years are presented. Nitrogen, phosphorus and boron furnished highly significant stimulation of initial growth. Triple superphosphate was significantly more effective at 80g per tree than at 40g. The combination of NPK at 60g+80g+20g per tree yielded average heights of 2.7 m. after one year and 7.2 m. after the second; these compared with 1.5 m. and 4.2 m. height on the control plots. At two years, NPK-treated trees averaged 5.1 cm. in diameter, breast height, while the unfertilized controls were 3.1 cm. Application of small quantities of boron and zinc with NPK increased second-year height to 9.1 m. and diameter to 6.5 cm. Calcium, zinc and potassium did not have significant effects. Economic analysis indicates that fertilization can compensate for most or all of its own cost in the first year, by permitting reduction of tending costs. By shortening the rotation and producing higher volumes, fertilization can be expected to produce a higher net return to the total plantation investment.
42604959|The importance of a thriving forestry industry is still not sufficiently recognised in this country. Britain has the smallest proportionate acreage under timber of any European country but, is after the U.S.A., the largest timber user in the world. Whilst timber forms our third largest import by value we have in this country millions of acres of hill land that could be used for woodland without touching an acre of land used for anything except grazing sheep, which even at the moment do not save us as much in imports as timber. Our current rate of planting new trees falls alarmingly short of our future timber needs. But what is the cost of increasing our area of forest? To use a topical comparison we could almost double our present timber production by spending what it cost to develop the Concorde airliner. Which is the more valuable to the countryan aircraft or three million acres of forest?
42604767|As part of an investigation into excessively slow growth ("check") of white spruce (Picea glauca (Moench) Voss) in young plantations, a planting depth study with P. glauca and P. abies (L.) Karst. (Norway spruce) was done at Ithaca, N.Y. The literature review is followed by an account of the split-splitplot experiments with four replications of five trees of each of two size classes, with and without waxed root collars planted (a) to the same depth as in nursery, (b) 5.0 cm deeper, and (c) 10.0 cm deeper. Survival after two years was 89 per cent. White spruce planted 10.0 cm deeper than normal grew significantly more in height in their first year than did those planted less deeply. Second year height increment was generally less than that of the first, but depth of planting was again significant (p < .07). Winterkill presumably increased variation and may explain the lack of significant growth relationship between different years. In Norway spruce, depth of planting became highly significant in the second year; the deeper the planting the better the growth. In neither species did two years of greater height increment of deep planted trees make up for the decrement due to deep planting. New roots up to 28 cm long were produced by white spruce within six weeks after planting. Within three months, more than half the deep planted trees had developed adventitious roots. Reduction of aeration by waxing the root collar region did not inhibit adventitious root formation. Deep planting did not inactivate the pre-existing root system, and adventitious roots supplemented rather than supplanted the old root system.
42604773|On the White Sands Series of Guyana, the leguminous Wallaba (Eperua spp.) grows gregariously and is strongly dominant. A case is presented for replacement by Pinus caribaea to provide a better use for the area and to meet potential market demand.
42605076|Problems inherent in the utilisation of Tropical High Forest are discussed and suggestions made for deciding on the most profitable way of utilising it. The operation of a small research sawmill in Uganda is described and an account is given of studies carried out with this mill to determine the practicability of fuller utilisation of the forest. Conclusions from the study indicate that in Uganda conditions it should be possible to double the volume of timber taken per hectare without reducing the profitability of sawmilling below an acceptable level. Suggestions are made for introducing measures which would make more intensive milling commercially attractive.
42609987|The trial comprising 15 provenances of five tropical Acacia species was replicated on four different sites in Sabah. The first year height growth indicates that, on poor site such as rocky, shallow and sandy soil with heavy lalang (Imperata cylindrica) infestation, all provenances of A. crassicarpa and A. aulacocarpa, and some provenances of A. auriculiformis are significantly taller than A. mangium, a popular plantation species in Sabah. On this poor site, A. crassicarpa is found to be taller than A. mangium by 73% while A. aulacocarpa and A. auriculiformis are 45% and 23% taller respectively at year 1. On fertile site with dense weed of Eupatorium odoratum, these species also outperform A. mangium, indicating their greater capabilities to compete with and dominate this fast growing weed. These three species, however, do not show any superiority over A. mangium growing on good site with clean ground. On the highland, A. mearnsii is the most vigorous species. Early result of the trial indicates the good potential of these three Acacia species in the humid tropics, especially in rehabilitation of grassy wasteland. L'essai comprenant 15 provenances de cinq essences tropicaux d'Acacia tait rpt sur quatre sites diffrents en Sabah. La croissance en hauteur de la premire anne montre que sur un site peu fertile, avec un sol rocheux, peu profond et sableux avec une forte invasion a d'imprata (Imperata cylindrica), toutes les provenances d'A crassicarpa et A. aulacocarpa et quelques provenances d'A. auriculiformis sont significativement plus grandes qu'A mangium, une essence populaire de plantation en Sabah. Sur ce site peu fertile A. crassicarpa est 73% plus grand qu'A mangium, pendant qu'A aulacocarpa et A. auriculiformis sont 45% et 23% plus grands respectivement  la fin de la premire anne. Ces essences dpassent A mangium aussi sur un site fertile avec un salissement dense d'Eupatorium odoratum, montrant leur capacit plus grande pour concurrencer et dominer cette mauvaise herbe  croissance rapide. Pourtant ces trois essences ne montrent aucune supriorit  A. mangium croissant sur un site fertile avec un sol dsherb. Sur les pays montagneux A. mearnsii est l'essence la plus vigoureuse. Les rsultats prliminaires de l'essai montre le potentiel de ces trois essences d'Acacia dans les tropiques humides, surtout pour la rhabilitation des friches herbeuses. Un ensayo que incluy 15 procedencias de cinco especies tropicales de Acacia se replic en cuatro sitios diferentes en Sabah. El primer ao de crecimiento en altura indica que en un sitio pobre, con un suelo rocoso, superficial y arenoso, y con una infestacin alta de Imperata cylindrica, todas las procedencias de A. crassicarpa y A. aulacocarpa, y algunas procedencias de A auriculiformis, fueron significativamente ms altas que A. mangium, una especie popular para plantaciones en Sabah. En ese mismo sitio, se encontr que el crecimiento en altura que presentaba A crassicarpa a un ao de edad, era 73% mayor que el que de A. mangium, mientras que el de A . aulacocarpa y A. auriculiformis eran 45% y 23% ms altos respectivamente. En un sitio frtil, con una presencia densa de la maleza Eupatorium odoratum, estas mismas especies superaron A. mangium, lo que indica su mayor capacidad para competir y dominar a esta maleza de rpido crecimiento. Sin embargo, estas tres especies no mostraron ninguna superioridad sobre A. mangium en sitios buenos y libres de malezas. En tierras altas, A. mearnsii mostr ser la especie ms vigorosa. Los resultados preliminares de este ensayo indican el buen potencial que presentan estas tres especies en los trpicos hmedos, especialmente en la rehabilitacin de tierras abandonadas e invadidas por gramneas.
42608676|The Swiss based firm Socit Gnrale de Surveillance (SGS) runs a certification programme for forestry projects that aims to contribute to the mitigation of climate change. The service focuses in particular on projects in non-Annex I countries from which the Framework Convention on Climate Change (FCCC) expects a certified demonstration of additionality. Since their is no internationally recognised standard yet defining Emission Reduction Units (ERUs), SGS has compiled all existing criteria from the FCCC and regulatory bodies around the world, and complemented this with its own expertise on best forest management practice into a provisional standard. The certification programme assesses projects against that standard and subsequently quantifies the project's performance in terms of achieved ERUs. It also assesses the risk and uncertainty associated with the project and the scientific methodologies used, and creates a self-insurance mechanism by putting all affected ERUs into a buffer which is non-tradable. The criteria used and the various assessments are described. La compagnie base dans la suisse Socit Gnrale de Surveillance (SGS) dirige un programme de certification pour les projets forestiers, qui a pour but de mitiger le changement climatique. Le service se concentre en particulier sur des projets dans les pays non-Annexe I duquels la Framework Convention on Climate Change (FCCC) attend une dmonstration certifie d'additionalit. Parce qu'il n'y a pas encore de modle internationalement reconnu pour dfinir les Units de la Rduction d'missions (URE), SGS a compil tous les critres existants du FCCC et des corps rgulateurs dans le monde, et a ajout sa propre expertise dans le domaine de la pratique forestire optimale pour crer un modle provisionnel. Le programme de certification value des projets en comparaison avec ce modle et quantifie dans la suite l'excution du projet en fonction des URE atteintes. Il value ausse le risque et l'incertitude d'un projet et les mthodologies utilises, et cr un mcanisme d'autoassurance en mettant toutes les URE non atteintes dans une zone non susceptible au commerce. Les critres utiliss et les diverses valuations sont dcrits.
42604638|Data from a pilot survey should not be pooled with that of the main survey unless both sets of data are produced from a double sampling plan. Survey reports would be clarified by distinguishing between a true pilot survey, designed purely to provide some relevant information, and the first stage of a double sampling scheme. Les donnes fournies par un inventaire pilote ne doivent pas tre mlanges  celles de l'inventaire principal  moins que les deux proviennent d'un chantillonnage double planifi. Les rapports d'inventaire seraient plus clairs si l'on distinguait entre un projet vraiment pilote, conu purement dans le but d'obtenir une certaine information pertinante, et la premire partie d'un projet d'chantillonnage double. Los datos que suministra una encuesta piloto no deben mezclarse con los de la encuesta principal a menos que ambas series de datos provengan de un programa de prueba doble. Resultaran ms claros los informes de encuesta si se hiciese una distincin entre una verdadera encuesta piloto, destinada nicamente a suministrar unos datos pertinentes, y la primera etapa de un proyecto de prueba doble.
42603275|The history of big game animals in Kenya's forests is traced. A hundred years ago, practically all the areas which comprise the present Forest Reserves contained large numbers of big game. During the fifty years which followed, unrestricted hunting annihilated the animals in some forests and agricultural development on the plains subsequently blocked migration routes and prevented the restocking of overhunted forests from other places where hunting was less intense. In recent decades, the depleted herds of animals have increased with protection until the present time when many Forest Reserves support large populations. The distribution of the animals is described and information is provided on their stocking, recruitment rates and mortality. The reasons for migration are discussed. Although the stoppage of migration has removed an important means of relieving overpopulation, natural hazards and spasmodic hunting appear to be holding numbers in check and the animals are assumed to have reached a new balance with their modified habitat. It must not be forgotten, however, that the habitat is still undergoing radical changes and that there is a very fine dividing line between equilibrium and inbalance.
42610028|The paper describes a ten-year project of 'action-research' in farm forestry for Bangladesh. A process of on-farm research carried out concurrently with 'best available knowledge' extension was used to develop technologies for intensification of trees grown on farms. The planting sites consisted mainly of two categories, homesteads and rice-based crop fields, where management was mainly under the control of women and men respectively. The extension system was based on private village-based micro-nurseries operated as integrated tree-services businesses. The advantages of on-farm research were direct reflection of farmers' practices and constraints, low overheads, fast results from many diverse field sites, and no time lag for transmission of findings to extension and practitioners. The main findings were that many trees, indigenous and exotic, can survive and grow in rice fields at least as productively as in forest plantations and, when managed by top and root pruning, without serious losses in crop production. Cultivation of trees on homesteads can be intensified and diversified, and varieties and management of fruit species improved. L'article dcrit un projet d'une dure de dix ans de la "recherche-action" dans la foresterie rurale pour Bangladesh. On a utilis des recherches sur le terrain allies  l'accessibilit populaire du savoir pour dvelopper des technologies pour l'intensification des arbres cultivs sur les fermes. Les sites de plantation consistaient principalement en deux catgories: les fermes et les rizires, gres par les femmes et les hommes respectivement. Le systme d'accssibilit populaire tait bas sur les microppinires prives des villages foncionnant comme les oprations intgres de services d'arbres. Les avantages de la recherche sur place: l'observation directe des pratiques et des contraintes des cultiveurs; des frais gnraux bas; des rsultats immdiats de multiples sites divers; et l'absence de dlai pour la transmission des rsultats  la population et aux practiciens. Les conclusions principales: beaucoup d'arbres, indignes et exotiques, peuvent survivre et pousser dans les rizires au moins aussi productivement que dans les plantations forestires, et ce, sans des pertes srieuses si on pratique l'lagage des branches suprieures et des racines. La cultivation des arbres sur les fermes est susceptible  l'intensification et  la diversification, et les varits des espces de fruitiers et leur amnagement peuvent tre amliors. El artculo describe un proyecto de diez aos de 'accin-investigacin' de ingeniera forestal en granja en Bangladesh. Se us un proceso de investigacin en granja llevado a cabo al mismo tiempo que un proceso de extensin 'con el mejor conocimiento disponible' para desarrollar tecnologas para la intensificacin de rboles plantados en granjas. Los sitios de plantacin consistieron principalmente de dos categoras, hogares y campos de cultivos basados en arroz, donde el manejo estuvo principalmente bajo el control de mujeres y hombres respectivamente. El sistema de extensin se bas en micro-viveros privados con base en las aldeas operados como negocios integrados de rboles y servicios. Las ventajas de la investigacin en granjas fueron un reflejo directo de las prcticas y restricciones de los granjeros, bajos costos operativos, resultados rpidos de muchos campos de cultivos diferentes, y ningn desfase entre la transmisin de hallazgos a la extensin y los practicantes. Los hallazgos principales fueron que muchos rboles, indgenas y exticos, pueden sobrevivir y crecer en campos de arroz al menos tan productivamente como en plantaciones forestales y, cuando se manejan por podas de raz y copa, sin prdidas serias en produccin. El cultivo de rboles en hogares puede intensificarse y diversificarse, y mejorarse el manejo de variedades de frutas.
42608428|Site form, the expected height of a 25 cm d.b.h.o.b. tree predicted from the stand height-diameter relationship, is shown to be a practical and useful measure of site productivity in indigenous cypress pine (Callitris sp.) forests in southern Queensland. Unlike site index, this measure is not based on age and thus has potential for site productivity assessment in stands of unknown or uneven age. Il est montr que la forme de station, la hauteur attendue d'un arbre de 25 cm de diamtre  hauteur d'homme (corce incluse) prvue du rapport hauteur dominantediamtre, est une mesure pratique et utile de la productivit de station dans les forts indignes de Callitris sp. du sud de Queensland.  la difference de l'indice de station, cette mesure n'est pas base sur l'ge, donc elle a du potentiel pour l'valuation de la productivit de station dans les populations inquiennes ou d'ge inconnu. Se presenta la Forma de Sitio (Site Form), definida como la altura esperada de un rbol de 25 cm. de dimetro (dap), obtenida de la relacin altura-dimetro del rodal, como un indicador prctico y til de la productividad del sitio en bosques nativos de Callitris sp en el sur de Queensland. A diferencia del Indice de Sitio, esta medida no se basa en la edad y por tanto sera de utilidad en la evaluacin de la productividad del sitio en rodales discetneos o de edad desconocida.
42603195|A historical review of the progressive improvement of tree seed collection in Kenya is presented. Before the First World War importations and collections of seed were mainly from wherever seed of the species required could be obtained. Seed collection greatly increased in the twenties and the dangers of using unselect seed appeared in the early thirties. Registered Seed Areas of superior growth and form were selected in the midthirties and seed collection of commonly planted species restricted to the registered stands. Comparisons of plantations raised from seed collected from registered stands enabled selection amongst seed areas, the poorer being rejected, and second generation seed stands were established from seed of preferred mother trees. Open pollinated progeny trials during the fifties confirmed improvement through the Registered Seed Area programme. In 1962, this led to the beginning of an East African Tree Breeding Programme, which prescribed more intensive selection of parent material, included timber quality amongst the criteria for selection and required the establishment of clonal seed orchards.
42608673|Estimates of carbon stocks within different land management systems are important elements in the design of land use systems that protect or sequester carbon. A method for the rapid estimation of total system carbon stocks in tropical forests and land uses derived from them was developed for field activities in Brazil, Cameroon, Indonesia and Peru. Careful selection of sites and land uses is necessary to ensure representativeness and assist in the later extrapolation of results. Carbon stocks in trees are estimated through allometric equations based on diameter at breast height. Carbon in understorey vegetation, litter, roots and soil is measured by destructive sampling. Modifications to sampling procedures are necessary within managed forests, incompletely cleared fields, recently felled and burned forests, tree plantations and thickly-vegetated bushland. The data collected are compiled into a spreadsheet data base containing 16 variables, four of which are used to sort cases and 12 are data for analytical comparison. Carbon stocks within land uses may be substituted for land use categories and overlay procedures of geographic information systems applied for spatial extrapolation. Ecosystems models, such as CENTURY (ver. 4.0) may be initialised with these data and long-term carbon dynamics compared in simulations of alternative land management practices. Les estimations des rserves de carbone dans les divers systmes de gestion de la terre sont indispensables pour la planification des systmes de l'emploi de la terre qui protgent ou qui squestrent le carbone. Une mthode de l'estimation rapide des rserves totales de carbone dans les forts tropiques et des emplois de terre en drivs a t dveloppe pour les activits sur le terrain au Brsil, au Cameroun, en Indonsie et au Prou. La slection soigneuse des sites et des emplois de la terre est ncessaire pour assurer un chantillon type pour l'extrapolation des rsultats plus tard. Les rserves de carbone dans les arbres sont estimes en utilisant les quations allomtriques bases sur le diamtre  hauteur de poitrine. Le carbone dans la vgtation du sous-tage, la litire, les racines et le sol est mesur par l'chantillonage destructeur. Des modifications des procds d'chantillonage sont ncessaires dans la fort gre, les champs pas entirement dfrichs, les forts rcemment coupes et brles, les plantations d'arbres, la brousse couverte de vgtation et la fort du marcage. Les donnes rassembles sont compiles dans une table base de donnes qui contient 16 variables, dont 4 servent  classifier les cas et 12 sont des donnes pour une comparaison analytique. Les rserves de carbone dans les emplois de la terre pourraient tre substitues pour des catgories d'emploi de la terre et des procds de la superposition des systmes de donnes gographiques utiliss pour l'extrapolation spatiale. Des modles d'cosystmes, tels CENTURY (ver 4.0), pourraient tre initialiss avec ces donnes, et la dynamique de carbone  longue chance pourraient tre compare dans les simulations de pratiques alternatives de la gestion de la terre.
42603103|On the pumice soils of the central region of the North Island, New Zealand, radiata pine has a growth rate faster than that of most other coniferous forests in the world. In young site quality II stands, annual dry matter production (excluding roots) reaches 18,000 1b./ac. During the years of peak production, site quality I stands produce double this amount of dry matter and use more than 5 per cent of the available solar radiation. Some of the factors contributing to this high level of photo-synthetic efficiency are the ability of radiata pine to grow for nearly 12 months of the year and adequate nutrient, carbon dioxide and moisture supplies. This fast rate of growth allows a crop of trees to be harvested every 35 years, removing about 200 lb. of N, 30 lb. of P, 250 1b. of K, and 170 1b. of Ca from the site. Soil nutrient reserves appear to be adequate to meet this demand in the immediate future.
42608148|Severe environmental degradation is occurring in Latin America. This results from mismanagement of watersheds, destruction of coastal environments, deforestation, soil depletion, over-harvesting and under-utilization of wildlife and fisheries resources. These trends reduce options for sustainable development in the region, they are destroying its biological capital and they are major factors promoting political unrest. However, a number of successful pilot "conservation for development" projects are under way in the region. Four of these are discussed in this paper; they are 1) CATIE's Wildlands Program, 2) La Planada Ecodevelopment Project, 3) Kuna Indian Wildlands Project; and 4) the Costa Rican National Park System. Each project in its individual way attempts to reverse the trend of environmental degradation, to improve the welfare of the local population and to create environmental awareness at the national level. Des dgradations graves de l'environnement se produisent en Amrique Latine. Cela rsulte de la mauvaise gestion de bassins-versants, la destruction d'environnements ctiers, le dboisement, l'puisement du sol, la surexploitation et la sous-utilisation des ressources cyngtique et piscicole. Ce/s tendances rduisent les choix pour le dveloppement soutenable dans la rgion, elles dtruisent le capital biologique et elles sont des causes principales d'agitation politique. Pourtant, un certain nombre de projets exprimentaux russis de 'conservation pour le dveloppement' sont en marche dans la rgion. Quatre d'entre eux sont discuts dans cette communication; ils sont 1) le Programme de Terres Vierges de CATIE; 2) le Projet d'codveloppement 'La Planada'; 3) le Projet de Terres Vierges des Indiens Kuna; et 4) le Systme de Parcs Nationaux de Costa Rica. Chaque projet essaie de sa faon de renverser la tendance de dgradation environnementale, d'amliorer le bien-tre des indignes et de stimuler la conscience de l'environnement  l'chelon national. Grave degradacin del medio ambiente occurr en Latinoamrica. Esto resulta del mal manejo de las cuencas, destruccin del medio ambiente costero, deforestacin, perdida de nutrientes del suelo, sobre explotacin de las cosechas, poca utilization de la vida silvestre y de sus recursos pesqueros. Estas tendencias reducen las opciones para el sostenimiento de desarollo en estas regin, destruyen al capital biolgico y estos factores promeven la inestabilidad politica. Sin embargo varios proyectos preliminares de "desarollo para la conservacion" se estn llevando acabo con xito en sta regin. Cuatro de estos proyectos son discutidos en este artculo: 1) Programa de Areas Silvestres de CATIE 2) Proyecto de Ecodesarollo "La Planada" 3) Proyecto de areas silvestres de la reserva indigena Kuna; y 4) Sistema de los Parques Nacionales en Costa Rica. Cada proyecto tiene su propio objetivo y tiende a reducir la degradacin del medio ambiente, y mejorar el bienestar local de la poblacin, asi como crear una concientizacin del ambiente a nivel nacional.
42607639|Macaranga is the world's largest genus of pioneer tree species. Nineteen species in New Guinea and adjacent Melanesia are known to grow to 20 m tall and may have potential for forestry.
42610027|Natural tropical forests can provide income, serve as carbon sinks, and be reservoirs of biological diversity. Management for these diverse goals can be guided by optimisation models that seek the best cutting regime, given different constraints and objective functions. The results for a lowland tropical rainforest in peninsular Malaysia show that to maximise a sustainable income one would cut all commercial trees of 30 cm and above every 20 years. All non-commercial trees would remain, and thus contribute to diversity and carbon storage. The best policy to maximise carbon storage was not to cut at all. This also maximised diversity, by leading to a forest in its climax state. However, this policy had a very high opportunity cost. Compromise policies were obtained, for example by maximising carbon storage, or diversity, while getting a competitive rate of return on the capital in trees. Findings suggest that increasing carbon storage and tree diversity can be attained only at significant costs in terms of foregone income. For example, increasing carbon storage beyond the income-maximising amount would cost $47/ton. Les forts ombrophiles peuvent fournir de la revenue, servir comme une rserve du carbone et des rservoirs de la diversit biologique. La gestion pour ces buts divers peut tre guid par des modles d'optimisation qui cherchent le rgime d'exploitation le meilleur, tant donns des contraintes et des objectifs diffrents. Les rsultats pour une fort ombrophile  basse altitude dans la Malaysia pninsulaire montrent que la maximisation d'un revenu soutenu peut tre atteinte si on coupe tout les arbres commerciaux  partir de 30cm tout les 20 ans. Tout les arbres non-commerciaux resteraient, contribuant ainsi  la diversit et  l'accumulation du carbone. Le meilleur procd pour maximiser l'accumulation du carbone tait de ne pas couper du tout. Cela a aussi maximis la diversit, en permettant la fort d'atteindre son apoge. Cependant, cette mthode a eu des cots d'option trs levs. On a tabli un compromis, par exemple en maximisant l'accumulation du carbone ou la diversit, tout en obtenant un bon rapport du capital des arbres. Les conclusions indiquent que l'augmentation du carbone et de la diversit des arbres ne peut tre obtenue qu'au prix des pertes apprciables de revenu. Par exemple, l'augmentation du carbone au del de la maximisation de revenu coterait $47/tonne. Los bosques tropicales naturales pueden proveer ingreso, servir como fijadores de carbono, y servir como reservorios de diversidad biolgica. La administracin de estos objetivos diversos puede guiarse por modelos de optimizacin que busquen el mejor rgimen de corte, dadas diferentes restricciones y funciones objetivo. Los resultados para un bosque tropical de tierras bajas en la Malasia peninsular muestran que para maximizar un ingreso sostenible uno debera cortar todos los rboles comerciales de 30 cm y por encima de 20 aos. Todos los rboles no-comerciales deberan permanecer y as contribuir a la diversidad y al almacenamiento de carbono. La mejor poltica para maximizar el almacenamiento de carbono sera no cortar nada. Esto tambin maximizara la diversidad, dirigiendo el bosque a un estado de clmax. Sin embargo, esta poltica tendra un costo de oportunidad muy alto. Se obtuvieron polticas comprometedoras, por ejemplo maximizando el almacenamiento de carbono, o la diversidad, mientras se obtena una tasa de retorno competitiva del capital en rboles. Los hallazgos sugieren que incrementar el almacenamiento de carbono y la diversidad de rboles puede lograrse solamente a costos significativos en funcin del ingreso predeterminado. Por ejemplo, incrementar el almacenamiento de carbono ms all de la cantidad de maximizacin del ingreso costara $47/ton.
42604415|Observations concerning the pathology of Pinus caribaea, P. kesiya, P. merkusii and P. oocarpa in West Malaysia are reported. The main problem noted was a foliage disease on seedlings and young trees of P. caribaea and P. merkusii associated with Cercospora pini-densiflorae. Four fungicides were found to give good control of the disease in the nursery. Another foliage disease was noted on nursery plants and young trees of P. kesiya and P. oocarpa associated with Cylindrocladium pteridis. Observations on the unhealthy appearance of older trees, the effects of fertilizer application on tree health, and the occurrence of decay fungi are aso reported.
42603297|The experiments described were carried out at the East African Agriculture and Forestry Research Organisation during 1963 with the object of developing reliable techniques for the establishment of exotic conifers by the direct planting of seed. The factors that militate against success have been shown to be: drought, the transposition or burying of seeds by soil erosion, and sun scorch of the tender seedlings. The date of sowing is also a factor probably affecting the degree of success obtained. The success of the sowings depends on the provision of 'aids' to augment the supply of available soil moisture and to ensure that there is adequate protection of the seeds and seedlings from physical hazards. A bamboo protective sleeve and a rainfall conductor stick have been shown to be effective in satisfying these requirements. The work includes investigations into the soil moisture balance in the first foot of soil, the root development of the young trees under the different treatment regimes and the effect of rainfall intensities on the collecting efficiency of the rainfall conductor sticks.
43737738|This paper presents the current status of forest seed pathology in India. An elaborate checklist of micro-organisms associated with seeds of 63 tropical tree species including exotics and 13 temperate tree species is provided. Lacunae in forest seed pathological research in India are highlighted. Thrust areas of research viz. seed collection, processing, storage, seed health testing, seed treatment and seed certification, etc. are identified for improving the quality of forestry seeds in India. Cet article prsente l'tat actuel de la pathologie des graines forestires en Inde. On dresse une liste de contrle minutieuse des micro-organismes associs aux graines de 63 essences tropicales, y compris des essences xotiques, et de 13 essences de zone tempre. On souligne des lacunes dans les recherches en pathologie des graines forestires en Inde. On identifie des champs vers lesquels il faudrait orienter les recherches - le ramassage, la transformation, l'entreposage, l'analyse de sant, le traitement et la certification des graines, etc. - afin d'amliorer la qualit des graines forestires en Inde. Este artculo muestra el estado actual de la patologa de semillas forestales en India. Se proporciona, adems, una lista detallada de micro-organismos asociados con semillas de 63 especies de rboles tropicales, incluyendo exticas y 13 especies de rboles templados. Se destacan las deficiencias en la investigatin de la patologa de las semillas forestales en India. Tambin se identifican reas destacadas de investigacin, es decir, la coleccin, procesamiento, almacenamiento, control sanitario, tratamiento y certificatin de semillas, etc., con el fin de mejorar la calidad de las semillas forestales en India.
42604306|A site assessment survey of P. patula growing in the Usutu Forest Swaziland is described. Multi-variable regression equations were computed relating top height with measured site factors. At the lower significance levels equations containing 4 or 5 variables were found to explain about 70 per cent of the observed variation in growth; at the high levels equations with 3 variables explained over 60 per cent of the variation. The main significant site factors were elevation above sea levelthe relationship was curvilinear with optimum growth occurring at about 4,000 feet (1,200 m), percentage distance between ridge top and valley bottom, slope, soil set (see Murdoch, 1968) and potassium level near the soil surface. Comparison is made with reports of P. patula growth elsewhere in E. and S. Africa.
42608068|Simulated fire exercises have been developed in New Zealand to train forest staff for forest fire emergencies. The exercise is planned on a map; carried out in a selected forest over several hours; and assessed at a debrief next day. Simulated fire exercises have proved valuable by leading to: improvements to forest and regional fire plans; more experienced staff; more effective and confident fire fighting organisation; benefits to neighbouring forests, local authorities and other organisations. Entrenamiento con el uso de incendios forestales simulados Se han desarrollado ejercicios con incendios simulados en Nueva Zelanda con el objeto de entrenar personal forestal en caso de emergencia de incendios forestales. El ejercicio se planea en un mapa y es ejecurado en bosques selectos a lo largo de varias horas; y evaluado y communicado el da siguiente. Los ejercicios con incendio simulado ha demostrado ser de valor por conducir a: Mejoramiento de planes de incendio forestal y regional Personal ms experimentado Organizacion de combate de incendio ms efectiva y confiable Beneficios para bosques vecinos, autoridades locales y otras organizaciones.
42605107|Data from the 1963 national forest inventory of Cuba are used to illustrate the principles and practice of constructing volume tables by least squares techniques (regression analysis). These yield unbiased estimates of volume and are preferable to free-hand graphs which can be subjective, imprecise and which yield no information on their precision. Nine mathematical models explaining variation in tree volume (V) were compared and the best, as judged by the Furnival index, was a weighted regression that included as independent variables tree height (H), diameter squared (D), and the interaction of these two variables (DH). This regression was computed for Pinus caribaea var. caribaea at three altitudinal locations in the Cajalbana Forest, Pinar del Rio; there were no significant differences between the three locations and the following combined regression equation was used to prepare a local volume table: V = 0.001738 - 0.000474H + 0.000092D + 0.000029DH
